716.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 27-33-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Department Of Revenue From Distributing Homestead Exemption Reimbursement Funds To Any Local Taxing District Wherein The Appraised Value Of Property Has Increased And The Local Taxing District Has Not Published, In A Newspaper Of General Circulation, A Notice Showing The Millage Rate That Would Have Produced The Same Revenues Collected In The Preceding Fiscal Year; To Amend Sections 27-33-77 And 27-33-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

717.title: Gaming; clarify powers of Mississippi Gaming Commission to regulate bingo.
717.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-33-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Powers Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission With Respect To The Regulation Of Certain Licensees And Applicants For Bingo Licenses Under The Mississippi Charitable Bingo Law; And For Related Purposes.

718.title: PEER Committee; establish criminal and civil penalties for contempt of.
718.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-3-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Criminal Penalty For Contempt Of The Peer Committee And To Establish Proper Venue In Cases Arising Under This Provision; To Create Section 5-3-70, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish An Alternate Civil Penalty For Contempt Of The Committee; To Amend Section 25-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Peer Committee From The Scope Of Any Protective Orders Authorized By The Section; And For Related Purposes.

719.title: Medicaid; create health care authority to administer and expand program.
719.description: An Act To Provide That The Availability Of Health Care Services Shall Be The Right Of All Citizens Of Mississippi; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 43-13-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Mississippi Health Care Authority To Administer The Mississippi Medicaid Law And Perform Any Other Duties As Prescribed By Law; To Specify The Members Of The Authority And Provide For Their Appointment; To Designate The Chairman Of The Authority And Provide For Meetings Of The Authority; To Abolish The Division Of Medicaid In The Office Of The Governor And Transfer The Powers, Duties And Functions Of The Division To The Mississippi Health Care Authority; To Amend Section 43-13-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appointment Of An Executive Director Of The Authority; To Amend Section 43-13-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Electronically Submitted Medicaid Claims To Be Paid Within 10 Days After Receipt; To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify How Certain Pregnant Women Shall Have Their Eligibility For Medicaid Determined; To Provide That Persons Whose Family Income Does Not Exceed 200% Of The Poverty Level And Who Have Paid A Monthly Premium To The Medical Care Fund Shall Be Eligible For Medicaid; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Inpatient Chemical Dependency Services Provided By A Licensed Chemical Dependency Hospital Shall Be Eligible For Medicaid Reimbursement; To Amend Sections 43-13-125 And 43-13-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Authority To Contract With Any Entity To Perform Any Of Its Functions Regarding Identification And Collection Of Third-party Benefits Of Medicaid Recipients If Certain Conditions Are Met; To Amend Sections 43-13-103, 43-13-105, 43-13-109, 43-13-111, 43-13-116, 43-13-117.1, 43-13-117.2, 43-13-117.3, 43-13-118, 43-13-119, 43-13-120, 43-13-121, 43-13-122, 43-13-123, 43-13-126, 43-13-127, 43-13-137, 43-13-139, 43-13-143, 43-13-145, 43-13-301, 43-13-303, 43-13-307, 43-13-309, 43-13-311, 43-13-313, 43-13-315, 43-13-317 And 43-13-507, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

720.title: Sex offenders; clarify notification to volunteer organizations regarding status.
720.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Duty Of A Sex Offender To Notify A Volunteer Organization Regarding Offender Status; And For Related Purposes.

721.title: Alcoholic beverages; prohibit adults from allowing party at private premises if minors obtain and adults know.
721.description: An Act To Prohibit Adults From Allowing A Party To Take Place At A Private Residence Or Private Premises If A Minor At The Party Obtains Any Alcoholic Beverage Or Beer And The Adult Knows Or Reasonably Should Know That The Minor Has Obtained Alcoholic Beverages Or Beer; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Section 67-3-70, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

722.title: Lee County; authorize contribution to the Sanctuary Hospice House.
722.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Sanctuary Hospice House; And For Related Purposes.

723.title: Life insurance; prohibit unfair discrimination against subjects of abuse.
723.description: An Act To Prohibit Unfair Discrimination In Life Insurance Against Persons Who Are Subjects Of Abuse; To Define Certain Terms; To Prescribe Unfairly Discriminatory Acts Relating To Life Insurance; To Require Justification Of Adverse Insurance Decisions Which Affect An Applicant Or Insured On The Basis Of A Medical Condition That The Insurer Knows Or Has Reason To Know Is Abuse-related; To Require Insurers To Develop And Adhere To Protocols For Persons Who Are Subjects Of Abuse; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Enforce The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 83-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

724.title: CON; issue for psychiatric facility beds in Washington County.
724.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Conversion Of 60 Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility Beds In The City Of Hollandale In Washington County; To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need To A Regional Medical Center In Washington County For The Construction Or Conversion Of 20 Child/adolescent Psychiatric Beds; And For Related Purposes.

725.title: Rural Fire Truck Acquisition Assistance Program; authorize an additional round for counties and municipalities.
725.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-23-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Additional Round Of Fire Trucks For Counties And Municipalities Under The Rural Fire Truck Acquisition Assistance Program; And For Related Purposes.

726.title: Tourism; create Mississippi heritage, history and culture trail.
726.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Division Of Tourism Development Of The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Statewide Mississippi Heritage, History And Culture Trail Infrastructure; And For Related Purposes.

727.title: School nurses; increase number eligible for annual salary supplement for acquiring national board certification.
727.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase To Forty The Number Of School Nurses Eligible For An Annual Salary Supplement For Acquiring National Board Certification; And For Related Purposes.

728.title: Motor vehicle liability insurance; revise procedure for owner cited for lack of to show proof necessary for waiver of fine.
728.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure By Which A Motor Vehicle Owner Cited For Failure To Have A Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Card May Present Proof Of Such Insurance In Order To Have The Fine And Court Costs For The Offense Waived; And For Related Purposes.

729.title: Willie E. "Rat" McGowan, Sr.; name Alcorn State University Baseball Park in honor of.
729.description: An Act To Provide That The Alcorn State University Baseball Park On The Campus Of Alcorn State University In Lorman, Mississippi, Shall Be Named The Willie E. "rat" Mcgowan, Sr., Baseball Stadium; To Provide That The Baseball Field Within The Willie E. "rat" Mcgowan Stadium Shall Be Named The William "bill" Foster Baseball Field; And For Related Purposes.

730.title: Beer; increase amount of alcohol that it may contain from 5% to 10% by weight.
730.description: An Act To Amend Sections 67-1-5, 67-3-1, 67-3-3, 67-3-5, 67-3-7, 67-3-9, 67-3-13, 67-3-17, 67-3-28, 67-3-49, 67-3-53 And 27-71-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Permissible Alcoholic Content Of Beer From 5% Of Alcohol By Weight To 10% Of Alcohol By Weight; And For Related Purposes.

731.title: Beer; permit making of homemade beer for domestic or household use only.
731.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Has The Right To Make Homemade Beer For Personal, Family, Domestic Or Household Use Only; And For Related Purposes.

732.title: Investigation costs; provide for recovery of reasonable costs.
732.description: An Act To Provide For An Assessment Against Convicted Criminal Defendants To Cover The Reasonable Costs Of Investigations; And For Related Purposes.

733.title: Public Service Commission; repeal authority to use alternate method of cost recovery on certain power generation.
733.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 77-3-101, 77-3-103, 77-3-105, 77-3-107 And 77-3-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For An Alternative Method Of Cost Recovery On Certain Base Load Generation For Electric Public Utilities And The Legislative Advisory Board For The Alternative Method; And For Related Purposes.

734.title: Expunction; provide for certain nonviolent offenses.
734.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure To Expunge Certain Felony Convictions; To Amend Section 41-29-150, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

735.title: Mississippi Recovery School District Charter Program; create.
735.description: An Act To Be Known As The "mississippi Recovery School District Charter Program Act"; To Require The State Board Of Education To Implement The Charter Program And The State Department Of Education To Administer The Program Beginning With The 2011-2012 School Year; To Authorize A Charter School Or Charter District To Be Formed By The Conversion Of An Existing Public School Or District To Charter Status By The State Board Of Education In School Districts Transferred To The Mississippi Recovery School District; To Prescribe Certain Requirements To Be Satisfied By Schools Or Districts In The Charter Program; To Require Schools Or Districts Converted To Charter Status To Give Enrollment Preference To Students Who Were Enrolled In And In Attendance At That School Or District Before The District Was Placed In The Charter Program; To Allow The Admission Of Students Outside Of The Local School Subject To The Establishment Of A Procedure For The Admission Of Those Students; To Require Any School Or District Placed In The Charter Program By The State Board Of Education To Be Open To Any Student Residing In The State; To Prescribe The Procedures To Be Followed For The Admission Of Students In Schools Or Districts Chartered Under The Charter Program; To Provide That A Charter School Or Charter District May Sue And Be Sued; To Provide Immunity From Civil Liability To The State Board Of Education And Its Members; To Provide That The Charter For A School Or District Placed Under The Charter Program Is Valid For An Initial Term Of Three Years; To Require That Certain Assurances And Components Are Included In Charters Issued By The Board; To Require All Schools Or Districts Chartered Under The Charter Program To Comply With All Statutes Applicable To The Public Schools And The Rules, Regulations, Policies And Procedures Of The State Board Of Education; To Provide For The Employment Of Faculty And Staff Members At Charter Schools And Charter Districts; To Grant Exclusive Authority Over All Employment Practices Of Charter Schools And Charter Districts To The Mississippi Recovery School District; To Provide That Those Employed By The Charter School Or Charter District Are Employees Of The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Providing Certain State-funded Benefits; To Require The Deputy Superintendent Responsible For The Mississippi Recovery School District To Provide An Annual Status Report To The State Board Of Education; To Provide For State And Local Funding Of Charter Schools Or Charter Districts Under The Charter Program; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Require The Consolidation Of Any Local School District That Is Placed Under The Mississippi Recovery School District Into An Adjacent School District; To Provide That The Consolidation Is Subject To Certain Conditions; To Authorize The Board To Establish A Charter School Or Charter District In A School District That Is Placed Under The Mississippi Recovery School District; To Amend Sections 37-7-113 And 37-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

736.title: Internet; impose fee on new contracts between service providers and consumers, to be used by Attorney General's Cybercrime Unit.
736.description: An Act To Impose A Fee On Interactive Internet Service Providers For Each New Contract Between The Provider And A Consumer That Includes A Fee To The Consumer For Access To The Internet; To Provide That The Monies From The Fees Collected Shall Be Used By The Attorney General's Cybercrime Unit Exclusively For The Investigation, Education And Prosecution Of Cyber Crimes And Related Matters; And For Related Purposes.

737.title: Mental health; modernize terminology used to refer to persons with mental retardation.
737.description: An Act To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 1-3-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "intellectual Disability" When Used In Any Statute; To Amend Sections 1-3-57, 1-3-58, 11-5-49, 11-5-113, 25-3-25, 25-7-61, 35-5-31, 37-3-85, 37-16-11, 37-23-3, 37-23-61, 37-23-63, 37-23-91, 37-101-285, 37-143-13, 41-4-1, 41-4-5, 41-4-7, 41-4-8, 41-4-11, 41-4-23, 41-5-44, 41-7-173, 41-19-1, 41-19-7, 41-19-15, 41-19-17, 41-19-31, 41-19-33, 41-19-37, 41-19-38, 41-19-39, 41-19-41, 41-19-43, 41-19-91, 41-19-103, 41-19-116, 41-19-118, 41-19-141, 41-19-147, 41-19-155, 41-19-157, 41-19-201, 41-19-203, 41-19-205, 41-19-207, 41-19-211, 41-19-213, 41-19-231, 41-19-235, 41-19-237, 41-19-239, 41-19-243, 41-19-245, 41-19-301, 41-21-35, 41-21-61, 41-21-67, 41-21-69, 41-21-73, 41-21-77, 41-21-82, 41-21-83, 41-21-87, 41-21-103, 41-21-109, 41-39-7, 43-6-171, 43-13-105, 43-13-117, 43-17-5, 43-21-105, 43-27-25, 73-19-23, 83-41-205, 83-41-207, 93-1-5, 93-5-1, 97-9-25, 99-13-1, 99-13-3, 99-13-5 And 99-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Modernize The Terminology That Is Used To Refer To Persons With Mental Retardation And The Commissions And Facilities That Provide Treatment And Care To Those Persons, By Referring To Them As Persons With An Intellectual Disability; To Further Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Medical And Mental Health Treatment, Care And Services For Children Who Are In The Custody Of The Department Of Human Services In Those Types Of Services Provided Under The Medicaid Epsdt Program For Which The Department May Provide State Matching Funds To The Division Of Medicaid To Obtain Federal Matching Funds Through The Division; And For Related Purposes.

738.title: Children's Health Insurance Program; transfer administration of to Division of Medicaid.
738.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-86-1, 41-86-5, 41-86-7, 41-86-9, 41-86-11, 41-86-13 And 41-86-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Administration Of The Mississippi Children's Health Insurance Program From The State And School Employees Health Insurance Management Board To The Division Of Medicaid; To Repeal Sections 41-86-3, 41-86-17, 41-86-19 And 41-86-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For A Temporary Program For Children's Health Insurance, Specify The Covered Benefits And Services To Be Provided Under The Children's Health Insurance Program, Establish A Children's Health Insurance Program Enrollment Outreach Initiative, And Establish A Children's Health Insurance Program Advisory Board And Joint Legislative Advisory Committee; And For Related Purposes.

739.title: State Health Insurance Management Board; authorize to impose premium differential based on risk factors.
739.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And School Employees' Health Insurance Management Board To Impose A Premium Differential To Participants In The Health Insurance Plan Based On The Risk Factors Associated With Smoking; To Provide That The Amount Of Any Premium Differential Shall Not Be Paid By The State For Any Active Employee, But Shall Be Paid By The Participant; To Bring Forward Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

740.title: State Health Insurance Management Board; authorize to impose premium surcharge on certain retirees.
740.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And School Employees' Health Insurance Management Board To Impose A Premium Surcharge On Retired Employees Who Are Under The Age For Medicare Eligibility And Who Were Initially Employed Before July 1, 2006, And Increase The Rate Of The Premium Surcharge Annually Not To Exceed Fifteen Percent Until The Premium Surcharge Amount Is Equal To The Amount That The Board Determines Actuarially To Cover The Full Cost Of The Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

742.title: Distinctive license tags; authorize issuance to supporters of the Gulfport School District.
742.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Gulfport School District; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

743.title: Interagency Task Force on Shared Services; create.
743.description: An Act To Create An Interagency Task Force On Shared Services To Study The Possibilities For Implementing A Shared Services Plan For The Executive Branch Of The Government; To Specify The Membership And The Duties Of The Task Force; To Provide That The Task Force Shall Submit A Report To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

744.title: Intensive supervision program; expand to include juvenile delinquents.
744.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Juvenile Offenders May Be Sentenced To The Intensive Supervision Program Administered By The Department Of Corrections; To Provide That The Minimum Sentence Under This Program Shall Be Six Months For Juvenile Offenders; To Require Juvenile Offenders To Be Tested For Alcohol And Drugs; To Require Juvenile Offenders To Pay $10.00 For The Test; To Provide That If A Juvenile Offender Tests Positive For Alcohol Or Drugs He Or She Shall Be Required To Attend An Alcohol And Drug Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Section 47-5-1003, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Juvenile Offenders To Participate In The Intensive Supervision Program; To Amend Section 47-5-1007, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Juvenile Offenders To Pay A Monthly Fee For Participation In Such Program; To Amend Section 47-5-1013, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

745.title: Legislative Public Project Grant Program; create.
745.description: An Act To Create The Legislative Public Project Grant Program To Be Administered By The Community Services Division Of The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Development Of Criteria For Grants; To Provide An Application Process; To Provide That Grant Funds Will Be Distributed By The County In Which A Project Is Located; And For Related Purposes.

746.title: Supervisors and municipal governing authorities; require course related to offices after elected.
746.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-3-41 And 21-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Members Of The Governing Authorities Of Counties And Municipalities To Attend And Complete A Course Of Training And Education Relating To The Duties And Responsibilities Of Their Respective Offices; And For Related Purposes.

747.title: School curriculum; require voter education as a component of the United States government course.
747.description: An Act To Require Each Public High School To Include Within Its United States Government Class Not Less Than One-half Hour Of Voter Education; And For Related Purposes.

748.title: Public school students; authorize community service as an alternative to suspension or expulsion.
748.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Allow Any Public School Student Who Has Never Been Subject To Disciplinary Action Who Commits An Act Or Engages In Conduct For Which The Student Otherwise Would Be Suspended Or Expelled Under The School District's Discipline Plan, At The Election Of The Student, To Participate In A Community Service Program As An Alternative To Suspension Or Expulsion; To Provide That While Participating In The Program, The Student Shall Receive Youth Peer Counseling Deemed Appropriate By The School District; To Provide That Upon Satisfactory Completion Of The Community Service Program, The Student Record Of The Student's Offensive Act Or Conduct Shall Be Expunged; And For Related Purposes.

749.title: Chronic diseases; Health Department shall establish WISEWOMAN & WISEMAN programs to reduce incidences of.
749.description: An Act To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Establish The Wisewoman Program And The Wiseman Program, The Purposes And Goals Of Which Are To Reduce The Incidences Of Certain Chronic Diseases Among Mississippians Through Education, Prevention And Early Screening And Detection; To Authorize The Department, In Implementing Those Programs, To Contract With Public Or Private Clinics Or Agencies That Have Demonstrated Success In Reducing Incidences Of Those Chronic Diseases Through Education, Prevention And Early Screening And Detection; And For Related Purposes.

750.title: Medical records; persons seeking disability benefits may obtain at no charge until final determination of disability.
750.description: An Act To Provide That When A Person Is Seeking Disability Benefits, The Health Care Providers Who Examine The Person To Determine The Person's Eligibility For The Benefits Being Sought Shall Provide The Person With Copies Of Their Medical Records At No Charge Until After The Final Determination Of Disability Has Been Made; To Provide That After The Final Determination Of Disability, The Health Care Providers Who Provided Copies Of Medical Records To The Person May Charge The Person For The Cost Of Providing Those Medical Records, At Rates Not Exceeding Certain Statutory Amounts; And For Related Purposes.

751.title: Homeowner's Emergency Mortgage Assistance Program; establish.
751.description: An Act To Establish The Homeowner's Emergency Mortgage Assistance Program, Which Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Home Corporation; To Authorize The Corporation To Make Loans To Mississippi Residents Who Are Eligible Under The Act; To Provide That Before A Mortgagee May Accelerate The Maturity Of A Mortgage Obligation Covered Under The Act Or Begin Any Mortgage Foreclosure, Certain Notice Must Be Given To The Mortgagor And A Determination Must Have Been Made On The Mortgagor's Application For Emergency Mortgage Assistance Payments; To Provide That Foreclosure Actions On Mortgages Covered Under The Act Shall Be Temporarily Stayed; To Specify The Requirements For Giving Notice To The Mortgagor; To Specify The Requirements For Eligibility For Assistance With Respect To A Mortgage Under The Act; To Provide That The Corporation Shall Pay To A Mortgagee The Full Amount Due Under The Terms Of A Mortgage Of A Mortgagor Who Is Eligible For Assistance Under The Act; To Provide That The Corporation Shall Enter Into Agreements With Mortgagors Who Receive Assistance Under The Act For The Repayment Of That Assistance; To Require All Mortgagors Who Receive Assistance Under The Act To Receive Consumer Credit Counseling; To Create The Homeowner's Emergency Mortgage Assistance Fund In The State Treasury; And For Related Purposes.

752.title: Family Savings Initiative Act; create.
752.description: An Act To Be Known As The Family Savings Initiative Act; To Provide For The Establishment Of Individual Development Accounts Designed To Provide Individuals And Families With Limited Means An Opportunity To Accumulate Assets, Facilitate And Mobilize Savings, Promote Home Ownership, Microenterprise Development, And Education, And Stabilize Families And Build Communities; To Provide That The Department Of Human Services Shall Enter Into Contracts With Fiduciary Organizations To Carry Out The Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize State Residents To Open An Individual Development Account Upon Approval Of A Fiduciary Organization; To Provide That The Fiduciary Organization Shall Approve The Application Only If Certain Criteria Are Met; To Specify The Qualified Purposes For Which Individual Development Accounts May Be Used; To Authorize The Contribution Of Matching Funds To Fiduciary Organizations For Individual Development Accounts; To Require Fiduciary Organizations To Submit Quarterly Reports To The Department Of Human Services; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Consist Of Transitional Employment Assistance Funds, Which Shall Be Used For The Purposes Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Gross Income For State Income Tax Purposes Interest And Dividends Earned On Individual Development Accounts And Matching Funds Deposited Into Those Accounts; And For Related Purposes.

753.title: Affordable and quality low-income housing; establish initiatives to improve.
753.description: An Act Relating To Affordable And Quality Housing For Lower Income Persons; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority (mda) To Make Available To Community Housing Development Organizations That Are Awarded Home Funds A Portion Of The State Appropriation Of Home Funds For Administrative And Operating Costs; To Authorize Mda To Set Aside A Percentage Of Federal Funds For The Purpose Of Supporting A Regional Homeownership Consortium; To Require Mda To Appoint A Task Force Comprised Of Representatives Of Mda And Regional Housing Authorities To Identify Incentives To Increase The Use Of Section 8 Homeownership Vouchers; To Require All Housing And Developments That Utilize State Funds Or State-allocated Low-income Housing Tax Credits (lihtc) To Provide Verifiable Energy-efficiency And Engineering Testing; And For Related Purposes.

754.title: State and county welfare department; authorize commissioners and employees to participate in political campaign.
754.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize State Or County Welfare Department Commissioners And Employees To Take An Active Part In Any Municipal Or County Campaign; And For Related Purposes.

755.title: Oakley Training School; change name to Oakley Rehabilitation Center.
755.description: An Act To Change The Name Of The Oakley Training School To The Oakley Rehabilitation Center, And To Amend Sections 37-31-65, 37-113-21, 37-143-15, 43-21-605, 43-27-10, 43-27-11, 43-27-39, 43-27-401, 47-5-151, 47-7-45, 65-1-37 And 97-37-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

756.title: Insurance company classifications; eliminate home warranty class.
756.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-19-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The Home Warranty Insurance Company Classification; And For Related Purposes.

757.title: CON; issue to Alexander Milne Home for Women for ICF-MR beds in Laurel.
757.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need To The Alexander Milne Home For Women, Inc., For Not Exceeding 45 Icf-mr Beds In Laurel, Under The Condition That The State Portion Of The Medicaid Match Be Paid By The Recipient Of The Certificate Of Need; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division Of Medicaid To Make Full Reimbursement To Any Intermediate Care Facility For The Mentally Retarded That Is A Nonprofit 501(c)(3) Corporation Paying The State's Portion Of The Medicaid Match; And For Related Purposes.

758.title: Implied consent law; allow sentence for violations to be suspended or reduced if violator is under 21 years.
758.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Sentences To Be Suspended Or Reduced If The Violator Is Under 21 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

759.title: Implied consent law; allow sentence for violations to include house arrest at rehab center.
759.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Sentences For Certain Violations To Include House Arrest At A Rehabilitation Center; And For Related Purposes.

760.title: County sheriffs; increase salaries of.
760.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of County Sheriffs; And For Related Purposes.

761.title: Medicaid; mental health counseling services provided by licensed professional counselors shall be reimbursable under.
761.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mental Health Counseling Services Provided By A Duly Licensed Professional Counselor (lpc) Will Be Reimbursable Under The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

762.title: Lien laws; include rental and lease equipment dealers.
762.description: An Act To Amend Sections 85-7-131, 85-7-135, 85-7-181, 85-7-185 And 85-7-189, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Rental And Lease Equipment And The Suppliers Thereof In The Lien Laws; And For Related Purposes.

763.title: Depicting child engaging in sexual conduct; include offenses in other jurisdictions.
763.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Offenses Committed In Other Jurisdictions As Punishable For Depicting A Child Engaging In Sexual Conduct; And For Related Purposes.

764.title: Board on Law Enforcement Officer Standards and Training; revise membership.
764.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Board On Law Enforcement Officer Standards And Training; And For Related Purposes.

765.title: Uniform Traffic Ticket Law; provide that officer's failure to timely file ticket is not grounds for dismissal of the ticket.
765.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Officer's Failure To Timely File A Traffic Ticket Is Not Grounds For Dismissal Of The Traffic Ticket; And For Related Purposes.

766.title: Radar; authorize sheriff and deputy sheriffs to use on county roads to enforce speed limits.
766.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff And His Deputies In Any County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon The Public Streets, Roads And Highways Of The County Lying Outside Of The Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

767.title: Administrative Office of Courts; may disclose to DPS certain information concerning children that is stored in office's data system.
767.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Administrative Office Of Courts To Disclose To The Department Of Public Safety Information Involving Children That Is Contained In The Office's Youth Court Data Management System Known As The Mississippi Youth Court Information Delivery System Or "mycids"; To Amend Section 43-21-561, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Youth Courts To Adjudicate The Status Of A Child As A Child In Need Of Special Care; And For Related Purposes.

768.title: Domestic violence; revise assault as an offense.
768.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Assault As Constituting Domestic Violence And To Include Strangulation Within The Offense; To Amend Section 99-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Children Of The Parties As Possible Victims Of Domestic Violence; To Amend Section 99-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A 24-hour Cooling-off Period; To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

769.title: Ad valorem taxes; school district not required to advertise revenue increase when district proposes no millage increase.
769.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A School District Shall Not Be Required To Advertise A Notice Of Budget Revenue Increase When The Amount Of The Increased Revenue From Ad Valorem Taxes In A Budget Is Derived Solely Because Of Increases In Property Values And Not From An Increase In The Millage Rate; And For Related Purposes.

770.title: Public benefits; deny to any person not lawfully present in the United States.
770.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For Public Benefits In Mississippi To Verify United States Citizenship Or Lawful Presence In The United States In Order To Be Eligible For The Benefits; To Provide Procedures And Exceptions For That Verification; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Willful Violations Of The Lawful Presence Requirements; To Prohibit State Agencies And Political Subdivisions From Providing Any Public Benefits In Violation Of The Lawful Presence Requirements; To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-17-1, 43-33-15 And 71-5-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Require The Division Of Medicaid, The Department Of Human Services, The Mississippi Housing Authorities And The Department Of Employment Security To Require Applicants Of Public Assistance Programs To Verify Lawful Presence In The United States As Required Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

772.title: Blood tests; authorize EMTs to administer under Implied Consent Law.
772.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-11-3, 63-11-5, 63-11-7, 63-11-9 And 63-11-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Who Is Authorized To Administer A Blood Test Under The Implied Consent Law; And For Related Purposes.

773.title: Regional correctional facility; authorize Department of Corrections to contract with DeSoto County for.
773.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Corrections To Contract With The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County To House Inmates In A Regional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

774.title: Income tax; authorize adjustment to gross income for physician providing services for which no compensation is received.
774.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Adjustment To Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law For A Taxpayer Who Is A Licensed Physician And Provides Any Medical Service Or Treatment For Which The Taxpayer Receives No Compensation; To Provide That The Amount Of The Adjustment To Gross Income Will Be Equal To The Amount Of Payment The Taxpayer Would Have Received If Payment For The Service Or Treatment Were Made Under The State Plan For Medical Assistance Under Medicaid; And For Related Purposes.

775.title: Counties; expand types of drainage structures may incur costs for.
775.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-92.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Types Of Drainage Structures For Which A County Is Authorized To Incur Costs; And For Related Purposes.

776.title: Ad valorem taxes; revise advertising requirements when school district proposes no millage increase.
776.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Form And Content Of The Required Newspaper Advertisement When A School Board's Proposed Ad Valorem Tax Effort For The Support Of The School District Does Not Require Any Increase In Its Current Millage Rate; And For Related Purposes.

777.title: Retirement; first responders who served in coast counties during Hurricane Katrina shall receive extra PERS credit.
777.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Vested Member Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Served As A First Responder In Hancock, Harrison Or Jackson County During The Period From August 29, 2005, Through September 5, 2005, And Who Served As A First Responder With The Same Agency Or Political Subdivision For Not Less Than One Year Thereafter, Shall Be Entitled To Additional Creditable Service In The System For That Service As A First Responder At No Cost, Not To Exceed One Year Of Creditable Service; And For Related Purposes.

778.title: Driver's licenses; authorize public school driver's education instructors to conduct driving tests in lieu of license examiner.
778.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-25-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Driver Education Instructors In The Public Schools To Officially Test The Driving Skills Of Students Completing A Public School Driver Training And Education Program; To Amend Section 63-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Department Of Public Safety License Examiners To Accept The Results Of Such Public School Driving Skills Tests In Lieu Of Conducting Skills Tests With Applicants For An Operator's License Or Temporary Driving Permit; To Amend Section 63-1-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

779.title: Dialysis treatment; require facilities providing to maintain backup power supply for dialysis machines.
779.description: An Act To Require Facilities That Provide Dialysis Treatment To Persons Diagnosed With End Stage Renal Disease To Maintain A Backup Power Supply Or System For The Dialysis Machines That Are Of Sufficient Capacity To Continue The Operation Of The Machines During A Full Power Failure; To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Monitor The Facilities And Enforce Compliance With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

781.title: Child care facilities; require to call child's contact persons if child hasn't arrived within one hour of normal times.
781.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-20-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Child Care Facilities To Call The Contact Persons For A Child On The List Maintained By The Facility If The Child Has Not Arrived At The Facility Within One Hour After The Normal Time For Arrival; To Require That The Child's Parent Or Legal Guardian Be The First Contact Person Listed On That List; And For Related Purposes.

782.title: Food unsafe for human consumption; authorize State Health Officer to prohibit sale of in this state.
782.description: An Act To Amend Sections 69-1-18 And 75-29-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Health Officer, With The Consent Of The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce, To Prohibit The Sale Of Food Deemed Unsafe For Human Consumption In This State; And For Related Purposes.

784.title: Health screening; require annually for Medicaid, CHIP & State Health Plan recipients & participants.
784.description: An Act To Require All Persons Who Are Recipients Of Benefits Under The Medicaid Program, The Children's Health Insurance Program, And The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan To Be Tested Or Screened Annually For The Use Of Illegal Drugs, Abuse Of Alcohol, Hepatitis B And C, Tuberculosis And Sexually Transmitted Diseases; To Provide That The Cost Of That Testing Or Screening Shall Be Covered As A Benefit Under Each Respective Program Or Plan; To Amend Sections 25-15-9, 41-86-17 And 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

785.title: Children's Health Insurance Program; transfer administration to Division of Medicaid.
785.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-86-1, 41-86-5, 41-86-7, 41-86-9, 41-86-11, 41-86-13 And 41-86-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Administration Of The State Children's Health Insurance Program And The State Child Health Plan From The State And School Employees Health Insurance Management Board To The Division Of Medicaid; To Repeal Sections 41-86-3, 41-86-17, 41-86-19 And 41-86-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For A Temporary Program For Children's Health Insurance, Specify The Covered Benefits And Services To Be Provided Under The Children's Health Insurance Program, Establish A Children's Health Insurance Program Enrollment Outreach Initiative, And Establish A Children's Health Insurance Program Advisory Board And Joint Legislative Advisory Committee; And For Related Purposes.

786.title: Sickle cell disease; create task force to study growing incidence and available treatment options.
786.description: An Act To Create The Concern For Children With Sickle Cell Disease Task Force; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Set Forth The Duties Of The Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

790.title: Mental Health, Dept. of; not less than 40% of funds appropriated to must be expended on children.
790.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-4-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Not Less Than Forty Percent Of The Total Amount Appropriated To The Department Of Mental Health For Any Fiscal Year Shall Be Expended By The Department For Programs And Services For Persons Who Are Under Twenty-one Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

791.title: MS Highways 24 and 33; designate certain segments of.
791.description: An Act To Designate Certain Segments Of Mississippi Highway 24 And Mississippi Highway 33 As "camp Van Dorn Highway," "99th Infantry Division Highway" And "63rd Infantry Division Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

792.title: Judges; provide additional chancellor for the Fourth Chancery Court District.
792.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Two Chancellors For The Fourth Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

793.title: All-terrain vehicles; establish ownership registration network and provide free safety course.
793.description: An Act To Require The Owner Of An All-terrain Vehicle To Register The Vehicle With The Sheriff's Department Of The County Of His Or Her Residence; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Establish A Statewide All-terrain Vehicle Registration Network Designed To Provide Immediate Response To Sheriffs' Departments And Law Enforcement Agencies With Regard To Reports Or Complaints Of Stolen Or Missing All-terrain Vehicles; To Provide For The Collection And Disposition Of Fees For Operation And Maintenance Of The Network; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Develop And Offer An All-terrain Vehicle Safety Course Conducted By And Using Course Materials, Curricula And Instructors Provided By The Department; To Provide That The Course Shall Be Available Free Of Charge To Any Person Who Wishes To Participate In The Course Who Has Registered His All-terrain Vehicle As Provided Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

794.title: CON; issue for add'l ICF-MR beds at community living program for developmentally disabled adults in Madison County.
794.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of A Certificate Of Need For Additional Icf-mr Beds In An Existing Community Living Program For Developmentally Disabled Adults In Madison County; And For Related Purposes.

795.title: Retirement; earned compensation of judges of the Supreme Court and Court of Appeals includes all remuneration except mileage.
795.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Purposes Of The Public Employees' Retirement System, The Term "earned Compensation" For Justices Of The Supreme Court And Judges Of The Court Of Appeals Shall Include All Remuneration Amounts Paid, Except Mileage; To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize Justices Of The Supreme Court And Judges Of The Court Of Appeals To Claim As Earned Compensation The Expense Allowances Paid To Them From And After December 31, 2003, That Were Not Reported As A Part Of Their Earned Compensation To The Public Employees' Retirement System Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

796.title: Driver's license; provide that retired law enforcement officer may be identified by distinctive symbol, character or endorsement.
796.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Resident Of This State Who Holds A Valid Mississippi Driver's License And Who Is A Retired Law Enforcement Officer, Upon Renewal Of His Driver's License, May Request That The Driver's License Issued To That Person Contain A Distinctive Symbol, Character Or Endorsement Thereon Identifying That Person As A Retired Law Enforcement Officer; And For Related Purposes.

797.title: Tax sales; require actual notice to owner and any mortgagee, beneficiary or lienholder of record before pending tax sale.
797.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-41-55 And 27-41-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Conduct Of The Sale Of Land For Unpaid Ad Valorem Taxes, To Require Actual Notice In Advance Of The Pending Tax Sale To The Owner Of, Along With Any Mortgagee, Beneficiary Or Lienholder Of Record With Regard To, The Land; To Amend Sections 27-43-1, 27-43-3, 27-43-5 And 27-43-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

799.title: Appellate judges; provide for appointed judges of Supreme Court and Court of Appeals.
799.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-4-5, 23-15-197, 23-15-849, 23-15-973, 23-15-975, 23-15-977, 23-15-991 And 23-15-993, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Judges Of The Supreme Court And Court Of Appeals Shall Be Appointed With The Advice And Consent Of The Senate At The End Of The Current Terms And Every Eight Years Thereafter; To Provide An Election At The End Of A Term To Determine If An Incumbent Judge Shall Be Retained Or Removed And A Successor Appointed; To Repeal Section 9-4-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Time For Electing Judges Of The Court Of Appeals; To Repeal Section 23-15-995, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Applicability Of Election Laws To The Election Of Judges Of The Supreme Court; And For Related Purposes.

800.title: Concealed weapons; allow persons with license to carry anywhere except into secure facilities.
800.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Persons Who Possess A Valid License To Carry A Stun Gun, Concealed Pistol Or Revolver To Carry Those Weapons Into Any Facility Or Place Except For Secure Facilities For Which There Are Persons Charged With The Search And Security Of The Facility To Prohibit Persons Other Than Law Enforcement Officers From Carrying Weapons Into The Facility, And For Which There Is Posted A Written Notice That The Carrying Of Those Weapons Is Prohibited; To Prohibit The Carrying Of Those Weapons Into Certain Other Facilities And Places; To Require The Facilities In Which The Carrying Of Those Weapons Is Prohibited To Provide To Persons Who Enter The Facility A Location In Which They May Securely Surrender The Weapons During The Time That They Are In The Facility; And For Related Purposes.

801.title: Public funds; prohibit investment in countries sponsoring terrorism.
801.description: An Act To Require That No Public Funds Shall Be Invested In Any Financial Investment That Has Relationships With Terrorist Sponsoring Nations; And For Related Purposes.

802.title: MAEP; define "at-risk pupil" and include a child diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder in the definition.
802.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "at-risk Pupil" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Include A Child Diagnosed With An Autism Spectrum Disorder In The Definition Of An "at-risk Pupil"; And For Related Purposes.

803.title: School social workers and psychologists; authorize districts to employ and receive partial state reimbursement for salaries.
803.description: An Act To Authorize School Boards To Employ And Fix The Compensation Of Licensed Social Workers And Licensed Psychologists To Provide Services To Students Enrolled In And In Attendance At The Schools Of The School District; To Provide That Any School District That Employs At Least One Social Worker Or Psychologist For Every One Thousand Students Enrolled In The Schools Of The District Is Eligible For Reimbursement For Fifty Percent Of The Cost Of The Salary Of Each Social Worker Or Psychologist From The State Department Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

804.title: Mississippi Skill Standards Board; create as advisory board on industry standards.
804.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Skill Standards Board As An Advisory Board To The Governor, The Legislature And The State Workforce Development System For The Development Of A Statewide System Of Industry-defined, Industry-recognized Skill Standards And Credentials For Certain Skilled Occupations; To Provide For The Composition Of The Board; To Provide The Duties Of The Board; And For Related Purposes.

805.title: Life jackets; increase maximum age of persons required to wear on certain vessels.
805.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-21-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From Twelve To Eighteen The Maximum Age Of Persons Who Are Required To Wear A Coast Guard Approved Personal Flotation Device While On Board A Motorboat, Sailboat Or Vessel That Measures Less Than Twenty-six Feet In Length And Which Is Underway; To Amend Section 59-21-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Penalty For Violations Of The Mississippi Boating Law; And For Related Purposes.

806.title: Identity theft; establish procedure for victim to have debt forgiven and credit reports purged.
806.description: An Act To Establish A Procedure For A Victim Of Identity Theft To Have The Debt Forgiven And Credit Reports Purged; And For Related Purposes.

807.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage for certain obesity treatments.
807.description: An Act To Require That Certain Insurance Policies And Contracts Shall Provide Coverage For Obesity Treatment For An Individual Who Has A Body Mass Index That Is Thirty Percent Or More Above His Or Her Ideal Body Weight And When A Written Order Is Provided By A Physician That States The Treatment Is Medically Necessary; And For Related Purposes.

808.title: State employees with certain licenses; require to be paid same as other state employees with license if certain skills used.
808.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any State Employee Who Possesses Or Attains A Vocational Or Technical License And Who Uses The Skills Required By Such License To Perform At Least 30% Of The Duties Of The Employee's Position Shall Be Paid A Salary At Least Equal To The Salary Paid To Other State Employees Who Are Employed In Positions That Require Such Vocational Or Technical License; And For Related Purposes.

809.title: Juneteenth Freedom Day; designate as day of commemoration, not legal holiday.
809.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate June 19 As "juneteenth Freedom Day"; To Specifically Provide That This Shall Not Be A Legal Holiday; To Provide That This Shall Be A Day Of Commemoration At No Expense To The State; And For Related Purposes.

810.title: CON; shall not be extended more than one time and shall not be valid after 18 months.
810.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Not Extend A Certificate Of Need More Than One Time, And The Maximum Period Of Time That A Certificate Of Need Shall Be Valid, Including Any Extension Of The Certificate, Shall Be Eighteen Months; To Provide That Certificates Of Need For Skilled Nursing Facilities, Hospitals, Psychiatric Hospitals, Chemical Dependency Hospitals And Long-term Care Hospitals Shall Be Issued For A Period Of Not More Than Sixty Months As Specified By The State Department Of Health, And The Maximum Period Of Time That A Certificate Of Need Issued For Those Facilities Shall Be Valid, Including Any Extension Of The Certificate, Shall Be Sixty-six Months; And For Related Purposes.

811.title: Contributing to the neglect or delinquency of a child and abuse of a child; revise penalties for.
811.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Contributing To The Neglect Or Delinquency Of Any Child, Abuse Of A Child, Aiding In The Escape Of A Child Under Certain Circumstances Or Aiding In The Harboring Or Concealing Of A Child Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

812.title: Crimes; create offense regarding throwing objects from an overpass and striking a motor vehicle.
812.description: An Act To Create A Felony Offense Regarding Throwing Objects From An Overpass And Striking A Motor Vehicle; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

813.title: CON; issue for nursing home in Holmes County.
813.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of Nursing Facility Beds Or The Conversion Of Other Beds To Nursing Facility Beds In Holmes County, Not To Exceed Sixty Beds; And For Related Purposes.

814.title: Motorcycles; create Safety and Operator Training Program.
814.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Establish And Operate A Motorcycle Safety And Operator Training Program For The Purpose Of Motorcycle Operator Training And To Promote Motorcycle Safety And Motorcycle Awareness; To Establish Course Requirements; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Appoint A Statewide Motorcycle Safety Director To Administer The Program; To Prescribe The Qualifications Of The Director And The Program Instructors; To Provide That Applicants For Motorcycle Operators' Licenses Or Motorcycle Endorsements Who Have Successfully Completed A Course Under The Program Shall Be Exempt From The Motorcycle Licensing Knowledge Test And Skill Test; To Establish A Motorcycle Safety And Operator Training Fund; To Amend Sections 27-19-5, 63-1-21 And 63-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase Certain Taxes And Fees To Fund The Program; To Amend Sections 63-1-6 And 63-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

815.title: Family masters; clarify chancellors' authority in Seventh Chancery Court District.
815.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of Chancellors In The Seventh Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

816.title: Pharmacists; require to notify primary care physicians of persons to whom they give injections.
816.description: An Act To Require Pharmacists Who Are Authorized To Administer Injections To Obtain From Each Person To Whom They Give An Injection The Name Of The Person's Primary Care Physician; To Require The Pharmacist To Notify The Person's Primary Care Physician Of The Date Of The Injection And The Name And Dosage Amount Of The Medicine Or Other Substance That Was Given In The Injection; And For Related Purposes.

817.title: Retirement; authorize surviving spouses of PERS members to choose different spouse annuity.
817.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-114, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Surviving Spouses Of Deceased Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Previously Selected A Spouse Annuity That Does Not Have A Remarriage Penalty To Choose To Receive A Different Spouse Annuity For Which The Remarriage Penalty Has Been Removed; And For Related Purposes.

818.title: All-terrain vehicles; provide penalty for driving on public highways, roads or streets.
818.description: An Act To Provide A Penalty For Persons Convicted Of Driving An All-terrain Vehicle On A Public Highway, Road Or Street; And For Related Purposes.

819.title: Recreational vehicles; require repurchase of inventory by manufacturer when dealer ceases to be a dealer.
819.description: An Act To Require Manufacturers Of Recreational Vehicles To Repurchase Certain Inventory From Dealers Who Cease To Engage In The Business Of Selling Recreational Vehicles; To Provide A Penalty For The Failure To Repurchase Recreational Vehicle Inventory And Parts; And For Related Purposes.

820.title: Gasoline excise tax; increase and use additional revenues for city, county and state highways purposes.
820.description: An Act Entitled The "save Our Roads Act Of 2010"; To Provide That Twenty-five Percent Of The Proceeds From An Increase In The Gasoline Excise Tax Shall Be Allocated To Fund A Loan Program Under Which Counties And Municipalities May Obtain Loans To Construct, Repair, Renovate, Rehabilitate And Improve County And Municipal Roads; To Provide That Seventy-five Percent Of Such Proceeds Shall Be Allocated To The Construction, Reconstruction, Replacement, Rehabilitation And Improvement Of State-maintained Highways And Bridges On Those Highways; To Establish The Local Governments Road Improvement Project Revolving Loan Program, To Be Administered By The Mississippi Department Of Transportation; To Require That The Maximum Amount Of A Loan Under The Program Is Fifty Percent Of The Costs Of The Specific Project For Which The Loan Is Made; To Require That The County Or Municipality Receiving A Loan Under The Program Shall Match At Least Fifty Percent Of The Costs Of The Specific Project For Which The Loan Is Made; To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Gasoline Excise Tax By Five Cents Per Gallon; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Twenty-five Percent Of The Proceeds Of The Tax Increase Shall Be Deposited Into The Local Governments Road Improvement Project Revolving Loan Fund, And That Seventy-five Percent Of Such Proceeds Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Account Within The State Highway Fund, To Be Expended Solely For The Purpose Of The Construction, Reconstruction, Replacement, Rehabilitation And Improvement Of State-maintained Highways And Bridges On Those Highways; To Amend Sections 19-9-5 And 21-33-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

821.title: Local System Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to provide funds for.
821.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund; To Amend Section 65-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

822.title: Law enforcement officers and fire fighters; increase death and disability benefits under trust funds.
822.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Death Benefit Payable From The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund For Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Killed In The Line Of Duty; To Create A Legal Presumption That Certain Health Conditions Resulting In The Death Of A Law Enforcement Officer Or Fire Fighter Occurred In The Line Of Duty; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Maximum Number Of Payments That May Be Made From The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To A Law Enforcement Officer Or Fire Fighter Who Suffers A Disability In The Line Of Duty And To Delete The Prohibition Against Payment Of Disability Benefits For Chronic Or Repetitive Injury; To Create A Legal Presumption That Certain Health Conditions Resulting In The Disability Of A Law Enforcement Officer Or Fire Fighter Occurred In The Line Of Duty; And For Related Purposes.

823.title: Jails; remove requirement that county jails be built in the county seats.
823.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-7-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That A County Jail Must Be Built Within The Corporate Limits Of The County Seat; And For Related Purposes.

824.title: Small business health insurance pool; create.
824.description: An Act To Create A Small Business Health Insurance Pool; To Provide For Employer Premium Incentive Payments, Employee Premium Assistance Payments, And Tax Credits To Be Administered By The Commissioner Of Insurance For Eligible Small Employers Who Provide Certain Group Health Plan Coverage For Their Eligible Employees; To Provide That Certain Eligible Small Employers May Receive Premium Incentive Payments And Employees May Receive Assistance For Paying Premiums For Health Insurance Purchased Through The Small Business Health Insurance Pool; To Allow The Tax Credit To Be Claimed When Filing Tax Returns; To Create The Small Business Health Insurance Pool Board Of Directors And Establishing Its Duties; To Provide Authority To The Board To Establish Eligibility Requirements For Receiving The Premium Incentive Payments, Premium Assistance Payments, And Tax Credits; To Provide Rulemaking Authority To The Commissioner To Implement The Premium Incentive Payments, Premium Assistance Payments, And Tax Credits; To Provide Penalties For Wrongfully Obtaining Premium Incentive Payments, Premium Assistance Payments, Or The Tax Credit; To Authorize The Division Of Medicaid To Pursue Medicaid Funding For Employee Premium Assistance; To Bring Forward Sections 27-7-15, 27-69-13, 27-69-75, 97-17-41 And 97-17-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

825.title: District attorneys; provide additional assistant for the Twelfth Circuit Court District.
825.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Legal Assistant For The Twelfth Circuit Court District; And For Related Purposes.

826.title: Uninsured motorist coverage; provide that coverage is mandatory in every automobile liability insurance policy.
826.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Mandate Uninsured Motorist Coverage In All Automobile Liability Insurance Policies; And For Related Purposes.

827.title: Motor vehicle liability insurance policy; require to include medical payment coverage.
827.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Policies To Include Medical Payment Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

828.title: Uninsured motorist coverage; policyholder must reject knowingly in writing in order to decline coverage.
828.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Policyholder Must Reject, Knowingly And Intelligently, Uninsured Motorist Coverage In Writing In Order To Decline The Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

830.title: Workers' compensation; increase benefits for serious facial or head disfigurement.
830.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $2,000.00 To $5,000.00 The Amount Of Compensation The Workers' Compensation Commission Is Authorized To Award For Serious Facial Or Head Disfigurements; And For Related Purposes.

831.title: Workers' compensation; provide for appeal of commission decisions directly to Court of Appeals.
831.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Decisions Made By The Workers' Compensation Commission May Be Appealed Directly To The Court Of Appeals; To Amend Section 9-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

832.title: Civil Rights Division; establish in the Office of Attorney General.
832.description: An Act To Create The Civil Rights Division In The Office Of The Attorney General; To Provide That The Civil Rights Division Shall Investigate And Prosecute Civil Rights Violations; And For Related Purposes.

833.title: Workers' compensation; require emergency hearing upon request of either party.
833.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Workers' Compensation Commission To Order An Emergency Hearing Upon Request Or Petition Of Either Party For Such Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

834.title: Circuit Court Community Corrections Act of 2010; create.
834.description: An Act To Create A Community Corrections Pilot Program For The Sixth, Seventh, Eleventh, Twelfth, Fourteenth, Fifteenth And Nineteenth Circuit Court Districts; To Provide That The Community Corrections Programs Be Known As The Circuit Court Community Corrections Programs; To Provide That The Name Of The Commission Which Operates Programs And Support Services For A Circuit Court Community Corrections Program Shall Be The Circuit Court Community Corrections Commission, Which Shall Oversee And Operate All Programs, Services And Administrative Functions Of The Circuit Court Community Corrections Program; To Provide For The Composition Of Each Commission; To Allow The Commission To Appoint An Executive Director, Who Shall Serve At Its Pleasure; To Incorporate Into The Circuit Court Community Corrections Program Support Services And Programs Concerning Pretrial Release, Community Service, Supervision For Certain Participants Entering A Plea Of Guilty, Post-adjudication Supervision, A Vocational/educational And Employment Program, Residential Rehabilitation And Work Release, A Reentry Residential And Nonresidential Program, Adult And Juvenile Drug And Dui Court Programs And Services, Including, But Not Limited To, Deferred Prosecution And Pretrial Diversion, And Any Other Similar Or Related Program; To Define Persons Eligible To Participate In Such Programs And Services And To Allow Refusal Of Participation In Programs And Services To Otherwise Eligible Persons Whose Participation Would Not Be In The Public Interest Or Would Invalidate The Intent Of The Programs Or Services Offered; To Authorize A Circuit Court Community Corrections Program To Collect Reasonable Fees From Participants In Its Programs And Services; To Provide For An Annual Audit Of A Circuit Court Community Corrections Program; To Authorize A Circuit Court Community Corrections Program The Ability To Hire Legal, Accounting And Other Professional Services; To Authorize The Executive Director To Defer Or Waive The Payment Of Any Fees Based Upon The Financial Hardship Of A Participant Or His Or Her Dependent; To Provide That Any Participant In A Residential Program Who Willfully Fails To Report To Such Program As Ordered, Or Who Willfully Fails To Return To Such Program From A Job Or Temporary Pass, Shall Be Guilty Of Escape; To Provide That The Provisions And Enumerated Powers Described Shall Not Interfere With, Or Change In Any Manner, The Drug Court Or Pretrial Diversion Programs Currently Operating In Circuit Court Districts Authorized By Other State Statutes; And For Related Purposes.

835.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize issuance of bonds for.
835.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of The Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

836.title: Sex education; require local school board to adopt a policy to implement abstinence-only or abstinence-plus education into curriculum.
836.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Local School Board To Adopt A Sex-related Education Policy To Implement Abstinence-only Or Abstinence-plus Education Into Its Local School District's Curriculum By June 30, 2011, Or To Require The Local School Board To Adopt The Program Developed By The Mississippi Department Of Human Services And The Department Of Health; To Require The State Department To Approve Each District's Curriculum For Sex-related Education And Establish A Protocol To Be Used By Districts To Provide Continuity In Teaching The Approved Curriculum; To Provide That Instruction In School Districts Implementing Abstinence-plus Education Into The Curriculum May Be Expanded Beyond The Instruction For Abstinence-only Education Within Parameters Approved By The Department; To Define Abstinence-plus Education; To Remove The Authority Given To Local School Boards To Vote In Favor Of Teaching Sex Education Without Any Instruction On Abstinence; To Prohibit Any Teaching That Abortion Can Be Used To Prevent The Birth Of A Baby; To Require Boys And Girls To Be Separated Into Different Classes By Gender At All Times When Sex-related Education Is Discussed Or Taught; To Require The Department Of Human Services And The Department Of Health To Develop Certain Programs And Strategies Promoting Pregnancy Prevention And Providing Information On The Consequences Of Unprotected, Uninformed And Underage Sexual Activity; To Provide For The Repeal Of This Section On July 1, 2015; To Amend Section 37-13-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Student Shall Be Required To Take Or Participate In Any Class Or Course In Sex-related Education Unless The Student's Parent Or Guardian Submits A Written Request To That Participation; To Require The State Board Of Education To Maintain Certain Standards In The Social Studies Curriculum Used In The Public Schools And To Prohibit History Courses From Being Revised For Partisan Or Philosophical Purposes; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 507, Laws Of 2009, To Revise The Duties Of The Teen Pregnancy Task Force And To Extend The Date Of The Repeal On The Task Force To July 1, 2015; To Require The State Department Of Health And The State Department Of Education, Subject To The Availability Of Funds, To Establish A Pilot Program In Each Health Care District, To Be Located In A School District In A County Having The Highest Number Of Teen Pregnancies; To Require Those Agencies To Provide Certain Educational Services Through Qualified Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

837.title: Driver's lic.; allow persons whose parent has a disability or is a farmer to obtain intermediate after holding a permit 6 months.
837.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Persons Whose Parent Or Guardian Has A Disability Or Whose Parent Or Guardian Is A Farmer To Obtain An Intermediate Driver's License If They Are At Least 15-1/2 Years Of Age And Have Held A Temporary Driving Permit For At Least 6 Months; And For Related Purposes.

838.title: Registered Interior Designer Registration Act; create.
838.description: An Act To Enact The Registered Interior Designer Registration Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide That The Registration Of Interior Designers Shall Be Under The Mississippi Board Of Architecture; To Provide For Qualifications Of Applicants; To Provide For Examination Of Applicants; To Provide Reciprocity With Other Jurisdictions; To Require Continuing Education; To Provide For The Biannual Renewal Of Certificates Of Registration; To Require Fees; To Provide For The Regulation Of Conduct Of Interior Designers; To Require The Posting Of Certificates Of Registration; To Provide For The Interior Design Advisory Committee And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Provide For The Deposit Of Funds; To Provide Compensation For Members Of The Interior Design Advisory Committee; To Provide For Disciplinary Procedures; To Provide For Appeals; To Provide Exemptions From The Provisions Of This Act; To Prohibit Certain Actions; To Address Interior Designers In Certain Corporate Or Other Professional Organizations; And For Related Purposes.

839.title: Sales under execution; reduce time period during which those sales may be held.
839.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-5-99 And 13-3-169, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Time Period During Which Sales Of Real Estate By Court Order And Sales Under Execution May Be Held; And For Related Purposes.

840.title: Municipal utility districts, certain; place under jurisdiction of the Public Service Commission.
840.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Place Any Utility Owned Or Operated By The City Of Moss Point Under The Jurisdiction Of The Public Service Commission; And For Related Purposes.

841.title: Mississippi Development Authority; require to conduct review of infrastructures in counties with high rates of poverty.
841.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Development Authority (mda) To Conduct A Yearly Study And Provide A Legislative Report That Identifies The Public Infrastructure Conditions And Needs Of Certain Counties With The Highest Percentages Of Poverty Within The State; To Require Mda To Provide Guidance And Assistance To Such Counties To Assist The Counties In Improving Their Public Infrastructures; And For Related Purposes.

842.title: Elections; require electors to present certain types of identification before being allowed to vote.
842.description: An Act To Require Persons Who Appear To Vote In Person At A Polling Place Or The Registrar's Office To Identify Themselves By Presenting Certain Types Of Identification To An Election Manager Or The Registrar Before They Are Allowed To Vote; To Provide For The Issuance Of A Mississippi Voter Identification Card Free Of Charge To Qualified Electors Who Do Not Have A Valid Mississippi Driver's License Or Identification Card; To Provide That Such Card Shall Be Valid Only As Identification For Voting Purposes; To Amend Sections 23-15-11, 23-15-541 And 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

843.title: Real estate; allow covenants to prohibit sale or lease of property to registered sex offenders.
843.description: An Act To Allow Real Estate Covenants To Prohibit Registered Sex Offenders From Purchasing Or Leasing Certain Residential Property; To Amend Section 45-33-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

844.title: Public benefits; agencies administering programs for must verify lawful presence in U.S. of applicants for.
844.description: An Act To Require State Agencies And Political Subdivisions To Verify The Lawful Presence In The United States Of Any Person Who Applies For State, Local Or Federal Public Benefits; To Provide For Certain Exceptions To This Requirement For Verification; To Provide That Applicants For Public Benefits Must Execute An Affidavit That He Or She Is A United States Citizen Or Is A Qualified Alien Under Federal Law And Is Lawfully Present In The United States; To Provide For A Criminal Penalty For Willfully Making A False Statement Of Representation In The Affidavit Required By This Act; To Require Each State Agency And Political Subdivision That Administers Any Program Of State Or Local Public Benefits To Provide An Annual Report To The Attorney General With Respect To Its Compliance With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

845.title: Counties; authorize board of supervisors to employ attorney as full-time county employee.
845.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County To Employ An Attorney As A Full-time County Employee; To Amend Section 19-23-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The County Prosecuting Attorney May Not Be Employed By The Board Of Supervisors As Such Full-time Attorney; And For Related Purposes.

846.title: Radar; sheriff may use in counties over 70,000 and impose additional state assessment for violations when radar used.
846.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff And His Deputies In Any County Having A Population Of 70,000 Or More To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon The Public Streets, Roads And Highways Of The County Lying Outside Of The Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; To Reduce From 15,000 To 14,000 The Minimum Population Requirements Of Municipalities Whose Law Enforcement Officers Are Authorized To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment On Federally Designated Highways Lying Within The Corporate Limits; To Amend Section 63-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Fine That May Be Imposed Upon Conviction Of Any Person For A Motor Vehicle Speeding Violation Where A Radar Speed Detection Device Was Used As Evidence Of The Violation By A Sheriff Or Deputy Sheriff In A County Having A Population Of 70,000 Or More; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose An Additional State Assessment Upon Persons Convicted Of A Motor Vehicle Speeding Violation Where A Radar Speed Detection Device Was Used As Evidence Of The Violation By A Sheriff Or Deputy Sheriff In A County Having A Population Of 70,000 Or More; To Prescribe The Manner By Which The Amount Of The Additional Assessment Shall Be Calculated; To Provide That The Assessment Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; And For Related Purposes.

847.title: Radar; Pearl River Valley Water Supply District may use.
847.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Use Of Radar Speed Detection Equipment By Patrol Officers Appointed By The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District On Roads And Streets Of Property Owned By Or Under The Jurisdiction Or Control Of The District; And For Related Purposes.

848.title: Liability insurance for certain vessels; require and provide for uninsured vessel coverage.
848.description: An Act To Require That Certain Vessels Operated On The Waters Of This State Shall Have An Insurance Card Maintained In The Vessel As Proof Of Liability Insurance; To Provide Penalties For Failure To Have The Insurance Card In The Vessel; To Require That Vessel Liability Insurance Policies Shall Contain Provisions For Uninsured Vessel Coverage; To Provide Definitions; To Provide For The Reporting Of An Accident; To Provide For Subrogation To The Insurer Paying An Uninsured Vessel Claim; To Allow Certain Excess Insurance Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

849.title: Marijuana; conform possession, possession in a motor vehicle.
849.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Penalties For Possession Of Marijuana, Possession Of Marijuana In A Motor Vehicle And Possession Of Paraphernalia; And For Related Purposes.

850.title: Motor vehicle liability insurance; require insurers to notify Department of Public Safety in event of lapse.
