1101.description: An Act To Authorize The Use Of A Global Positioning Monitoring System As A Condition Of Bond For A Person Who Is A Defendant In A Domestic Violence Case; To Define Certain Terms; To Specify Conditions Of Such Bond; To Require The Court To Provide Certain Information To The Victim Of The Domestic Violence Case; To Provide For The Use Of The System; To Provide That The Victim May Request That The Use Of The System Be Terminated; To Address Indigency In The Use Of Such Systems; To Provide That A Bond Issued With The Conditions Provided In This Act Shall Be Supplemental To Other Bonds Provided By Law; And For Related Purposes.

1102.title: Gun permits; clarify that permit law supersedes other provisions of law.
1102.description: An Act To Amend Sections 45-9-101, 49-1-43, 49-7-49, 97-15-13 And 97-37-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Provisions Of Law Which Authorize A Person To Possess And Carry Firearms Shall Supersede Any Other Provision Which Could Impair Or Restrict The Right To Possess Or Carry Firearms; And For Related Purposes.

1103.title: Interpreting services for the deaf and hard of hearing; revise credentialing requirements and related provisions.
1103.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-33-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Credentialing Requirements Of Certain Persons Who Provide Interpreting Services To The Deaf And Hearing Impaired For A Fee, And To Grant The Mississippi Department Of Rehabilitation Services, Office On Deaf And Hard Of Hearing, Oversight Of Quality Assurance Evaluations; And For Related Purposes.

1104.title: Crabs; requirements for taking.
1104.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-84, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirements For Taking Of Crabs And Crab Traps; And For Related Purposes.

1105.title: Municipalities; authorize to provide alternative forms of notice to landowner.
1105.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure Authorized For Municipal Governing Authorities To Clean Dilapidated Property; And For Related Purposes.

1106.title: Retirement; increase to 30 the years of service required for new teachers to retire regardless of age.
1106.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase To 30 Years The Number Of Years Of Creditable Service Required For Retirement Regardless Of Age Under The Public Employees' Retirement System For New Public Schoolteachers Who Become Members Of The System On Or After July 1, 2010; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-114 And 25-11-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1107.title: Distinctive license tags; authorize issuance to supporters of the Biloxi Public School District.
1107.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Biloxi Public School District; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1108.title: Murderer; clarify that murderer cannot inherit property of victim.
1108.description: An Act To Amend Sections 91-1-25 And 91-5-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Murderer Cannot Inherit From A Victim; And For Related Purposes.

1110.title: Reimbursement to counties for Department of Corrections prisoners; clarify that counties are not responsible for certain medical costs.
1110.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-901, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A County Shall Not Be Liable For Medical Costs That Exceed Medicaid Rates Or Rates Paid By The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; To Provide That Certain Contracts For Negotiated Medical Fees Shall Not Be Impaired; To Authorize The Commissioner Of The Department To Amend Or Extend Certain Agreements Pertaining To Certain Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1111.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of West Jones High School.
1111.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of West Jones High School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1112.title: 85% rule; prohibit application to DOC inmates under 21 years of age who have committed certain drug crimes.
1112.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From The 85% Rule Offenders Of The Department Of Corrections Who Are Under The Age Of 21 And Who Have Committed Certain Drug Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

1113.title: Municipalities; revise procedure to clean dilapidated property.
1113.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedures Provided To Municipalities To Clean Property Determined To Be A Menace To Those In The Municipal Community; And For Related Purposes.

1114.title: Distinctive license tag; reauthorize issuance to supporters of American Cancer Society.
1114.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The American Cancer Society; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1115.title: Mississippi Youthbuild Act; create.
1115.description: An Act To Be Known As The "mississippi Youthbuild Act"; To Require The Division Of Family And Children's Services Of The Department Of Human Services To Administer The Act; To Provide That Certain Disadvantaged Youth Will Be Provided With Opportunities Through Youthbuild Programs For Employment, Education, Leadership Development, Entrepreneurial Skills Development And Training In The Construction Or Rehabilitation Of Housing For Special Need Populations, Very Low-income Households Or Low-income Households; To Prescribe Requirements For Youthbuild Programs; To Describe Activities And Entities Eligible For A Youthbuild Program Grant; To Prescribe Requirements For Youthbuild Program Grant Applications; And For Related Purposes.

1116.title: Distinctive license tags; authorize issuance to supporters of D'Iberville Elementary School.
1116.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of D'iberville Elementary School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1117.title: Real estate; authorize agents to provide broker opinion of value.
1117.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-34-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Real Estate Brokers Or Salespersons To Give An Opinion To A Potential Purchaser Or Third Party As To The Recommended Listing Price Of Real Estate; To Exempt Evaluations Of The Value Of Real Estate Serving As Collateral For Certain Loans From The Provisions Of The Real Estate Appraiser Licensing And Certification Act; To Provide That Such Opinions And Evaluations Shall Not Be Appraisals; And For Related Purposes.

1118.title: Mississippi Highway 161; designate certain segment as "Dr. Aaron E. Henry Memorial Highway."
1118.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 161 In Coahoma County As "dr. Aaron E. Henry Memorial Highway"; To Add Certain Segment Of Old Mississippi 6 In Pontotoc County To State Highway System; And For Related Purposes.

1119.title: Education Employment Procedures Law; reduce probationary period for certified employees.
1119.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Probationary Period For Licensed Public School District Employees Under The Education Employment Procedures Law To One Year And To Eliminate The Probationary Period F0r Licensed Employees Transferring From Another Public School District In The State; And For Related Purposes.

1120.title: Sale of Checks Act; rename "MS Money Transmitters Act: and make various amendments.
1120.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Name Of The Chapter From The "sale Of Checks Law" To The "money Transmitters Act"; To Amend Section 75-15-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms; To Amend Section 75-15-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 75-15-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions Provided In The Act; To Amend Section 75-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Applicants For Licensure Shall Not Have Been Convicted Of A Felony Or Certain Misdemeanors; To Amend Section 75-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Surety Bond Requirement For Licensees; To Amend Sections 75-15-13, 75-15-15 And 75-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 75-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Licensees To Submit Reports Of Outstanding Money Transmissions On A Monthly Basis And To Require Licensees To Maintain Certain Records; To Amend Section 75-15-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 75-15-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Limitation On The Total Amount In Outstanding Money Transmissions Or Checks Of Licensees; To Amend Section 75-15-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A License Shall Be Automatically And Finally Revoked Upon Failure By Licensee To File When Due Certain Information Required By Law; To Amend Section 75-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Amount By Which The Commissioner May Increase The Surety Bond Or Deposit Required By Licensees; To Amend Section 75-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Create A New Section To Require Certain Licensees To Possess Permissible Investments Having An Aggregate Market Value Of Not Less Than The Aggregate Amount Of Outstanding Checks; To Create A New Section To Require Each Licensee To Comply With State And Federal Money Laundering Laws; And For Related Purposes.

1121.title: Motor vehicles; prohibit use of nitrous oxide in certain.
1121.description: An Act To Create New Section 63-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Use Of Nitrous Oxide In Any Motor Vehicle Or Motorcycle Driven On The Streets Or Highways And To Prescribe Penalties For The Use Of Nitrous Oxide In Motor Vehicles Or Motorcycles Driven On The Streets Or Highways; To Create New Section 63-3-502, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Racing And To Make The Use Of Nitrous Oxide In A Motor Vehicle Or Motorcycle That Is Driven In A Race On The Streets Or Highways An Additional Offense; And For Related Purposes.

1122.title: Distinctive license tags; authorize for various purposes.
1122.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Amory High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Lake Cormorant High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The African American Heritage Rodeo Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mississippi College School Of Law; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Aberdeen Main Street Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Lewisburg High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Center Hill High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Camp Bratton-green; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Southaven High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Desoto Central High School Band Boosters; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Horn Lake High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Hernando High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Gulfport School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Running In The State Of Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury Into Which Certain Fees Paid For The Issuance Of The License Tags Shall Be Deposited For Expenditure By The Mississippi Athletic Commission; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Biloxi Public School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of West Jones High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of D'iberville Elementary School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mount Olive Attendance Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Little League Baseball And Softball; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Saint Richard Catholic School In Jackson, Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Authorized By This Act; To Provide For The Disposition Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Amend Section 27-19-56.15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags That Display The Emblems Of Universities Located In Other States, To Revise The Distribution Of Fees Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of The University Of Alabama; To Provide That The Fee Collected From Such Distinctive License Tags Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury To The Credit Of The Blair E. Batson Hospital For Children At The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; To Amend Section 27-19-56.94, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Distribution Of Certain Monies Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags In Appreciation Of Blues Music To The Mississippi Blues Foundation; To Amend Section 27-19-56.190, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Additional Fee That Is Distributed To The Mississippi Athletic Commission From The Purchase Of The Distinctive License Tag In Support Of Boxing May Be Used By The Commission For Its Official Use Instead Of For The Payment Of Certain Travel Expenses For Amateur Boxing Athletes Attending Boxing Events; To Amend Section 27-19-56.20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Members Of Civitan International; To Amend Section 27-19-56.97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The American Cancer Society; To Amend Section 27-19-56.141, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Mississippi Sids Alliance; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-19-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires All Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Authorized And/or Renewed After July 1, 2010, To Have A County Designation Referencing The Name Of The County In Which The Vehicle Is Registered; And For Related Purposes.

1123.title: Airport authorities; authorize to enter into certain contracts.
1123.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Airport Authorities To Enter Into Contracts For The Acquisition Of Computer Equipment And Services, Telecommunication Equipment And Services, Airline And Airline Passenger Forecasting And Studies, And Airline Schedules, Regardless Of Whether The Contracts Provide A Limitation Of A Vendor's Liability, Provided The Limitation Is Commercially Reasonable And Provides Protection To An Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1124.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of Mount Olive Attendance Center.
1124.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mount Olive Attendance Center; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1125.title: Professional development; eliminate during the first week of the school year.
1125.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-343, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Local School District From Conducting Training Or Professional Development Activities During Any Week Immediately Preceding The Date Students Are Required To Report For The Start Of The School Year, To Permit The School District To Schedule The Training Or Professional Development Activities, And To Require The Training Or Professional Development To Be Conducted In A Manner That Does Not Interfere With The District's Instructional Days; To Amend Section 37-9-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Minimum Term Allowed In School Districts' Contracts With Licensed Personnel From 187 To 182 Days, And To Require School Districts To Shorten The Terms Of Contracts Previously Executed For The 2010-2011 School Year, Without Any Reduction To The Annual Salary Set Forth In Each Contract, Accordingly; To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Teacher Salary Scale Is Applicable For All Teachers Whose Contracts Are For A Term Of No Less Than The Statutorily Prescribed Minimum Number Of Days; And For Related Purposes.

1126.title: Fictitious Business Name Registration Act; enact.
1126.description: An Act To Create The Fictitious Business Name Registration Act; To Create New Section 25-93-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 25-93-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Centralized Statewide System For Voluntary Registration Of Fictitious Business Names In Order To Provide The Public With The Actual Identities Of Persons Or Entities Doing Business In This State; To Create New Section 25-93-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 25-93-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Registration; To Create New Section 25-93-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Amendments To Registrations; To Create New Section 25-93-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For The Term And Renewal Of Registrations; To Create New Section 25-93-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Registration Under The Act Does Not Confer Exclusivity Or Preservation Of Use Of A Name; To Create New Section 25-93-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Withdrawal Or Cancellation Of Registration; To Create New Section 25-93-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Registration, Amendments To Registrations, The Term And Renewal Of Registrations, And Withdrawal Or Cancellation Of Registration; To Create New Section 25-93-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Change Of Ownership; To Create New Section 25-93-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees Under The Act; To Create New Section 25-93-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Restrict The Use Of The Designation Of Certain Business Forms; To Create New Section 25-93-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Limitations On The Adoption Of Certain Fictitious Business Names; To Create New Section 25-93-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Public Access To Records Created Under The Act; To Create New Section 25-93-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Powers Of The Secretary Of State Under The Act; To Create New Section 25-93-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Penalties For Fraudulent Filings; And For Related Purposes.

1127.title: Open Meetings and Public Records Acts; revise imposition of penalties for violation of.
1127.description: An Act To Be Known As The "meetings Accountability Act"; To Amend Section 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty That May Be Imposed For Violations Of The Open Meetings Act; To Amend Section 25-61-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty That May Be Imposed Under The Public Records Act; And For Related Purposes.

1128.title: School districts; exempt from advertising requirements if no millage rate increase.
1128.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt A School District From Advertising A Notice Of Budget Revenue Increase When The Amount Of The Increased Revenue From Ad Valorem Taxes In A Budget Is Derived Solely Because Of Increases In Property Values And Not From An Increase In The Millage Rate; And For Related Purposes.

1129.title: Election Reform Act; create.
1129.description: An Act To Create The "election Reform Act"; To Provide The Times And Days On Which A Qualified Elector May Vote Early; To Provide That County Election Commissioners, With The Consent Of The County Board Of Supervisors, May Vote Unanimously To Have Additional Early Polling Sites; To Require County Election Commissioners To Give Public Notice Of The Times And Locations Of Early Voting Sites; To Require County Election Commissioners To Supervise The Use Of Voting Machines During Early Voting; To Provide That A Person Who Votes Early Shall Have The Same Assistance During The Early Voting Period That Such Person Would Be Entitled To On The Day Of Election; To Provide That The County Registrar's Budget Shall Be Paid Not Less Than Minimum Wage For A Period Not To Exceed Thirty-five Days For Hiring One Extra Deputy For The Purpose Of Carrying Out The Requirements Of This Act; To Amend Section 23-15-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Officer Charged With Printing And Distributing The Official Ballot Shall Ascertain From The Registrar Or The County Board Of Election Commissioners, At Least Ten Days Before The Beginning Of Early Voting The Number Of Ballots To Be Distributed; To Amend Sections 23-15-195, 23-15-449, 23-15-463, 23-15-641 And 23-15-653, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; To Provide That A Person May Apply To Become A Registered Voter On Election Day; To Require The Driver's License Application To Contain A Voter Registration Application; To Allow Certain Disqualified Electors To Vote; To Amend Sections 23-15-11, 23-15-13, 63-1-210, 23-15-37, 23-15-47 And 23-15-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; To Bring Forward Sections 23-15-33 And 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Revision Of The Pollbooks; And For Related Purposes.

1130.title: Open top vehicles; revise requirement for covering when carrying certain loads.
1130.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-7-83 And 63-7-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Vehicles To Be Equipped With And Use A Tarpaulin, Canvas Or Other Such Top To Cover Their Loads When Carrying Certain Loose Material Over State Highways; To Require Certain Vehicles That Are Not Equipped With A Tarpaulin, Canvas Or Other Such Top To Use Sideboards To Secure Their Load When Carrying Certain Loose Material Over State Highways; And For Related Purposes.

1131.title: U.S. Highway 72; authorize MDOT to construct an interchange and railroad overpass in Marshall County.
1131.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Construct An Interchange And Railroad Overpass On U.s. Highway 72 In Marshall County; And For Related Purposes.

1132.title: Mississippi High School Dropout Prevention Act of 2010; create.
1132.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi High School Dropout Prevention Act Of 2010; To Require The Department Of Education To Work With School Districts That Have The Lowest High School Graduation Rates; To Require The Department To Develop Methods Of Targeted Intervention For Low Performing School Districts; To Provide That Children Of A Certain Age May Not Withdraw From School Unless Certain Conditions Are Met; And For Related Purposes.

1133.title: Major medical leave; remove requirement that state employee must use one day of personal leave before using.
1133.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-3-95 And 25-3-93, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That State Employees And Appointed Officers Use One Day Of Accrued Personal Or Compensatory Leave For An Absence Due To Illness Or Injury Before Using Major Medical Leave; And For Related Purposes.

1134.title: Corrections; prohibit sex between employees of correctional facilities or law enforcement agencies and offenders.
1134.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Sexual Activity Between An Employee Of A Law Enforcement Agency Or Correctional Facility And An Offender; To Prohibit Sexual Activity Between A Civilian With Certain Supervisory Authority And An Incarcerated Offender; And For Related Purposes.

1135.title: Parole board; provide discretion for the revocation of certain offender's parole.
1135.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Parole Board Discretion To Continue Or Discontinue An Offender On Parole If An Offender Is Convicted Of A Felony While On Parole For A Crime Committed Prior To The Offender Being Placed On Parole; To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Offender Who Has Been Convicted Of Certain Drug Crimes And Is In Trusty Status May Be Awarded Additional Trusty Earned Time; And For Related Purposes.

1136.title: Deer Management Assistance Program; expand for antlerless deer harvest.
1136.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Allow Private Lands Enrolled In The Deer Management Assistance Program To Expand Means Of Harvesting Antlerless Deer; And For Related Purposes.

1137.title: Free fishing day; move from July 4.
1137.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change Free Fishing Day To Free Fishing Weekend And To Observe It During National Fishing And Boating Week; And For Related Purposes.

1138.title: Alcoholic beverages; qualified resort areas may be established in dry counties only after a countywide vote.
1138.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After July 1, 2010, A Resort Area May Not Be Established In A County That Has Not Voted In Favor Of Coming Out From Under The Dry Law Unless An Election Is Held In The County On The Question Of Whether Qualified Resort Areas Shall Be Allowed In The County; To Bring Forward Sections 67-1-5 And 67-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Define Certain Terms Used In The Local Option Alcoholic Beverages Control Law And Provide For The General Applicability Of Such Law; And For Related Purposes.

1139.title: Special hunting season; authorize commission on Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks to set.
1139.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Set A Special Season To Run Concurrently With The Primitive Weapons Season; To Amend Section 49-7-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision That Authorizes The Commission To Establish A Special Hunting Season For Youth; And For Related Purposes.

1140.title: Wildlife licenses; bring forward sections issuing hunting licenses & create additional category for lifetime sportsman's license.
1140.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Additional Category Of Resident Lifetime Sportsman License; To Bring Forward Sections 49-7-1, 49-7-3, 49-7-5, 49-7-8, 49-7-9, 49-7-12, 49-7-13, 49-7-16, 49-7-17, 49-7-34, 49-7-37, 49-7-38, 49-7-165, 49-7-22 And 49-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Licenses For Hunting, Fishing And Trapping, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1141.title: Gaming; create state lottery regulated by MS Gaming Commission to fund MS Burn Center & state education needs.
1141.description: An Act To Establish A State Lottery To Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The Administration Of The State Lottery; To Provide That The Purpose Of The Lottery Is To Fund The Construction And Operation Of The Mississippi Burn Center And To Fund Certain Education Needs Of The State; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets In The State, After Deducting Certain Administrative And Prize Expenses; To Provide That Forty-five Percent Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets In The State Shall Be Allocated As Prize Money; To Provide That Twenty Percent Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets In The State, Or Such Lower Amount As May Be Necessary For The Purpose Of The Construction And Operation Of The Mississippi Burn Center, Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Burn Center Special Fund For; To Provide That Twenty Percent Of The Proceeds Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Community And Junior College Scholarship Special Fund For The Purpose Of Awarding Tuition Scholarships To Mississippi Students To Attend Any State Community And Junior College; To Provide That The Remainder Of The Proceeds Shall Be Allocated For The Benefit Of The Education Needs Of The State, Including Expenditures For K-12 And Higher Education, Upon Appropriation By The Legislature; To Amend Sections 37-106-5, 37-115-45, 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1142.title: Counties and municipalities; mandate election on incurring debt for operational expenses and issuing bonds.
1142.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-9-11, 19-9-13 And 21-33-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Mandate The Holding Of An Election On The Question Of Issuing County Or Municipal Bonds; To Amend Sections 19-3-40 And 21-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Mandate The Holding Of An Election On The Question Of Whether A County Or Municipality May Borrow Funds Or Otherwise Incur Debt For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Operating Expenses; And For Related Purposes.

1143.title: Education; revise various provisions and create new programs.
1143.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Minimum Length Of The Public Schools' Scholastic Year From 180 To 170 Days; To Amend Sections 37-13-91, 37-151-5 And 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 37-9-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Minimum Term Allowed In School Districts' Contracts With Licensed Personnel From 187 To 177 Days, And To Require School Districts To Shorten The Terms Of Contracts Previously Executed For The 2010-2011 School Year, Without Any Reduction To The Annual Salary Set Forth In Each Contract, Accordingly; To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Suspend The Payment Of An Additional Incremental Increase Payable To Teachers For Earning An Additional Year Of Experience For The 2010-2011 School Year, And To Clarify That The Teacher Salary Scale Is Applicable For All Teachers Whose Contracts Are For A Term Of No Less Than The Statutorily Prescribed Minimum Number Of Days; To Provide That Any School District Receiving A Loan From The Education Liquidity Fund (elf) Must Be Assigned An Interim Conservator Until The Elf Loan Is Paid In Full; To Require The State Board Of Education To Maintain Certain Standards In The Social Studies Curriculum Used In The Public Schools And To Prohibit History Courses From Being Revised For Partisan Or Philosophical Purposes; To Amend Sections 37-7-343 And 37-3-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Temporarily Require Professional Development Courses For School District Employees To Be Delivered To The District Via Internet, Telephone Or Other Electronic Means; To Prohibit School Districts From Reimbursing Employees For Costs Incurred In Traveling To And From Meetings Outside The District, And To Provide For The Repeal Of These Provisions On July 1, 2012; To Prohibit School Districts From Hiring As A Consultant Any Education Administrator Whose Last Full Time Education Job In Mississippi, Within The Preceding Two Years, Was With A Failing School District; To Require The State Department Of Education To Implement A Mentoring Program For School Districts Failing To Meet Accreditation Standards; To Create The "truth In Grading Act"; To Require The School Board Of Each Local School District To Adopt A Uniform Grading Policy Before Each School Year; To Prescribe The Criteria For The Grading Policy Adopted By The School Board; To Require The School Board To Require The Uniform Grading Policy To Apply To Both Elementary And Secondary Schools In The District And To Adopt Appropriate Equivalents That Are Representative Of The Age And Grade Level Curriculum Of The Students To Whom The Grading Policy Applies; To Amend Section 37-23-148, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Develop Alternate Assessments Designed Specifically To Measure The Progress Of Children With Disabilities; To Amend Section 37-23-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Encourage Full Inclusion Of Children With Disabilities Only When Such Inclusion Will Best Further The Educational Interests Of The Child Involved; To Amend Section 37-16-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Develop Alternate Minimum Performance Standards For Children With Disabilities, And To Exempt Children With Disabilities Who Participate In An Alternate Assessment From The Requirement Of Participating In Uniform Basic Skills Tests; To Require The State Board Of Education To Abolish Each Chronically Underperforming School District, Which Is Defined As A School District Having, For Two Consecutive School Years, 1,500 Or Fewer Enrolled Students And An Accountability Label Other Than Successful, High Performing Or Star; And For Related Purposes.

1144.title: Legislators; reduce salaries of by 12%.
1144.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce By Twelve Percent The Amount Of The Annual Salary Of Members Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1145.title: Ad valorem tax; revise bond amount for appeal of assessment by local governing authorities.
1145.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-51-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount Of The Appeal Bond From An Assessment Of Ad Valorem Taxes Decision By A Board Of Supervisors Or Municipal Authorities; And For Related Purposes.

1146.title: Gaming Commission; clarify authority to impose and collect certain fees, revise certain other provisions regarding.
1146.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That All Regulations Adopted By The Mississippi Gaming Commission Shall Be Adopted In Accordance With The Mississippi Administrative Procedures Law; To Authorize The Commission To Prescribe The Amount Of, And To Collect, Certain Limited Fees Imposed By Regulations Of The Commission; To Require The Commission To Adopt Regulations Setting Those Fees At Levels That Will Provide The Commission With Sufficient Revenue, When Combined With Certain Other Monies, To Carry Out The Provisions Of The Mississippi Gaming Control Act Without Any State General Funds; To Amend Section 75-76-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commission Shall Assess And Collect Those Fees Authorized By Regulations Of The Commission And That The Fees Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund Created In The State Treasury To Be Designated As The "mississippi Gaming Commission Fund"; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund May Be Used By The Commission To Carry Out The Purposes Of The Mississippi Gaming Control Act; To Ratify, Approve And Confirm The Imposition And Collection Of Any Fees By The Mississippi Gaming Commission Under The Mississippi Gaming Control Act, The Deposit Of Funds Received From Those Fees Into Any Fund In The State Treasury And The Expenditure Of The Funds Before The Effective Date Of This Act, As Being The Proper Method Of Imposition, Collection, Deposit And Expenditure Before The Effective Date Of This Act; To Amend Sections 75-76-9 And 75-76-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Executive Director And Members Of The Commission May Not Receive Anything Of Value From Any Person Holding Or Applying For A Gaming License; To Amend Section 75-76-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Issued A Manufacturer's License Under The Mississippi Gaming Control Act May Not Be Directly Reimbursed By A Holder Of A Gaming License For The Cost Of Any Fee Paid By The Person For The Issuance Or Continuation Of Such A License; To Amend Section 75-76-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Schools And Training Institutions That Are Regulated By The Commission To Teach Or Train Gaming Employees May Accept Students Who Are Not Residents Of The State Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 75-76-157, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of The Gaming Commission Regarding The Promotional Activities Of Licensees; And For Related Purposes.

1147.title: Private roads; allow counties to levy for those repaired or replaced by county.
1147.description: An Act To Amend Sections 65-7-117, 65-15-1 And 19-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Governing Authorities To Levy Owners Of A Subdivision For Repair Or Replacement Of Roads; And For Related Purposes.

1148.title: DEQ; authorize to charge fees for expedited permitting process for certain environmental programs.
1148.description: An Act To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Department Of Environmental Quality Shall Establish A Fee For Each Type Of Permit, Certification Or Authorization Required From The Permit Board, The Commission On Environmental Quality Or The Department Under Certain Environmental Programs Administered By The Department, Which May Be Voluntarily Paid By The Applicant In Order To Expedite The Permitting, Certification Or Authorization Process For The Applicant; To Amend Sections 17-17-27, 17-17-405, 49-17-29, 49-17-429, 51-3-5 And 51-3-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1149.title: Abortion coverage; prohibit in qualified health plans offered through an exchange.
1149.description: An Act To Prohibit Abortion Coverage In Qualified Health Plans Offered Through An Exchange Or Other Instrumentality Of The State Established By State Or Federal Law; To Bring Forward Section 41-41-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Restricts The Use Of Public Funds For Abortions, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1150.title: Motor vehicle title fees; increase and deposit into Crisis Intervention Mental Health Fund.
1150.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-21-63 And 63-21-64, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fees For Certificates Of Title For Motor Vehicles, Manufactured Homes And Mobile Homes; To Amend Section 63-21-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of The Title Fees Collected By The Department Of Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury To The Credit Of The Department; And For Related Purposes.

1151.title: State Health Insurance Management Board; authorize to assess active employees a portion of premium under health plan.
1151.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And School Employees Health Insurance Management Board To Assess Active Full-time Employees A Portion Of The Active Employee Premium Under The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1152.title: School boards; revise composition of membership in certain school districts.
1152.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Composition Of The Membership Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Municipal Separate School District In Certain Municipalities Having A Population In Excess Of 100,000 To Reflect The Number Of Wards In The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1153.title: Oil and gas lease fees; revise.
1153.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add A Fee Of $2.00 For Each Additional Assignee For Each Recording For Each Oil And Gas Assignment; And For Related Purposes.

1154.title: Tuition waiver; provide for certain foster and adopted children and wards of the state to attend a public community or junior college.
1154.description: An Act To Waive The Cost Of Tuition At Any Public Community Or Junior College For Certain Foster Or Adopted Children Or Wards Of The State, Subject To Certain Conditions; To Require The Department Of Human Services, Upon The Request Of A Community Or Junior College, To Confirm The Eligibility Of Those Students Seeking To Participate In The Waiver Program; To Require Students To Complete The Free Application For Federal Student Aid To Determine The Level Of Need And Eligibility For State And Federal Financial Aid Programs; To Establish The Requirements For Eligibility; To Require The Department And The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Make Reports To The Legislature On Certain Components Of The Tuition Waiver Program; To Require The Board To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary For The Proper Administration Of The Program; And For Related Purposes.

1155.title: Insurance companies; increase privilege taxes and license fees for foreign and domestic companies.
1155.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-15-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Privilege Tax And License Fees For Foreign And Domestic Insurance Companies; To Amend Section 83-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Aggregate Amount Of License Fees Which May Be Imposed On An Insurance Company For Each Class Of Business; To Amend Section 83-21-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Fee Paid By Nonadmitted Insurers In Order To Be Eligible For Certification By The Commissioner Of Insurance; To Amend Section 83-19-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1156.title: Statewide monetary assessments; revise.
1156.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A State Assessment Upon Persons Convicted Of A Felony, Which Shall Be Deposited Into The Crime Laboratory Dna Identification System Fund, To Impose An Additional Assessment Against Railroad Crossing Violations For The Benefit Of The Operation Lifesaver Program And Fund And To Impose An Additional Assessment For Violations Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 45-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose Upon Individuals Convicted Of Certain Crimes A Separate Laboratory Analysis Fee In A Case Where The Crime Laboratory Provided Forensic Science Or Laboratory Services In Connection With The Case, Which Shall Be Deposited Into The Special Fund Of The Crime Laboratory; To Create The Operation Lifesaver Program Under The Auspices Of The Department Of Transportation And To Create The Operation Lifesaver Fund; To Create The Drug Evidence Disposition Fund Under The Control Of The Bureau Of Narcotics; And For Related Purposes.

1157.title: Municipal judges; revise population threshold of cities that must appoint.
1157.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Governing Authorities Of A Municipality To Appoint One Additional Municipal Judge; To Amend Section 21-23-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Population Threshold Under Which A Municipal Judge Is Not Required To Be An Attorney Who Resides Within That Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1158.title: Highway Patrol officers; specify rate of compensation for certain.
1158.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Rate Of Compensation For Certain Officers Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol; And For Related Purposes.

1159.title: Blues Commission; authorize to raise funds to assist blues musicians in need.
1159.description: An Act To Amend Section 39-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Blues Commission To Raise Funds To Assist Blues Musicians In Need; And For Related Purposes.

1160.title: Loans; create Mississippi Alternative Loan Act.
1160.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Alternative Loan Act"; To Define Certain Terms; To Prohibit Any Person From Engaging In The Business Of Lending Money, Except As Authorized By This Act; To Provide For Applications For A License For Such Loans; To Authorize Licensing Fees; To Provide For The Revocation Or Suspension Of Licenses By The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance; To Authorize An Examination Fee; To Provide Record Keeping Requirements; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Promulgate Rules And Regulations For Administration Of This Act; To Authorize Certain Loan Charges By The Licensee; To Prescribe Certain Terms Of The Loan Contract; To Require All Borrower Contracts And Records Of The Licensee To Be Open To The Inspection Of The Commissioner Or His Duly Authorized Representatives; To Provide That Certain Finance Charges Contracted For Or Received In Excess Of That Authorized By This Act Shall Be Forfeited And May Be Recovered; And For Related Purposes.

1161.title: Scholarship; create program for law students who agree to work as attorney for Mississippi Legal Services.
1161.description: An Act To Establish A Scholarship Program Administered By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Law School Students At The University Of Mississippi Or Mississippi College Who Agree To Work As Attorneys For A Mississippi Branch Of The Legal Services Corporation After Graduation From Law School; To Provide That Persons Who Receive A Scholarship Under The Program, After Graduation From Law School, Must Render Service As An Attorney For A Mississippi Branch Of The Legal Services Corporation For A Period Of Not Less Than Four Years; To Provide That Any Person Who Receives A Scholarship Under The Program Who Fails To Complete Law School Or Fails To Complete The Service Obligation As An Attorney For The Department For Not Less Than Four Years, Shall Become Liable Immediately To The Board Of Trustees For The Sum Of All Scholarship Awards Received, Plus Interest; And For Related Purposes.

1162.title: Public university property; authorize DFA to donate certain real property at the Mississippi University for Women.
1162.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Donate To The City Of Columbus, Certain Real Property Under The Possession And Control Of The Mississippi University For Women, Located In Lowndes County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1163.title: Mississippi Proprietary School and College Registration Law; revise provisions of law regarding fees and surety bonds.
1163.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-60-4, 75-60-15, 75-60-17, 75-60-19, 75-60-23, 75-60-25, 75-60-27, 75-60-29, 75-60-31, 75-60-33, 75-60-35, And 75-60-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Commission On Proprietary School And College Registration; To Remove The Specific Fee Amounts And Authorize The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Levy Fees Only In The Amounts Required For The Commission To Perform Its Duties; To Remove The Specific Surety Bond Amount Required To Accompany An Application For A Certificate Of Registration And Authorize The Commission To Set The Amount Of The Surety Bond; To Refer To The License Awarded To Agents Of The Proprietary Schools And Colleges As An Agent Permit; To Allow The Commission To Refund Fees To Applicants That Are Refused Registration If The Commission Determines That Financial Hardship Would Result Otherwise; And For Related Purposes.

1164.title: Medicaid Fraud Control Act; revise several provisions of.
1164.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Prohibition On Making False Or Fraudulent Claims For Medicaid Benefits To Include Specific Descriptions About What Constitutes Those Types Of Claims And Impose Civil Penalties For Violations Of This Section; To Create New Section 43-13-222, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Actions To Be Brought By Private Persons For Violations Of The Medicaid Fraud Control Act; To Amend Section 43-13-223, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Statute Of Limitations For Civil Actions Brought Under The Medicaid Fraud Control Act; To Create New Section 43-13-218, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Standard Of Proof In Any Action Brought Under The Medicaid Fraud Control Act Shall Be By Preponderance Of The Evidence; To Create New Section 43-13-224, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Attorney General To Issue And Serve Subpoenas In Conducting Investigations Into False Or Fraudulent Claims Under The Medicaid Fraud Control Act; And For Related Purposes.

1165.title: Judges; provide additional judge for Seventh Circuit Court District.
1165.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-7-23 And 9-7-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Five Judges For The Seventh Circuit Court District; To Revise The Subdistricts Of The Seventh Circuit Court District; And For Related Purposes.

1166.title: Dental services; prohibit certain provision in contract between health care entity and dentist.
1166.description: An Act To Prohibit A Contract Between A Health Care Entity That Offers A Dental Plan And A Dentist For The Provision Of Services To His Subscribers From Requiring That A Dentist Provide Services To His Subscribers At A Fee Set By The Health Care Entity Unless The Services Are Covered Services Under The Applicable Subscriber Agreement; And For Related Purposes.

1167.title: CON; issue for additional psychiatric residential treatment facility beds in Hinds County.
1167.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The New Construction Or Conversion Of Additional Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility Beds To A Privately Owned, Nonprofit Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility Operating In Hinds County; To Provide That The Beds Shall Be Dedicated To The Treatment Of Children Younger Than Fourteen Years Of Age And Children Who Have Been Diagnosed With Autism Spectrum Requiring Psychiatric Residential Treatment Services; And For Related Purposes.

1168.title: Exceptional children; require SDE to pay educational costs while receiving inpatient care in certain private facilities.
1168.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Pay The Educational Costs Of Certain Exceptional Children Receiving Inpatient Care In A Private Facility That Operates An Approved Private School As An Integral Part Of The Facility; And For Related Purposes.

1169.title: School District Maintenance Fund; require district to file budget cuts plan if falls below 7% ending balance of.
1169.description: An Act To Require The School Board Of A School District Having A Certain Ending Fund Balance In The 2010, 2011 And 2012 Fiscal Years To Submit A Plan For Budget Cuts To The State Department Of Education; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Adopt Rules And Regulations Specifying The Required Contents Of The Plan; To Require The Department To Approve Or Return The Plan To The School District With Instructions; To Authorize Public School Districts To Furlough All Instructional And Noninstructional Employees On A Limited Basis For The 2010-2011 And 2011-2012 School Years; To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Additional 1/2 Day Of Personal Leave For Every Furlough Day Required For School District Employees; To Amend Sections 37-151-87, 38-19-7, 37-9-23 And 37-9-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Reductions In Local Supplements On A Limited Basis And In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1171.title: 911 address; require owners and renters to obtain.
1171.description: An Act To Require Each Person Who Owns Or Rents A Residence, Building Or Structure To Obtain A 911 Address; To Amend Section 19-5-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Bring Forward Section 19-5-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1172.title: CHIP program; allow deduction from self employment income for depreciation in computing income for eligibility.
1172.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-86-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When Computing A Person's Income From Self Employment For The Purposes Of Eligibility For The Children's Health Insurance Program, A Deduction May Be Taken From The Gross Income For Depreciation; And For Related Purposes.

1173.title: Oil and gas severance taxes; bring forward certain sections regarding.
1173.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 27-25-501 And 27-25-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Define Certain Terms Under The Oil Severance Tax Laws And Provide For The Levy Of The Oil Severance Tax, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 27-25-701 And 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Define Certain Terms Under The Gas Severance Tax Laws And Provide For The Levy Of The Gas Severance Tax, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1174.title: Bad check law; revise.
1174.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-19-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Bad Checks And Insufficient Funds Law; And For Related Purposes.

1175.title: Truss construction emblem; revise provisions related to.
1175.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-11-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Buildings Constructed Before July 1, 2010, Are Not Required To Attach An Emblem Identifying The Building As Having Truss Construction Unless It Is Expanded Or Renovated After That Date; To Remove Municipal And County Fire Code Or Coordinator Enforcement Provisions; To Provide That The Contractor Performing The Work Shall Be Responsible For The Proper Attachment Of The Emblem; And For Related Purposes.

1176.title: Residential builders; repeal section related to licensing of commercial work.
1176.description: An Act To Repeal Section 73-59-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relates To Licensees Who May Work On Certain Commercial Structures Without Additional License; And For Related Purposes.

1178.title: School cafeteria workers; provide state funded health insurance on a phased-in basis.
1178.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Shall Fund The Cost Of The State Health Insurance Plan For Full-time School Cafeteria Workers On A Phased-in Basis; To Require Local School Districts To Match The State Contribution To The Cost Of Such Health Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

1179.title: Funeral service; increase renewal fees for funeral service and funeral director licenses.
1179.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-11-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Renewal Fees For Funeral Service Licenses And Funeral Director Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

1180.title: Mississippi Qualified Disposition Act; enact.
1180.description: An Act To Be Known And Cited As The Mississippi Qualified Disposition Act; To Create New Section 91-9-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 91-9-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Definitions; To Create New Section 91-9-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Contents Of A Qualified Affidavit; To Create New Section 91-9-707, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Claims And Actions Against Property Subject To Qualified Disposition; To Create New Section 91-9-709, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Transferor's Powers And Rights; To Create New Section 91-9-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide When And Under What Circumstances A Qualified Disposition May Be Avoided; To Create New Section 91-9-713, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Spendthrift Provision; To Create New Section 91-9-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Persons Qualified To Serve As Trustees And Advisors; To Create New Section 91-9-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Persons Qualified To Serve As Investment Advisors; To Create New Section 91-9-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appointment Of Successor Trustees; To Create New Section 91-9-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide When A Trust Is Not Revocable; To Create New Section 91-9-723, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Applicability Of The Article; To Amend Sections 91-9-503, 91-9-505 And 91-9-507, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 91-9-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Situation When A Settlor Is Beneficiary Of A Settlor-created Trust As Inconsistent With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1181.title: Ad valorem tax; provide a rebate to businesses that pay tax on inventory.
1181.description: An Act To Create The Inventory Tax Rebate Act; To Provide That Any Manufacturer, Distributor, Wholesale Or Retail Merchant Who Pays Ad Valorem Taxes Imposed On Commodities, Products, Goods, Wares And Merchandise Held For Resale, Shall Be Entitled To A Rebate In An Amount Equal To The Amount Of Ad Valorem Taxes So Paid; To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Known As The "inventory Tax Rebate Fund"; To Require The Legislature To Appropriate A Certain Amount Of Money Into The Fund; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Used By The Department Of Revenue To Make The Payments Required By This Act; To Provide The Manner Of Applying For The Rebate; To Provide That The Department Of Revenue Shall Verify Claims And Make The Payments To Eligible Businesses; To Create A Study Committee To Review Current Law And Proposed Legislation On Ad Valorem Taxation Of Business Inventories In This State And To Make Recommendations To The Legislature Which Identify Long-term Strategies To Eliminate Ad Valorem Taxation Of Business Inventories While Ensuring The Local Governments Do Not Experience Fiscal Harm As A Result Of The Elimination Of The Tax; To Amend Section 27-7-22.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Businesses Using A Certain Income Tax Credit Shall Not Be Eligible For The Rebate; And For Related Purposes.

1183.title: School bus turnarounds; authorize superintendents of education to request county maintenance in large school districts.
1183.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The County Superintendent Of Education, Instead Of The School Board, In School Districts Having 25,000 Or More Students To Submit A Written Request To The County Board Of Supervisors For The Maintenance Of Private Roads And Driveways Used For School Bus Turnarounds; And For Related Purposes.

1184.title: Health and disability income insurance; require insurers to provide an explanation to individual whose application is rejected.
1184.description: An Act To Provide That Any Insurer That Rejects An Application For A Policy Or Certificate Of Health Insurance Or Disability Income Insurance Must Provide The Individual Whose Application Was Rejected With A Statement Of Explanation Of The Rejection; To Provide That The Statement Must Be In Writing; And For Related Purposes.

1185.title: Free port warehouses; bring forward sections governing for purposes of amendment.
1185.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 27-31-51, 27-31-53, 27-31-55, 27-31-57, 27-31-59 And 27-31-61, Which Govern Free Port Warehouses And Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Governing Authorities To Grant Partial Ad Valorem Tax Exemptions For Property In Free Port Warehouses, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1186.title: Department of Finance and Administration; may transfer certain real property to MDOT.
1186.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Transfer Certain State-owned Real Property, Located On North West Street, To The Department Of Transportation; And For Related Purposes.

1187.title: Transportation commission; allow to assess fee to purchaser of surplus property to defray costs of sale.
1187.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-1-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Assess The Purchaser A Fee Of Not More Than Ten Percent Of The Fair Market Value As A Condition Of The Sale Of Surplus Right-of-way And Uneconomic Remnant Property To Defray The Administrative Costs Associated With The Sale Of The Property; And For Related Purposes.

1188.title: Tort claims fund; exempt Department of Transportation.
1188.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation From Participation In The State Tort Claims Fund; To Require The Commission To Provide Coverage For Liability Of The Commission And Department; To Provide Coverage Of Claims During The Transition Period; And For Related Purposes.

1189.title: Trans. Commission and Department; authorize certain expenditures without appropriation bill, only to fund essential operations.
1189.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Make Certain Expenditures From The Highway Fund Without An Appropriation Bill To Fund Existing Contracts And Essential Operations And Personnel Of The Commission And The Department If The Legislature During Any Regular Session Fails To Enact An Appropriation Bill To Fund The Operations Of The Commission For The Next Fiscal Year; To Amend Section 65-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

1190.title: Insurance companies; increase certain fees.
1190.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-15-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Privilege Tax On Foreign Insurance Companies; To Amend Sections 83-21-1 And 83-21-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fee On Nonadmitted Insurers And Deposit The Fee In The General Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1191.title: Health care; Board of Health adopt guidelines incorporating principles of patient-centered medical home.
1191.description: An Act To Make Certain Legislative Findings About A Patient-centered Medical Home; To Direct The State Board Of Health To Adopt Guidelines Applicable To Physician Practices, Nurse Practitioner Practices And Physician Assistant Practices In Mississippi That Incorporate The Principles Of The Patient-centered Medical Home; And For Related Purposes.

1192.title: Mental Health, Department of; shall have a full-time medical director.
1192.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-4-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Department Of Mental Health Shall Have A Full Time Medical Director; And For Related Purposes.

1193.title: College and Career Readiness Planning Program; create.
1193.description: An Act To Create The College And Career Readiness Planning Program Act; To Lower Educational Costs, Shorten A Student's Time To Complete A Degree And Increase The Overall Success Rate Of Students By Reducing The Need For Remediation; To Ensure That Students Have The Career Readiness Skills To Compete In The Global Economy; And For Related Purposes.

1194.title: Banks; allow out-of-state banks to establish branch banks in Mississippi.
1194.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-7-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Out-of-state Banks That Do Not Already Maintain A Branch In Mississippi To Establish And Maintain A Branch In Mississippi Through The Acquisition Of A Branch Bank Or Branch Office Or The Establishment Of A Branch Bank De Novo; To Amend Section 81-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

1195.title: MAEP at-risk funds; allow school districts to spend for operational purposes if MAEP not fully funded.
1195.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Education To Allow School Districts To Use Funds Allocated For At-risk Pupil Programs To Be Spent For Purposes Of Operation Of The School District In Any School Year In Which The Mississippi Adequate Education Program Is Not Fully Funded By The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1196.title: Broadband Over Power Lines Act; create.
1196.description: An Act To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Name The Act As The "broadband Over Power Lines Act"; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-803, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare Legislative Findings; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Electric Utility, An Affiliate Of An Electric Utility Or A Person Unaffiliated With An Electric Utility To Own, Construct, Maintain And Operate A Bpl System; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Ownership And Operation Of Bpl Systems; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-811, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Agency, Instrumentality Or Political Subdivision Of The State Shall Have Jurisdiction Over An Electric Utility's Ownership Or Operation Of A Bpl System, Except Provided In This Act; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-813, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Fees And Charges For The Costs Incurred To Own, Operate, Construct And Maintain A Bpl System; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 77-3-815, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Electric Utility That Installs Or Operates A Bpl System On Its Electric Delivery System To Maintain The Reliability Of The Utility's Electric System; To Create A New Section To Be Codified As Section 11-27-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That There Is No Additional Taking When Uses Have No Substantial Impact Upon The Servient Estate; And For Related Purposes.

1197.title: Excavations near underground utility lines; certain persons who remove markings shall be subject to civil penalty.
1197.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-13-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Whenever The Term "mississippi One-call System, Inc." Appears In The Chapter Regulating Excavations, The Term Shall Mean "mississippi 811, Inc."; To Amend Section 77-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Method Of Marking The Location Of Underground Utility Lines Or Underground Facilities Upon Receiving Advance Notice Of An Excavation; To Provide That Any Operator Who Suffers Damages As A Result Of Not Participating As A Member Of Mississippi 811, Inc., Waives The Right To Recover Damages From An Excavator That Complied With This Chapter; And For Related Purposes.

1198.title: City of Jackson; require state to provide funds to defray ad valorem tax loss due to city being seat of state government.
1198.description: An Act To Provide That The State Of Mississippi Shall Provide Funds By Legislative Appropriation Or From Any Other Source, In The Amount Equal To 50% Of Ad Valorem Taxes That Would Otherwise Be Due Each Year On All State-owned Property Within The City Limits Of The City Of Jackson; To Provide That The Purpose Of Such Appropriation Shall Be To Defray Increased Infrastructure And Public Safety Costs Incurred By The City Of Jackson As A Result Of The City Being The Seat Of State Government; And For Related Purposes.

1200.title: Medicaid; persons eligible for TANF shall be eligible for; and redetermination of eligibility for shall be available by mail.
1200.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Determined As Eligible For Tanf By The Department Of Human Services Shall Be Eligible For Medicaid; To Provide That The Regular Redetermination Of Medicaid Eligibility Shall Be Available By Mail; To Provide That The Division Of Medicaid Shall Have Eligibility Workers Available At Various Sites To Accept Applications For Medicaid And To Assist Applicants With The Application Process; And For Related Purposes.

1201.title: School superintendents; authorize to furlough employees for no more than three days during 2010-2011 school year.
1201.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Superintendents To Furlough School Employees During The 2010-2011 School Year; To Bring Forward Sections 37-9-24 And 37-13-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1202.title: Medicaid; require to use in-state psychiatric facilities before contracting with out-of-state facilities.
1202.description: An Act To Prohibit The Division Of Medicaid From Contracting With Any Out-of-state Acute Child/adolescent Psychiatric Facility Or Psychiatric Residential Treatment Facility To Provide Medicaid Services For A Mississippi Resident, Unless All Of Those Beds In Mississippi Are Filled Or Otherwise Unavailable For Use By The Mississippi Resident; And For Related Purposes.

1203.title: Child endangerment; create offense regarding the use of all-terrain vehicles.
1203.description: An Act To Create The Offense Of Child Endangerment Regarding The Use Of All-terrain Vehicles By Minors; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1204.title: Alcoholic beverages; authorize certain municipalities in dry counties to vote to come out from under the dry law.
1204.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Municipalities Located In Counties That Have Voted Against Coming Out From Under The Dry Law May Authorize The Sale Of Alcoholic Beverages Pursuant To An Election; And For Related Purposes.

1205.title: Legislators and certain state elected officials and state employees; reduce salaries of by 10%.
1205.description: An Act To Amend Sections 5-1-41, 5-1-43, 5-1-45 And 5-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce By Ten Percent The Amount Of The Annual Salary And Monthly Expense Allowance Of Members And Officers Of The Legislature; To Amend Section 25-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce By Ten Percent The Amount Of The Annual Salary Of State Elected Officials In The Executive Branch; To Reduce By Ten Percent The Amount Of The Annual Salary Of Those Appointed Officers And Employees Of The State Whose Annual Salary Exceeds $100,000.00, Beginning After The State Fiscal Officer Has Reduced The Budgets Of More Than One-half Of All State Agencies By Ten Percent Or More; To Authorize The Executive Heads Of State Agencies To Offer Any Of The Agency's Employees The Option Of Taking A Period Of Unpaid Furlough Leave As An Alternative To Termination Of The Employee's Position With The Agency, Whenever The State Fiscal Officer Has Reduced The Budget Of The Agency And The Executive Head Determines That Those Reductions In Funds Will Require A Reduction In The Amount Of Funds That The Agency Spends For Salaries For The Agency's Employees; To Amend Section 37-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

1206.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of handguns, rifles, shotguns and ammunition during Second Amendment Weekend.
1206.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Handguns, Rifles, Shotguns And Ammunition If Sold During "second Amendment Weekend" Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Friday Before Labor Day And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Saturday; And For Related Purposes.

1207.title: Sixteen Section Principal Funds; authorize school districts under financial hardship to borrow from.
1207.description: An Act To Authorize The School Board Of A Local School District In An Extreme Emergency Financial Situation To Request Authority From The State Board Of Education To Borrow From The District's Sixteenth Section Principal Fund In The 2010, 2011 And 2012 Fiscal Years; To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt Rules And Regulations Governing The Borrowing Of Sixteenth Section Principal Funds By School Boards, And To Prescribe Certain Matters That Must Be Addressed In The Rules And Regulations; To Amend Section 29-3-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1208.title: Municipal officers; change the date when such take office.
1208.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-5-23, 21-8-7 And 21-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Date Upon Which Elected Municipal Officers Take Office From The First Monday In July To The First Day In July That Does Not Occur On A Weekend; To Amend Sections 21-5-13, 21-8-11 And 21-35-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1209.title: Alternative career track programs and diplomas; require all high schools to provide.
1209.description: An Act To Create New Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For High School Career Option Programs And Career Track Curricula For Students Not Wishing To Pursue A Baccalaureate Degree; To Authorize Dual Enrollment And Dual Credit For Students Pursuing A Career Track; To Provide Certain Conditions For Students To Enroll In Career Track Programs; To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act, To Require School Districts To Establish Dual Enrollment Programs, And To Provide Certain Standards For Dual Enrollment-dual Credit Programs; And For Related Purposes.

1210.title: Universities and colleges; provide conditions on charging monetary penalty for cell phone interruptions.
1210.description: An Act To Prohibit A Student Enrolled In A Public University Or College From Being Charged More Than Five Dollars For A Cell Phone Interruption; To Prohibit Any Monetary Penalty Unless The University Or College Has A Written Policy And A System To Account For The Funds Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1211.title: Municipal police pursuits; require policies to limit into other municipal jurisdictions by more than one mile.
1211.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local Law Enforcement Policies To Prohibit Vehicular Pursuits That Cross Over Into Other Municipal Jurisdictions By More Than One Mile; And For Related Purposes.

1212.title: MAEP; increase adjustment to base cost for at-risk students.
1212.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Adjustment To The Base Student Cost For At-risk Students Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

1213.title: Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Day; designate as day of commemoration, not legal holiday.
1213.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The First Monday In March Of Each Year As Law Enforcement Officers Day; To Specifically Provide That This Shall Be A Day Of Commemoration And Not A Legal Holiday; And For Related Purposes.

1214.title: Juvenile Detention Facilities Monitoring Unit; revise certain duties of.
1214.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-323, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Duties Of The Juvenile Detention Facilities Monitoring Unit And To Provide That All Monitors Of The Unit Shall Be Employees Of The Department Of Public Safety; To Require The Unit To Investigate And Inspect Group Homes And Other Public And Private Out-of-home Placement Facilities, Which Are In Addition To The Detention Facilities And The Training School That The Unit Currently Inspects; To Provide Certain Duties Of The Unit, Which Include Submitting Quarterly Reports To Certain Elected Officials; And For Related Purposes.

1215.title: Check cashers; reduce rate of interest that may be charged for cashing a delayed deposit check.
1215.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Maximum Rate Of Interest That A Check Casher May Charge For Cashing A Delayed Deposit Check; To Specify How The Interest On A Delayed Deposit Check Loan Will Be Calculated; And For Related Purposes.

1216.title: Public property; authorize DFA to exchange certain property between two public entities.
1216.description: An Act To Authorize The Exchange Of Certain Real Property Between The Board Of Supervisors Of Simpson County, Acting On Behalf Of The Simpson County Economic Development District, And The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health, For Purposes Of Accommodating The Expansion Of The Magee Municipal Airport; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Simpson County To Exchange Certain Real Property With A Certain Private Landowner, Subject To Certain Conditions Having Been Met Before The Transfer; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Simpson County To Sell And Convey The Real Property Received From The Exchange With The Private Landowner To The City Of Magee, Subject To Certain Conditions Having Been Met Before The Sale And Conveyance; And For Related Purposes.

1217.title: MAEP Funds; grant school districts discretionary spending authority for next two school years.
1217.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant School Districts Discretionary Authority In Determining The Manner In Which State Allocations Under The Adequate Education Program, Excluding Funds Allotted For Vocational, Special Education And Gifted Programs, Shall Be Expended In The 2010-2011 And 2011-2012 School Years; To Amend Section 37-151-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1218.title: Justice court; increase monetary jurisdiction.
1218.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Monetary Jurisdiction Of Justice Court Judges; And For Related Purposes.

1219.title: Mississippi S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; amend provisions and extend repealer.
1219.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-18-1 Through 81-18-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Known As The "mississippi S.a.f.e.
