1524.title: Mental health commitment laws; revise various provisions of.
1524.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set The Fee That Chancery Clerks Shall Charge For A Commitment Action; To Amend Section 41-21-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commitment Of Persons With Minor Criminal Charges Pending As Long As There Are Not Felony Charges Pending; To Amend Section 41-21-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Simplify And Make Uniform The Beginning Of The Commitment Process; To Allow Chancellors To Decide If They Want To Hear A Case Of A Person Who Is Found In Their County, Or Transfer The Case To The County Of Residence; To Simplify The Affidavit Process By Generalizing The Information Required For The Affidavit, Requiring The Chancery Clerk To Provide The Affiant With A Simple, One-page Form Developed By The Department Of Mental Health To Fill Out As An Affidavit, And Preventing Chancery Clerks From Requiring The Affiant To Hire An Attorney; To Prevent "add On" Fees Being Charged To The Affiant And Allow The Filing Fee To Be Waived At The Affiant's Request; To Remove The Requirement Of Filing A Bond; To Provide For Punishment With Criminal Charges And Contempt For Individuals Who File An Intentionally False Affidavit For Commitment; To Amend Section 41-21-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Persons Waiting For Commitment From Being Held In Jail; To Amend Section 41-21-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Judge To Dismiss The Affidavit Without The Need For A Hearing If The Examiners Determine A Person Is Not In Need Of Treatment; To Amend Section 41-21-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set A Cap On The Total Amount That May Be Charged For All Of The Costs Incidental To The Court Proceedings; To Amend Section 41-31-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1525.title: DA, asst. DA and criminal investigators; allow salaries to be supplemented by nonstate funds to be supplemented.
1525.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Supplemental Pay For A District Attorney In An Amount Not To Exceed $8,300.00 Which May Be Paid From Any Source, Other Than The State Treasury; And For Related Purposes.

1526.title: District Attorney; allow additional employees without limitation of funds.
1526.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-31-5 And 25-31-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow District Attorneys To Employ Additional Assistant District Attorneys And Criminal Investigators Without Limitation If Paid With Nonstate Funds; To Supplement Salaries Of District Attorneys And Criminal Investigators; And For Related Purposes.

1527.title: Mississippi Rural Legal Services Scholars Program; establish.
1527.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Rural Legal Services Scholars Program; To Authorize Loans To Approved Applicants; To Provide Locations For The Scholars; To Provide Eligibility Requirements; To Provide For Fund Distribution For The Program; To Create A Selection Committee To Select Participants In The Program; To Amend Sections 9-21-43 And 73-3-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Bring Forward Sections 73-3-205 And 73-3-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1528.title: ICCCY and State System of Care; delete repealers, expand council and define authority of council.
1528.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-14-1, 43-14-3 And 43-14-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealers On The Statutes Establishing And Empowering The Interagency Coordinating Council For Children And Youth (icccy); To Expand The Membership Of The Council; To Define The Authority Of The Council To Assist Multidisciplinary Assessment And Planning (map) Teams To Become The Single Point Of Entry For Certain Children And Youth; To Clarify The Purpose Of The Mississippi Statewide System Of Care For Children With Emotional And Behavioral Disorders; And For Related Purposes.

1529.title: Community colleges; authorize to pledge taxes regarding auxiliary facilities.
1529.description: An Act To Authorize Counties To Pledge Taxes To Community Or Junior College Districts For The Purpose Of Financing, Constructing, Renovating, Furnishing And Equipping Auxiliary Facilities Of The Community College District; To Amend Section 37-29-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Term Of Leases; And For Related Purposes.

1530.title: Judges; provide additional judge for the Twelfth Circuit Court District.
1530.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Additional Judge For The Twelfth Circuit Court District; To Amend Section 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Section; And For Related Purposes.

1531.title: Workers' Compensation Law; reduce compensation by employer's percentage of fault.
1531.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Workers' Compensation Law To Reduce The Compensation By The Employer's Percentage Of Fault; And For Related Purposes.

1532.title: Cooperatives; provide for the incorporation of.
1532.description: An Act To Provide For The Incorporation Of Cooperative Associations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Requisites For The Articles Of Association Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Adoptions Of Bylaws By Cooperatives; To Specify The Membership Of Cooperatives And The Requisites For Voting By Members; To Provide For The Organization Of Meeting And The Notification Of Members Of Meetings; To Provide For The Authorization Of, Control And Use Of Stock By Cooperatives; To Provide For The Number, Election And Removal Of Directors; To Provide For The Meetings Of Directors; To Authorize Executive Committees; To Provide For The Officers Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Compensation And Benefits To Directors, Officers And Employees Of A Cooperative; To Provide For The Liability Of Directors, Members, Stockholders And Patrons Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Dispose Of Assets; To Provide Rules That Govern Contracts By Cooperatives; To Authorize Contracts To Be Filed With The Chancery Clerk And Provide The Effect Of Such Filing; To Provide That The Directors Shall Determine And Distribute Net Assets At Least Once Annually; To Provide For Annual Reports; To Provide The Manner In Which Articles Of Association May Be Amended; To Provide The Manner In Which Cooperatives May Merge And Consolidate; To Provide The Manner In Which A Corporation May Convert Itself Into A Cooperative; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Voluntarily Dissolve Itself; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Be Involuntarily Dissolved; To Provide For The Liquidation Of The Assets And Business Of A Cooperative Under Court Supervision; To Provide For Derivative Actions By Members And Stockholders; To Limit The Use Of The Term "cooperative" To Associations Organized Under This Act And To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Such Term; And For Related Purposes.

1533.title: Mississippi Racial Justice Act; create.
1533.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Racial Justice Act; To Prohibit The Imposition Or Seeking Of Death Sentences Based On The Race Of An Individual; To Provide That Certain Proof Must Be Demonstrated To Prove Such Racial Discrimination; To Provide A Hearing Procedure For An Individual Seeking To Find Relief From The Imposition Of A Death Sentence If The Individual Has Proof That Race Was A Factor For His Or Her Receipt Of A Death Sentence; And For Related Purposes.

1534.title: Mississippi Ethics Commission; revise jurisdiction of.
1534.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Chancery Court To Enforce The Mississippi Ethics Laws; To Allow Concurrent Jurisdiction, For The Filing Of Ethics Complaints, Between The Mississippi Ethics Commission, The Attorney General's Office And Any District Attorney's Office With The State; And For Related Purposes.

1535.title: Bad check; revise fee for deferral of prosecution.
1535.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-19-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fee For Deferral Of Prosecution Under The Bad Check Law; And For Related Purposes.

1536.title: Legal Aid for Economically Deprived Mississippians Study Panel; create.
1536.description: An Act To Create The Legal Aid For Economically Deprived Mississippians Study Panel; To Provide Membership For The Panel; To Require The Panel To Study Incentives For Law Students Who Agree To Provide Nonprofit Legal Assistance To Mississippians Who Are Economically Deprived Upon Their Graduation From Law School; And For Related Purposes.

1537.title: Public lands; bring forward sections for purposes of amendment.

1538.title: Workers' Compensation Commission; require to promulgate rules and regulations regarding safety program.
1538.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Workers' Compensation Commission To Promulgate Rules And Regulations As To Require Each Insurer To Establish A Safety Program For The Health And Benefit Of The Employees Of The Insured Employer; And For Related Purposes.

1539.title: Eminent domain; allow opportunity for removal of house on property acquired by Department of Transportation.
1539.description: An Act To Provide That If The Department Of Transportation Acquires Property Through Eminent Domain Proceedings And A House Or Other Residential Structure Is Located On The Property, The Department Shall Not Demolish Or Dismantle The House Or Other Structure Within One Hundred Twenty Days After The Date The Department Acquired The Property; To Provide That The Department Shall Offer The House Or Other Structure For Sale And Advertise For Bids And May Sell The Home Or Other Structure After The Receipt Of Sealed Bids; To Provide That If The House Or Other Structure Is Not Sold Within The One Hundred-twenty-day Period, Then The Department May Demolish Or Otherwise Remove The House Or Structure; To Bring Forward Sections 65-1-47, 65-1-303, 65-1-305 And 65-1-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Use Of Eminent Domain By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1540.title: Child support; court may deviate from guidelines for child care expenses in certain cases.
1540.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-19-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Court To Deviate From Child Support Guidelines For The Payment Of Child Care Expenses In Cases Where The Obligee Spouse Is Employed Or Disabled; And For Related Purposes.

1541.title: Preneed contract funded by insurance; authorize to be written up to $15,000.
1541.description: An Act To Authorize A Preneed Contract Funded By Insurance To Be Delivered Or Issued For Delivery In Amounts Up To $15,000; And For Related Purposes.

1542.title: Pharmacy practice and controlled substances; revise certain statutes relating to.
1542.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Definitions Under The Mississippi Pharmacy Practice Act; To Amend Section 73-21-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Continuing Education Reporting Requirements For The Annual Renewal Of A License To Practice Pharmacy; To Amend Section 73-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Biennial Fee That May Be Charged By The State Board Of Pharmacy For A Permit To Engage In The Prescription Drug Business; To Amend Section 73-21-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Permitting Requirements For Nonresident Pharmacies That Deliver Prescription Drugs Into This State And To Require Those Pharmacies To Comply With All Rules And Regulations Of The State Board Of Pharmacy; To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Pharmacy To Assess A Fee Against Each Person Licensed To Dispense Controlled Substances In Mississippi For The Purpose Of Funding The Mississippi Prescription Monitoring Program; To Amend Section 41-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Registration Of Out-of-state Facilities That Distribute Or Dispense Controlled Substances Within The State; And For Related Purposes.

1543.title: Candidate for judicial office; revise when qualifying petition may be filed.
1543.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise When A Candidate For Judicial Office May File A Petition To Qualify For Such Office; And For Related Purposes.

1544.title: Corporations; provide method to break tie in vote of shareholders.
1544.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-4-7.21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Method To Break A Tie In A Vote Of Shareholders In A Corporation; And For Related Purposes.

1545.title: Personal care home; require to notify resident's responsible party before moving resident to another facility or location.
1545.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Before A Resident Of A Personal Care Home May Be Transferred From The Home Where He Or She Was Initially Admitted To Another Facility Or Location, The Operator Of The Personal Care Home Shall Notify The Resident's Responsible Party And Shall Allow The Responsible Party To See The Facility Or Location To Which The Resident Is To Be Transferred; And For Related Purposes.

1546.title: Open Meetings Law; prescribe civil penalty for disclosing information from executive session of a public body.
1546.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-41-7 And 25-41-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Civil Penalty For Disclosing Information From An Executive Session; And For Related Purposes.

1547.title: Flood and Drainage Control Joint Legislative Study Committee; create.
1547.description: An Act To Create The Flood And Drainage Control Joint Legislative Study Committee That Studies The Flood And Drainage Control Districts Throughout The State To Determine Whether Through The Existence Of These Districts The Overflow And Surface Waters Have Been Controlled; To Require The Committee To Report Its Findings And Recommendations By 2011 Regular Legislative Session; And For Related Purposes.

1548.title: Flood and drainage control districts; revise composition of board of directors of certain.
1548.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-35-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Where A Flood And Drainage Control District Is Comprised Of Lands Located In One Or More Municipalities And In One Or More Counties, The Governor Shall Appoint A Member To The District Board Of Directors From Each County In Which Any Part Of The District Is Located; And For Related Purposes.

1549.title: Public contracts; give preference to resident bidders, and prescribe specific penalties for violations.
1549.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-13-111, 31-7-15 And 31-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Letting Of Public Contracts, Preference Shall Be Given To Resident Bidders Whenever All Things Are Equal With Regard To Quality And Service But Differ Only As To Price, If The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Resident Bidders Is Not More Than Five Percent Greater Than The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Nonresident Bidders; To Provide That A Nonresident Bidder Domiciled In A State Having Laws Granting Preference To Resident Bidders Shall Be Awarded Mississippi Contracts Only On The Same Basis As The Nonresident Bidder's State Awards Contracts To Mississippi Residents Bidding Under Similar Circumstances; To Amend Section 31-7-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe A Penalty For Persons Who Intentionally, Willfully And Knowingly Violate The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1550.title: Public improvement districts; exempt certain projects from public bidding requirements.
1550.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-31-17 And 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain Projects Of Public Improvement Districts From Public Bidding Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

1552.title: Bullying or harassing behavior; prohibit in schools.
1552.description: An Act To Prohibit Bullying Or Harassing Behavior In The Public Schools; To Define Bullying Or Harassing Behavior; To Define Hostile Environment And To Require All Local School Districts To Adopt A Policy Prohibiting Bullying And Harassing Behavior As Required By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1553.title: Workers' Compensation Law; require every carrier to provide coverage to employees who have a nonviolent record.
1553.description: An Act To Require Every Carrier In This State Providing Workers' Compensation Insurance Coverage To An Employer To Provide Coverage To Every Employee Of That Employer Who Has A Nonviolent Felony Conviction Record; And For Related Purposes.

1554.title: Construction contractors; require disclosure regarding general liability insurance.
1554.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-3-13 And 73-59-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Disclosure In Contracts By Contractors Whether They Carry General Liability Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

1555.title: Law enforcement officer; create crime of public intimidation of.
1555.description: An Act To Create The Crimes Of Public Intimidation And Public Retaliation Against A Law Enforcement Officer; To Enact Punishment Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

1556.title: Civil actions; provide that P&C insurers have burden of proof for exclusions/exceptions in "all perils" coverage policy.
1556.description: An Act To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against A Property And Casualty Insurer Under A "all Perils" Coverage Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy And Any Exception To Or Other Avoidance Of Coverage By The Insurer; And For Related Purposes.

1557.title: Environmental Health Fund; create and authorize Commission on Environmental Quality to deposit fees into.
1557.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Create The Environmental Health Fund; To Create A Permitting Advisory Council; To Amend Sections 51-3-31, 51-5-1, 53-7-21, 53-7-25 And 53-7-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission To Set Program Fees And To Direct Fees To The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Bring Forward Section 53-7-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Applications For The Modification, Transfer Or Reissuance Of Any Surface Mining Permit, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 49-31-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes Multimedia Pollution Prevention Fees, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1558.title: Alcorn State University; provide additional funding sources to enroll more graduate students in nurse educators program.
1558.description: An Act To Provide That Alcorn State University Is Eligible For State Funding To Enroll Additional Graduate Students In The Nurse Educators Program Beginning With The 2010-2011 Academic Year; To Amend Section 37-129-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Amend Section 71-5-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Purposes For Which Monies In The Mississippi Workforce Enhancement Training Fund May Be Expended To Include Funding To Nursing Schools And Degree Programs At Alcorn State University To Enroll Additional Graduate Students In The Nurse Educators Program As Provided In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1559.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for certain highway improvements.
1559.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Replacement And Rehabilitation Of Bridges On The State Highway System That Are Determined To Be Deficient Or Functionally Obsolete, For The Construction, Reconstruction And Improvement Of Certain Highway Segments Statutorily Designated As High Priority Projects, And To Provide Funds For Use By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction For Grants To Counties For The Replacement And Rehabilitation Of Bridges That Are Determined By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction To Be Deficient And Which Are Not Part Of The National Bridge Inspection Inventory; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Revenues Derived From Motor Fuel Taxes And Allocated To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury And Used To Pay The Debt Service On Certain Bonds Issued Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1560.title: Adams County; revise jurisdiction of St. Catherine Creek Utility Authority.
1560.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 953, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Reduce The Scope, Duties And Responsibilities Of St. Catherine Creek Utility In Order To Prevent Fragmentation, Duplication And Overlap Of Duties And Responsibilities With Other Adams County Entities; And For Related Purposes.

1562.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property and services to East Mississippi State Hospital Friends.
1562.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To East Mississippi State Hospital Friends; And For Related Purposes.

1563.title: Ad valorem tax; authorize partial exemption for agricultural land that is converted to a residential use.
1563.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of A County And/or The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality To Grant A Partial Ad Valorem Tax Exemption For Agricultural Property That Is Being Converted To A Residential Use In An Amount Equal To The Difference Between The Assessed Value Of The Property For Agricultural Use And The Assessed Value Of The Property For Residential Use; To Provide That The Exemption Shall End When The Property Is Occupied By A Homeowner; To Provide The Manner In Which A Request For Such Exemption Must Be Made; And For Related Purposes.

1564.title: Inventory tax; authorize a tax credit for.
1564.description: An Act To Create The Inventory Tax Reduction Act; To Allow Taxpayers A Credit Against Inventory Tax That Shall Begin In A Calendar Year After A Certain Amount Of Growth In State General Fund Revenue Occurs; To Increase The Credit Each Calendar Year Thereafter Until The Amount Of The Credit Equals 50% Of The Ad Valorem Tax Imposed On The Inventory Of The Taxpayer; To Create The Inventory Tax Reduction Fund, Into Which Shall Be Deposited An Amount Appropriated Annually By The Legislature That Is Necessary To Pay Counties For The Annual Reduction In Inventory Tax Revenue Incurred By Local Taxing Districts In The County As A Result Of The Tax Credit; To Provide That The Department Of Revenue Shall Make Payments From The Inventory Tax Reduction Fund To The County Tax Collectors For Distribution To The Local Taxing Districts As Reimbursement For Inventory Taxes That Are Lost Each Fiscal Year As A Result Of The Inventory Tax Credit Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Amount That Each Local Taxing District Will Receive Under This Section Shall Be Determined By The Department Of Revenue Based On Documentation Provided By The Tax Collectors Under Guidelines Established By The Department; Funds Received By Local Taxing Districts From Such Payments Shall Be Considered To Be, And Shall Be Used In The Same Manner As, The Proceeds Of Inventory Taxes; To Amend Section 27-7-22.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Taxpayers Utilizing The Income Tax Credit Authorized By This Section Shall Not Be Eligible For The Inventory Tax Credit Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1565.title: Farmers' markets; clarify sales tax provisions regarding products sold at markets certified by Department of Agriculture.
1565.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Food Products That Are Grown, Made Or Processed In Mississippi And Sold From Farmers' Markets That Have Been Certified By The Mississippi Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; And For Related Purposes.

1566.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for costs of installing certain energy-efficient products in homes.
1566.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Taxpayers For The Costs And Expenses Incurred For Purchasing And Installing Insulation, Energy-efficient Replacement Windows And High-efficiency Heating And Cooling Equipment On Property Upon Which Homestead Exemption Is Granted; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1567.title: Homestead exemption; increase for persons 65 years of age or older or totally disabled.
1567.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Homestead Exemption For Persons Who Are Sixty-five Years Of Age Or Older Or Who Are Totally Disabled; And For Related Purposes.

1568.title: Income tax; provide a credit for certain energy efficiency improvements to homestead property.
1568.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Costs And Expenses Incurred By A Taxpayer For Certain Energy Efficiency Improvements To Property Used As A Dwelling By The Taxpayer And Upon Which Homestead Exemption Is Granted; To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Expenses Incurred For The Installation Of A Wind Or Solar Energy System In The Residence Of The Taxpayer Or At A Residential Rental Apartment Complex Owned By The Taxpayer; To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation The True Value Added To A Residence Or A Residential Rental Apartment Complex As A Result Of The Installation Of A Wind Energy System Or A Solar Energy System That Is Eligible For The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1570.title: Ad valorem tax; create 10% cap on increase in assessed value of agricultural property and commercial poultry houses.
1570.description: An Act To Provide That The Assessed Value Of Agricultural Property Or Property Used For Or In Association With Commercial Poultry Houses May Not Be Increased More Than 10% Above The Assessed Value Of The Property For The Next Preceding Year For Purposes Of Ad Valorem Taxation; To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes In The Amount Of The Difference Between The Assessment Of Agricultural Property Or Property Used For Or In Association With Commercial Poultry Houses At True Value And The Assessment Subject To The 10% Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

1571.title: Income tax; increase credit for ad valorem tax paid on inventory.
1571.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Income Tax Credit For Ad Valorem Taxes Paid By Taxpayers On Certain Inventory; To Include Raw Materials Or Works-in-process In The Type Of Inventory Covered By The Credit; To Provide That Beginning With The 2012 Taxable Year A Taxpayer May Claim A Percentage Of The Ad Valorem Taxes That He Pays On Inventory For The Credit; To Increase The Percentage Amount Of Ad Valorem Taxes Paid By The Taxpayer That May Be Claimed For Such Credit Each Taxable Year For Five Taxable Years Until Such Time As The Entire Amount Of Ad Valorem Tax Paid On Inventory By The Taxpayer May Be Utilized For Such Credit; To Provide That The Taxpayer Shall Be Eligible For A Payment From The State In The Amount That The Ad Valorem Tax Credit Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Due The State In The Calendar Year In Which The Credit Is Claimed; And For Related Purposes.

1572.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for purchase and installation of wind energy systems/solar energy systems.
1572.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Costs Incurred By A Taxpayer For The Purchase And Installation Of Wind Energy Systems And Solar Energy Systems In Property That Is The Primary Residence Of The Taxpayer Or That Is Owned By The Taxpayer And Rented To Others For Dwelling Purposes; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1573.title: Appropriation; Archives and History for preplanning new museum of Mississippi's Native American heritage.
1573.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Archives And History For The Purpose Of Preplanning The Establishment Of A New Museum At Winterville Mounds In Washington County To Highlight Mississippi's Rich Native American Heritage, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1574.title: Housing repair grant program; authorize issuance of bonds to provide grants to low income individuals for home repair.
1574.description: An Act To Establish A Housing Repair Grant Program To Provide Grants To Certain Low Income Individuals To Make Significant Repairs To Their Homes; To Provide That The Department Of Finance And Administration Shall Administer The Grant Program; To Provide The Maximum Amount Of A Grant Authorized Under The Program; To Prescribe The Requirements To Be Eligible For A Grant Under The Program; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The Mississippi Housing Repair Grant Fund, Which Shall Be Used For The Program; To Authorize The Issuance Of $50,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Program; And For Related Purposes.

1575.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for public school capital improvements.
1575.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To School Districts In The State For Capital Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

1576.title: Income tax; exclude overtime compensation from gross income.
1576.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Overtime Compensation From The Definition Of "gross Income" For Purposes Of The State Income Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1578.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on sales of certain food and revise diversion to municipalities.
1578.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Rate Of Tax On Retail Sales Of Food For Human Consumption Not Purchased With Food Stamps But Which Would Be Exempt From Sales Tax If Such Food Were Purchased With Food Stamps; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Percentage Of Sales Tax Collected On Retail Sales Of Such Food Within Municipalities That Is Distributed To Municipalities; And For Related Purposes.

1580.title: Lowndes County; may enter into certain loan agreements with the USDA for terms of not more than 30 years.
1580.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Loan Agreements With The United States Department Of Agriculture Rural Development For Terms Of Not More Than 30 Years To Finance The Acquisition Of Real Property And Otherwise Aid In The Development Of The Aerospace Park In The County; And For Related Purposes.

1582.title: Growth and Prosperity Act; revise the date upon which supervisors districts are determined eligible.
1582.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-80-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "eligible Supervisors District" Under The Growth And Prosperity Act To Include Those Supervisors Districts In Which 30% Or More Of Such District's Population Is At Or Below The Federal Poverty Level According To The Latest Official Data Compiled By The United States Census Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

1583.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds for.
1583.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1586.title: Sales tax; exempt certain organizations operating long-term care facilities for adults with mental retardation.
1586.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services To Nonprofit Organizations That Operate Long-term Care Facilities Solely For Adults With Mental Retardation If The Organization Is Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

1587.title: Income tax; sales of certain interests in certain business entities are gain and include certain dividend income in gross income.
1587.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Sales Of Certain Interests In Financial Institutions Domiciled In Mississippi, Domestic Corporations, Domestic Limited Partnerships Or Domestic Limited Liability Companies Shall Be Recognized As Gain Under The Income Tax Law Of 1952; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Within The Definition Of Gross Income Under The Income Tax Law Of 1952, Income From Dividends That Has Already Borne A Tax As Dividend Income When The Dividends May Be Specifically Identified In The Possession Of The Recipient; To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1588.title: Sales tax and use tax; exempt shipping and handling charges from.
1588.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "shipping And Handling Charges" For Purposes Of The State Sales Tax Law; To Provide That Shipping And Handling Charges Shall Not Be Included Within The Meaning Of "gross Proceeds Of Sale" For Purposes Of The State Sales Tax Law; To Amend Section 27-67-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "shipping And Handling Charges" For Purposes Of The State Use Tax Law; To Provide That Shipping And Handling Charges Shall Not Be Included Within The Meaning Of "purchase Price" Or "sales Price" For Purposes Of The State Use Sales Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1589.title: Income tax; authorize credit for portion of costs of college textbooks.
1589.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit To Taxpayers For A Portion Of The Costs Paid By The Taxpayer For Textbooks Used By The Taxpayer Or A Dependent Of The Taxpayer While Enrolled As A Resident Student In A Course Or Courses At A Public Or Private University, College, Community College Or Junior College In This State; To Limit The Period Of Time Within Which The Tax Credit May Be Claimed; To Limit The Maximum Amount Of The Credit; To Allow Any Unused Tax Credit To Be Carried Forward One Year; And For Related Purposes.

1590.title: Bonds; increase amount that may be issued for the Local Governments and Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund.
1590.description: An Act To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 3, Chapter 492, Laws Of 2008, To Increase From $24,743,000.00 To $26,143,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; And For Related Purposes.

1591.title: Community colleges; authorize additional tax levy for improvements and general support.
1591.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-29-141, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties To Levy Additional Taxes For Capital Improvements And General Support Of A Community College District; And For Related Purposes.

1592.title: Lauderdale County; authorize donation of certain real property to Northeast Volunteer Fire and Rescue, Inc.
1592.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County To Donate Certain Real Property To Northeast Volunteer Fire And Rescue, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1593.title: Mississippi Small Business Investment and Jobs Promotion Act of 2010; create.
1593.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Small Business Investment And Jobs Promotion Act Of 2010; To Provide For An Income Tax, Insurance Premium Tax And Insurance Premium Retaliatory Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Make Qualified Investments In Qualified Small Business Capital Companies For The Purpose Of Investing In Mississippi Small Business Ventures; To Define The Terms "qualified Investment," "qualified Small Business Capital Company," "mississippi Small Business Venture" And Other Terms For The Purposes Of Such Tax Credits; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credits Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of The Tax Credits That May Be Allocated To All Taxpayers In Any One State Fiscal Year Shall Not Exceed $15,000,000.00 And That The Credits Shall Be Allocated By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Recapture Of A Tax Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 27-15-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Investments That May Reduce A Taxpayer's Insurance Premium Tax Liability Under Such Section Shall Not Include Any Investment For Which A Credit Is Allocated Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1594.title: Income tax; authorize credit for taxpayers who maintain, support and care for dependent with diagnosis of developmental disability.
1594.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Any Taxpayer In This State Who Is Maintaining, Supporting And Caring For A Dependent With A Diagnosis Of Developmental Disability In His Home; And For Related Purposes.

1595.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of state general obligation bonds for constructing a new spillway at Lake Mary in Wilkinson County.
1595.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing A New Lake Mary Spillway And Dam In Wilkinson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1596.title: Town of Byhalia; authorize a tax on hotels and motels.
1596.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Byhalia, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals; To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Expended By The Town Of Byhalia To Enhance Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The State Tax Commission And Paid To The Town Of Byhalia; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1597.title: Mississippi Existing Forestry Industry Enterprise Revolving Loan Program; create and authorize issuance of bonds for.
1597.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Existing Forestry Industry Enterprise Revolving Loan Program To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Loans To Certain Forestry Industry Enterprises That Have Been Operating In This State For Not Less Than Three Years; To Authorize The Issuance Of $18,500,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Existing Forestry Industry Enterprise Assistance Program; And For Related Purposes.

1599.title: Ad valorem tax; local governing authorities may grant an exemption on homesteads of certain residents serving in Iraq or Afghanistan.
1599.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-33-76, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, Except Taxes For School District Purposes, On Homesteads Of Residents Of This State Who Are Serving On Active Duty Pursuant To Military Orders In Iraq Or Afghanistan; To Provide The Amount Of Such Exemption; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Adopt And Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Administer And Implement Such Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1600.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize contribution to Emmett Till Memorial Commission.
1600.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County To Donate Funds To The Emmett Till Memorial Commission Of Tallahatchie County, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1601.title: Sales tax; exempt retail sales of exercise equipment to individuals for home use.
1601.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Exercise Equipment To Individuals For Home Or Personal Use; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Develop A List Of Items To Which The Exemption Applies And Guidelines For Administering The Exemption; And For Related Purposes.

1602.title: Appropriation; Health Department to develop and operate two STD/HIV specialty clinics.
1602.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Expanding Access To Primary Care For Hiv Disease By Developing And Operating Two Std/hiv Specialty Clinics In Certain Areas Of The State, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1605.title: Sweetened Beverages and Syrups Tax Law; enact.
1605.description: An Act To Be Known As The "sweetened Beverages And Syrups Tax Law"; To Provide That Distributors Who Receive, Store, Manufacture, Bottle Or Distribute Certain Sweetened Beverage Products For Sale To Retailers In This State Must Obtain From The Department Of Revenue A Permit To Engage In Such Business; To Impose An Excise Tax On Every Distributor For The Privilege Of Selling Certain Sweetened Beverage Products; To Create The Children's Health Promotion Fund; To Provide That 20% Of The Revenue From The Excise Tax Imposed By This Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Children's Health Promotion Fund And That The Remainder Of Such Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Money In Such Fund; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Tax Levied By This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1606.title: Income tax; exclude transportation fringe benefits from gross income as allowed under the Internal Revenue Code.
1606.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income For State Income Tax Purposes Qualified Transportation Fringe Benefits Provided By An Employer Of The Taxpayer To The Taxpayer In The Amount Allowed To Be Excluded From The Taxpayer's Federal Gross Income Under Section 132 Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

1607.title: Tunica County; authorize contribution to Aaron E. Henry Community Health Clinic, P.A.
1607.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Aaron E. Henry Community Health Clinic, Incorporated, And The G.a. Stover Health Clinic, P.a., For The Purpose Of Improving The Medical Care For The Residents Of Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

1608.title: Tunica County; authorize to contract with and/or contribute to Mid-State Opportunity, Inc.
1608.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contract With And Donate Funds To Mid-state Opportunity, Incorporated; And For Related Purposes.

1609.title: Tunica County; authorize contribution to Institute of Community Services, Inc.
1609.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County To Contribute Funds To The Institute Of Community Services, Inc., To Assist The Institute In Establishing And Operating Head Start Classes For Children In Tunica County, To Acquire, Operate And Maintain New And Existing Vehicles To Be Used To Transport The Children To And From The Head Start Facility And To Provide Day Care Vouchers For Parents; And For Related Purposes.

1610.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Jackson in making repairs and improvements to water and sewer systems.
1610.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Making Repairs, Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Water And Sewer Systems; And For Related Purposes.

1611.title: Bonds; authorize issuance provide funds for community and junior colleges technology upgrades.
1611.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Community And Junior Colleges To Assist In Paying The Costs Of Acquiring, Repairing, Replacing, Upgrading And Improving Technology Equipment And Infrastructure; And For Related Purposes.

1612.title: Sales tax; impose a tax on sales of machinery and construction services at certain refineries.
1612.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-65-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Levy A Tax On The Sale Of Manufacturing Or Processing Machinery To Be Installed And/or Used At A Refinery In This State And On The Performance Of Construction Services At Or In Regard To A Refinery In This State; To Provide That If The Owner Of The Refinery Holds A Direct Pay Permit Issued By The Department Of Revenue, The Owner Must Furnish The Permit To The Seller Or Person Performing The Construction Activity Unless The Holder Of The Direct Pay Permit Is Given Written Instructions Or Written Authority To Do Otherwise By The Commissioner Of Revenue; To Provide That After Being Furnished The Direct Pay Permit, The Seller Or Person Performing The Construction Activity Shall Be Relieved Of The Duty To Collect The Tax And The Owner Of The Refinery Shall Pay The Tax In The Manner Required By Rule And Regulation Promulgated By The Commissioner; To Amend Section 27-65-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Construction Activities Performed At Certain Refineries From The Tax Imposed By This Section; To Amend Section 27-65-93, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Holder Of A Direct Pay Permit To Pay The Taxes Due Under Section 27-65-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Section 27-67-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Use Tax Shall Apply To Certain Equipment Used At Refinery Operations At The Rate Provided For In Section 27-65-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Sections 57-3-33, 57-10-255, 57-10-439 And 57-71-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Purchases Financed By Certain Bond Proceeds Shall Not Be Exempt From The Tax Levied In Section 27-65-24(1)(b), Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

1613.title: DeSoto County; authorize contribution to Institute for Community Services, Inc., for a bus for Head Start program.
1613.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Institute For Community Services, Inc., For The Funding Of The Purchase Of A Bus For Its Head Start Program; And For Related Purposes.

1614.title: Appropriation; Legislative Expense, Regular.
1614.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Paying The Expenses And Providing Contingent Funds For The Legislature, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Budget Committee, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Reapportionment Committee, The Expenses Of The Joint Committee On Compilation, Revision And Publication Of Legislation, Paying The Monthly Expense Allowance Of The Members Of The Legislature, Paying The State's Share Of Various Assessments, And Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1615.title: Appropriation; Attorney General - support.
1615.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of The Attorney General For Fiscal Year 2011.

1616.title: Appropriation; District Attorneys and staff.
1616.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Paying Salaries And Travel Expenses Of District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys Of The State And Paying Office Expenses Of District Attorneys For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1617.title: Appropriation; Supreme Court Services.
1617.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Supreme Court Which Is Comprised Of The Supreme Court, The Office Of The Supreme Court Clerk And The State Law Library And To Pay Expenses Of Special Judges, Chancellors And Circuit Judges, And For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Administrative Office Of Courts And Certified Court Reporters, Continuing Legal Education, Court Of Appeals And The Board Of Bar Admissions, For The Fiscal Year 2011; And For Related Purposes.

1618.title: Appropriation; Office of Capital Defense Counsel.
1618.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of Capital Defense Counsel Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1619.title: Appropriation; Office of Capital Post-Conviction Counsel.
1619.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of Capital Post-conviction Counsel Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1620.title: Appropriation; Office of Indigent Appeals.
1620.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Office Of Indigent Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2011; And For Related Purposes.

1621.title: Appropriation; State Department of Education - General Programs, Education Reform Act and Vocational Education.
1621.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Funding K-12 And Other Related Educational Activities, Including Certain Agencies And Programs, In The State Of Mississippi, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1622.title: Appropriation; Mississippi Authority for Educational Television.
1622.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Authority For Educational Television For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1623.title: Appropriation; Library Commission.
1623.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Library Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1624.title: Appropriation; Department of Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks.
1624.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1625.title: Appropriation; Department of Environmental Quality.
1625.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Environmental Quality; And For Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1626.title: Appropriation; Governors Office - Division of Medicaid.
1626.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Governor's Office - Division Of Medicaid For The Purpose Of Providing Medical Assistance Under The Mississippi Medicaid Law And Defraying The Expenses Of The Administration Of Such Law For The Fiscal Years 2010 And 2011.

1627.title: Appropriation; State Department of Health-support.
1627.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Health For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1628.title: Appropriation; State Forestry Commission.
1628.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The State Forestry Commission And For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Institute For Forest Inventory For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1629.title: Appropriation; State Board of Registration for Foresters.
1629.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Registration For Foresters For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1630.title: Appropriation; Soil and Water Conservation Commission.
1630.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Soil And Water Conservation Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1631.title: Appropriation; Department of Archives and History.
1631.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Department Of Archives And History, For The Fiscal Year 2011; And For Related Purposes.

1632.title: Appropriation; Arts Commission.
1632.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Arts Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1633.title: Appropriation; Department of Marine Resources.
1633.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Marine Resources For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1634.title: Appropriation; Grand Gulf Military Monument Commission.
1634.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Grand Gulf Military Monument Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1635.title: Appropriation; Mississippi River Parkway Commission.
1635.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi River Parkway Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1636.title: Appropriation; Pat Harrison Waterway District.
1636.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pat Harrison Waterway District For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1637.title: Appropriation; Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority.
1637.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1638.title: Appropriation; Pearl River Basin Development District.
1638.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pearl River Basin Development District For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1639.title: Appropriation; Pearl River Valley Water Supply District.
1639.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1640.title: Appropriation; Mississippi State Port Authority at Gulfport.
1640.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Port Authority At Gulfport For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1641.title: Appropriation; Insurance Department.
1641.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Insurance For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1642.title: Appropriation; State Fire Academy.
1642.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Fire Academy For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1643.title: Appropriation; Department of Human Services-Consolidated.
1643.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1644.title: Appropriation; Rehabilitation Services - Consolidated.
1644.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Rehabilitation Services For Fiscal Year 2011.

1645.title: Appropriation; Tombigbee River Valley Water Management District.
1645.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Tombigbee River Valley Water Management District For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1646.title: Appropriation; Public Employees' Retirement System-administrative expenses; maintenance and operation of building.
1646.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Public Employees' Retirement System And For The Maintenance And Operation Of The Retirement System Building For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1647.title: Appropriation; Oil and Gas Board.
1647.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Oil And Gas Board For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1648.title: Appropriation; Public Service Commission.
1648.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Public Service Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1649.title: Appropriation; Public Utilities Staff.
1649.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Public Utilities Staff For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1650.title: Appropriation; Real Estate Commission.
1650.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Real Estate Commission For Fiscal Year 2011.

1651.title: Appropriation; Real Estate Appraiser Licensing and Certification Board.
1651.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Real Estate Appraiser Licensing And Certification Board For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1652.title: Appropriation; Athletic Commission.
1652.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Athletic Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1653.title: Appropriation; State Board of Medical Licensure.
1653.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Medical Licensure For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1654.title: Appropriation; Physical Therapy Board.
1654.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Physical Therapy For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1655.title: Appropriation; Board of Psychology.
1655.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Psychology For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1656.title: Appropriation; Coast Coliseum Commission.
1656.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1657.title: Appropriation; State Board of Nursing Home Administrators.
1657.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Nursing Home Administrators For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1658.title: Appropriation; Board of Nursing.
1658.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Nursing For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1659.title: Appropriation; State Board of Registration for Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors.
1659.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Registration For Professional Engineers And Land Surveyors For Fiscal Year 2011.

1660.title: Appropriation; Board of Cosmetology.
1660.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Cosmetology For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1661.title: Appropriation; Board of Examiners for Social Workers and Marriage and Family Therapists.
1661.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1662.title: Appropriation; Veterans' Home Purchase Board.
1662.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans' Home Purchase Board And Making New Home Loans As Authorized By Law For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1663.title: Appropriation; Auctioneers Commission.
1663.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Auctioneers Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1664.title: Appropriation; State Board of Barber Examiners.
1664.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Barber Examiners For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1665.title: Appropriation; Board of Optometry.
1665.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Optometry For The Fiscal Year 2011.

1666.title: Appropriation; Department of Transportation.
1666.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, For The Fiscal Year 2011; And For Related Purposes.

1667.title: Appropriation; reappropriation, DFA - Bureau of Building; FY11.
1667.description: An Act Making A Reappropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Reauthorize The Expenditure Of Special Funds Previously Appropriated For Construction And/or Repair And Renovation Projects At Various State Agencies And Institutions, For Fiscal Year 2011.

1668.title: Sales tax; authorize sales tax holiday for retail sales of guns and certain other outdoor sporting goods.
1668.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition, Hunting Equipment And Supplies, Camping Equipment And Supplies, Fishing Equipment And Supplies, Outdoor Nature Sports Equipment And Supplies And Paddle Sports Equipment And Supplies, If The Sale Takes Place During The Period Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Friday After Thanksgiving And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Saturday; And For Related Purposes.

1669.title: Sales tax; increase rate on sales of tickets or admissions to movie theaters.
1669.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Additional Sales Tax On Sales Of Admissions To Motion Picture Theaters And Movie Theaters; And For Related Purposes.

1670.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for construction of state law enforcement and fire museum.
1670.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Pay The Costs Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A State Law Enforcement And Fire Museum To Be Located In The Farish Street Historical District In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1671.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to Jackson State University for purchase of historical exhibit.
1671.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Jackson State University For Use In The Purchase Of An Exhibit That Would Enhance The Historical Significance Of The Struggles Of The Disadvantaged Individuals And Promote Tourism On The Campus, In The Community And Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1672.title: Income tax; exclude amounts converted from traditional IRA to Roth IRA from gross income.
1672.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "gross Income" Under The State Income Tax Law To Exclude Amounts Converted From A Traditional Individual Retirement Account To A Roth Individual Retirement Account For The Purposes Of The 2010 Taxable Year And Subsequent Taxable Years; And For Related Purposes.

1673.title: Income tax; authorize job tax credit for new cut and sew jobs in the upholstered household furniture manufacturing industry.
1673.description: An Act To Authorize A Job Tax Credit For Enterprises That Own Or Operate An Upholstered Household Furniture Manufacturing Facility For Each Full-time Employee Employed By Such Manufacturer In A New Cut And Sew Job; To Provide The Amount Of Such Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit That May Be Claimed In Any One Year; To Authorize Any Tax Credit Claimed But Not Used In Any Taxable Year To Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years; And For Related Purposes.

1674.title: Income tax; revise new jobs required for tax credit allowed for company establishing or transferring national or regional headquarters.
1674.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Minimum New Jobs Requirement For Purposes Of The Additional Income Tax Credit Authorized For A Company Establishing Or Transferring Its National Or Regional Headquarters From Within Or Outside The State Of Mississippi; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority, Instead Of The State Tax Commission, Shall Establish Criteria And Prescribe Procedures To Determine If A Company Qualifies As A National Or Regional Headquarters For Purposes Of Receiving The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1675.title: DeSoto County; authorize contribution to Historic DeSoto Foundation, Inc.
1675.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Historic Desoto Foundation, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1676.title: Taxation; provide ad valorem, fuel and sales tax exemptions regarding private buses contracted to transport school students.
1676.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Ad Valorem Tax Exemption For Buses And Other Motor Vehicles Owned And Operated By An Entity That Has Entered Into Or Renewed A Contract With A School Board On Or After July 1, 2010, For The Transportation Of Students To And From Schools And Used By The Entity For Such Transportation Purposes; To Amend Sections 27-55-12 And 27-55-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Partial Gasoline, Special Fuel And Compressed Gas Tax Exemptions For Sales Of Gasoline, Special Fuel And Compressed Gas Made To An Entity That Has Entered Into Or Renewed A Contract With A School Board On Or After July 1, 2010, For The Transportation Of Students To And From Schools For Use In Buses And Other Motor Vehicles For Such Transportation Purposes; To Amend Section 27-65-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Buses And Other Motor Vehicles, And Parts And Labor Used To Maintain And Repair The Buses And Motor Vehicles, To An Entity That Has Entered Into Or Renewed A Contract With A School Board On Or After July 1, 2010, For The Transportation Of Students To And From Schools And Uses Or Will Use The Buses And Other Motor Vehicles For Such Transportation Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1677.title: Sales tax and use tax; provide certain exemptions for business enterprises owning or operating data centers.
1677.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Business Enterprises That Operate Data Centers In This State Shall Be Exempt From Any Sales And Use Tax Imposed On The Business Enterprise For The Purchase Of Component Building Materials And Equipment For Initial Construction Of Facilities Or Expansion Of Facilities, And Any Sales And Use Tax Imposed On The Purchase Of Replacement Hardware, Software Or Other Necessary Technology To Operate A Data Center; To Provide That Applications For The Tax Exemptions Shall Be Made To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Minimum Contents Of The Application; To Provide Certain Conditions That Apply To The Exemptions; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1678.title: City of Booneville; authorize to contribute funds to Rails and Trails Museum.
1678.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Booneville To Contribute Funds To The Rails And Trails Museum; And For Related Purposes.

1679.title: City of Booneville; authorize to contribute funds to Booneville Hardware Cultural Arts Center, Inc.
1679.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Booneville To Contribute Funds To The Booneville Hardware Cultural Arts Center, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1680.title: Sweet potato industry; authorize issuance of bonds to provide funds for disaster assistance loan guaranty program.
1680.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Mississippi Development Authority To Provide For A Program Of Loan Guaranties To Be Made On Behalf Of Certain Agribusinesses Engaged In Sweet Potato Growing And Farming For The Purpose Of Encouraging Thereby The Extension Of Conventional Financing And The Issuance Of Letters Of Credit To Such Agribusinesses By Lenders; To Specify Eligibility Requirements For The Loan Guaranty Program; To Specify The Maximum Amount Of A Loan Guaranty That May Be Made Under The Program; To Specify The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of A Loan May Be Used; To Provide That Monies To Make The Loan Guaranties Under The Program Shall Be Drawn From The Emerging Crops Fund And Shall Not Exceed $17,000,000.00 In The Aggregate; To Amend Section 69-2-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The Emerging Crops Fund By $17,000,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

1682.title: Rental equipment; tax rental equipment and distribute revenue to local governments and exempt from ad valorem taxation.
1682.description: An Act To Levy An Additional Tax On Persons Engaged In The Business Of Renting Certain Equipment; To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Tax Shall Be Paid To The County Which Is The Situs Of The Equipment And Distributed By The County To The County, Municipality And The School District Of The Situs, As Appropriate, In The Same Manner That Ad Valorem Taxes On The Equipment Would Be Distributed; To Exempt Rental Equipment From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1684.title: Jackson County; authorize use of forfeiture funds to pay clothing allowance for undercover agents of Narcotics Task Force.
1684.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Utilize Forfeiture Funds To Pay A Clothing Allowance For Undercover Agents Assigned To The Narcotics Task Force Of The County; And For Related Purposes.

1685.title: City of Natchez and Adams County; authorize to contribute certain funds to Natchez, Inc.
1685.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Natchez And The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Each Provide Certain Funding On An Annual Basis To Natchez, Inc., A Nonprofit Economic Development Organization; To Repeal Chapter 913, Local And Private Laws Of 2002, Which Creates The Natchez-adams County Development Authority; To Provide That All Property And Assets Held By The Authority Shall Be Transferred To Natchez, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1686.title: Hinds County; may establish Hinds County Economic Development Authority and abolish Hinds County Economic Development district.
1686.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County, Mississippi, To Establish An Economic And Community Development Authority To Be Known As The Hinds County Economic Development Authority; To Provide For The Appointment Of Trustees Of The Authority; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Authority; To Provide That The Authority May Be Authorized By The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Certain Economic Development, And/or Community Development For Municipalities Located In Hinds County; To Provide That The Authority May Be Authorized By The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Certain Community Development Services In The County; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County To Issue Bonds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Cost Of Acquiring And Improving Land And Buildings Related To Economic Development; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Dissolve The Hinds County Economic Development District; And For Related Purposes.

1687.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for state highway and county road and bridge improvements.
1687.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-4-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "high Economic Benefit Project" Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $42,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $258,000,000.00 To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Replacement Or Rehabilitation Of Certain Bridges On State Maintained Highways That Are Deficient Or Functionally Obsolete, For The Construction And Reconstruction Of Certain Vision 21 High Priority Projects And Certain Other Specified State Highway Segments, And To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Office Of State Aid Road Construction For The Replacement And/or Rehabilitation Of Certain Deficient County Bridges And For Certain Safety Related Improvements To County Roads; And For Related Purposes.

1688.title: Economic development; authorize certain tax exemptions for certain clean energy and aerospace industry business enterprises.
1688.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Business Enterprises That Locate Or Expand In This State That Own Or Operate A Facility For The Manufacture Or Assembly Of Systems Or Components Used In The Generation Of Clean Energy, Or Own Or Operate A Facility That Manufactures Or Assembles Products For The Aerospace Industry Or Provides Research And Development Or Training Services In The Aerospace Industry, Shall Be Exempt For A Period Of Ten Years From Any Sales And Use Tax Related To The Purchase Of Component Building Materials And Equipment For Initial Construction Of Facilities Or Expansion Of Facilities, All Income Tax Imposed On Income Earned By The Business Enterprise, Franchise Tax Imposed On The Business Enterprise And Any Sales And Use Tax Imposed On The Lease Of Machinery And Equipment Acquired In The Initial Construction To Establish The Facility Or For An Expansion Of A Facility; To Amend Sections 27-7-21, 27-13-5, 27-13-7 And 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1689.title: Housing Loan Assistance Pilot Program; create.
1689.description: An Act To Create The Housing Loan Assistance Pilot Program To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Loans To Certain Persons To Repair An Existing Home Or To Construct A New Home; To Authorize The Issuance Of $3,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Housing Loan Assistance Pilot Program; To Create The Housing Loan Assistance Bond Sinking Fund For The Purpose Of Providing The Principal And Interest On The Bonds Authorized Under This Act To Be Paid Primarily From Certain Fees Authorized By This Act; To Amend Section 25-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Additional Fee For Recording Deeds And Deeds Of Trusts; To Require The Chancery Clerk To Remit Such Fees To The Mississippi Development Authority To Be Deposited Into The Housing Loan Assistance Bond Sinking Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1690.title: Sales tax; levy additional one cent on soft drinks.
1690.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Provide For Definitions Of Terms Associated With Imposing An Additional Sales Tax On Soft Drinks; To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose An Additional Sales Tax On Retail Sales Of Soft Drinks In The Amount Of One Cent Per Bottle Containing A Soft Drink; To Provide That This Additional Tax Levy Shall Be Imposed Without Regard To The Size Or Volume Capacity Of The Bottle And Without Regard To Whether The Soft Drink Contains A Caloric Or Noncaloric Sweetener; To Create A New Code Section To Provide For The Creation Of The School Health Disparity Special Fund, Into Which Shall Be Deposited The Collections Of The Additional Sales Tax On Soft Drinks; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund Shall Be Allocated To Certain School Nurse Programs Located In School Districts Having Students With A Health Disparity When Compared To The Median Health Index Of The School Districts In The State, As Identified By The State Superintendent Of Public Education; To Provide That Those School Districts Shall Use Such Monies For Educational, Environmental And Policy Approaches That Promote Health, Nutrition And Physical Activity; To Provide That The State Auditor And The Commissioner Of Revenue Shall Audit And Establish Rules And Procedures As Necessary To Accomplish The Purposes Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Diversion Of Sales Tax Collections Of This Additional Sales Tax On Soft Drinks Into The School Health Disparity Special Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1691.title: Sales tax; exempt retail sales of fruits and vegetables.
1691.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Fruits And Vegetables; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Develop A List Of The Specific Items To Which The Exemption Applies And Guidelines For Administering The Exemption; And For Related Purposes.

1692.title: Sales tax; exempt certain retail sales made as part of toy collection campaign under U.S. Marine Corps Toys for Tots Program.
1692.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Purchased With Credit Cards Or Other Forms Of Payment Issued By The Marine Toys For Tots Foundation As Part Of Local Toy Collection Campaigns Conducted Under The U.s. Marine Corps Reserve Toys For Tots Program; And For Related Purposes.

1693.title: Income tax; authorize a job credit for employers that hire certain unemployed persons.
1693.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who, At The Time Of Such Employment, Were Unemployed And Had Been Unemployed For At Least Six Months Immediately Preceding Employment; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In Any Taxable Year; To Authorize Any Tax Credit Claimed But Not Used In Any Taxable Year To Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years; And For Related Purposes.

1694.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for repair of bridges in Alcorn and Tishomingo Counties.
