1860.title: Reverend Dr. Jerry Young; commend and congratulate on 30th anniversary as Pastor of New Hope Baptist Church.
1860.description: A Resolution Commending The Pastoral Leadership And Spiritual Excellence Of Reverend Dr. Jerry Young And Congratulating Him Upon Being Honored As Pastor Of New Hope Baptist Church On The Occasion Of His 30th Year Anniversary.

1861.title: Karen and Maur McKie; commend upon being named a finalist for Total Landscape Care Magazine Landscaper of the Year Award.
1861.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Karen And Maur Mckie, Owners Of Green Oak Garden Center And Florist, Upon Being Named As Finalists For Total Landscape Care Magazine National Landscaper Of The Year Award.

1862.title: Carole Lynn Meadows; commend on receiving the coveted Billy Creel Tourism Award.
1862.description: A Resolution Commending The Civic Contributions Of Gulf Coast Volunteer Leader, Carole Lynn Meadows, And Congratulating Her Upon Receiving The Annual Billy Creel Tourism Award.

1863.title: 2010 Greenwood Public School District retirees; congratulate for numerous years of dedicated service.
1863.description: A Resolution Congratulating The 2010 Retirees Of The Greenwood Public School District For Their Numerous Years Of Dedicated Service And Extending Best Wishes Upon Their Retirement.

1864.title: Holmes CC-Grenada Campus' Alpha Mu Beta Chapter of Phi Theta Kappa; commend upon being named Most Distinguished Chapter.
1864.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Holmes Community College-grenada Campus' Alpha Mu Beta Chapter Of Phi Theta Kappa Upon Being Named Most Distinguished Chapter At The 2010 Annual International Convention.

1865.title: Sacred Heart Mock Trial Team; commend on State Championship.
1865.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Sacred Heart Catholic High School Mock Trial Team Upon Winning 2008-2009 And 2009-2010 Mississippi State Mock Trial State Championships.

1866.title: Yazoo-Mississippi Delta Levee Board; commend on work for the North Mississippi Fish Hatchery.
1866.description: A Resolution Commending The Outstanding And Dedicated Work Of The Yazoo-mississippi Delta Levee Board In Providing In-kind Services For The Construction Of Ponds For The North Mississippi Fish Hatchery At Enid Dam And The Ross Barnett Reservoir.

1867.title: George Thatcher; commend the military and civilian service of.
1867.description: A Resolution Commending The Military And Civilian Service Of Author George Thatcher.

1868.title: Gulfport High School; commend for winning 2010 "We the People" civic education competition and advancing to national event.
1868.description: A Resolution Commending Gulfport High School For Winning The State-level Competition Of The 2010 "we The People: The Citizen And The Constitution" Civic Education Competition And Expressing Best Wishes For Their Success At The National Competition In Washington, D.c.

1869.title: Robert Davis, Sr.; commend and congratulate on 100th birthday.
1869.description: A Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Life Of Mr. Robert Davis, Sr., And Congratulating Him Upon The Celebration Of His 100th Birthday.

1870.title: Gary Matthews; commend on achievements as Executive Director of Tishomingo County Development Foundation.
1870.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Gary Matthews Of Tishomingo County Upon Being Recognized As One Of The "ten Persons Who Made A Difference In The South" In 2009 By Southern Business And Development.

1871.title: Janette Breedlove; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
1871.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Janette Laughlin Breedlove And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1872.title: Stephen and Evelyn Drury Day; proclaim October 14, 2010, as in the State of Mississippi.
1872.description: A Resolution Commending Stephen And Evelyn Drury For Their Life's Work In Ministry And Proclaiming October 14, 2010, As Stephen And Evelyn Drury Day In The State Of Mississippi.

1873.title: USM; commend the recipients of the Founders' Day awards.
1873.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2010 Recipients Of The University Of Southern Mississippi Founders' Day Awards.

1874.title: George County; commend on occasion of 100th anniversary.
1874.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending George County, Mississippi, Upon Its Centennial Anniversary Celebration On May 8, 2010, And Expressing Sincere Wishes For Continued Success And Prosperity In The Future.

1875.title: Billy Mac Gore; commend upon the occasion of his retirement and honor meritorious service as Sheriff of Calhoun County.
1875.description: A Resolution Commending Billy Mac Gore Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement And Honoring His Meritorious Service As Sheriff Of Calhoun County.

1876.title: Dr. James Price; commend dedicated service upon occasion of his retirement as Superintendent of Vicksburg-Warren Schools.
1876.description: A Resolution Commending The Remarkable And Dedicated Service Dr. James Price Provided As Superintendent Of The Vicksburg-warren School District And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1877.title: Mrs. Mary Ann Williams Nave; commend life and legacy and express sympathy upon passing.
1877.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Mary Ann Williams Nave And Expressing Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1878.title: Aaron E. Henry Community Health Services Center, Inc.; commend commitment to health care and partnering with the Heinz Family Philanthropic Foundation.
1878.description: A Resolution Commending Aaron E. Henry Community Health Services Center, Inc., For Its Commitment To Health Care And Partnering With The Heinz Family Philanthropic Foundation.

1879.title: Steve Cummings; commend on 30 years of service to Yalobusha County.
1879.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Steve Cummings Upon His Retirement After 30 Years Of Service To Yalobusha County And Expressing Deepest Appreciation To Him For His Hard Work Over The Years.

1880.title: Dr. Claudia Limbert; commend laudable service as President of MUW upon the occasion of her retirement.
1880.description: A Resolution Commending The Laudable Service Of And Exceptional Leadership Dr. Claudia A. Limbert Provided As President Of The Mississippi University For Women And Extending Congratulations And Best Wishes For Continued Success Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement.

1881.title: Dr. John E. Walls, Jr.; commend service as Deputy Superintendent of Vicksburg-Warren School District upon his retirement.
1881.description: A Resolution Commending The Remarkable And Dedicated Service Of Dr. John E. Walls, Jr., Provided As Deputy Superintendent Of The Vicksburg-warren School District And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1882.title: Bennie L. Jones, Sr; commend life and legacy on his passing.
1882.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Influential And Iconic Delta Community Leader, Mr. Bennie L. Jones, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1883.title: Charles W. (Charlie) Capps, Jr.; commend life, service, accomplishments and legacy upon his passing.
1883.description: A Resolution Commemorating The Life, Service, Accomplishments And Legacy Of The Honorable Charles W. (charlie) Capps, Jr., Former Representative Of House District 28, For His Many Years Of Outstanding And Dedicated Service To The Citizens Of The State Of Mississippi And Expressing Deepest Sympathy Of The Mississippi Legislature To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1884.title: Constitution; amend to require advance notice to Legislature of extraordinary session.
1884.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require A Proclamation Which Calls The Legislature Into Extraordinary Session To Be Issued At Least Five Calendar Days Before The Convening Of The Legislature In Extraordinary Session; And For Related Purposes.

1885.title: U.S. Congress; urge to be mindful of state sovereignty enumerated in the 10th Amendment to U.S. Constitution.
1885.description: A Concurrent Resolution Reinforcing The Fundamental Principle And Authority Of State Sovereignty Under The Tenth Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Over Certain Powers And Discouraging The Federal Government From Imposing Certain Restrictive Mandates.

1886.title: Slavery; issue apology for state's role in upholding and perpetuating the institution of in Mississippi.
1886.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, Expressing Profound Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, The Discrimination Of Its Legacy And Urging Reconciliation.

1887.title: Amend Constitution; restrict use of eminent domain.
1887.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 17, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Private Property Shall Never Be Taken For Private Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1888.title: Constitution; amend to change statewide elections to first Saturday of November.
1888.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day On Which Elections For Statewide Offices Occur From The First Tuesday To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November Beginning In 2011.

1889.title: Amend Constitution; prohibit construing the Constitution as granting the right to have an abortion.
1889.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 32, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Prohibit Construing The Constitution As Granting The Right To Have An Abortion; And For Related Purposes.

1890.title: T. Ray Lawrence; commend career as accomplished singer with the Metropolitan Opera upon his return to Mississippi.
1890.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Stellar, Illustrious And Accomplished Musical And Teaching Career Of Mississippi's Native Son, Mr. T. Ray Lawrence, Of The Renowned New York Metropolitan Opera, And Extending To Him A Royal Welcome Back To His Native Birthplace Of Gulfport, Mississippi.

1891.title: Amend Constitution; Governor's pardoning power; exclude murder and capital murder from.
1891.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 124 To Exclude Murder And Capital Murder From The Types Of Felony Convictions For Which The Governor May Grant A Pardon; And For Related Purposes.

1892.title: Amend Constitution; public hearing for felony crime; require before pardon.
1892.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 124 To Require A Public Hearing To Occur In The County In Which A Felony Is Committed Before A Pardon Is Granted For The Person Who Has Committed Such Felony; And For Related Purposes.

1893.title: Constitution; amend to require majority vote only for bill reducing taxes.
1893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 70, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Bills That Reduce Taxes Require Only A Majority Vote Of Each House Of The Legislature For Passage; And For Related Purposes.

1894.title: Constitution; amend to provide for a state university system state board of governors and local board of trustees.
1894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi; To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System; To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1895.title: Constitution; establish right to hunt, fish and trap.
1895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Creating A New Section Establishing The Right To Hunt, Fish And Trap Wildlife And Fish As A Constitutional Right; And For Related Purposes.

1896.title: Constitution; amend to limit members of the Legislature to 20 years of service.
1896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Add A New Section 35a To Provide That Any Person Who Is Elected To The Legislature In Or After The 2011 General Election Shall Not Be Eligible To Serve For More Than Twenty Years In The Legislature, Whether Those Years Are Consecutive Years Of Service Or Not; And For Related Purposes.

1897.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the Legislature shall meet in regular session once every two years.
1897.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2012, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; And For Related Purposes.

1898.title: Reciprocity; urge Louisiana to provide for Mississippi gun permits.
1898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The State Of Louisiana To Provide Reciprocity For Mississippians With Valid Gun Permits.

1899.title: State of Mississippi; urge to take critical and fundamental actions to improve the state's economic and social rankings.
1899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Economic And Social Rankings And Encouraging Mississippi Agencies, And Public And Private Entities To Take Critical And Fundamental Actions To Improve Mississippi's Economic And Social Rankings.

1900.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit laws compelling any person, employer or health care provider to participate in any health care plan.
1900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Prohibit Laws Or Rules From Compelling Any Person, Employer Or Health Care Provider To Participate In Any Health Care System; To Permit A Person Or Employer To Pay Directly For Lawful Health Care Services And To Permit A Health Care Provider To Accept Direct Payment From A Person Or Employer For Lawful Health Care Services; To Provide That The Purchase Or Sale Of Health Insurance Shall Not Be Prohibited By Law Or Rule.

1901.title: Hamilton High School Softball Team; commend on winning 2009 2A State Championship.
1901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Hamilton High School Lady Lions Slow-pitch Softball Team For Their Outstanding 2009-2010 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association (mhsaa) Class 2a State Championship.

1902.title: Constitution; amend to reduce the size of the House of Representatives.
1902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 254, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Consist Of Not More Than 104 Members; And For Related Purposes.

1903.title: Joint Session; call to hear State of the State address of the Governor.
1903.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Haley Barbour.

1904.title: Tylertown High School Chiefs Football Team; commend on winning Class 3A State Championship.
1904.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Tylertown High School Chiefs Football Team And Head Coach Walter Denton For Their Outstanding 2009 Season And For Winning The Class 3a State Championship.

1905.title: Constitution; amend to provide for appointment of Supreme Court judges.
1905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Amending Section 145 To Provide That Judges Of The Supreme Court Shall Be Appointed; To Provide That Each Judge Shall Stand For An Election During The Last Year Of His Term Of Office To Determine If That Judge Shall Be Retained In Service Or Removed From Office And A Successor Appointed; By Amending Sections 149 And 149-a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, In Conformity; By Repealing Sections 145-a And 145-b, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Provide For Six Judges In Addition To The Original Three Judges Of The Supreme Court; And For Related Purposes.

1906.title: Nurse Anesthetists Week; designate week of January 24-30, 2010, as in Mississippi.
1906.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Mississippi's Unwavering Commitment To Health Care And The Zealous Service Of Health Care Professionals In The Designation Of The Week Of January 24-30, 2010, As Nurse Anesthetists Week In The State Of Mississippi.

1907.title: Constitutional amendment; bail not allowed for sex crime offenses.
1907.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 28, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Deny Bail To Those Accused Of Crimes Related To Sex As Defined In Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

1908.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit bail for person appealing felony conviction.
1908.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 29, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Prohibit Bail For A Person Appealing A Felony Conviction.

1909.title: Constitution; amend to restrict use of eminent domain.
1909.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 17, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Private Property Shall Never Be Taken For Private Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1910.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit person convicted of voting crime from holding public office.
1910.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 44, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Prohibit A Person Who Has Been Convicted Of A Crime Related To Voting Or Voter Registration From Holding Public Office; And For Related Purposes.

1911.title: Honorable Thomas F. Hall; commend on recent retirement.
1911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Secretary Thomas F. Hall On His Recent Retirement As Assistant Secretary Of Defense For Reserve Affairs.

1912.title: Billie Hopkins; commend the valiant and dedicated service rendered as a World War II veteran.
1912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Gallant And Dedicated Service And Sacrifice Of World War Ii Veteran And Three-time Purple Heart Recipient Billie Hopkins Of Baldwyn, Mississippi.

1913.title: Mississippi Public Broadcasting; commend and congratulate on winning two Emmy Awards for the "Between the Lions" series.
1913.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Commitment Of Mississippi Public Broadcasting For Its Continual Commitment To Promoting And Enhancing Early Childhood Literacy Through Its Excellence Of Production Of The "between The Lions" Educational Series And Congratulating The Show Upon Winning Two Daytime Creative Arts Emmys At The 2009 Emmy Awards.

1914.title: Constitution; amend to elect State Superintendent of Public Education.
1914.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Election Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education Beginning At The General State Election In 2011.

1915.title: State tax system; create study committee to study and make recommendations.
1915.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Create A Study Committee To Study The Tax System Of This State And To Make Recommendations Thereon To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1916.title: United States Constitution; request Congress to call convention to adopt flat-rate income tax.
1916.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To A Flat-rate Income Tax System And Urging And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1917.title: Smithville High School Band; commend on winning the Class 1A State Championship.
1917.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Smithville High School Band For Winning The 2009 Mississippi Class 1a State Marching Band Championship And Receiving A Superior Rating At Region 1 State Marching Festival.

1918.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1918.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Sections 140 And 142 And Repealing Section 141 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1919.title: Constitution; amend to set elections for statewide elective offices in even-numbered years.
1919.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Elections For Statewide Elective Offices Held After The Election In 2011 Shall Occur In 2014 And Every Four Years Thereafter.

1920.title: Constitution; amend to authorize metropolitan government.
1920.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Laws And To Permit The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Laws Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1921.title: Constitution; amend to provide that felony convictions result in loss of suffrage; Legislature impose conditions for restoration.
1921.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 241 And Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Delete The Enumeration Of Specific Felonies, Conviction Of Which Will Preclude A Person From Being Declared A Qualified Elector; To Provide That Conviction In A Court Of This State Or Of Any Other State Or In Any Federal Court Of Any Felony Will Preclude A Person From Being Declared A Qualified Elector; To Provide That A Person Disqualified As An Elector By Reason Of Conviction Of An Offense Under Section 241 Of This Constitution May Have His Right To Vote Restored Upon Completion Of His Sentence, Probation, Parole And Any Other Conditions As The Legislature, By General Law, May Prescribe; And For Related Purposes.

1922.title: Kaleb Eulls; commend and honor his lifesaving heroic acts exemplified on September 1, 2008.
1922.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Heroism And Selfless Courage Under Fire Exhibited By Kaleb Eulls In Defusing A Volatile Situation And Saving The Lives Of Numerous Students By Placing Himself In Harm's Way To Disarm A Gun Threat On A School Bus.

1923.title: Mayor Buford C. Blount II; commend life, legacy and public service of upon his passing.
1923.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of Retired Air Force Colonel And Jefferson Davis County Icon Mayor Buford C. Blount Ii Of Bassfield, Mississippi.

1924.title: Joint Rules; amend to require 72-hour waiting period before voting on appropriation or revenue bill.
1924.description: A Concurrent Resolution Amending Rule 40, Which Is The Timetable For Processing Legislation, Of The Joint Rules Of The House Of Representatives And The Senate For The 2008-2012 Term Of The Mississippi Legislature To Require A 72-hour Waiting Period Before Certain Votes On Passage Of An Appropriation Or Revenue Bill May Be Taken.

1925.title: Cotillion Federated Club; commend and congratulate on the occasion of its 55th anniversary.
1925.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Cotillion Federated Club Upon The Special Occasion And Celebration Of Its 55th Anniversary.

1926.title: State appointments, certain; urge to reflect more of the demographics and diversity of the state.
1926.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging That State Appointments For Agency Directors, Commissioners And Boards Be More Reflective Of The Demographics And Diversity Of The State Of Mississippi.

1927.title: Amend Constitution; suffrage restored automatically for first felony conviction upon completion of sentence.
1927.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That If A Person Is Convicted For The First Time Of A Crime That Disqualifies Him As A Qualified Elector, This Right To Vote Shall Be Restored Automatically Upon Completion Of The Sentence Imposed For The Crime.

1928.title: Mississippi Lions' All-State Band; commend and congratulate on the occasion of its 60th year anniversary.
1928.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Outstanding Musicianship Of The Prestigious And Prolific Mississippi Lions' All-state Band And Congratulating The Band And Its Members On The Occasion Of Its 60th Year Anniversary Of Astounding Musical Excellence And Showmanship.

1929.title: U.S. Congress; urge not to support legislation removing or restricting the use of private-ballot elections in union formations.
1929.description: A Concurrent Resolution To The United States Congress Expressing The Opposition Of Mississippians To The Deprivation Of Their Right To Choose By Secret Ballot Whether To Support Or Oppose Union Representation.

1930.title: Constitution; amend Section 41 to revise the qualifying age to serve in the House of Representatives to 18.

1991.title: Special Olympics Mississippi Team; commend outstanding achievements of.

1992.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of HB 1346; reenact provisions and include federal conforming language.
1992.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill No. 1346, Regular Session Of 2010, Entitled "an Act To Reenact Sections 37-153-1 Through 37-153-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Mississippi Comprehensive Workforce Training And Education Consolidation Act Of 2004; To Reenact Sections 71-5-5, 71-5-11 And 71-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Employment Security Law; To Amend Section 71-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "base Period"; To Amend Reenacted Sections 71-5-5 And 71-5-112, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Reenact Sections 71-5-101 And 71-5-107 Through 71-5-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Transfer The Powers And Responsibilities Of The Mississippi Employment Security Commission To The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security In The Office Of The Governor And Prescribe The Department's Powers And Duties; To Reenact Section 71-5-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Mississippi State Employment Service Within The Department Of Employment Security; To Reenact Sections 71-5-357 And 71-5-359, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribe Regulations Governing Nonprofit Organizations, State Agencies And Political Subdivisions Under The Employment Security Law; To Reenact Sections 71-5-451 And 71-5-457, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Unemployment Compensation Fund And The Unemployment Trust Fund; To Reenact Section 71-5-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Formula For Determining An Individual's Weekly Benefit Amount Under The State Unemployment Compensation Laws; To Amend Reenacted Section 71-5-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer; To Reenact Sections 71-5-511, 71-5-513, 71-5-517, 71-5-519, 71-5-523, 71-5-525, 71-5-529, 71-5-531 And 71-5-541, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Payment Of Unemployment Compensation Benefits; To Amend Section 71-5-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Individual, Who Is Otherwise Eligible To Receive Benefits, Shall Be Deemed Ineligible To Receive Benefits Solely Because Such Individual Seeks, Applies For Or Accepts Only Part-time Work, Where The Individual Is Available For A Number Of Hours Per Week That Are Comparable To The Individual's Part-time Work Experience In The Base Period; To Amend Section 71-5-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define "good Cause"; To Further Amend Section 71-5-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Person Who Is Otherwise Eligible To Receive Benefits Under The Provisions Of This Chapter Shall Be Denied Benefits Solely Because Such Individual Leaves Employment For "good Cause" As Provided By This Act; To Amend Section 71-5-517, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department To Obtain From The Employer Any Wage Information Needed For The Last Completed Calendar Quarter, If Such Information Has Not Been Reported Or Is Otherwise Unavailable At The Time Of Initial Application When The Last Four Completed Calendar Quarters Are Used; To Reenact Section 73-30-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Excludes Certain Professionals From Regulation Under The Laws Governing Licensed Professional Counselors; To Reenact Section 43-1-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Mississippi Tanf Implementation Council And Prescribes Its Powers And Duties; To Reenact Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Governs The Determination Of The Amount Of Tanf Benefits That May Be Granted To Eligible Persons; To Amend Reenacted Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On That Statute From July 1, 2011, To July 1, 2013; To Reenact Section 43-19-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Child Support Unit Established By The Department Of Human Services To Establish A State Parent Locator Service; To Reenact And Amend Section 43-19-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Employers To Submit Certain Information Relating To Newly Hired Employees To The Directory Of New Hires Within The Department Of Human Services; To Reenact Sections 57-62-5, 57-62-9, 57-75-5 And 57-80-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act, The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act And The Growth And Prosperity Act, Respectively; To Reenact And Amend Section 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes Certain Duties Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service Relating To The Dissemination Of Information To The Agricultural Community; To Reenact Section 7-1-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Make An Annual Report To The Legislature On Workforce Investment Activities; To Amend Section 60, Chapter 572, Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Section 58, Chapter 30, Laws Of The First Extraordinary Session Of 2008, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Those Statutes Reenacted By This Act From July 1, 2010, To July 1, 2013; To Bring Forward Section 71-5-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides The Weekly Compensation For Unemployment; And For Related Purposes."

1999.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; state agencies; delete repealer on Dept. of Employment Security and related laws of other agencies.
1999.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Reenact Sections 37-153-1 Through 37-153-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Mississippi Comprehensive Workforce Training And Education Consolidation Act Of 2004; To Reenact Sections 71-5-5, 71-5-11 And 71-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Employment Security Law; To Reenact Sections 71-5-101 And 71-5-107 Through 71-5-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Transfer The Powers And Responsibilities Of The Mississippi Employment Security Commission To The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security In The Office Of The Governor And Prescribe The Department's Powers And Duties; To Reenact Section 71-5-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Mississippi State Employment Service Within The Department Of Employment Security; To Reenact Sections 71-5-357 And 71-5-359, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribe Regulations Governing Nonprofit Organizations, State Agencies And Political Subdivisions Under The Employment Security Law; To Reenact Sections 71-5-451 And 71-5-457, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Unemployment Compensation Fund And The Unemployment Trust Fund; To Reenact Sections 71-5-511, 71-5-513, 71-5-517, 71-5-519, 71-5-523, 71-5-525, 71-5-529, 71-5-531 And 71-5-541, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Payment Of Unemployment Compensation Benefits; To Reenact Section 73-30-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Excludes Certain Professionals From Regulation Under The Laws Governing Licensed Professional Counselors; To Reenact Section 43-1-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Mississippi Tanf Implementation Council And Prescribes Its Powers And Duties; To Reenact Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Governs The Determination Of The Amount Of Tanf Benefits That May Be Granted To Eligible Persons; To Reenact Section 43-19-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Child Support Unit Established By The Department Of Human Services To Establish A State Parent Locator Service; To Reenact Section 43-19-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Employers To Submit Certain Information Relating To Newly Hired Employees To The Directory Of New Hires Within The Department Of Human Services; To Reenact Sections 57-62-5, 57-62-9, 57-75-5 And 57-80-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act, The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act And The Growth And Prosperity Act, Respectively; To Reenact Section 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes Certain Duties Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service Relating To The Dissemination Of Information To The Agricultural Community; To Reenact Section 7-1-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Make An Annual Report To The Legislature On Workforce Investment Activities; To Amend Reenacted Sections 37-153-3, 71-5-5, 71-5-112, 71-5-359, 71-5-511 And 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Inform The Code Publisher Of Certain Nonsubstantive Language That Should Be Revised; To Repeal Section 60, Chapter 572, Laws Of 2004, Which Establishes A Repeal Date On Those Statutes That Establish And Prescribe The Membership Of The Mississippi Workforce Investment Board And Transfers The Mississippi Employment Security Commission To The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security; To Amend Section 71-5-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Provision Of Law That Provides The Weekly Benefit Amount For An Individual Who Is Receiving Unemployment Compensation; And For Related Purposes."

2000.title: Mrs. Vashti Underwood Muse; commend on meritorious and dedicated service to education in the Magnolia State.
2000.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mrs. Vashti Underwood Muse On Her Meritorious And Dedicated Service To Education In The Magnolia State.

2002.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Employment Security Commission; bring forward sections relating to for purposes of amendment.
2002.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Bring Forward Sections 37-153-1 Through 37-153-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Mississippi Comprehensive Workforce Training And Education Consolidation Act Of 2004 For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-5, 71-5-11 And 71-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Employment Security Law For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-5, 71-5-112, 43-19-46 And 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-101 And 71-5-107 Through 71-5-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Transfer The Powers And Responsibilities Of The Mississippi Employment Security Commission To The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security In The Office Of The Governor And Prescribe The Department's Powers And Duties For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 71-5-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Mississippi State Employment Service Within The Department Of Employment Security For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-357 And 71-5-359, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribe Regulations Governing Nonprofit Organizations, State Agencies And Political Subdivisions Under The Employment Security Law For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-451 And 71-5-457, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Unemployment Compensation Fund And The Unemployment Trust Fund; To Bring Forward Section 71-5-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Formula For Determining An Individual's Weekly Benefit Amount Under The State Unemployment Compensation Laws; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-503, 71-5-511, 71-5-513, 71-5-517, 71-5-519, 71-5-523, 71-5-525, 71-5-529, 71-5-531 And 71-5-541, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Payment Of Unemployment Compensation Benefits For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 73-30-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Excludes Certain Professionals From Regulation Under The Laws Governing Licensed Professional Counselors For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 43-1-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Mississippi Tanf Implementation Council And Prescribes Its Powers And Duties For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Governs The Determination Of The Amount Of Tanf Benefits That May Be Granted To Eligible Persons For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 43-17-5 And 43-19-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Child Support Unit Established By The Department Of Human Services To Establish A State Parent Locator Service For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 43-19-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Employers To Submit Certain Information Relating To Newly Hired Employees To The Directory Of New Hires Within The Department Of Human Services For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 57-62-5, 57-62-9, 57-75-5 And 57-80-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act, The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act And The Growth And Prosperity Act, Respectively For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes Certain Duties Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service Relating To The Dissemination Of Information To The Agricultural Community For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 7-1-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Make An Annual Report To The Legislature On Workforce Investment Activities For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 60, Chapter 572, Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Section 58, Chapter 30, Laws Of The First Extraordinary Session Of 2008, Which Provide The Date Of The Repealer On Those Statutes For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes."

2003.title: Legislature; extend session, set return date, suspend deadlines for certain bills, and change deadlines for general bill conf. rpts.
2003.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Extend The 2010 Regular Session Of The Legislature For A Period Of Thirty Days From The Final Day Of The Ninety-day Session; To Authorize The House And Senate To Adjourn For More Than Three Days; To Provide That The House And Senate Shall Reconvene On April 20, 2010; To Suspend The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration, Filing And Adoption Of Conference Reports On Appropriation Bills And On House Bill No. 1059; To Amend Joint Rule 40 For The 2010 Regular Session Only To Change The Deadlines Applicable To General Bills And Constitutional Amendments For Concurring In Amendments From The Other House, Filing Conference Reports, First Consideration Of Conference Reports, Filing Conference Reports That Were Recommitted For Further Conference, Adoption Of Conference Reports After Recommittal, And Disposing Of Motions To Reconsider Conference Reports; And For Related Purposes.

2004.title: Legislature; extend session, set return date, suspend deadlines for certain bills, change deadlines for general bill conf. rpts.
2004.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Extend The 2010 Regular Session Of The Legislature For A Period Of Thirty Days From The Final Day Of The Ninety-day Session; To Authorize The House And Senate To Adjourn For More Than Three Days; To Provide That The House And Senate Shall Reconvene On April 20, 2010; To Suspend The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration, Filing And Adoption Of Conference Reports On Appropriation Bills And On House Bill No. 1059; To Amend Joint Rule 40 For The 2010 Regular Session Only To Change The Deadlines Applicable To General Bills And Constitutional Amendments For Concurring In Amendments From The Other House, Filing Conference Reports, First Consideration Of Conference Reports, Filing Conference Reports That Were Recommitted For Further Conference, Adoption Of Conference Reports After Recommittal, And Disposing Of Motions To Reconsider Conference Reports; To Provide That It Is The Intention Of The Legislature To Pass A Balanced Budget Within The Time Period Provided For By This Resolution; And For Related Purposes.

2005.title: Brain Injury Awareness Day; designate March 25, 2010, as day of observance in the State of Mississippi.
2005.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing March 25, 2010, As Brain Injury Awareness Day In Mississippi.

To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-5, 71-5-11 And 71-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Employment Security Law For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-5, 71-5-112, 43-19-46 And 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-451 And 71-5-457, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Unemployment Compensation Fund And The Unemployment Trust Fund; To Bring Forward Section 71-5-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Formula For Determining An Individual's Weekly Benefit Amount Under The State Unemployment Compensation Laws; To Bring Forward Sections 71-5-503, 71-5-511, 71-5-513, 71-5-517, 71-5-519, 71-5-523, 71-5-525, 71-5-529, 71-5-531 And 71-5-541, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Payment Of Unemployment Compensation Benefits For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 73-30-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Excludes Certain Professionals From Regulation Under The Laws Governing Licensed Professional Counselors For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 43-1-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Mississippi Tanf Implementation Council And Prescribes Its Powers And Duties For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Governs The Determination Of The Amount Of Tanf Benefits That May Be Granted To Eligible Persons For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 43-17-5 And 43-19-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Child Support Unit Established By The Department Of Human Services To Establish A State Parent Locator Service For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 43-19-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Employers To Submit Certain Information Relating To Newly Hired Employees To The Directory Of New Hires Within The Department Of Human Services For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 57-62-5, 57-62-9, 57-75-5 And 57-80-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act, The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act And The Growth And Prosperity Act, Respectively For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 69-2-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes Certain Duties Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service Relating To The Dissemination Of Information To The Agricultural Community For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 7-1-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Make An Annual Report To The Legislature On Workforce Investment Activities For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 60, Chapter 572, Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Section 58, Chapter 30, Laws Of The First Extraordinary Session Of 2008, Which Provide The Date Of The Repealer On Those Statutes For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes."

2007.title: Jim Weatherly; commend career accomplishments upon Pontotoc's celebration of "Jim Weatherly Day" on August 7, 2010.
2007.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending James Dexter "jim" Weatherly For His Athletic Accomplishments And Distinguished Entertainment Career Upon The Celebration Of "jim Weatherly Day" On August 7, 2010, During The City Of Pontotoc's 2010 Bodock Festival.

2008.title: Jarvis Varnado; commend athletic success and congratulate on NCAA record-breaking season.
2008.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi State University Senior Forward Jarvis Varnado For Breaking Ncaa Career Records And For An Exceptional 2009-2010 Season.

2009.title: Isaiah Canaan; commend athletic success and congratulate upon a remarkable season with Murray State University Racers Basketball Team.
2009.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Isaiah Canaan Upon His Athletic Accomplishments With The Murray State University Racers Basketball Team And Being Named Recipient Of The 2009-2010 Ohio Valley Conference Championship Most Valuable Player Award.

2010.title: Damion Fletcher; commend athletic success and congratulate on career accomplishments.
2010.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Damion Fletcher For His Athletic Success And Career Accomplishments With The University Of Southern Mississippi Golden Eagles Football Team.

2011.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Medicaid; transfer sum from Health Care Trust Fund to division to reduce FY10 deficit.
2011.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 43-13-407, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer A Certain Sum From The Health Care Trust Fund To The Division Of Medicaid For The Purpose Of Reducing The Deficit In The Budget Of The Division During Fiscal Year 2010; And For Related Purposes."

2012.title: The 761st Tank Battalion "Black Panthers"; commend for heroic efforts during World War II.
2012.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The 761st Tank Battalion, Known To Many As The "black Panthers," For Its Heroic Efforts During World War Ii, And Thanking Them For Their Strength And Passion In Battle.

2013.title: Gibbs-Green memorial observance; 40th year anniversary; commemorate.
2013.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The 40th Year Anniversary Of The Gibbs-green Memorial Observance, Commemorating The Lives And Legacies Of Phillip Gibbs And James Green.

2014.title: Dr. Wood Hiatt; commend life, legacy and stellar community service upon his passing.
2014.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Wood Coleman Hiatt And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

2016.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; expunction, certain criminal offenses; provide for filing fee.
2016.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Provide For A Fee For Filing Petitions To Expunge Certain Felony Convictions; To Provide That The Funds Derived From The Fee Shall Be Deposited Into The Special Funds Created In The State Treasury In This Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury Which Shall Be Administered By The Administrative Office Of Courts For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Operation Of The Judicial System In The State; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury And Provide That Monies In The Special Fund Shall Be Used For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Operation Of The Offices Of District Attorneys In The State; To Bring Forward Section 9-1-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Certain Funds For Defraying Office Operating Expenses Of Circuit Judges And Chancellors, For The Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-31-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Certain Funds For Defraying Office Operating Expenses Of District Attorneys, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes."

2017.title: Evan Littleton Turnage; commend for his outstanding and exemplary academic achievements and extend best wishes.
2017.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Evan Littleton Turnage For His Many Outstanding And Exemplary Academic And Social Achievements And Extending Best Wishes For His Continued Success.

2019.title: Reverend Donald E. Wildmon; commend prolific service provided to the American Family Association and upon his retirement.
2019.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Prolific Service Of Reverend Donald E. Wildmon As Founder And Chairman Emeritus Of The American Family Association And American Family Radio, Acknowledging The Great Strides Made By The Organization To Promote Family Decency And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

2020.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of SB 2938; emergency 911 law; include certain fees.
2020.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of Senate Bill 2938, Regular Session Of 2010, Entitled "an Act To Reenact Sections 19-5-303, 19-5-313, 19-5-319, 19-5-331 Through 19-5-341, 19-5-359 And 19-5-361, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Emergency 911 Telecommunications Services And Provide For The Collection Of Service Charges; To Amend Reenacted Section 19-5-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Of Certain Terms As They Relate To The Emergency 911 Telecommunications Law; To Amend Reenacted Section 19-5-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Collection Of A Fee For Voice Over Internet Protocol (voip); To Amend Reenacted Section 19-5-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Commercial Mobile Radio Service (cmrs) Board; To Amend Reenacted Section 19-5-361, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Voip Service Suppliers In The Provision That Provides Liability Limitations To Other Emergency Service Suppliers; To Amend Section 19-5-371, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Reenacted Sections; To Create A New Section To Provide For The Collection And Remittance Of Prepaid Wireless E911 Charges, And To Provide Liability Protections To Providers And Sellers Of Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications Services; To Require Certain Emergency Telecommunicators To Receive Certain Continuing Education Courses; And For Related Purposes."

2021.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of HB 452; municipal annexation; require additional services to annexed area within 30 days.
2021.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 452, Regular Session Of 2010, Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 21-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When A Municipality Desires To Annex Territory The Ordinance Must Provide Specific Benefits And Services That Must Be Provided To The Territory Within 30 Days Of The Court's Ordering An Annexation Decree; To Provide Certain Restrictions For Ranges Within The Proposed Annexed Territory; To Amend Section 21-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If Such Benefits And Services Are Not Provided Within 30 Days To An Annexed Territory, Then The Annexation Shall Be Ordered Null And Void; To Require A Municipality To Wait Five Years Before Pursuing Annexation Proceedings Again On The Territory; To Amend Sections 21-33-1 And 27-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Municipality That Has Had An Annexation Ordered Null And Void From Assessing Property Within The Formerly Annexed Area For Tax Purposes; To Amend Section 27-51-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Municipal Tax Collector From Collecting Ad Valorem Taxes On Motor Vehicles Located In Annexed Territory That Has Had The Annexation Ordered Null And Void; To Amend Section 27-51-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Counties May Not Collect Motor Vehicle And Ad Valorem Taxes For Municipalities In Annexed Territory That Has Had The Annexation Ordered Null And Void; To Amend Section 27-39-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Municipalities May Not Levy Ad Valorem Taxes On Property Located Within Annexed Territory That Has Had The Annexation Ordered Null And Void; And For Related Purposes."

2022.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; castle doctrine; revise.
2022.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 97-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Castle Doctrine Applies In Both Criminal And Civil Cases; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: William K. and Barbara Dease; commend and congratulate on the occasion of their 50th wedding anniversary.
2023.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating William And Barbara Dease On The Celebration Of Their Fiftieth Wedding Anniversary.

2024.title: Kossuth High School Aggies; commend on winning Class 3A Cross Country State Championship.
2024.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Kossuth High School Aggies Boys Cross Country Team And Head Coach Chris Butler For Winning The Mhsaa 2009 Class 3a State Championship.

2025.title: Grand Gulf Nuclear Station; commend for 25 years of clean, reliable and affordable energy to Mississippi.
2025.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Entergy Corporation And The Employees And Management Of Grand Gulf Nuclear Station For 25 Years Of Commitment To Providing Clean, Reliable And Affordable Energy To Mississippi.

2026.title: 1984 Rust College Lady Bearcats Basketball Team; commend upon being inducted into the inaugural Rust College Athletic Hall of Fame.
2026.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The 1984 Rust College Lady Bearcats Basketball Team Upon Being Inducted Into The Inaugural Rust College Athletic Hall Of Fame.

2027.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; prohibit use of federal funds to pay for elective abortions in Mississippi.
2027.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act Entitled The "federal Abortion-mandate Opt-out Act"; To Prohibit The Use Of Federal Funds To Pay For Elective Abortions Covered By Private Insurance In The State Of Mississippi Through A Health Care Exchange; And For Related Purposes."

2029.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration of HB1744; authorize City of McComb to impose a tourism tax.
2029.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 1744, Regular Session Of 2010, Entitled "an Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Impose A Tourism Tax Within The City, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism And Economic Development; And For Related Purposes."

2030.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; authorize DFA to sell, convey or lease property known as the "Old School for the Blind."
2030.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Sell And Convey Or Lease Certain State-owned Real Property Formerly Known As The "old School For The Blind," Located In Jackson, Mississippi; To Require Monies Derived From The Sale Or Lease Of That Property To Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Being Disbursed To The State Board Of Education; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Negotiate An Agreement Requiring The Developer To Construct A New Superintendent Residence And Building Maintenance Facility; To Provide That The State Shall Retain The Right To Repurchase The Real Property Or Terminate The Lease If Certain Conditions Occur; To Provide That The State Shall Retain All Mineral Rights To The Real Property Sold Or Leased Under This Act; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Review And Consider All Proposals For The Purchase Or Lease Of The Property Using Certain Reviewing Factors; To Allow The Department Of Finance And Administration To Correct Any Discrepancies In The Legal Description To The Property; To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property Located In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, In Connection With The Proposed Sale Or Lease Of The "old School For The Blind Property"; To Amend Sections 27-33-17 And 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Repeal Sections 1, 2 And 3, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2007, Which Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Lease The Old School For The Blind Property; And For Related Purposes."

2032.title: Jurors; may receive supplemental pay from parties to a civil suit.
2032.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Jurors May Receive Supplemental Pay From Voluntary Contributions Made By Parties To A Civil Suit; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: Trade names; create the Fictitious Business Name Registration Act.
2034.description: An Act To Create The Fictitious Business Name Registration Act; To Create New Section 25-93-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 25-93-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Centralized Statewide System For Voluntary Registration Of Fictitious Business Names In Order To Provide The Public With The Actual Identities Of Persons Or Entities Doing Business In This State; To Create New Section 25-93-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 25-93-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Registration; To Create New Section 25-93-9 Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Amendments To Registrations; To Create New Section 25-93-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For The Term And Renewal Of Registrations; To Create New Section 25-93-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Registration Under The Act Does Not Confer Exclusivity Or Preservation Of Use Of A Name; To Create New Section 25-93-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Withdrawal Or Cancellation Of Registration; To Create New Section 25-93-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For Registration, Amendments To Registrations, The Term And Renewal Of Registrations, And Withdrawal Or Cancellation Of Registration; To Create New Section 25-93-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Change Of Ownership; To Create New Section 25-93-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees Under The Act; To Create New Section 25-93-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Restrict The Use Of The Designation Of Certain Business Forms; To Create New Section 25-93-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Limitations On The Adoption Of Certain Fictitious Business Names; To Create New Section 25-93-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Public Access To Records Created Under The Act; To Create New Section 25-93-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Powers Of The Secretary Of State Under The Act; To Create New Section 25-93-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Penalties For Fraudulent Filings; And For Related Purposes.

2035.title: Letters rogatory; authorize.
2035.description: An Act To Provide For Depositions In Foreign Jurisdictions For Use In Mississippi Proceedings And For Depositions In Mississippi For Use In Foreign Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: State agencies; require to accept payment by personal check upon certain conditions.
2036.description: An Act To Require All State Agencies, Departments, Boards Or Commissions To Accept Personal Checks For Payment Of Any License, Permit, Fee Or Any Obligation Owing To The Agency Or Trust Deposit; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Radar; repeal requirements and restrictions.
2037.description: An Act To Repeal Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Specifies Certain Requirements For And Restrictions Upon The Purchase And Use Of Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon Any Public Street, Road Or Highway Of This State; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: One minute of quiet reflection at the beginning of each school day; require local school boards to provide for.
2038.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School Boards To Provide For The Observance Of One Minute Of Quiet Reflection At The Beginning Of Each School Day; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tags; authorize for supporters of various organizations.
2039.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Mississippi Dental Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Camp Bratton-green; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of St. Martin High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Little Light House Of Central Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Public Schools Located In The Town Of Sumrall, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of West Jones High School, South Jones High School, Northeast Jones High School And Laurel High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Velma Jackson High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The Wayne County Athletic Foundation; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Amory High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Lake Cormorant High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The African-american Heritage Rodeo Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mississippi College School Of Law; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Aberdeen Main Street Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Lewisburg High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Center Hill High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Southaven High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Desoto Central High School Band Boosters; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Horn Lake High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Hernando High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Gulfport School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Running In The State Of Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury Into Which Certain Fees Paid For The Issuance Of The License Tags Shall Be Deposited For Expenditure By The Mississippi Athletic Commission; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Biloxi Public School District; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of D'iberville Elementary School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mount Olive Attendance Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Little League Baseball And Softball; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Saint Richard Catholic School In Jackson, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Boys Baseball Association; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Olive Branch High School; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Trail Of Honor; To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Recipients Of The Meritorious Service Medal; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Authorized By This Act; To Provide For The Disposition Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Amend Section 27-19-56.15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags That Display The Emblems Of Universities Located In Other States, To Revise The Distribution Of Fees Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of The University Of Alabama; To Provide That The Fee Collected From Such Distinctive License Tags Shall Be Distributed To Friends Of Children's Hospital; To Provide That Fees Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags Displaying The Emblem Of The University Of South Alabama Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Trauma Care Systems Fund; To Extend The Period Of Time During Which The Provisions Of Section 27-19-44 Must Be Satisfied For Such University License Tags; To Amend Section 27-19-56.94, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Distribution Of Certain Monies Collected From The Issuance Of Distinctive License Tags In Appreciation Of Blues Music To The Mississippi Blues Foundation; To Amend Section 27-19-56.190, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Additional Fee That Is Distributed To The Mississippi Athletic Commission From The Purchase Of The Distinctive License Tag In Support Of Boxing May Be Used By The Commission For Its Official Use; To Amend Section 27-19-56.20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Members Of Civitan International; To Amend Section 27-19-56.97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The American Cancer Society; To Amend Section 27-19-56.141, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Mississippi Sids Alliance; To Amend Section 27-19-56.161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Clinton Community Nature Center; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-19-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires All Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Authorized And/or Renewed After July 1, 2010, To Have A County Designation Referencing The Name Of The County In Which The Vehicle Is Registered; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: School district consolidation; authorize State Board of Education to mandate where schools have failed for two consecutive years.
2040.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-17-6 And 37-17-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When Any School In A School District Meets The Definition Of A Failing School For Two Consecutive Years, The State Board Of Education Shall Abolish The School District, Appoint A Conservator To Administer The Schools Formerly In The District And Assign The Territory Formerly In The Abolished District To One Or More Contiguous School Districts; To Provide That The Local School Board Of The Receiving District Shall Consent To The Receipt Of The Territory Of The Abolished District; To Provide For The Transfer Of Real And Personal Property Of The Abolished District, New Teacher Contracts, Appointment Of Administrators, Adoption Of School Budgets And Final Approval Of The Mandatory Consolidation By The State Board Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: Cemeteries; authorize reasonable ingress and egress under certain circumstances when located on private property.
2041.description: An Act To Grant Certain Persons The Authority Of Reasonable Ingress And Egress To Cemeteries Located On Private Property Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: English rule; allow prevailing party to recover attorney's fees.
2042.description: An Act To Provide For Award Of Attorney's Fees To The Prevailing Party In A Legal Action; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: Domestic violence; hospitals required to report suspected.
2043.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Providers To Report Suspected Domestic Abuse; To Grant Immunity For Such Reporting; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Controlled substances; enhance penalty for illegal sale in proximity to drug rehab facility.
2044.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Enhancement Of Penalties For The Sale Of Drugs Within 1500 Feet Of A Drug Or Alcohol Treatment Or Rehabilitation Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Drug and alcohol testing in the workplace; provide certain standards.
2045.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Standards For Drug And Alcohol Testing In The Workplace; And For Related Purposes.

2046.title: Bullying or harassing behavior in the schools; prohibit.
2046.description: An Act To Prohibit Bullying Or Harassing Behavior In The Public Schools; To Define Bullying Or Harassing Behavior; To Define Hostile Environment And To Require All Local School Districts To Adopt A Policy Prohibiting Bullying And Harassing Behavior As Required By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: General Fund estimate; limit to 7-year average and deposit any excess into Working Cash-Stabilization Fund.
2047.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-103-211 And 27-103-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Fund Revenue Estimate Shall Not Exceed The Average Annual General Fund Revenue Received Over The Immediately Preceding Seven Years And To Provide That Any Amount Received In Excess Of The General Fund Revenue Estimate Shall Be Deposited Into The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Legislature; reduce size beginning with 2011 statewide general election.
2048.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2011 Statewide General Election The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Consist Of 90 Members; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2011 Statewide General Election The Mississippi Senate Shall Consist Of 40 Members; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: Child support; delete repealer on statutes.
2049.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-19-34 And 93-11-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealer Provisions On The Child Support Law; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: Concealed weapons; remove prohibition against carrying in a public park.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Prohibition Against Carrying A Concealed Weapon Into A Public Park By A Person Holding A Concealed Weapon Permit; To Amend Section 45-9-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: Concealed weapon; remove prohibition against carrying in a church.
2051.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Prohibition Against Carrying A Concealed Weapon In A Church Or Place Of Worship; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize a tax free tag for World War II Veterans.
2052.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-54, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Residents Of This State Who Are Veterans Of World War Ii; To Authorize The Surviving Spouse Of A Deceased Person Who Was Issued Such A License Tag To Apply For Or Retain Such License Tag For As Long As The Spouse Remains Unmarried; To Exempt Vehicles Owned By Veterans Of World War Ii From All Motor Vehicle Registration Fees And Privilege Taxes; To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Motor Vehicles Owned By Veterans Of World War Ii From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

2054.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 30 years of creditable service.
2054.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Who Have At Least 30 Years Of Creditable Service In The Public Employees' Retirement System, Who Were Employed As Public Schoolteachers At The Time Of Their Retirement And Who Have Been Retired And Receiving A Retirement Allowance For At Least One Year, May Be Employed As Teachers By A Public School District After Their Retirement And Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary If They Are Employed In A Public School District Located In A Geographic Area Of The State Designated As A Critical Teacher Shortage Area By The State Board Of Education; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105, 25-11-123 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Pseudoephedrine; list as Schedule IV controlled substance.
2055.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Ephedrine And Pseudoephedrine As A Schedule Iv Controlled Substance; To Amend Section 41-29-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 41-29-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Restricts The Over-the-counter Purchase And Sale Of Ephedrine And Pseudoephedrine; To Amend Section 41-29-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: Real estate transactions; require disclosure if meth production occurred on the property.
2056.description: An Act To Require A Seller Or Transferor Of Real Property To Disclose In Writing If, To His Knowledge, Methamphetamine Production Has Occurred On Habitable Property; To Declare Legislative Findings And Purpose Of The Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Establish A Decontamination Standard For Methamphetamine Inside Habitable Property Unless A Different Standard Is Adopted By The Department Of Environmental Quality; To Authorize The Department Of Environmental Quality To Establish By Rule The Minimum Standards For Training And Certification Of Contractors Who Perform Remediation Of The Property; To Require State And Local Law Enforcement Agencies To Report To The Department Of Environmental Quality Whenever Habitable Property Has Been Contaminated By Its Use As A Clandestine Methamphetamine Drug Lab; To Require The Department Of Environmental Quality To Maintain A List Of Habitable Properties That Have Been Reported As Contaminated; To Amend Section 89-1-527, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2057.title: First lien; hospitals have against damages.
2057.description: An Act To Provide That A Hospital Shall Have A Lien Against Wrongful Death Damages And Personal Injury Damages Recovered By Patients; And For Related Purposes.

2058.title: Workforce Enhancement Training Fund; provide for unemployment tax rates following suspension of the fund.
2058.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-5-353 And 71-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security To Modify Unemployment Insurance Rates For Continuation Of The Workforce Enhancement Training Fund Program Following December 31, 2009; To Provide For Indices Applicable To Unemployment Insurance Trust Fund Taxation And Provide For The Rate Of Contributions For Workforce Enhancement Training Fund Contributions; To Provide Conditions For The Suspension Of The Workforce Enhancement Training Fund Contributions In Years Subsequent To 2009, And To Provide Certain Definitions; To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "cost Rate Criterion" And "size Of Fund Index" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Employment Security Law; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Sidearm; allow to be retained by estate of certain officers killed in line of duty.
2059.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-3-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Estate Of An Officer Of The Highway Patrol Or Bureau Of Narcotics Killed In The Line Of Duty To Retain The Firearm Of Such Officer Or Agent; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: Bonds; create and fund the New Municipalities Infrastructure and Essential Services Fund.
