2391.description: An Act Entitled The "hospital Infections Disclosure Act Of 2010"; To Provide Definitions; To Empower And Direct The State Department Of Health To Require Acute Care Hospitals And Ambulatory Surgical Facilities To Collect And Provide Statistical Quarterly Reports On Hospital-acquired Infection Rates For Specific Clinical Procedures; To Provide For The Appointment Of An Advisory Committee To Assist The Department In Developing A Methodology For Said Reports; To Provide For Confidentiality; To Provide Civil Penalties For Noncompliance With Said Reporting Requirements; To Amend Sections 41-9-15, 41-75-11 And 41-9-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2392.title: Sales tax exemption; Ducks Unlimited fund-raising purchases.
2392.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Taxation Purchases Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services By Ducks Unlimited Chapters, Which Tangible Personal Property Or Services Are Resold As Part Of The Chapters' Fund-raising Activities; And For Related Purposes.

2393.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for the Mississippi Watershed Repair and Rehabilitation Cost-Share Program.
2393.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Watershed Repair And Rehabilitation Cost-share Program; To Amend Section 51-37-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2395.title: Mississippi Code; provide a set to the school board of each public school district.
2395.description: An Act To Amend Section 1-1-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The School Board Of Each Public School District Shall Be Provided A Set Of The Mississippi Code; And For Related Purposes.

2397.title: Tort reform; clarify legislative intent.
2397.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-46-11 And 15-1-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Substantive Nature Of The Notice Requirements For A Person Making A Claim Under The Tort Claims Act Or For A Person Pursuing A Medical Malpractice Claim; To Amend Section 15-1-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

2398.title: Visitation; require for noncustodial parents concurrent with order of child support.
2398.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Statute Of Limitations On Paternity Actions; To Amend Section 93-9-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Mothers Be Informed Of The Existence Of The Statute Of Limitations; To Amend Sections 93-11-103 And 93-11-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Human Services To Seek An Order Of Visitation For The Noncustodial Parent Concurrently With The Child Support Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

2399.title: Columbia Training School; authorize alternative uses by DHS.
2399.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Human Services To Make Alternative Uses Of Columbia Training School Properties And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2400.title: Interior designers; create registration act.
2400.description: An Act To Enact The Registered Interior Designer Registration Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide That The Registration Of Interior Designers Shall Be Under The Mississippi Board Of Architecture; To Provide For Qualifications Of Applicants; To Provide For Examination Of Applicants; To Provide Reciprocity With Other Jurisdictions; To Require Continuing Education; To Provide For The Biannual Renewal Of Certificates Of Registration; To Require Fees; To Provide For The Regulation Of Conduct Of Interior Designers; To Require The Posting Of Certificates Of Registration; To Provide For The Interior Design Advisory Committee And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Provide For The Deposit Of Funds; To Provide Compensation For Members Of The Interior Design Advisory Committee; To Provide For Disciplinary Procedures; To Provide For Appeals; To Provide Exemptions From The Provisions Of This Act; To Prohibit Certain Actions; To Address Interior Designers In Certain Corporate Or Other Professional Organizations; And For Related Purposes.

2401.title: Contractors; revise certificate of responsibility threshold for private contracts.
2401.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-3-1 And 31-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Threshold Amount For Private Contracts Requiring A Contractor To Hold A Certificate Of Responsibility; To Authorize The State Board Of Contractors To Impose Community Service In Addition To, Or In Lieu Of, Civil Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2402.title: Department of Human Services; revise restrictions regarding employees participating in political campaigns.
2402.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provision Of Law That Prohibits The Mississippi Department Of Human Services Personnel From Taking An Active Part In Election Campaigns; And For Related Purposes.

2403.title: Mississippi Persian Gulf War Memorial; authorize State Veterans Affairs Board to establish in Newton County.
2403.description: An Act To Authorize The State Veterans Affairs Board To Establish, Operate And Maintain A Mississippi Persian Gulf War Memorial In Newton County, Mississippi; To Authorize The State Veterans Affairs Board To Receive Federal Aid And Any Gifts, Contributions, Bequests And Reimbursements To Establish, Operate And Maintain Such Memorial; And For Related Purposes.

2405.title: State agencies; require to eliminate existing landline telephone upon issuance of cellular telephone to employee.
2405.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require State Agencies To Eliminate An Existing Landline Telephone Upon The Issuance Of A Cellular Telephone To An Officer Or Employee; And For Related Purposes.

2406.title: State Board of Contractors; may conduct meetings through teleconferencing/revise application procedure.
2406.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The State Board Of Contractors To Conduct Regular Meetings Through Teleconference And Video Means; To Amend Section 31-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 1555, 2010 Regular Session, To Revise The Application Procedure For A Certificate Of Responsibility Issued By The State Board Of Contractors; And For Related Purposes.

2408.title: Tourism; MDA shall promote the establishment of fishing tournaments on state-owned lakes.
2408.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Have The Duty To Promote The Establishment Of Fishing Tournaments On State-owned Lakes; And For Related Purposes.

2409.title: Mississippi Code; certain elected officials shall receive CD-ROM version of the code unless they request bound volumes.
2409.description: An Act To Amend Section 1-1-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Each Elected State Official, Elected State District Official And Member Of The Legislature Shall Receive An Official Cd-rom Version Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972 In Lieu Of Bound Volumes Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972 Unless The Official Or Member Of The Legislature Makes A Request In Writing To The Joint Committee On Compilation, Revision And Publication Of Legislation That He Receive Bound Volumes Of The Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Section 1-5-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Copies Of The General Laws And Journals Of Each Session Of The Legislature Shall Not Be Provided To Members Of The Legislature Or Attorneys Employed In The Legislative Services Offices Of The House And Senate Unless Specifically Requested By The Legislators Or Attorneys; To Provide That Copies Of The Local And Private Laws Shall Not Be Provided To Attorneys Employed In The Legislative Services Offices Of The House And Senate Unless Specifically Requested By The Attorneys In Writing; And For Related Purposes.

2410.title: Pregnant inmates; may not be restrained during childbirth.
2410.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Restraints To Control An Offender Who Is In Custody At The Time She Is Giving Birth In The Absence Of Certain Justifying Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2411.title: Distinctive license tag; for supporters of public schools in Sumrall, Mississippi.
2411.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Public Schools Located In The Town Of Sumrall, Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fees; And For Related Purposes.

2413.title: Homeowners insurance policies; adopt efficient proximate cause doctrine to require coverage for certain losses.
2413.description: An Act To Provide That, Whenever A Loss Under A Homeowners Insurance Policy Is Caused By A Combination Of A Covered Risk And An Excluded Risk, An Insurer Shall Be Liable If The Covered Risk Was The Efficient Proximate Cause Of The Loss; And For Related Purposes.

2414.title: Boating under the influence; conform to driving under the influence.
2414.description: An Act To Amend Sections 59-23-3, 59-23-5 And 59-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Standard For Intoxication Under The Alcohol Boating Safety Act To The Standard For Driving Under The Influence Under Traffic Laws And To Expand Potential Enforcement Of The Act To Include The Department Of Marine Resources; And For Related Purposes.

2415.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act; create under authority of Insurance Commissioner.
2415.description: An Act To Create The "unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act"; To Set Forth Standards For The Investigation And Disposition Of Claims Arising Under Policies Or Certificates Of Insurance; To Provide Definitions Of Unfair Claims Practices; To Provide Hearing Procedures; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2417.title: State agencies; delete repealer on Department of Employment Security and related laws of other agencies.
2417.description: An Act To Repeal Section 60, Chapter 572, Laws Of 2004, Which Establishes A Repeal Date On Those Statutes That Establish And Prescribe The Membership Of The Mississippi Workforce Investment Board And Transfers The Mississippi Employment Security Commission To The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security; And For Related Purposes.

2419.title: High school alternative career track programs and diplomas; provide conditions for schools to offer.
2419.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For High School Career Option Programs And Career Track Curricula For Students Not Wishing To Pursue A Baccalaureate Degree; To Authorize Dual Enrollment And Dual Credit For Students Pursuing A Career Track; To Provide Certain Conditions For Students To Enroll In Career Track Programs; To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity And To Provide Certain Standards For Dual Enrollment-dual Credit Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2420.title: High School alternative career track programs; provide conditions for schools to offer.
2420.description: An Act To Create New Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For High School Career Option Programs And Career Track Curricula For Students Not Wishing To Pursue A Baccalaureate Degree; To Authorize Dual Enrollment And Dual Credit For Students Pursuing A Career Track; To Provide Certain Conditions For Students To Enroll In Career Track Programs; To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act, To Require School Districts To Establish Dual Enrollment Programs, And To Provide Certain Standards For Dual Enrollment-dual Credit Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2421.title: Flexible office hours for certain state agencies; authorize.
2421.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-98, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Flexible Office Hours For Certain State Agencies And To Provide For Staff During Such Flexible Office Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2422.title: IHL Board of Trustees; may transfer to State Veterans Affairs Board certain real property in Newton County.
2422.description: An Act To Authorize The State Board Of Trustees For Institutions Of Higher Learning To Transfer And Convey To The State Veterans Affairs Board Certain Real Property Located In Newton County, Mississippi, For Use As An Addition To The Mississippi Veterans Memorial Cemetery; And For Related Purposes.

2423.title: Lauderdale County; authorize donation of real property to Northeast Volunteer Fire and Rescue, Inc.
2423.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County To Donate Certain Real Property To Northeast Volunteer Fire And Rescue, Inc; And For Related Purposes.

2424.title: Self-administration of prescription asthma/anaphylaxis medication by students; clarify policy.
2424.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-79-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Policy For The Possession And Self-administration Of Prescription Asthma And/or Anaphylaxis Medication By Public And Nonpublic School Students While On School Property Or At School Activities; To Require The State Department Of Education To Require All School Districts To Take Certain Actions Relating To Children With Asthma; And For Related Purposes.

2425.title: School employment procedures law; reduce probationary period for certified employees.
2425.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Probationary Period For Certified School District Employees Under The School Employment Procedures Law To One Year And To Eliminate The Probationary Period For Certified Employees Transferring From Another School District; And For Related Purposes.

2426.title: Auto insurance; deductible provisions shall not apply to windshield damage.
2426.description: An Act To Provide That The Deductible Provisions Of Certain Motor Vehicle Insurance Policies Shall Not Apply To Damages To The Windshield Of Motor Vehicles Covered Under Such Policies; And For Related Purposes.

2427.title: Elections; require additional payments to bilingual managers and clerks that are required by federal law.
2427.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-227, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Additional Compensation For Managers And Clerks Designated As Bilingual Managers And Clerks For The Purpose Of Fulfilling Requirements Under Federal Law To Provide Minority Language Assistance; And For Related Purposes.

2430.title: Wind Pool Reinsurance Assistance Fund; authorize additional year of insurance premium tax diverted to the fund.
2430.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-34-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Additional Year Whereby A Portion Of The Insurance Premium Tax Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association Reinsurance Assistance Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2432.title: School district sixteenth section principal fund; authorize local school boards to expend certain amount.
2432.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Boards To Expend Up To One Million Dollars Of The School District's Sixteenth Section Principal Fund For Lawful School Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2433.title: Master Teacher certificate salary supplement; teachers beginning the process after June 30, 2010, not eligible to receive.
2433.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certified School Employees Who Begin The Process For Acquiring A Master Teacher Certificate After June 30, 2010, Shall Not Be Eligible To Receive The Salary Supplement Authorized By Law; To Provide That Certified School District Employees Who Currently Hold Or Renew The Certificate Are Eligible To Continue Receiving The Supplement; And For Related Purposes.

2434.title: Mississippi Trust Code of 2010; enact.
2434.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Uniform Trust Code; To Create New Section 91-23-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 91-23-102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Scope Of The Act; To Create New Section 91-23-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 91-23-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Duties And Powers Of Trustee Relations Among Trustees And The Rights And Interests Of A Beneficiary Default To The Act In Absence Of Express Provision To The Contrary; To Create New Section 91-23-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Representation Of Another Person Under The Act; To Create New Section 91-23-304, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Representation By A Person Having A Nearly Identical Interest; To Create New Section 91-23-411, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Modification Or Termination Of A Noncharitable Irrevocable Trust By Consent; To Create New Section 91-23-414, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Modification Or Termination Of An Uneconomic Trust; To Create New Section 91-23-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Act In Good Faith; To Create New Section 91-23-802, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe A Trustee's Duty Of Loyalty; To Create New Section 91-23-803, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee's Impartiality; To Create New Section 91-23-804, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Prudent Administration Of The Part Of A Trustee; To Create New Section 91-23-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit A Trustee To Incur Only Reasonable Costs; To Create New Section 91-23-806, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Use Any Special Skills He May Possess; To Create New Section 91-23-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify In What Way A Trustee May Delegate Powers; To Create New Section 91-23-808, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide In What Way A Trustee May Be Directed; To Create New Section 91-23-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Protect Trust Property; To Create New Section 91-23-810, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Keep Records; To Create New Section 91-23-811, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Enforce And Defend Claims As Appropriate; To Create New Section 91-23-812, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Collect Trust Property; To Create New Section 91-23-813, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Trustee To Inform Beneficiaries As Appropriate; To Create New Section 91-23-814, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant Certain Discretionary Powers To Trustees; To Create New Section 91-23-815, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify A Trustee's General Powers; To Create New Section 91-23-816, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify A Trustee's Specific Powers; To Create New Section 91-23-817, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Distribution Upon Termination; To Create New Section 91-23-1001, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Remedies For Breach Of Trust; To Create New Section 91-23-1002, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Damages For Breach Of Trust; To Create New Section 91-23-1003, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Damages In Absence Of Breach; To Create New Section 91-23-1004, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Court To Award Attorney's Fees And Costs In Certain Circumstances; To Create New Section 91-23-1005, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Certain Limitations Of Action Against A Trustee; To Create New Section 91-23-1006, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Immunize A Trustee Acting In Reasonable Reliance On The Trust Document; To Create New Section 91-23-1007, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Immunize A Trustee Acting With Reasonable Care; To Create New Section 91-23-1008, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Exculpation Of A Trustee; To Create New Section 91-23-1009, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Immunize A Trustee Acting With The Consent Of A Beneficiary; To Create New Section 91-23-1010, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit A Trustee's Personal Liability; To Create New Section 91-23-1011, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Responsibility Of A Trustee Who Is Also A General Partner; To Create New Section 91-23-1012, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Protect Certain Persons Dealing With A Trustee; To Create New Section 91-23-1013, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Certification Of A Trust; To Create New Section 91-23-1101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Uniformity In Construction; To Create New Section 91-23-1102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Interface Between The Act And Electronic Signature Laws; To Create New Section 91-23-1106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Application Of The Act To Relationships Existing On The Effective Date Thereof; To Reserves Sections 91-23-104, 91-23-106, 91-23-107, 91-23-108, 91-23-109, 91-23-110, 91-23-111, 91-23-112, 91-23-302, 91-23-303, 91-23-305, 91-23-401, 91-23-402, 91-23-403, 91-23-404, 91-23-405, 91-23-406, 91-23-407, 91-23-408, 91-23-409, 91-23-410, 91-23-412, 91-23-413, 91-23-415, 91-23-416, 91-23-417, 91-23-1104 And 91-23-1105, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Reserve Articles 2, 5, 6, 7 And 9 Of Title 91, Chapter 23, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Repeal Sections 91-9-101, 91-9-103, 91-9-105, 91-9-107, 91-9-109, 91-9-111, 91-9-113, 91-9-115, 91-9-117 And 91-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Which Constitute Title 91, Chapter 9, Article 3, Uniform Trustee Powers; And For Related Purposes.

2436.title: Law enforcement officers; provide minimum due process rights for municipal.
2436.description: An Act Entitled The "law Enforcement Employment Procedures Act"; To Require Municipalities To Provide A Predisciplinary Hearing Prior To The Suspension Or Termination Of Any Law Enforcement Officer; To Establish A Minimum Level Of Written Due Process Procedures; To Specify What Notice Shall Be Provided To The Officer; To Provide That The Officer May Attend The Hearing, May Be Represented By Counsel, May Present Evidence On His Own Behalf And Question Witnesses; To Provide That The Evidentiary Phase Of The Hearing May Be Held In Executive Session; To Provide That Final Adjudication Shall Be Held In Open Meeting; To Exempt Municipalities That Have A Civil Service Commission Or Due Process Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2437.title: Medicaid; services by marriage and family therapists are reimbursable to same extent as for social workers.
2437.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Services Provided By Licensed Marriage And Family Therapists Shall Be Reimbursable To The Same Extent As For Those Services That Are Provided By Licensed Social Workers; And For Related Purposes.

2438.title: Sales tax; authorize a sales tax holiday for retail sales of hunting supplies.
2438.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition And Hunting Supplies During The Period Beginning At 12:01 A.m. On The Friday Prior To The First Monday In September And Ending At 12:00 Midnight The Following Sunday; And For Related Purposes.

2439.title: Wildlife; prohibit the hunting of deer with dogs in Homochitto National Forest.
2439.description: An Act To Prohibit The Hunting Of Deer With Dogs In The Homochitto National Forest; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2440.title: Investment advisor representatives; allow to transact business for more than one investment advisor.
2440.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-71-404, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow An Investment Adviser Representative To Transact Business For More Than One Investment Adviser Or Federal Covered Investment Adviser; And For Related Purposes.

2441.title: Municipally owned waterworks; prohibit from charging higher rates to certain customers in another municipality.
2441.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Certain Municipalities From Charging Greater Rates For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Outside Of And Within One Mile Of The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality Than For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Within The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2442.title: Rating Bureau; shall use Fire Suppression Rating Schedule (FSRS) published by ISO when rating municipalities or districts.
2442.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-3-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi State Rating Bureau To Utilize The Fire Suppression Rating Schedule (fsrs), Or Its Successor, Published By Insurance Services Office, Inc., When Rating A Municipality Or Fire District; And For Related Purposes.

2443.title: Court-appointed special advocates; clarify court's authority.
2443.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-21-121 And 9-5-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of The Youth And Chancery Courts To Appoint A Layperson Special Advocate And To Set Forth Minimum Qualifications For A Person To Serve In That Capacity; And For Related Purposes.

2444.title: Custody and visitation; clarify for parents on certain military duty.
2444.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Custody And Visitation Procedure Upon A Parent Being Assigned To Military Temporary Duty, Deployment Or Mobilization; And For Related Purposes.

2445.title: Model Business Corporation Act; correct certain fees.
2445.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-4-1.22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct A Typographical Error Omitting Certain Fees To Be Charged By The Secretary Of State Concerning Business Corporations; And For Related Purposes.

2446.title: Municipalities; authorize to contract with public housing authorities for extra police protection.
2446.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governing Authority Of Any Municipality To Enter Into Agreements And Contracts With Certain Housing Authorities To Provide Extra Police Protection In Exchange For Compensation Or A Fee; And For Related Purposes.

2447.title: Qualified Disposition Act; create to provide for self-settled spendthrift funds.
2447.description: An Act To Be Known And Cited As The Mississippi Qualified Disposition Act; To Create New Section 91-9-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 91-9-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Definitions; To Create New Section 91-9-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Contents Of A Qualified Affidavit; To Create New Section 91-9-707, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Claims And Actions Against Property Subject To Qualified Disposition; To Create New Section 91-9-709, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Transferor's Powers And Rights; To Create New Section 91-9-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide When And Under What Circumstances A Qualified Disposition May Be Avoided; To Create New Section 91-9-713, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Spendthrift Provision; To Create New Section 91-9-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Persons Qualified To Serve As Trustees And Advisors; To Create New Section 91-9-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Persons Qualified To Serve As Investment Advisors; To Create New Section 91-9-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appointment Of Successor Trustees; To Create New Section 91-9-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide When A Trust Is Not Revocable; To Create New Section 91-9-723, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Applicability Of The Article; To Amend Sections 91-9-503, 91-9-505 And 91-9-507, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 91-9-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Situation When A Settlor Is Beneficiary Of A Settlor-created Trust As Inconsistent With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2448.title: Corrections; require any person incarcerated for nonpayment of child support to work.
2448.description: An Act To Require Any Person Incarcerated For Nonpayment Of Child Support To Work Unless The Person Is Physically Unable; And For Related Purposes.

2450.title: Uniform Commercial Code; revise to conform to model act (ULC).
2450.description: An Act To Conform To Certain Changes To The Model Act For The Uniform Commercial Code; To Amend Section 11-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Law On Implied Warranties, Limitations And Disclaimers To The Nonuniform Choice Of Law Provisions In The Mississippi Enactment Of The Uniform Commercial Code; To Create New Section 15-1-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Six-year Statute Of Limitations For Nonnegotiable Promissory Notes; To Create New Section 75-1-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Short Titles For The Uniform Commercial Code And For Article 1; To Create New Section 75-1-102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Scope Of The General Provisions Of Article 1; To Create New Section 75-1-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Uniform Construction Of The Uniform Commercial Code; To Create New Section 75-1-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Implied Repeal; To Create New Section 75-1-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Severability; To Create New Section 75-1-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Grammatical Construction Of Personal And Possessive Pronouns As To Gender; To Create New Section 75-1-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Section Captions Are Part Of The Act; To Create New Section 75-1-108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Relationship Between The Act And The Electronic Signatures Act; To Create New Section 75-1-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact General Definitions; To Create New Section 75-1-202, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify When Both Notice And Knowledge Occur; To Create New Section 75-1-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Distinguish A Lease From A Security Interest; To Create New Section 75-1-204, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify When A Person Has Given Value; To Create New Section 75-1-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Reasonable Time And Seasonableness; To Create New Section 75-1-206, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Presumptions Of Fact; To Create New Section 75-1-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Choice Of Law; To Create New Section 75-1-302, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Variation By Agreement; To Create New Section 75-1-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Course Of Performance, Course Of Dealing, And Usage Of Trade; To Create New Section 75-1-304, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Good Faith; To Create New Section 75-1-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Liberal Administration Of Remedies; To Create New Section 75-1-306, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Waiver Or Renunciation Of Claim Or Right Upon Breach; To Create New Section 75-1-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Prima Facie Evidence By Third-party Documents; To Create New Section 75-1-308, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Performance Or Acceptance Under Reservation Of Rights; To Create New Section 75-1-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Option To Accelerate At Will; To Create New Section 75-1-310, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Subordination Of Obligations; To Amend Sections 75-2-103, 75-2-107, 75-2-202, 75-2a-103, 75-2a-501, 75-2a-51, 75-2a-518, 75-2a-527, 75-2a-528, 75-3-103, 75-3-106, 75-3-116, 75-3-119, 75-3-305, 75-3-309, 75-3-312, 75-3-415, 75-3-416, 75-3-417, 75-3-419, 75-3-602, 75-3-604, 75-3-605, 75-4-104, 75-4-105, 75-4-207, 75-4-208, 75-4-212, 75-4-301, 75-4-403, 75-4a-105, 75-4a-106, 75-4a-204, 75-5-103, 75-7-102, 75-8-102 And 75-9-102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-13-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Enforceability Of Limitations On Assignments Of Partnership Interests; To Create New Section 79-14-706, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Enforceability Of Limitations On Assignments Of Limited Partnership Interests; To Create New Section 1-3-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Editorial Nature Of Section Captions Unless Specifically Provided Otherwise By Law; To Repeal Sections 75-1-101, 75-1-102, 75-1-103, 75-1-104, 75-1-105, 75-1-106, 75-1-107, 75-1-108, 75-1-109, 75-1-110, 75-1-201, 75-1-202, 75-1-203, 75-1-204, 75-1-205, 75-1-206, 75-1-207 And 75-1-208, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Comprise The Uniform Commercial Code Article 1 - General Provisions, And Are Being Replaced By Revised Article 1 - General Provisions; To Repeal Section 75-2-208, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Practical Construction Of "course Of Performance" For Purposes Of The Uniform Commercial Code Article 2 - Sales, The Substance Thereof Being Reenacted In Revised Article 1 - General Provisions; To Repeal Section 75-2a-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Practical Construction Of "course Of Performance" For Purposes Of The Uniform Commercial Code Article 2a - Leases, The Substance Thereof Being Reenacted In Revised Article 1 - General Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2451.title: Judgment for overdue child support and enforcement by DHS; delete certain statute reverters.
2451.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-11-71, 93-11-101 And 93-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Section Reverters On Statutes Relating To The Enforcement Of Judgments For Overdue Child Support And The Administration Of Withholding Orders For Child Support By The Department Of Human Services; To Amend Section 43-19-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Repealer On The Statute Allowing Stipulated Agreements For Modification Of Support Order; And For Related Purposes.

2452.title: Tax Collectors Education and Certification Program; require Office of State Auditor to implement.
2452.description: An Act To Require The Office Of The State Auditor To Establish And Implement A Mississippi Tax Collectors Education And Certification Program; To Require That The Training And Examinations Of The Program Shall Be Administered And Conducted By The Education And Certification Board In Cooperation With The Center For Governmental Training And Technology Within The Mississippi State University Extension Service; To Establish The Education And Certification Board And Provide For Its Composition Of Members; To Provide For The Manner, Frequency And Location With Which Certification Courses Must Be Conducted; To Provide For The Reimbursement Of Certain Expenses For Persons Attending Courses Administered Under The Program; To Prescribe The Responsibilities Of The Board With Respect To The Administration Of The Program; To Require The Board And The Center For Governmental Training And Technology To Design Two Tax Collector And Assessor-tax Collector Examinations; To Provide Who May Be Eligible To Take The Examinations; To Prescribe The Guidelines For The Administration And Implementation Of Courses And Examinations For Certification; To Require The Board To Establish A Fair And Reasonable Fee For The Examinations And Certifications Of Tax Collectors And Assessor-tax Collectors; To Create The Tax Collector Training Fund In The State Treasury And To Provide For Its Funding; And For Related Purposes.

2453.title: Movie Industry Studio Construction Loan Fund; create and issue bonds to fund.
2453.description: An Act To Create The Movie Industry Studio Construction Loan Fund For The Purpose Of Providing Loans For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of Movie Industry Studios; To Provide That Application For Such Loans Shall Be Made To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide The Interest Rate On Such Loans; To Give The Mississippi Development Authority Certain Powers And Duties Regarding Any Such Loan; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 To Provide Funds To Make The Loans Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2457.title: Public construction contracts; grant preference to contractors who use resident subcontractors.
2457.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-3-21 And 31-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, In The Letting Of Public Contracts, Preference Shall Be Given To Contractors Who Use Resident Subcontractors To Perform The Public Work; And For Related Purposes.

2458.title: MS Debt Management Services Act; extend repealer on.
2458.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-22-1, 81-22-3, 81-22-5, 81-22-7, 81-22-9, 81-22-11, 81-22-13, 81-22-15, 81-22-17, 81-22-19, 81-22-21, 81-22-23, 81-22-25, 81-22-27 And 81-22-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Known And Cited As The "mississippi Debt Management Services Act"; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-22-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Inform The Code Publisher Of Certain Nonsubstantive Language That Should Be Revised; To Reenact And Amend Section 81-22-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

2459.title: Human Relations Commission; establish.
2459.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Human Relations Act Of 2010"; To Establish And Empower A Mississippi Commission On Human Relations; To Require The Cooperation Of State Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2460.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 25 years of creditable service.
2460.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Persons Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As Teachers In The Public School System After Their Retirement, And Certain Persons Employed As Teachers In The Public School System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System, May Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Be Contributing Members Of The Retirement System Nor Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which They Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2461.title: State Workforce Investment Board; make report to the Legislature on the economic contributions of immigrants.
2461.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi State Workforce Investment Board To Develop And Make A Report To The Legislature And The Governor On The Economic Contributions Of Immigrants In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2462.title: Mississippi Consumer Insurance Policyholder Bill of Rights; create.
2462.description: An Act To Set Forth The Mississippi Consumer Insurance Policyholder Bill Of Rights; To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against An Insurer Under A Homeowner's Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy And Any Exception To Or Other Avoidance Of Coverage By The Insurer; To Amend Section 83-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Policies Containing Concurrent Causation Exclusions Are Defined As Unfair Methods Of Competition And Unfair And Deceptive Acts Or Practices In The Business Of Insurance; To Amend Section 83-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Commissioner Of Insurance From Receiving Gifts Or Campaign Contributions From Any Insurance Company Doing Business And Regulated Within The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2463.title: Auto liability insurance coverage; require before receiving tag.
2463.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Be Codified As Section 63-15-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Proof Of Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Before Receiving Motor Vehicle License Tags; And For Related Purposes.

2464.title: Study selection and governance structures of local school boards; create task force.
2464.description: An Act To Create A Task Force To Conduct A Study Of The Selection And Governance Structure Of Local School Boards In Mississippi; To Provide For A Report To The 2011 Regular Session Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2466.title: Emergency telephone calls; allow recordings to be released by order of MS Ethics Commission.
2466.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-319, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Ethics Commission To Release Recordings Of Emergency Telephone Calls (e-911); And For Related Purposes.

2467.title: Voter; define all convicted felons as not qualified.
2467.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Person Convicted Of A Crime Upon Completion Of The Sentence Imposed Shall Be Automatically Eligible To Vote; And For Related Purposes.

2468.title: School bonds; require 55% vote to pass.
2468.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-59-17 And 37-59-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That 55% Of The Qualified Electors Voting On The Question Of Issuance Of School Bonds Or Certificates Of Indebtedness Shall Be Required To Approve The Issuing Of Such Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

2469.title: Interpreter fund; create and place under management of Administrative Office of Courts.
2469.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-21-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Separate Interpreters Fund And Place Under The Management Of The Administrative Office Of Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2470.title: School guidance counselors; provide state funds for.
2470.description: An Act To Provide An Allotment Of Funds Under The Adequate Education Program For The Purpose Of Employing School Guidance Counselors (k-12) Based Upon School Student Enrollment, To Provide Certain Conditions On The Employment Of State-funded School Guidance Counselors And To Prescribe The Comprehensive Counseling Services To Be Provided To Include Crisis Intervention And Prevention And Dropout Prevention; And For Related Purposes.

2471.title: Donated leave; return unused leave pursuant to school board policy.
2471.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That School Districts Shall Return Unused Donated Catastrophic Leave To The Donor Employee In Accordance With School Board Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2472.title: Office of Occupational Safety and Health; State Department of Health shall establish.
2472.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Health To Establish An Office Of Occupational Safety And Health; And For Related Purposes.

2473.title: Workers' Compensation; require workplace medical services and transportation for injured employees.
2473.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Workplace Medical Services And Transportation To Be Available For Injured Persons Under The Workers' Compensation Law; And For Related Purposes.

2474.title: Unemployment compensation benefits; eliminate one-week waiting period for eligibility.
2474.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Until July 1, 2012, The One-week Waiting Period Required For Eligibility For Unemployment Compensation Benefits Shall Be Eliminated; And For Related Purposes.

2475.title: Income tax; provide a credit for certain energy efficiency improvements to property.
2475.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Costs And Expenses Incurred By A Taxpayer For Certain Energy Efficiency Improvements To Homes And Commercial Or Business Property; To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Expenses Incurred For The Installation Of A Wind Or Solar Energy System In The Home Of The Taxpayer Or At Business Or Commercial Property Owned By The Taxpayer; To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation The True Value Added To A Property As A Result Of The Installation Of A Wind Energy System Or A Solar Energy System That Is Eligible For The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2476.title: Civil actions; insurer has burden of proof for exclusions/exceptions in homeowners insurance policies.
2476.description: An Act To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against An Insurer Under A Homeowner's Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy And Any Exception To Or Other Avoidance Of Coverage By The Insurer; And For Related Purposes.

2478.title: Mississippi Civic Literacy Act; enact.
2478.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Civic Literacy Act; To Require The Teaching Of The Nation's Founding And Related Documents During The High School Years; To Require The State Department Of Education To Submit An Annual Report To The Governor And Legislature On The Effectiveness Of The Curriculum On Civic Literacy; And For Related Purposes.

2479.title: Elections; require voter to present I.D. prior to voting.
2479.description: An Act To Require Persons Who Appear To Vote In Person At A Polling Place Or The Registrar's Office To Identify Themselves By Presenting Certain Types Of Identification To An Election Manager Or The Registrar Before They Are Allowed To Vote; To Amend Sections 23-15-11, 23-15-541 And 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2480.title: MS Telephone Solicitation Act; apply to cellular telephones.
2480.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "consumer" As Used In The Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Act In Order To Broaden The Application Of The Act To Include Cellular Telephones; And For Related Purposes.

2481.title: Workers' compensation; preexisting conditions do not have to be occupationally disabling for apportionment to apply.
2481.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Preexisting Conditions Do Not Have To Be Occupationally Disabling For Apportionment To Apply In A Workers' Compensation Claim; And For Related Purposes.

2483.title: Personal care homes; create program of Medicaid assistance payments for.
2483.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Program Of Assistance Payments For Persons Who Reside In Personal Care Homes And Who Are Eligible For And Receiving Certain Medicaid Assistance; To Authorize The Division Of Medicaid To Administer The Program Of Assistance Payments; And For Related Purposes.

2484.title: Family protection specialists under DHS; extend repealers.
2484.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-1-55 And 43-27-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealers On Sections Relating To The Qualifications Of Family Protection Specialists Under The Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes.

2485.title: Tort immunity; include food donated to needy.
2485.description: An Act To Amend Section 95-9-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Include The Donation Of Food To Service Organizations For The Needy In The Tort Liability Exemption For Volunteer Charitable Activity; And For Related Purposes.

2486.title: Insurance companies; require to offer property/casualty insurance if offered in another state.
2486.description: An Act To Provide That Any Insurance Company Which Writes Policies Of Insurance In The State Of Mississippi And Offers Property And Casualty Insurance In Another State Shall Offer Property And Casualty Insurance In The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2487.title: Compulsory school attendance requirements; child with 30 or more excused/unexcused absences not allowed to advance or graduate.
2487.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Compulsory-school-age Child That Has Accumulated 30 Or More Excused Or Unexcused Absences In A School Year Shall Not Be Allowed To Advance To The Next Grade Or Graduate; And For Related Purposes.

2488.title: Students with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD); State Dept. of Education to implement program in the public schools.
2488.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Department Of Education To Develop Standards And Implement Autism Spectrum Disorder (asd) Classrooms In The School Districts Statewide To More Fully Meet The Needs Of Students With Autism In The Public School Setting; And For Related Purposes.

2489.title: School district; elect members of all school boards in 2013.
2489.description: An Act To Require The Election Of All School Board Members In Municipal Separate And Special Municipal Separate School Districts Beginning With The Municipal Elections In The Year 2013; To Amend Sections 37-7-203 And 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Election Of The Members Of School Boards Of Municipal Separate School Districts And Special Municipal Separate School Districts From School Board Member Districts By The Qualified Electors Of Such Districts, To Direct The Municipal Governing Authorities To Apportion The School Districts Into Five School Board Member Districts, And To Prescribe The Time And Manner Of Such Elections And The Manner In Which Vacancies On The School Boards Shall Be Filled; To Amend Section 37-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 37-7-204, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Appointment Of Interim Board Members To Fill Certain Vacancies On The School Boards Of Countywide Municipal Separate School Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-7-209 Through 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees From Added Territory Of Municipal Separate School Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705 Through 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2490.title: Prekindergarten programs; require under-performing school districts in the Delta to implement.
2490.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Pilot Program For A Mandatory Prekindergarten Program In Under-performing School Districts Located In The Mississippi Delta; And For Related Purposes.

2491.title: Ad valorem tax, homestead property; exempt portion of increase in assessed value above assessed value for preceding year.
2491.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Owners Of Homestead Property Shall Be Allowed An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes In An Amount Equal To The Increase In The Assessed Value Of The Homestead Property, Not To Exceed 10%, Above The Assessed Value Of Such Homestead Property For The Preceding Calendar Year; To Provide That The Ad Valorem Tax Exemption Provided By This Act Is In Addition To All Other Exemptions Provided By State Law; And For Related Purposes.

2492.title: Workers' compensation; provide for admissibility of drug and alcohol testing.
2492.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Admissibility Of Drug And Alcohol Testing, Employer Administered Or Otherwise, Solely On The Issue Of Causation At The Time Of Injury For Workers' Compensation; And For Related Purposes.

2494.title: Workers' compensation; increase certain death benefits, authorize interested party to request an autopsy.
2494.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Compensation The Workers' Compensation Commission Is Authorized To Award For Serious Facial Or Head Disfigurements; To Amend Section 71-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Compensation The Workers' Compensation Commission Is Authorized To Award While An Employee Is Undergoing Vocational Rehabilitation; To Amend Section 71-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Death Benefit Compensation The Workers' Compensation Commission Is Authorized To Award For Death, And To Authorize Any Interested Party To Request An Autopsy In Certain Instances; And For Related Purposes.

2495.title: Legislature; shall not meet on General Robert E. Lee/Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s birthday.
2495.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Legislature Shall Not Meet On The Third Monday In January (robert E. Lee's Birthday And Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s Birthday); And For Related Purposes.

2498.title: Sex education pilot program; SBE and SBH shall establish.
2498.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education, Acting Jointly With The State Board Of Health, To Establish A Sex Education Pilot Program; To Require The State Department Of Education And The State Department Of Health To Determine The Grade Or Grades In Which The Pilot Program Will Be Implemented; To Require The State Department Of Education To Select School Districts For Participation In The Program; To Require The State Department Of Education, With The Input Of The State Department Of Health, To Submit A Report On The Pilot Program To The Chairmen Of Certain Legislative Committees Before January 1, 2012; To Amend Section 41-79-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Bring Forward Section 37-14-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Designates The State Department Of Education As The State Agency Responsible For The Administration Of The Public School Nurse Program And Prescribes The Responsibilities Of The Nurses; And For Related Purposes.

2499.title: Victims of Trafficking and Violence Protection Act; require Judicial College to train judges, DAs & law enforcement officers.
2499.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Judicial College Of The University Of Mississippi Law Center To Prepare And Conduct Courses Of Training Concerning The Federal Victims Of Trafficking And Violence Protection Act To Be Offered To Judges, District Attorneys And Law Enforcement Officers; To Amend Sections 45-6-7 And 45-6-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2500.title: Sales tax; revise definition of business" to exclude food sales paid by certain declining balance debit cards.
2500.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "business" Under The State Sales Tax Law To Exclude Retail Sales Of Food When Sold On The Campus Of A Public Or Private University, College Or Community Or Junior College To A Student Enrolled At Such University, College Or Community Or Junior College And Payment For The Sale Is Made Through The Use Of A Card Or Declining Balance Account Or Similar Instrument Or Account Issued To The Student By The University, College Or Community Or Junior College; And For Related Purposes.

2501.title: Agreement between child development tech programs at the community colleges and the universities; require.
2501.description: An Act To Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Enter Into An Articulation Agreement Between The Child Development Technology Degree Program At The Community Colleges And The Appropriate College Program At The Universities; And For Related Purposes.

2502.title: MS Civil Rights Museum; create under authority of Department of Archives and History/issue bonds to construct.
2502.description: An Act To Provide For The Creation Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; To Provide That The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum Shall Be Under The Supervision And Control Of The Department Of Archives And History; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Department Of Archives And History Regarding The Museum; To Create The "mississippi Civil Rights Museum Fund"; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi In The Amount Of $50,000,000.00 For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Construction Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum; And For Related Purposes.

2503.title: E-verification of employee work eligibility status; repeal law.
2503.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 71-11-1 And 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The "mississippi Employment Protection Act" Requiring E-verification Of Employee Work Eligibility Status And Providing Certain Procedures For Newly Hired Employees And Their Employers; And For Related Purposes.

2504.title: Consumer collection agencies; require registration and prohibit certain acts.
2504.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Consumer Collection Practices Act"; To Define Certain Terms; To Require Registration Of Consumer Collection Agencies Engaging In Business In Mississippi; To Prohibit Certain Practices By Consumer Collection Agencies When Collecting Consumer Debts; To Prescribe Certain Duties Of The Office Of Consumer Protection Within The Office Of The Attorney General And The Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance In Enforcing The Act; To Provide For Administrative And Civil Remedies For Violations Of The Act; And For Related Purposes.

2505.title: Retirement; retirees may be reemployed for 195 days per fiscal year.
2505.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Retirees To Be Employed In State Service And Draw A Retirement Allowance For A Period Of Time Not To Exceed 195 Days In Any Fiscal Year; To Provide That Any Person Employed Pursuant To This Provision Shall Not Be An Active Member Of The Retirement System And Shall Not Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which He Is Employed Pursuant To This Provision; To Provide That The Employer Of A Person Employed Pursuant To Such Provision Shall Deduct Employee Contributions And Make Employer Contributions On Behalf Of Such Person; To Provide That The Retirement Allowance Of Such Person Shall Not Be Enhanced Or Diminished As A Result Of Such Employment; To Amend Section 25-11-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Member Employed Under The Above Provision May Not Receive A Refund Of The Amount Of Employee Contributions, Or Interest Earned On Those Contributions, That Were Made During Any Period When He Was So Employed; And For Related Purposes.

2506.title: Teachers' salaries; increase next 5 years and determine "living wage" for assistant teachers.
2506.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Teacher Salary Scale For The Next Five Years So That Beginning In The 2014-2015 School Year, The Lowest Salary On The Scale Exceeds $40,000.00; To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Assistant Teachers During The Next Five Years In An Amount Proportionate To The Increases To The Teacher Salary Scale; To Require The State Board Of Education To Appoint A Study Committee To Determine An Amount That Constitutes A Living Wage For Assistant Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

2508.title: Unused sick leave earned by teachers; authorize one-time payment by school district.
2508.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Districts To Make A One-time Payment To Teachers For Unused Sick Leave Credited During The Current School Year Equal To The Substitute Teacher's Rate; And For Related Purposes.

2509.title: Substitute teachers may be paid twice per month and while student teaching; authorize.
2509.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts To Pay Substitute Teachers Twice Per Month And To Clarify That School Districts May Pay Substitute Teachers From Any Available Fund Of The District; To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Substitute Teachers With Certain Experience To Be Compensated While Completing Student Teaching Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2510.title: Birthday cutoff date for 5- and 6-year old enrollment in public kindergarten or first grade; move to January 1.
2510.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Children Who Have Reached Their 5th Or 6th Birthday On Or Before January 1 Of The Upcoming School Year Shall Be Eligible To Enroll In Public Kindergarten Or First Grade; To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Said Enrollment Requirements To The Provisions Of The Compulsory School Law; And For Related Purposes.

2511.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or comm. college; authorize for students with at least 3.0 GPA regardless of immigration status.
2511.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Who Have At Least A 3.0 Grade Point Average In High School And Maintain That Average Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College, Regardless Of The Immigration Status Of Such Student; And For Related Purposes.

2512.title: Annual leave for teachers; allow additional accumulation of personal leave.
2512.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Teachers To Accumulate Personal Leave Up To Three Days; And For Related Purposes.

2513.title: Criminal convictions; judge to explain to convict whether he remains a qualified elector.
2513.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Judge To Explain To Every Person Convicted Of A Felony Whether He Remains A Qualified Elector Upon Sentencing; And For Related Purposes.

2514.title: Workers' compensation disability payments; extend time period for receiving.
2514.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Period Of Time Allowed For The Receipt Of Workers' Compensation Disability Payments; And For Related Purposes.

2515.title: Student loans; provide graduate degree teacher incentive loans to applicants agreeing to teach in public schools or universities.
2515.description: An Act To Create Section 37-143-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Graduate Degree Teacher Education Incentive Loans To Qualified Applicants Agreeing To Teach In Public School Districts Or State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Authorize Stipends For Such Students In Graduate Teacher Education Programs; To Provide For The Conversion Of Such Loans Into Interest-free Scholarships By Performing Such Teaching Service; And For Related Purposes.

2516.title: Income tax; provide credit for out-of-pocket classroom supply expenditures made by public schoolteachers.
2516.description: An Act To Provide A State Income Tax Credit Up To $500.00 For Out-of-pocket Classroom Supply Expenditures Made By Public Schoolteachers; And For Related Purposes.

2517.title: Sales tax; exempt retail sales of certain food for human consumption.
2517.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Certain Food For Human Consumption; And For Related Purposes.

2518.title: Mississippi Community/Junior College Transfer Scholarship Fund; create.
2518.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Community/junior College Transfer Scholarship Fund To Assist Eligible Students To Transfer From Two-year Public Colleges To Four-year Public Universities; To Provide Eligibility Requirements And Conditions; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Issue Regulations To Implement This Program; And For Related Purposes.

2519.title: Accumulated personal leave; authorize transfer between state and county agencies.
2519.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-97, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Transfer Of Accumulated Leave Between State And County Departments And Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2520.title: State Board of Dental Examiners; provide for two additional members from the state at large.
2520.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-9-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Two Additional African-american Members Of The State Board Of Dental Examiners To Be Appointed From The State At Large; And For Related Purposes.

2521.title: Workers' compensation; injured employee may select specialists who provide type of treatment prescribed.
2521.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Under The Workers' Compensation Law, An Injured Employee Shall Have The Right To Select The Specialists, Practitioners Or Health Care Providers Of His Choosing Who Provide The Type Of Treatment That Is Prescribed By His Chosen Physician; And For Related Purposes.

2522.title: School districts provide an annual report of teacher vacancies to the SBE and the Legislature; require.
2522.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Provide An Annual Report Of Teacher Vacancies By Instructional Area To The State Superintendent Of Education For Submission To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2523.title: Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP); create.
2523.description: An Act To Authorize Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Have Reached Their Normal Retirement Date To Participate In A Deferred Retirement Option Program (drop) Under Which The Employee May Retire And Continue Working For A Specified Period And Receive His Or Her Regular Salary, While Having The Retirement Benefit He Or She Would Have Otherwise Received Paid Into An Account For The Member's Benefit; To Provide That Money In Such Account Will Be Paid To The Member Upon Completion Of The Drop Period; To Provide That The Member Must Elect To Participate In The Program Within 12 Months Immediately Following The Date Upon Which The Member Reached His Or Her Normal Retirement Date; To Provide That The Drop Period May Be For Any Time Not Exceeding Five Years; To Provide That The Decision To Participate In The Drop Program Is Irrevocable Once It Is Made; To Provide That The Drop Account For The Benefit Of The Member Shall Be Held In Reserve Until The End Of The Drop Period; To Provide That Regular Interest Shall Be Paid On Monies In The Drop Account During The Time That The Member Participates In The Drop Program And Until The Monies Are Paid To The Member; To Provide That The Member Shall Receive The Accumulated Monies In The Drop Account In Addition To The Regular Retirement Allowance At The End Of The Drop Period; To Provide That Any Member Participating In The Drop Program Shall Not Be An Active Member Of The Retirement System And Shall Not Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period Of Participation In The Program; To Amend Sections 25-11-105, 25-11-109, 25-11-117 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2524.title: MS Veterans Memorial Stadium; transfer and convey to Jackson State University.
2524.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Transfer And Convey To Jackson State University All Of Its Rights, Title And Interest To The Mississippi Veterans Memorial Stadium And Any Adjoining State-owned Land Under Its Jurisdiction; To Amend Sections 55-23-13, 55-23-15, 55-23-17, 55-23-19 And 55-23-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Repeal Sections 55-23-1, 55-23-3, 55-23-5, 55-23-6, 55-23-7, 55-23-8, 55-23-9 And 55-23-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Veterans Memorial Stadium Commission And Provide For The Management And Operation Of The Mississippi Veterans Memorial Stadium; And For Related Purposes.

2526.title: Revision of state agency budgets; authorize restoration of funds and certain transfers during FY2010.
2526.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Certain Sums To The Budget Contingency Fund During Fiscal Year 2010 For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Restore A Portion Of The Budget Cuts Made To Certain Agencies During Fiscal Year 2010; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Specified Sums To Certain Agencies From The Amount Transferred To The Budget Contingency Fund; To Authorize The Agencies To Which The Funds Are Transferred To Escalate Their Budgets And Expend Those Funds For The Purposes Authorized By Law, Subject To Certain Conditions; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer A Certain Sum To The School District Emergency Assistance Fund And To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Escalate The Appropriate Budget By That Amount And Expend That Sum For The Purposes Authorized By Law, Subject To Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2527.title: Suffrage; provide for immediate restoration upon completion of sentence and other conditions.
2527.description: An Act To Create The Restoration Of Voting Rights Act; To Provide That A Person Who Was Disqualified As An Elector For Commission Of Certain Crimes Shall Have The Right To Vote Restored Automatically Upon Completion Of The Sentence And Following A Two-year Waiting Period; To Provide That Notice Shall Be Given Before A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere Is Accepted In A Court Of Law; To Require The Secretary Of State To Implement Certain Education Programs For State Agencies And Judges; To Amend Section 23-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2528.title: Emergency services agencies; authorize fingerprinting and criminal history checks for employees.
2528.description: An Act To Authorize Fingerprinting And Criminal History Record Checks To Determine Suitability For Employment With Emergency Services Agencies; To Authorize The Collection Of A Fee For The Fingerprinting And Criminal History Record Checks; To Authorize Emergency Services Agencies To Grant Waivers If An Applicant Shows Mitigating Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2529.title: Income taxes; exclude transportation fringe benefits from gross income as allowed under the Internal Revenue Code.
2529.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income For State Income Tax Purposes Qualified Transportation Fringe Benefits Provided By An Employer Of The Taxpayer To The Taxpayer In The Amount Allowed To Be Excluded From The Taxpayer's Federal Gross Income Under Section 132 Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2530.title: Licensed school employees; allow use of personal leave near holiday if summoned by court.
2530.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Licensed School Employee To Use Personal Leave On The First/last Day Of A School Term And The Day Before/after A Holiday, If The Employee Is Summoned To Appear For Jury Duty Or As A Witness In Court On Such Days; And For Related Purposes.

2531.title: Ad valorem tax; local governing authorities may grant an exemption of homesteads of certain residents serving in Iraq or Afghanistan.
2531.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-33-76, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, Except Taxes For School District Purposes, On Homesteads Of Residents Of This State Who Are Serving On Active Duty Pursuant To Military Orders In Iraq Or Afghanistan; To Provide The Amount Of Such Exemption; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Adopt And Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Administer And Implement Such Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-51-42.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The September 30, 2012, Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County And The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes, Except Taxes For School District Purposes, On Motor Vehicles Of Residents Of This State Who Are Serving On Active Duty Pursuant To Military Orders In Iraq Or Afghanistan; And For Related Purposes.

2532.title: Administration of public education; delete automatic repealers on statutes relating to.
2532.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-3-93, 37-7-301, 37-9-77, 37-11-18.1, 37-11-54 And 37-11-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealers On Those Statutes Relating To The Administration Of Public Education In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2534.title: Special education program teachers of 3- and 4-year-old children; provide full funding under MAEP.
2534.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Special Education Program Teachers Of Three- And Four-year-old Exceptional Children Shall Be Fully Funded Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

2535.title: Special education services; increase age of exceptional children who qualify.
2535.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-23-1, 37-23-3, 37-23-63 And 37-23-135, To Increase The Age Of Exceptional Children Who Qualify For Special Education Services From 20 To 21 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2536.title: Nathan's law; increase penalty for unlawful passing of school bus.
2536.description: An Act To Create "nathan's Law"; To Amend Section 63-3-615, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Offense Of Passing A School Bus When Stopped To Load Or Unload Students And To Revise The Penalty Therefor; To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Devices In School Crossings Without Using Hands-free Accessories And To Require The State Department Of Education To Develop And Issue Curriculum Guidelines To School Districts For Implementation Of A School Bus Safety Curriculum; To Amend Section 63-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Driver's License Examination Requirements To Ensure Coverage Thereon Of School Bus Safety Issues; To Authorize Cameras On School Bus Stop Arms; To Authorize The Department Of Transportation To Conduct A Public Education Campaign On School Bus Safety; To Create A School Bus Safety Taskforce; And For Related Purposes.

2537.title: Legislators and Lt. Governor; reduce compensation by 10% for the remainder of the current term of office.
2537.description: An Act To Amend Sections 5-1-41, 5-1-43, 5-1-45 And 5-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Annual Salary By 10% Of Legislators And The Lieutenant Governor For The Remainder Of The Current Term Of Office; And For Related Purposes.

2540.title: Salaries of certain elected state and district officials; reduce by 10%.
2540.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-3-31, 5-1-41, 5-1-43, 5-1-45 And 5-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Annual Salaries Of Certain Elected State And District Officials By 10%; And For Related Purposes.

2541.title: School term; revise first day and reduce length in all school districts.
2541.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Public School Terms Shall Open On The Tuesday Following Labor Day; To Amend Sections 37-13-63 And 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Minimum Length Of The School Term In All School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2542.title: Sixteenth section school land; limit rent increases on farm-residential land.
2542.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-63 And 29-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Annual Rental For Sixteenth Section School Land Classified As Farm-residential Land Shall Not Be Increased To An Amount Exceeding 5% Of The Current Market Value Of Agricultural Land In The County In Which The Lease Is Located; To Amend Section 29-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Lessee Of Such Farm-residential Land Shall Have The Right To Hire His Own Appraiser, And That Any Disagreement As To Fair Market Rental Amount Shall Be Appealable To The Secretary Of State; And For Related Purposes.

2543.title: Right to work; private and public employers prohibited from permitting payroll deductions for union political activities.
2543.description: An Act Relating To The Right To Work; To Provide That The Right To Work Shall Not Be Infringed Or Restricted In Any Way Based On Membership In, Affiliation With, Or Financial Support Of A Labor Organization Or On The Refusal To Join, Affiliate With, Or Financially Or Otherwise Support A Labor Organization; To Authorize Employers To Deduct Union Fees From An Employee's Wages With The Employee's Signed Written Authorization, But To Prohibit Any Requirement For The Payment Of Dues Or Fees To A Labor Organization As A Condition Of Employment; To Prohibit Coercion And Intimidation Relating To Such Action; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violation Of This Act; To Provide Civil Remedies For Violation Of This Act; To Provide That This Act Applies To Private And Public Employers; And For Related Purposes.

2545.title: Health care certificate of need; remove moratorium on home health agencies.
2545.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Restriction Which Prohibits The State Department Of Health From Issuing A Certificate Of Need For The Establishment Or Expansion Of Approved Territory For A Home Health Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2546.title: Alcoholic beverages, light wine and beer permits; suspend or revoke for the discharge of a firearm on the premises.
2546.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That On-premises Retailer's Permits Issued Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law May Be Revoked Or Suspended For The Discharge Of A Firearm On The Premises That Is Reported To Law Enforcement Authorities; To Amend Section 67-3-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Revoke Or Suspend The Light Wine And Beer Permit Of Any Permit Holder Who Sells Light Wine Or Beer For Consumption On The Licensed Premises If The Discharge Of A Firearm On The Premises Is Reported To Law Enforcement Authorities; And For Related Purposes.

2548.title: Deputy Superintendent of the Mississippi Recovery School District; appointed by State Superintendent with approval of State Board.
2548.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Deputy Superintendent Of The Mississippi Recovery School District Is Appointed By The State Superintendent Of Education Subject To The Approval Of The State Board Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

2549.title: Annual school attendance reports by the State Department of Education; clarify date for filing.
2549.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorized The Office Of Compulsory School Attendance Enforcement Of The State Department Of Education To File Annual Reports On The Same Date As Other Department Reports; And For Related Purposes.

2551.title: Testing instruments and procedures for students with disabilities; clarify accommodation.
2551.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Requirement Of Making Appropriate Accommodations For Testing Instruments And Procedures For Students With Disabilities; And For Related Purposes.

2554.title: Mississippi Industries for the Blind; authorize to establish a nonprofit foundation.
