2554.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-3-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Industries For The Blind To Establish A Nonprofit Foundation To Support Its Operations; And For Related Purposes.

2555.title: Mississippi Public Health Laboratory; name for Dr. Ed Thompson.
2555.description: An Act To Name The Mississippi State Public Health Laboratory In Jackson, Mississippi, For Dr. F.e. "ed" Thompson, Jr.; And For Related Purposes.

2556.title: Chickasawhay Natural Gas District; extend repealer on statute creating board of directors for.
2556.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Statute Creating The Board Of Directors For The Chickasawhay Natural Gas District; And For Related Purposes.

2558.title: UMC Center of Excellence for abused and neglected children; delete repealer.
2558.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-115-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On That Section Of Law Which Authorizes The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Create A Center Of Excellence To Provide Care For Abused And Neglected Children At The Blair E. Batson Hospital For Children In Jackson, Mississippi, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer; And For Related Purposes.

2559.title: Medicated contact lenses; authorize persons to dispense if FDA-approved.
2559.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-19-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Persons To Sell, Prescribe Or Dispense Fda-approved Medicated Contact Lenses; And For Related Purposes.

2560.title: Veterans; authorize IHL to transfer certain real property for cemetery/create Persian Gulf War Memorial in Newton County.
2560.description: An Act To Authorize The State Board Of Trustees For Institutions Of Higher Learning To Transfer And Convey To The State Veterans Affairs Board Certain Real Property Located In Newton County, Mississippi, For Use As An Addition To The Mississippi Veterans Memorial Cemetery; To Authorize The State Veterans Affairs Board To Establish, Operate And Maintain A Mississippi Persian Gulf War Memorial In Newton County, Mississippi; To Authorize The State Veterans Affairs Board To Receive Federal Aid And Any Gifts, Contributions, Bequests And Reimbursements To Establish, Operate And Maintain Such Memorial; And For Related Purposes.

2562.title: Gaming licensees; prefer Mississippi residents in purchasing and hiring.
2562.description: An Act To Require Gaming Licensees To Give Preference To Mississippi Residents When Supplying Their Gaming Establishments And When Hiring Employees; And For Related Purposes.

2563.title: Taxation; authorize an income tax credit for installation of energy-efficient products in homes.
2563.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Taxpayers For The Cost And Expenses Incurred For Purchasing And Installing Insulation, Energy-efficient Replacement Windows And High-efficiency Heating And Cooling Equipment On Property Upon Which Homestead Exemption Is Granted; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2564.title: Public buildings; require art by Mississippi artists in certain state buildings.
2564.description: An Act To Create The Allocation For Art For Public Facilities Act; To Declare Legislative Intent And Purpose; To Require State Agencies To Expend, Out Of Monies Allocated For Original Construction, Remodeling Or Renovation Of Any State Facility, A Certain Percentage For The Purpose Of Including Works Of Art By Mississippi Artists In Such Facility; To Establish In The State Treasury The "art For Public Facilities Fund"; To Authorize The Mississippi Arts Commission To Administer This Act; To Provide That The State Of Mississippi Shall Receive The Right To Sole Ownership And Public Display Of All Art Acquired Under The Act, Subject To Certain Rights Retained By The Artist; And For Related Purposes.

2565.title: Municipal governing bodies; require those elected to serve to receive basic and continuing education.
2565.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 21-15-2.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Elected Municipal Officials, Whether Legislative Or Executive, To Complete A Certified City Management Course And To Complete Annual Continuing Education Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2566.title: Mississippi Youth Build Program for court-ordered delinquent juveniles; DHS to establish.
2566.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Department Of Human Services Division Of Youth Services To Establish And Operate The Mississippi Youth Build Program In Jackson, Mississippi, For Court-ordered Delinquent Youth To Provide Certain Rehabilitation Services; And For Related Purposes.

2567.title: Fuel taxes; allocate a portion to the City of Jackson to defray costs incurred as a result of being the seat of state government.
2567.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From The Proceeds Of Gasoline, Diesel Fuel Or Kerosene Taxes, An Amount Equal To 2% Of The Revenue From Gasoline And Diesel Fuel Taxes On Gasoline, Diesel Fuel And Kerosene Sold Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The City Of Jackson And Paid To The City; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2568.title: Office of Utility Consumer Advocate; create.
2568.description: An Act To Create The Office Of Utility Consumer Advocate; To Prescribe Its Powers And Duties; To Provide For The Appointment Of The Utility Consumer Advocate By The Governor With The Advice And Consent Of The Senate; To Provide Qualifications For The Utility Consumer Advocate; To Prohibit Certain Acts; To Prohibit Certain Employment Or Representation Of A Former Utility Consumer Advocate; To Require The Office Of Utility Consumer Advocate To File Certain Reports; And For Related Purposes.

2570.title: City of Jackson; require payments in lieu of taxes on state-owned property located in the city.
2570.description: An Act To Require The State Of Mississippi To Provide Funds To The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Payment In Lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes For The Purpose Of Assisting The City To Defray The Ad Valorem Tax Loss The City Sustains As A Result Of State Ownership Of Property In The City And To Defray Certain Costs The City Incurs As A Result Of Being The Seat Of Government; To Provide That The Amount Of The Annual Payment Shall Be Equal To 50% Of The Ad Valorem Tax Revenue That Would Be Due Each Calendar Year On All State-owned Property Within The City Limits Of Jackson If The Property Were Not Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Funds May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

2571.title: MS Training and Education Marketing Board and Special Task Force for Economic Development Planning; create.
2571.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Training And Education Marketing Board And Provide For Its Membership; To Empower This Board To Conduct Programs To Advertise And Increase Participation In Workforce Training And Education Programs; To Authorize The Board To Adopt Regulations And Employ Personnel; To Amend Section 57-63-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make The Vice President For Agriculture, Forestry And Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University And The Chairman Of The Department Of Agriculture At Alcorn State University Members Of The Special Task Force For Economic Development Planning; To Require The Heads Of The State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Assist The Special Task Force For Economic Development Planning In An Advisory Capacity And To Meet With The Task Force At Least Once Annually; And For Related Purposes.

2572.title: CON for nursing facility in any underserved minority zip code area in the state; authorize.
2572.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need For The Construction Of A 60-bed Nursing Facility In Any Underserved Minority Zip Code Area In The State; And For Related Purposes.

2573.title: MS Affordable Housing Trust Fund; create to assist in the development, rehabilitation and preservation of affordable housing.
2573.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; To Provide That Money In The Trust Fund Shall Be Made Available For Assisting The Development, Rehabilitation And Preservation Of Affordable Housing; To Provide That The Trust Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Oversight Board To Approve Rules And Regulations Proposed By The Mississippi Development Authority, To Oversee The Management Of Monies In The Trust Fund And To Approve Awards Of Trust Fund Monies To Applicants; To Provide For The Membership Of The Oversight Board; To Amend Section 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of All Taxes, Fees, Interest, Penalties, Damages, Fines Or Other Monies Collected By The State Tax Commission Under The Gaming Control Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2574.title: Health education in public schools; to include medically and scientifically accurate information.
2574.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct Public School Districts To Provide Certain Information To Young People To Enable Informed Life Choices; And For Related Purposes.

2575.title: Arrest warrant; require probable cause hearing before issuance.
2575.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Probable Cause Hearing Upon A Criminal Affidavit Prior To Issuance Of Any Arrest Warrant; And For Related Purposes.

2577.title: Insurance company catastrophe models; require Attorney General to study accuracy and reliability of.
2577.description: An Act To Require The Attorney General To Study The Accuracy And Reliability Of Catastrophe Models Used By Insurance Companies Writing Property Insurance In The State Of Mississippi; To Require The Attorney General To Report Its Findings To The Legislature And Commissioner Of Insurance; To Require Any Insurance Company Writing Property Insurance In The State Of Mississippi To Grant The Attorney General Access To The Models' Underlying Data, Formulas And Calculations; And For Related Purposes.

2578.title: Insurance; prohibit use of credit information in underwriting and rating.
2578.description: An Act To Prohibit Insurers From Using Information Regarding A Consumer's Creditworthiness, Credit Standing Or Credit Capacity For The Purpose Of Determining Rates For Insurance Or Eligibility For Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2580.title: Age of majority; eighteen.
2580.description: An Act To Amend Sections 1-3-21 And 1-3-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Of "infant" And "minor" To Provide That 18 Shall Be The Age Of Majority; To Amend Section 11-5-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To Sale Or Conveyance Of A Minor's Property; To Amend Sections 13-5-1 And 13-5-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Age Of Jury Service; To Amend Section 93-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Age For Issuance Of A Marriage License; To Amend Section 93-9-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To Paternity Proceedings; To Amend Section 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Age Of Emancipation; To Amend Sections 93-13-75 And 93-13-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To The Guardianship Of Minors; To Amend Section 93-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To The Age Of Parents In An Adoption; To Amend Section 91-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To The Age Of Issue Capable Of Inheriting; To Repeal Section 91-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That The Age Of 18 Years Shall Be The Age Of Majority Of An Executor, Executrix, Administrator Or Administratrix And That The Bond Executed By Such Person For The Performance Of The Duties Shall Be As Valid And Binding As If Such Person Were Of Full Age; To Amend Section 91-7-293, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To Final Accounting As To Heirs Of An Estate; To Amend Section 91-20-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To Transfers To Minors; To Amend Section 43-19-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform As To Child Support Paid By The Putative Father Of A Disabled Child; To Amend Section 97-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Penalty For Gambling With A Known Minor; To Amend Sections 93-3-11, 93-19-1 And 93-19-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 93-19-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That All Persons 18 Years Of Age Or Older, If Not Otherwise Disqualified, Shall Have The Capacity To Enter Into Binding Contractual Relationships Affecting Personal Property And That An Eighteen-year-old May Sue In His Own Name As An Adult And Be Sued In His Own Name As An Adult And Be Served With Process As An Adult; And For Related Purposes.

2581.title: Motor vehicles; authorize the operation of low-speed electric vehicles on certain public roads.
2581.description: An Act To Authorize The Operation Of Certain Low-speed Four-wheeled Electric Vehicles On Public Roads And Streets On Which The Posted Speed Limit Is 35 Miles Per Hour Or Less; To Provide That Such Vehicles May Be Operated On Such Public Roads And Streets Only By The Holder Of A Valid Driver's License; To Authorize Counties, Municipalities And The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Prohibit The Operation Of Such Vehicles Upon Streets Under Their Jurisdiction If Such Prohibition Is In The Interest Of Safety; To Amend Section 27-19-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Such Vehicles Are Included Within The Definition Of The Term "motor Vehicle" Under The Laws Governing The Privilege Taxation And Licensing Of Motor Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2582.title: Noise abatement; revise offense of noise disturbance.
2582.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-35-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Noise Disturbance; And For Related Purposes.

2583.title: Elderly victims; enhance penalty for fraud and monetary crimes against.
2583.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Enhancement Of Penalties For Fraud And Nonviolent Monetary Crimes When Committed Against The Elderly; To Amend Section 97-23-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Home Repair Fraud; And For Related Purposes.

2584.title: "Mississippi Postsecondary Textbook Transparency Act of 2010"; enact to assist students in obtaining the lowest textbook cost.
2584.description: An Act To Enact The "mississippi Postsecondary Textbook Transparency Act Of 2010"; To Require Publishers Selling Or Distributing Material For Use In University Classrooms To Disclose Certain Pricing Information, Format Revisions And Return Policies Regarding The Purchase Of Textbooks By Students; To Direct University Instructors To Provide Adequate Notice Of Orders To Appropriate Bookstores In Order That The Instructor Shall Be Informed As To Price, Format Availability, And Any Plans For Revision Of The Textbook; To Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Develop Materials Necessary To Inform Faculty And Students As To Methods To Obtain The Lowest Textbook Cost; To Authorize The Establishment Of A Pilot Textbook Rental Program For University Students; And For Related Purposes.

2585.title: Health Insurance Exchange Study Committee; create.
2585.description: An Act To Create The Health Insurance Exchange Study Committee To Conduct A Study Of Health Insurance Exchanges As Proposed At The Federal Level And To Make Implementation Recommendations; To Provide For The Membership Of The Study Committee And Its Powers And Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2586.title: County board of education is levying authority for all school districts in county school system; provide.
2586.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-57-1, 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The County Board Of Education Shall Be The Ad Valorem Tax Levying Authority For Any School District Which Is In The County School System; And For Related Purposes.

2587.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage for hearing aids.
2587.description: An Act To Require Certain Insurers And Nonprofit Health Service Plans To Provide Coverage Of Hearing Aids; And For Related Purposes.

2588.title: Certified nurse practitioner requirement for supervision by a licensed physician for insurance reimbursement; delete reverter.
2588.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5, 73-15-20 And 83-41-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Automatic Reverter And Repealer On Those Statutes Which Delete The Requirement That Certain Regulations Relating To The Practice Of Nursing Shall Be Jointly Promulgated By The State Board Of Nursing And The State Board Of Medical Licensure, Define The Term "advance Practice Registered Nurse" For The Purposes Of The Nursing Practice Law, Prescribe The Qualifications For The Licensure Of Advance Practice Registered Nurses, Prescribe The Practice Requirements For Advance Practice Registered Nurses, And Delete The Requirement That Certified Nurse Practitioners Shall Be Under The Supervision Of A Licensed Physician For Insurance Reimbursement Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2589.title: Beer; increase the amount of alcohol that it may contain from 5% by weight to 17% by weight.
2589.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Permissible Alcoholic Content Of Beer From 5% Of Alcohol By Weight To 17% Of Alcohol By Weight; To Amend Section 67-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Every Person Shall Have The Right To Make Homemade Beer For Domestic Or Household Use Only; To Amend Sections 67-1-5, 67-3-1, 67-3-5, 67-3-7, 67-3-9, 67-3-13, 67-3-17, 67-3-28, 67-3-49, 67-3-53 And 27-71-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2590.title: Counties; authorize to acquire cell phones for Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks' officers.
2590.description: An Act To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors To Acquire Cellular Phones Which May Be Used By The Enforcement Officers Of The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, And To Pay The Monthly Bill For The Cellular Phones Out Of The County General Fund Or Any Other Appropriate Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2591.title: Deputy sheriff for narcotics; fund from drug fines.
2591.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-25-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of Additional Deputy Sheriffs Who Are Specifically Designated For Narcotics Enforcement Shall Be Funded From The Proceeds Of Fines Collected By The County From Convictions Under The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2592.title: State buildings/construction projects; shall be constructed under supervision of DFA.
2592.description: An Act To Provide That All Buildings, Facilities Or Other Construction Projects Erected Or Constructed For State Agencies Shall Be Constructed Under The Supervision Of The Bureau Of Building, Grounds And Real Property Management, Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

2594.title: Public property; authorize DFA to apply rent payments toward the purchase of real property.
2594.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Apply Rent Payments Made During The Lease Of Any Real Property For State Government Offices Toward The Purchase Of The Real Property; To Provide That The Purchase Price Of The Real Property Shall Be Based Upon Appraisals Approved By The Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

2595.title: Medicaid coverage for breast and cervical cancer screening services; provide reimbursement for.
2595.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Medicaid Coverage For Breast And Cervical Cancer Screening Services; And For Related Purposes.

2596.title: Law enforcement officers; require to be compensated for overtime work.
2596.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Law Enforcement Officers Shall Be Compensated For Overtime Worked Between 160 To 171 Hours In A 28-day Work Period; And For Related Purposes.

2597.title: Appropriations; MS National Guard Youth Challenge Program at Camp McCain.
2597.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of State General Funds To The Mississippi National Guard, For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of A Youth Challenge Program At Camp Mccain For Fiscal Year 2011.

2598.title: Create task force to study the laws regarding the sale of land for taxes.
2598.description: An Act To Create The Tax Sale Of Land Reform Task Force To Study The Laws Regarding The Sale Of Land For Delinquent Ad Valorem Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

2599.title: State agencies; authorize transfer of allotments from one budget category to another.
2599.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize State Agency Heads To Transfer Allotments From One Budget Category To Another And To Prohibit Any Salary Increases; To Require The Reporting Of Personnel Contracts Of Former State Employees; And For Related Purposes.

2601.title: Sales tax; exempt certain organizations operating long-term care facilities solely for adults with mental retardation.
2601.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services To Nonprofit Organizations That Operate Long-term Care Facilities Solely For Adults With Mental Retardation If The Organization Is Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2602.title: Justice court; revise civil monetary jurisdiction.
2602.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Jurisdiction Of The Justice Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2603.title: CON for ICFMR beds; authorize additional beds for center in Madison County.
2603.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of A Certificate Of Need For 20 Additional Icfmr Beds To A Community Living Program For Developmentally Disabled Adults Located In Madison County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2604.title: Depositions and Discovery; enact the Uniform Interstate Depositions and Discovery Act.
2604.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Depositions And Discovery Act; To Enact Definitions; To Provide For Interstate Issuance Of Subpoenae; To Provide For Service Of Subpoenae; To Provide For Application Of The Rules Of Civil Procedure To Subpoenae Issued Under The Act; To Provide For Application To Enforce, Quash Or Modify; To Provide For Effectiveness In Pending Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

2605.title: Hunting rights on Sixteenth Section school land; local school board may hold an auction on leases for.
2605.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Local School Board Is Authorized To Reject Bids For Hunting And Fishing Rights On Sixteenth Section School Land And Hold An Auction Among Those Who Submitted Bids; And For Related Purposes.

2607.title: State IHL Board; authorize to acquire and sell real property for certain universities in their program of operations.
2607.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-113-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision Requiring The Recommendation Of The Director Of The Mississippi Agricultural And Forestry Experimental Station Before Real Property May Be Acquired Or Sold For The Use Of Mississippi State University; To Create New Sections To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Acquire And Sell Any Real Property Required By And For The Use Of The University Of Southern Mississippi, Mississippi University For Women, Alcorn State University, Delta State University, Jackson State University And Mississippi Valley State University; And For Related Purposes.

2608.title: Commercial driver's license; technical correction and clarification.
2608.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction To Codal References And To Clarify That The Holder Of A Commercial Driver's License Is Ineligible For A Hardship-based Restoration Of The Driving Privilege; To Amend Section 63-1-222, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2609.title: Continuing education requirements for pharmacist license renewal; revise.
2609.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Continuing Education Reporting Requirements For Pharmacist License Renewal; And For Related Purposes.

2610.title: Qualified circulating nurse in each operating room; require for hospitals and ambulatory surgical facilities.
2610.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-9-17 And 41-75-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Department Of Health Shall Require Hospitals And Ambulatory Surgical Facilities To Have A Qualified Registered Nurse Present As A Circulating Nurse In Each Separate Operating Room And Each Separate Invasive Procedure Room For The Duration Of The Operative Procedure; And For Related Purposes.

2611.title: Mississippi State Department of Health; extend automatic repealer.
2611.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-3-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The State Board Of Health And The State Department Of Health; To Reenact Sections 41-3-1.1, 41-3-3, 41-3-4, 41-3-5.1, 41-3-6, 41-3-15, 41-3-16, 41-3-17, 41-3-18 And 41-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish And Empower The State Board Of Health And The State Department Of Health; And For Related Purposes.

2613.title: Controlled substance; revise Schedules II and V.
2613.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Tapentadol To Schedule Ii; To Amend Section 41-29-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Lacosamide To Schedule V; And For Related Purposes.

2614.title: Nursing home licensure; authorize State Department of Health to remove residents in imminently dangerous environment.
2614.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-13 And 43-11-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Remove Residents From Any Nursing Facility Which Has Created An Imminently Dangerous Environment; And For Related Purposes.

2615.title: Short-Term Lender Law; create and repeal MS Check Cashers Act.
2615.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Short-term Lender Law"; To Require Licensure Of Short-term Lenders; To Provide Application Procedure And Bond Requirements; To Provide Certain Restrictions On Short-term Loans; To Limit The Interest Rate And Fees On Short-term Loans; To Prohibit Certain Acts By Short-term Loan Licensees; To Provide For The Refusal, Suspension Or Revocation Of License; To Require Licensee Records And Reports; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Adopt Rules And Issue Specific Orders To Enforce And Carry Out The Provisions Of The Act; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Certain Violations; To Prohibit Debt Collector Communications And Conduct By Short-term Lenders; To Require The Commissioner Of Banking To Develop And Maintain A Statewide Database Of Short-term Loans; To Provide Reporting Requirements By The Commissioner Of Banking; To Create A Consumer Finance Education Board And Provide For Its Membership; To Prescribe The Duties Of The Board; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2616.title: Bonds; increase the amount that may be issued for the Local Governments and Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund.
2616.description: An Act To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 3, Chapter 492, Laws Of 2008, To Increase From $24,743,000.00 To $26,493,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2617.title: Mississippi Virtual Public School Program; authorize SDE to contract with private provider to operate.
2617.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-161-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Contract The Operation Of The Mississippi Virtual Public School Program To A Private Provider And To Evaluate The Program Every Three Years Instead Of Annually; And For Related Purposes.

2619.title: School nurses; increase number eligible for salary supplement under MAEP.
2619.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Authorized Number Of School Nurses Eligible For State Salary Supplement Under The Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

2620.title: District attorneys; may employ additional legal assistants and criminal investigators if funds are received from any available source.
2620.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize District Attorneys To Employ Additional Legal Assistants Or Criminal Investigators To The Extent The District Attorney's Office Receives Funds From Any Available Source; And For Related Purposes.

2621.title: Home mortgages; prohibit certain mortgage lending practices.
2621.description: An Act To Provide Consumer Protections From Certain Mortgage Lending Practices Relating To Balloon Payments, Negative Amortization And Prepayment Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2622.title: Local law enforcement officers; authorize supplemental pay for certain.
2622.description: An Act To Authorize Extra Compensation For Commissioned Full-time Law Enforcement Officers Employed In Actually Performing Direct Law Enforcement Duties; To Specify The Amount Of The Extra Compensation; To Set Parameters For Eligibility For The Extra Compensation; To Authorize State Reimbursement Of Costs Associated With The Application For Certification By Law Enforcement Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2624.title: Corrections; authorize regional facility for Quitman County.
2624.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Contract With Quitman County For A Regional Prison; And For Related Purposes.

2625.title: Sex offender registration; revise to comply with federal mandates.
2625.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 45-33-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Registration Under The Act; To Amend Section 45-33-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Number Of Days Within Which Registration Is Required; To Create New Section 45-33-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Registration Of An Offender Housed At A Shelter During A Natural Disaster Or Other Emergency; To Amend Section 45-33-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of A Registrant To Update Registration Information; To Amend Section 45-33-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Notification Of Other Law Enforcement Agencies; To Amend Section 45-33-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For Violations; To Amend Section 45-33-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of A Registrant To Update Registration Information; To Amend Section 45-33-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Notification Given To Other Interested Parties; To Amend Section 45-33-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Registration Duties Of A Court Under The Act; To Amend Section 45-33-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Three-tier Classification Of Offenses To Correlate With The Length Of Time During Which Continuing Registration Is Required; To Amend Section 45-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Department's Responsibility To Maintain A Website And Provide Public Notice; To Amend Section 47-7-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2627.title: Public streets and highways; prohibit racing and use of nitrous oxide.
2627.description: An Act To Create Section 63-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Use Of Nitrous Oxide In Any Motor Vehicle Or Motorcycle Driven On The Streets Or Highways And To Prescribe Penalties For The Use Of Nitrous Oxide In Motor Vehicles Or Motorcycles Driven On The Streets Or Highways; To Create New Section 63-3-502, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Racing In A Motor Vehicle Or Motorcycle On Streets Or Highways; And For Related Purposes.

2628.title: Hit-and-run; revise penalties under certain circumstances.
2628.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty Imposed Upon A Hit-and-run Driver Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2629.title: Corrections; authorize regional facility for Coahoma County.
2629.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Contract With Coahoma County For A Regional Prison; And For Related Purposes.

2630.title: Defensive driving school; authorize Internet courses.
2630.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-55 And 63-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Attendance At A Defensive Driving School Offered Through The Internet Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2631.title: Individual development accounts; authorize for certain low-income individuals.
2631.description: An Act To Create The Family Savings Initiative Act; To Authorize The Creation Of Individual Development Accounts For Low-income Individuals That May Be Utilized By The Account Holder For Certain Purposes; To Authorize The Department Of Human Services To Contract With Fiduciary Organizations To Serve As Intermediaries Between Individual Development Account Holders And Financial Institutions Holding Account Funds; To Provide That The Gross Household Income Of Individual Retirement Account Holders May Not Exceed 200% Of The Poverty Level And The Account Holder's Net Worth May Not Exceed $10,000.00; To Require Individuals Opening An Individual Development Account To Enter Into An Agreement With A Fiduciary Organization; To Provide That The Fiduciary Organization Shall Provide Matching Funds For Amount Contributed To The Individual Development Account By The Individual Development Account Holder; To Limit The Amount Of Matching Funds That May Be Provided For An Individual Development Account; To Provide The Purposes For Which Individual Development Accounts May Be Utilized; To Provide Civil Penalties For The Withdrawal Of Individual Development Account Funds For Purposes Other That Those Authorized Under This Act; To Require Fiduciary Organizations To Make Quarterly Reports To The Department Of Human Services Containing Certain Information; To Provide That Funds Deposited In An Individual Development Account, Shall Not Be Counted As Income, Assets Or Resources Of The Individual In Determining Financial Eligibility For Assistance Or Services Pursuant To Any Federal, Federally Assisted, State Or Municipal Program Based On Need; To Authorize A Credit Against State Income Tax Liability For Taxpayers Who Contribute Matching Funds To A Fiduciary Organization; To Limit The Amount Of Such Credit; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income Interest Or Dividend Earned On An Individual Development Account; And For Related Purposes.

2632.title: Check casher license; applicants convicted of a felony not eligible.
2632.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Applicant Shall Not Have Been Convicted Of A Felony To Be Eligible For A Check Casher License; And For Related Purposes.

2634.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2634.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity In Connection With The Officer's Training By The Minimum Standards Training Academy; And For Related Purposes.

2635.title: Sheriff of Tunica County; authorize additional salary supplement by board of supervisors.
2635.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Salary Supplement Which May Be Paid Annually By The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County To The Sheriff Of That County; And For Related Purposes.

2637.title: Marihuana; allow medical use by seriously ill patients under doctor's supervision.
2637.description: An Act To Authorize The Medical Use Of Marihuana By Seriously Ill Patients Under A Physician's Supervision; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide An Exemption From Criminal And Civil Penalties For The Medical Use Of Marihuana; To Provide Limitations On The Medical Use Of Marihuana; To Provide A Legal Defense For Patients And Primary Caregivers; To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Marihuana From Schedule I To Schedule Ii Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marihuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2639.title: Sheriffs; bring forward law relating to annual salaries of.
2639.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Annual Salaries Of Sheriffs, For Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2641.title: Salary supplements for district attorneys, legal assistants and criminal investigators; authorize from nonstate funds.
2641.description: An Act To Codify Section 25-31-10.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Salary Supplements For District Attorneys, Legal Assistants And Criminal Investigators From Certain Nonstate Funding Sources; To Require Reporting Of Salary Supplements; And For Related Purposes.

2642.title: State Board for Community and Junior Colleges; transfer duties to Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
2642.description: An Act To Transfer The Authority And Responsibilities Of The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Promulgate Rules And Regulations For The Orderly Merger Of The Responsibilities Of The State Board For Community Colleges; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Establish An Administration Division For The Community And Junior College System In Mississippi And To Appoint An Executive Director Therefor; To Amend Sections 37-4-3, 37-4-5, 37-4-7, 37-4-9, 37-4-11, 37-4-13, 37-4-15, 37-29-1, 37-29-67, 37-29-69, 37-101-3, 37-101-15, 37-101-28, 37-15-38, 37-63-3, 37-151-17 And 37-151-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 37-4-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Commissioner Of Higher Education To Attend Meetings Of The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges; And For Related Purposes.

2643.title: Reorganization of all public school districts in MS; require one school district per county.
2643.description: An Act To Provide For The Reorganization Of All Public School Districts In The State Of Mississippi Into A System With One Countywide School District Per Each County; To Abolish Other Types Of School Districts And Reconstitute Countywide School Districts As Is Necessary To Effect Said Reorganization; To Provide That The Territory Of Any School District Located In Two Or More Counties Shall Become Added Territory To The County School District In Which The School Buildings Are Located; To Provide That Counties With Less Than 3,000 Population Shall Form A Two-county School District With An Adjoining County, And Provide For A Special School Board In Such Situations; To Require All School Boards Affected By Said Reorganization To File A Transition Plan With The State Board Of Education On July 1, 2011; To Amend Sections 37-5-1, 37-5-7 And 37-5-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require New County Board Of Education Elections In All Counties In November 2012; To Repeal Section 37-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Residents Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Qualifying For The County Board Of Education, And Section 37-5-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Election Of School Board Members From Special Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-7-103 Through 37-7-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Abolition, Alteration Or Creation Of School Districts By Local School Governing Boards Or Petition Filed By The Electorate, And Sections 37-7-501 Through 37-7-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Disposition Of Property On Dissolution Of A School District; To Repeal Sections 37-7-201 Through 37-7-229, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Selection Of Boards Of Trustees Of Municipal Separate And Consolidated School Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-6-5 And 37-6-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Title Of Public School Districts And The Composition Of School Boards; To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower County Boards Of Education To Govern Reorganized School Districts, And To Amend Sections 37-6-3, 37-6-9, 37-6-11, 37-6-13, 37-6-15, 37-7-301, 37-7-303, 37-7-305, 37-7-307, 37-7-311, 37-7-315 Through 37-7-323, 37-7-327, 37-7-329, 37-7-333, 37-7-401, 37-7-405, 37-7-409, 37-7-411, 37-7-431, 37-7-433, 37-7-435, 37-7-451, 37-7-455, 37-7-471, 37-7-475, 37-7-477, 37-7-479 And 37-7-481, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-9-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Selection Of The County Superintendent Of Education By The County Board Of Education; To Amend Sections 37-9-3, 37-9-14, 37-9-15, 37-9-17, 37-9-21 Through 37-9-27, 37-9-33, 37-9-37 Through 37-9-43, 37-9-49, 37-9-55 Through 37-9-59, 37-9-70 And 37-9-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Duties Of The County Superintendent Of Education; To Repeal Sections 37-5-61 Through 37-5-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Elective Office Of County Superintendent Of Education, And Section 37-9-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Powers And Responsibilities Of Administrative Superintendents; To Amend Sections 37-15-2, 37-15-3, 37-15-4, 37-15-8, 37-15-13, 37-15-15, 37-15-17, 37-15-21 And 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Permanent Pupil Records And Assignment Of Pupils To Schools By The Newly Reconstituted School Boards; To Amend Sections 37-57-1, 37-57-105, 37-57-107, 37-59-3, 37-59-11, 37-59-13, 37-59-17, 37-59-19, 37-59-23, 37-59-27 Through 37-59-31, 37-59-35, 37-59-37, 37-59-43, 37-59-101 Through 37-59-107, 37-59-109 And 37-59-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Sections 37-57-131 And 37-57-133, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Levy And Collection Of Ad Valorem Taxes By Municipal Governing Authorities In Annexed Territory; To Amend Section 29-3-1.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Sections 37-61-3, 37-61-9, 37-61-17, 37-61-19, 37-61-21, 37-61-23 And 37-61-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2644.title: Health care certificates of need; issue for construction of PRTF and child acute care beds in certain counties.
2644.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 30 Psychiatric Residential Treatment (prtf) Beds In Rankin County, A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 30 Psychiatric Residential Treatment (prtf) Beds In Winston County, A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 30 Psychiatric Residential Treatment (prtf) Beds In Lauderdale County, A Certificate Of Need For The Construction Or Expansion Of 20 Child/adolescent Acute Care Beds In Lauderdale County, And To Provide That 20 Child/adolescent Acute Care Beds Authorized In Winston County Are Eligible For Participation In The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2645.title: Medicaid reimbursement; authorize for licensed marriage and family therapist services.
2645.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Medicaid Reimbursement For Licensed Marriage And Family Therapist Services; And For Related Purposes.

2647.title: Public property; authorize transfer of various state-owned properties.
2647.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Transfer And Convey Certain Real Property To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Located In Harrison County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Mississippi Forestry Commission To Lease Certain State-owned Property Located In Union County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District, To Donate And Convey To The City Of Flowood And County Of Rankin, Mississippi, Required Interests In State-owned Property Necessary For The Expansion Of Old Fannin Road; To Rename The Ross Barnett Lake In Mize, Mississippi, The Prentiss Walker Lake; To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Donate And Convey Lake Dockery To The City Of Byram In Hinds County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Alcorn State University Baseball Park On The Campus Of Alcorn State University In Lorman, Mississippi, Shall Be Named The Willie E. "rat" Mcgowan, Sr., Baseball Stadium; To Provide That The Baseball Field Within The Willie E. "rat" Mcgowan Stadium Shall Be Named The William "bill" Foster Baseball Field; To Authorize The Department Of Archives And History To Proceed With The Recovery And Restoration Of An Historic Shipwreck; To Authorize The Use Of Private Funds; To Create A Special Fund For Such Purpose; To Direct Certain State Agencies To Aid The Department Of Archives And History In The Recovery And Restoration Process; And For Related Purposes.

2648.title: Natural resources; require an assessment of the value of Mississippi's natural resources.
2648.description: An Act To Require The Assessment Of The Economic Value Of The Natural Resources Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

2649.title: Fines; provide for uniform credit against fines for work performed by a convict.
2649.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-1-41, 47-1-47 And 99-19-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Uniform Credit Against Fines For Work Performed By A Convict And For Each Day Of Confinement; And For Related Purposes.

2650.title: Controlled substance; false representation a felony.
2650.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-146, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Felony Of Falsely Representing A Substance As A Controlled Substance; And For Related Purposes.

2652.title: Central business services and procurement for all public school districts; DFA Office of Shared Services administers on regional basis.
2652.description: An Act To Establish An Office Of Shared Services (oss) In The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2011, The Office Of Shared Services Shall Administer A Central Business Office For All School Districts In The State To Provide Accounting Services, Payroll Services, Human Resource Services And Pooled Insurance Coverage Services; To Provide That The Office Of Shared Services Shall Develop And Administer Regional Offices For Procurement Functions Of All School Districts In The State With Exceptions For Large School Districts; To Require The Office Of Shared Services To Develop A Transition Plan To Phase-in These Services Prior To July 1, 2014; To Require School Districts To Comply With The Plan; To Authorize Fees For Services; To Direct The Office Of Shared Services To File With The State Treasurer And The State Fiscal Officer Necessary Data And Information To Enable The Office Of Shared Services To Prepare All School District Payroll Checks And Distribute Said Payments By Electronic Funds Transfer To Each School District Employee; To Authorize The State Treasurer And The State Fiscal Officer To Jointly Promulgate Regulations For The Utilization Of Electronic Funds Transfer To School Districts For Salary Payroll Purposes; To Provide That The Regional Office Of Shared Services Shall Be The Purchasing Agent For School Districts; To Provide That Such School Districts Shall Purchase Perishables, Food, Commodities, Equipment, Supplies, Utilities, Fuel And School Buses Through The Office Of Shared Services; To Amend Sections 27-104-3, 31-7-5, 31-7-9, 31-7-12, 37-39-1, 37-39-5, 37-39-15, 37-39-17, 37-39-21, 37-39-23, 37-39-25, 37-41-101, 37-41-103 And 37-7-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 25-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Employees And Service Functions Of The Office Of Shared Services Shall Be Exempt From State Service; And For Related Purposes.

2653.title: Appropriations bills; contain lump-sum amounts not major object of expenditure.
2653.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-103-113 And 27-104-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Appropriations Bills Shall Contain Lump-sum Amounts And Shall Not Divide Appropriations By Major Object Of Expenditure; And For Related Purposes.

2655.title: Furlough Plan for State of Mississippi; require for FY2010.
2655.description: An Act To Direct The Governor To Implement A Furlough Plan For The State Of Mississippi For The Remainder Of The 2010 Fiscal Year Applicable To All State Service And Nonstate Service Employees; To Provide For State Agency Closures On Days When These Employees Are Furloughed; To Provide Exemptions For Employees And Agencies Providing Direct Patient Or Inmate Residential Care Or Providing Law Enforcement Services; To Amend Section 25-1-98, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2656.title: Terrorism; add as an aggravating circumstance for capital offenses.
2656.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add As Aggravating Factor For Capital Cases Certain Acts Of Terrorism; And For Related Purposes.

2657.title: General Educational Development (GED) program; revise entrance and testing requirements.
2657.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Entrance Requirements And Testing Requirements For The General Educational Development (ged) Program; And For Related Purposes.

2658.title: Education of exceptional children; repeal certain standards for hearings.
2658.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-23-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Standards For Hearings Regarding The Education Of Exceptional Children; And For Related Purposes.

2660.title: Sidearm; allow district attorneys and certain staff to retain upon retirement (MPA).
2660.description: An Act To Permit Retention Of One Service-issued Sidearm Upon Retirement By District Attorneys, Assistant District Attorneys, And Criminal Investigators Of District Attorneys; And For Related Purposes.

2661.title: School cafeteria workers; provide state funded insurance on a phased-in basis.
2661.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Shall Fund The Cost Of The State Health Insurance Plan For Full-time School Cafeteria Workers On A Phased-in Basis; To Require Local School Districts To Match The State Contribution To The Cost Of Such Health Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

2662.title: Medicaid reimbursement; authorize for licensed professional counselors.
2662.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Medicaid Reimbursement For Services Provided By Licensed Professional Counselors; And For Related Purposes.

2663.title: Barber Practice Act; make technical revisions to.
2663.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-5-3, 73-5-7, 73-5-8, 73-5-9, 73-5-23, 73-5-25, 73-5-27, 73-5-29, 73-5-33, 73-5-39 And 73-5-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Barber Practice Act, To Provide For An Executive Director Of The Board Of Barber Examiners; To Provide For Inspectors; To Provide Qualifications For Registration As A Barber Instructor; To Provide Qualifications For Registration As A Barber; To Provide Requirements For Display Of Barber Licenses; To Provide Grounds For License Disciplinary Action; To Provide Hearing Procedures Before The Board; To Prescribe Fees; To Revise The Definition Of The Practice Of Barbering; To Prescribe Criminal Penalties For Violations Of The Act; And For Related Purposes.

2664.title: Columbia Training School property; authorize sale or lease of certain acreage.
2664.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Department Of Human Services, To Lease Certain Real Property Located On The Columbia Training School Campus In The City Of Columbia, Marion County, Mississippi; To Amend Section 43-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center, To Donate And Convey To The Jackson Medical Mall Foundation Certain Real Property Located On Bailey Avenue In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2666.title: Election commissioners; authorize counties to pay per diem for an additional five days.
2666.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of A County, In Its Discretion, To Pay Per Diem To The Commissioners Of Election For Not To Exceed An Additional Five Days Per Year; And For Related Purposes.

2667.title: Sales tax; divert a portion derived from sales by cotton warehouses or compresses to the Boll Weevil Management Fund.
2667.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Avails Of The Sales Tax That Are Derived From Sales By Cotton Compresses Or Cotton Warehouses And That Would Otherwise Be Paid Into The General Fund, Shall Be Deposited Into The Boll Weevil Management Fund Until Such Time That The Total Amount Deposited Into The Fund During A Fiscal Year Equals $1,000,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2668.title: Mississippi School for Mathematics and Science; transfer to Mississippi School of the Arts.
2668.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-139-1 Through 37-139-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, And To Codify Section 37-139-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer And Merge The Administration And Programs Of The Mississippi School For Mathematics And Science At The Mississippi University For Women To The Mississippi School Of The Arts In Brookhaven, Mississippi, On July 1, 2011; To Provide That The Mississippi School For Mathematics And Science Shall Be Administered By The State Board Of Education Acting Through The Mississippi School Of The Arts; And For Related Purposes.

2669.title: Ignition interlock; create DUI-restricted driver's license.
2669.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Dui-restricted Driver's License To Authorize Operation Of Only A Vehicle That Is Equipped With An Ignition Interlock Device Upon A Second Or Subsequent Conviction And To Create An Opt-in Provision For A First Offense; To Amend Section 63-11-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Ignition Interlock; To Amend Section 63-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Ignition Interlock License; To Amend Section 63-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set The Fee For The Dui-restricted Driver's License And To Create The Driver's License Bureau Enhancement Fund; To Bring Forward Sections 63-1-45 And 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 63-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Term And Renewal Of The Dui-restricted Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

2670.title: Methamphetamine; revise crime of child endangerment during the manufacture process.
2670.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Child Endangerment Committed During The Process Of Methamphetamine Manufacture; And For Related Purposes.

2671.title: Minimum Standards Board; revise membership.
2671.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Minimum Standards Board; And For Related Purposes.

2672.title: Pseudoephedrine; revise offense of facilitating manufacture of methamphetamine.
2672.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Crime Of Purchasing, Possession, Transferring Or Distributing Any Amount Of Pseudoephedrine Or Ephedrine Knowing That It Will Be Used To Unlawfully Manufacture A Controlled Substance; And For Related Purposes.

2673.title: Armed Forces Absentee Voting Law; make changes to comply with federal law.
2673.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-673, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That The Spouse And Dependants Of An Absent Voter As Defined In The Armed Forces Absentee Voter Law May Register To Vote As Provided Under Such Law; To Amend Section 23-15-677, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Absent Voters Who Register To Vote Utilizing A Federal Postcard Application Or A Federal Write-in-absentee Ballot May Vote In An Election If They Were Registered To Vote 10 Or More Days Prior To The Date Of The Election; To Amend Section 23-15-687, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Application For An Absentee Ballot Under The Armed Forces Absentee Voting Law Shall Serve As A Request By The Applicant Through The Date Of The Next Federal Election Rather Than The Next Two Federal Elections; To Amend Section 23-15-692, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Upon Receipt Of A Federal Write-in-absentee Ballot Executed By A Person Who Is A Registered Voter Or Whose Information On The Form Is Sufficient To Register Or Update The Registration Of That Person, The Federal Write-in-absentee Ballot Shall Be Considered As An Absentee Ballot Request; To Amend Section 23-15-693, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Absent Voters Voting Pursuant To The Armed Forces Absentee Voting Law To Complete The Declaration Specified By The Federal Uniformed And Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act; To Amend Section 23-15-699, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Absent Voters Who Have Requested To Receive Absentee Ballots And Balloting Materials Pursuant To The Armed Forces Absentee Voting Law May Choose To Receive Such Ballots And Balloting Materials By Mail, Facsimile Device (fax) Or Electronic Mail Delivery (e-mail) And To Provide That If The Absent Voter Does Not Indicate A Preference, Delivery Shall Be By Mail; To Authorize Registrars To Receive Voted Absentee Ballots And Completed Federal Postcard Applications By Electronic Mail Delivery And To Provide Procedures For The Handling Of Such Ballots; To Amend Section 23-15-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Absent Voters Utilizing The Armed Forces Absentee Voting Law To Receive Voter Registration Information, Absentee Ballot Applications, Absentee Ballots And Other Voting Information By Contacting The Secretary Of State In The Manner Established By The Secretary Of State; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Adopt Rules To Implement The Armed Forces Absentee Voting Law And To Bring The State Into Compliance With The Federal Uniformed And Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act; To Amend Sections 23-15-125, 23-15-635, 23-15-681 And 23-15-691, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 23-15-695, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Specifies Those Persons Authorized To Administer And Attest Oaths For Absentee Ballots Under The Armed Services Absentee Voting Law; And For Related Purposes.

2676.title: Joint Legislative Study Committee on mental health system; continue authority of.
2676.description: An Act To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 552, Laws Of 2009, To Continue The Existence Of The Joint Legislative Study Committee On Improving The Mental Health System In Mississippi; To Authorize The Joint Committee To Make A Report Of Its Findings And Recommendations To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2677.title: State Employee Wellness Program; establish.
2677.description: An Act To Create A State Employee Wellness Program; To Provide For Definitions; To Establish Standards For The Wellness Program; To Authorize State Agencies To Participate In The State Employee Wellness Program; To Repeal Sections 41-97-1 Through 41-97-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorize State Agencies To Establish Employee Volunteer Wellness And Physical Fitness Programs, Prescribe The Duties Of Agencies Establishing Those Programs, And Require The State Board Of Health To Administer And Approve Those Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2678.title: Delinquent sewer utility fees; authorize certain remedies for the collection of.
2678.description: An Act To Authorize Providers Of Sewer Services To Institute Certain Remedies For The Collection Of Delinquent User Fees; And For Related Purposes.

2679.title: Interagency Coordinating Council for Children and Youth (ICCCY); define responsibilities and delete repealer.
2679.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-14-1, 43-14-3 And 43-14-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealer On The Statutes Establishing And Empowering The Interagency Coordinating Council For Children And Youth (icccy), To Expand The Membership Of The Council And To Define The Authority Of The Council To Assist Multidisciplinary Assessment And Planning (map) Teams To Become The Single Point Of Entry For Certain Children And Youth, To Clarify The Purpose Of The Mississippi Statewide System Of Care For Children With Emotional And Behavioral Disorders; And For Related Purposes.

2682.title: Credit card processing hardware or software; shall meet federal law requirements when provided to retail merchants.
2682.description: An Act To Require Business Entities Providing Credit Card Processing Hardware Or Software To Retail Merchants To Provide Such Hardware Or Software That Meets The Requirements Of Federal Law; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2683.title: Sale of Checks Act; rename "MS Money Transmitters Act" and make various amendments.
2683.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Name Of The Chapter From The "sale Of Checks Law" To The "money Transmitters Act"; To Amend Section 75-15-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms; To Amend Section 75-15-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 75-15-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions Provided In The Act; To Amend Section 75-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Applicants For Licensure Shall Not Have Been Convicted Of A Felony Or Certain Misdemeanors; To Amend Section 75-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Surety Bond Requirement For Licensees; To Amend Sections 75-15-13, 75-15-15 And 75-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 75-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Licensees To Submit Reports Of Outstanding Money Transmissions On A Monthly Basis And To Require Licensees To Maintain Certain Records; To Amend Section 75-15-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 75-15-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Limitation On The Total Amount In Outstanding Money Transmissions Or Checks Of Licensees; To Amend Section 75-15-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A License Shall Be Automatically And Finally Revoked Upon Failure By Licensee To File When Due Certain Information Required By Law; To Amend Section 75-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Amount By Which The Commissioner May Increase The Surety Bond Or Deposit Required By Licensees; To Amend Section 75-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Create A New Section To Require Certain Licensees To Possess Permissible Investments Having An Aggregate Market Value Of Not Less Than The Aggregate Amount Of Outstanding Checks; To Create A New Section To Require Each Licensee To Comply With State And Federal Money Laundering Laws; And For Related Purposes.

2684.title: Headlights; require use of when windshield wipers necessary.
2684.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Headlights Of Vehicles Shall Be Operated Whenever Conditions Necessitate The Use Of Windshield Wipers; And For Related Purposes.

2685.title: Federal Workforce Investment Act; Hinds County is separate workforce investment area.
2685.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Hinds County Shall Be A Separate Workforce Investment Area Under The Federal Workforce Investment Act; And For Related Purposes.

2686.title: Construction contracts; require a set-aside for small businesses.
2686.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Set Aside 20% Of The Amount Expended For Any Public Construction Project That The Department Manages, Not To Exceed $5,000,000.00, To Small Contractors; To Award Such Set-aside Contracts To The Lowest And Best Small Contractor Bidder; To Define The Term "small Contractor"; And For Related Purposes.

2687.title: Mississippi Armed Forces Museum; designate as Mississippi's official state military history museum.
2687.description: An Act To Designate The Mississippi Military Department's Armed Forces Museum As Mississippi's Official State Military History Museum; And For Related Purposes.

2688.title: Uniform Prudent Management of Institutional Funds Act; enact.
2688.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Prudent Management Of Institutional Funds Act; To Enact A Short Title; To Create Definitions; To Set The Standard Of Conduct In Managing And Investing Institutional Funds; To Enact Default Rules Of Construction; To Provide For The Delegation Of Management And Investment Functions; To Provide For The Release Or Modification Of Restrictions On Management, Investment Or Purpose; To Specify In What Way Compliance With The Act Will Be Determined; To Make Transition Provisions; To Provide For The Relationship Of The Act To Certain Other Laws; To Provide For Uniformity Of Application And Construction; To Repeal Sections 79-11-601 Through 79-11-617, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constitute The Uniform Management Of Institutional Funds Act; And For Related Purposes.

2689.title: Revenue from leasing of channels awarded by the FCC; are public funds expendable by the state agency leasing the channels.
2689.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-63-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Revenue Generated By The Leasing Of Channels Awarded By The Federal Communications Commission To A State Agency Are Public Funds And May Be Expended By The Leasing Agency Pursuant To Law; And For Related Purposes.

2690.title: Central business functions; payroll and purchases for all state agencies; establish DFA Office of Shared Services.
2690.description: An Act To Establish An Office Of Shared Services (oss) In The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2010, The Office Of Shared Services Shall Establish A Central Business Office For All State Agencies In The State; To Provide Shared Business Services; To Require The Office Of Shared Services To Develop A Business Case And Transition Plan To Phase-in These Services Prior To July 1, 2014; To Require State Agencies To Comply With The Plan; To Authorize Fees For Services; To Amend Section 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 25-9-108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Employees And Service Functions Of The Office Of Shared Services Shall Be Exempt From State Service Until July 1, 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2692.title: Seventh Chancery District; delay election of third Chancellor.
2692.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay The Election Of A Third Judge For The Seventh Chancery District; And For Related Purposes.

2693.title: Student vaccination requirements; provide for exemptions based on physician opinion or parent/guardian bona fide belief.
2693.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Provide For A Certificate Of Exemption From Student Vaccination Based Upon The Opinion Of A Licensed Physician Or The Bona Fide Belief Of The Parent Or Guardian That A Vaccine Or Immunization Is Inappropriate For The Child; And For Related Purposes.

2694.title: Registered nurse and LPN; require fingerprint-based criminal history check.
2694.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-19 And 73-15-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Applicants For Licensure As A Registered Nurse Or Licensed Practical Nurse To Undergo A Fingerprint-based Criminal History Check; To Amend Section 73-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Nursing, Upon Reasonable Suspicion That A Licensee Has Violated Any Statutory Ground For Denial Of Licensure Or Is Guilty Of Any Of Certain Offenses, To Require The Licensee To Undergo A Fingerprint-based Criminal History Records Check In The Same Manner As Required For Applicants For Licensure; And For Related Purposes.

2695.title: Traffic tickets; clarify time of filing in certain circumstances and revise authority to prescribe form of ticket.
2695.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Filing Of Traffic Tickets With The Clerk Of Court Under The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law And To Revise The Duties Of The State Auditor With Regard To The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law, Giving Additional Responsibility To The Commissioner Of Public Safety And Revising The Reporting Duties Of The Court Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2696.title: Driver's license; revise punishment for driving without.
2696.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Punishment For Driving With A Suspended Driver's License To The Punishment For Driving Without A Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

2697.title: BUI; conform BAC and punishment to DUI.
2697.description: An Act To Amend Sections 59-23-3 And 59-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Standard For Intoxication And Punishments Under The Alcohol Boating Safety Act To The Same Standards For Driving Under The Influence Under Traffic Laws; And For Related Purposes.

2698.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of the University of Mississippi Medical Center.
2698.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fees; And For Related Purposes.

2699.title: State land mammal; designate black bear as.
2699.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The American Black Bear As One Of The State Land Mammals; And For Related Purposes.

2700.title: Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; add two board members from the City of Jackson.
2700.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Governor Shall Appoint Two Members From The City Of Jackson To Serve On The Board Of Directors Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District From A List Of Six Names Submitted By The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson; And For Related Purposes.

2702.title: Wind Pool Reinsurance Assistance Fund; increase amount of insurance premium tax diverted to the fund.
2702.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-34-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Insurance Premium Tax Revenues That Will Be Deposited Annually Into The Mississippi Windstorm Underwriting Association Reinsurance Assistance Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2703.title: Old School for the Blind property; delete provision requiring Secretary of State approval before lease of.
2703.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2007, To Remove The Provision Requiring Approval By The Secretary Of State Before Final Execution Of The Lease Of Certain Real Property, Formerly Known As The "old School For The Blind", Located In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2704.title: Limited liability companies; require annual reports.
2704.description: An Act To Create New Section 79-29-215, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Domestic And Foreign Limited Liability Companies To File An Annual Report; To Create New Section 79-29-821, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Liability Company Under Certain Circumstances; To Create New Section 79-29-823, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Procedure For Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-29-825, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Following Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-29-827, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appeal From A Denial Of Reinstatement; To Create New Section 79-29-831, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Various Effects Of Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-29-1021, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Create New Section 79-29-1023, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Procedure For Administrative Dissolution Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Create New Section 79-29-1025, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company Following Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-29-1027, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appeal From A Denial Of Reinstatement Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Amend Section 79-29-1203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Charged In Reference To Certain Filings Under The Limited Liability Company Act; And For Related Purposes.

2705.title: Coroners; allow to carry a concealed weapon without a permit.
2705.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Coroners To Carry A Concealed Weapon Without A Permit; And For Related Purposes.

2706.title: Pseudoephedrine; revise sales of and recordkeeping.
2706.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sales And Electronic Tracking Of Sales Of Pseudoephedrine And Ephedrine; To Amend Section 41-29-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2707.title: Drug violations; enhance penalties when children under 18 are present.
2707.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Potential Punishment For Certain Drug Violations In Cases Where A Child Under The Age Of 18 Is Present During The Violation; And For Related Purposes.

2708.title: State lottery; create and provide for the distribution of revenue from.
2708.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create A Special Fund Into Which A Portion Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited And To Provide That Of The Proceeds Of The Lottery That Are Deposited Into The Special Fund The Legislature Shall Appropriate 25% To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Be Used For The Support Of Institutions Of Higher Learning, 25% To The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Be Used For The Support Of Public Community And Junior Colleges, 25% To The State Board Of Education For The Support Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program, 10% To The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety, 10% To The Mississippi Department Of Revenue And 5% To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2709.title: Income tax; increase rate of tax.
2709.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The State Income Tax By Providing That All Taxable Income In Excess Of $15,000.00 Shall Be Taxed At The Rate Of Six Percent; And For Related Purposes.

2710.title: Municipal cleaning costs; collected as for delinquent municipal taxes when unpaid by property owner.
2710.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Unpaid Municipal Assessments Levied For The Costs Of Cleaning Property Shall Become Delinquent And Shall Be Collected In The Same Manner And At The Same Time As Municipal Taxes; To Provide That A Fee May Be Retained When Collected By The County Tax Collector; And For Related Purposes.

2711.title: State Truth Commission; establish.
2711.description: An Act To Create The State Truth Commission; To Prescribe Powers And Duties Of The Commission; To Provide For The Establishment Of Procedures To Investigate Grievances Registered With The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2712.title: Agent for service of process; Model Registered Agents Act (ULC).
2712.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Registered Agents Act; To Create New Section 79-35-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 79-35-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 79-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees And Allow The Secretary Of State To Reduce Fees For Electronic Filings Under The Act; To Create New Section 79-35-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Standards For Street And Mailing Addresses Used In Registering Under The Act; To Create New Section 79-35-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of A Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Listing Of A Commercial Registered Agent;
