To Create New Section 79-35-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Termination Of Listing Of A Commercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Change In Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Change Of Name Or Address By A Noncommercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Change Of Name, Address Or Business Type By A Commercial Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Resignation Of A Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of An Agent By A Nonfiling Or Nonqualified Foreign Entity; To Create New Section 79-35-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Service Of Process On Entities And To Specify Procedures When Service Cannot Be Had; To Create New Section 79-35-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Duties Of A Registered Agent; To Create New Section 79-35-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Appointment Of An Agent Does Not Confer Jurisdiction Or Determine Venue; To Create New Section 79-35-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct Uniformity With Other States In The Construction Of The Act; To Create New Section 79-35-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Relationship Between This Act And The Electronic Signatures Act; To Create New Section 79-35-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Savings Clause; To Create New Section 79-35-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Penalties For Violation Of The Act; To Amend Sections 79-4-1.20, 79-4-1.22, 79-4-1.25, 79-4-1.26, 79-4-1.41, 79-4-2.02, 79-4-7.03, 79-4-7.04, 79-4-7.20, 79-4-7.48, 79-4-8.09, 79-4-10.05, 79-4-11.07, 79-4-13.30, 79-4-14.07, 79-4-14.08, 79-4-14.20, 79-4-14.21, 79-4-14.22, 79-4-14.23, 79-4-14.31, 79-4-15.03, 79-4-15.04, 79-4-15.10, 79-4-15.20, 79-4-15.30, 79-4-15.31, 79-4-15.32, 79-4-15.33, 79-4-16.04, 79-4-16.05, 79-4-16.22, 79-11-109, 79-11-115, 79-11-117, 79-11-131, 79-11-137, 79-11-201, 79-11-213, 79-11-289, 79-11-299, 79-11-327, 79-11-345, 79-11-347, 79-11-349, 79-11-351, 79-11-353, 79-11-355, 79-11-357, 79-11-367, 79-11-369, 79-11-381, 79-11-383, 79-11-385, 79-11-389, 79-11-391 And 79-13-1001, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-13-1003, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Liability Partnership; To Create New Section 79-13-1004, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow For A Limited Liability Partnership To Correct Deficiencies In Order To Avoid Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-13-1005, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of A Limited Liability Partnership Following Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-13-1006, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Denial Of Reinstatement; To Amend Section 79-13-1102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-13-1106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Notice Of Pending Revocation Of Qualification Of A Foreign Limited Liability Partnership; To Create New Section 79-13-1107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Revocation Of Foreign Qualification; To Create New Section 79-13-1108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of Qualification Of A Foreign Limited Liability Partnership; To Create New Section 79-13-1109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Denial Of Reinstatement Of A Foreign Limited Liability Partnership; To Amend Sections 79-14-104, 79-14-201, 79-14-202, 79-14-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-14-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-810, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Notice Of Pending Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-811, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Following Administration Dissolution Of A Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-812, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Notice Following Denial Of Reinstatement; To Amend Section 79-14-902, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-14-910, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Revocation Of Registration Of A Foreign Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-911, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Revocation Of Registration Of A Foreign Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-912, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Following Revocation Of Registration Of A Foreign Limited Partnership; To Create New Section 79-14-913, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Denial Of Reinstatement; To Amend Sections 79-14-1104, 79-15-109, 79-15-129, 79-15-131, 79-15-135, 79-16-11, 79-16-27, 79-16-29, 79-16-33, 79-29-201 And 79-29-206, Mississippi Code Of 1972, 79-29-207, 79-29-214, 79-29-802, 79-29-803, 79-29-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-29-821, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Administrative Dissolution Of A Limited Liability Company; To Create New Section 79-29-823, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-29-825, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement After Administrative Dissolution; To Create New Section 79-29-827, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appeal Of Denial Of Reinstatement; To Create New Section 79-29-831, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Effect Of Dissolution Of A Limited Liability Company; To Bring Forward Section 79-29-913, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Court's Appraisal Of Membership Interests; To Amend Sections 79-29-923 And 79-29-1002, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Create New Section 79-29-1021, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Revocation Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Create New Section 79-29-1023, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Procedure For Revocation Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Create New Section 79-29-1025, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Create New Section 79-29-1027, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Appeal Of Denial Of Reinstatement Of A Foreign Limited Liability Company; To Amend Section 79-29-1203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Fees; To Repeal Sections 79-4-5.01, 79-4-5.02, 79-4-5.03, And 79-4-5.04, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For A Registered Agent Maintaining A Registered Office, For The Change Of The Registered Office Of A Registered Agent, For The Resignation Of A Registered Agent, For Service Of Process On A Corporation, And Which Collectively Constitute Article 5, Office And Agent, Of The Mississippi Business Corporation Act; To Repeal Section 79-4-15.07, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Registered Office Of A Registered Agent Of A Foreign Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-4-15.08, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Change Of An Officer Or Registered Agent Of A Foreign Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-4-15.09, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Resignation Of A Registered Agent Of A Foreign Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Nonprofit Corporation Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-11-165, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Nonprofit Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-167, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Resignation Of A Nonprofit Corporation's Registered Agent; To Repeal Section 79-11-169, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Nonprofit Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-375, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Foreign Nonprofit Corporation Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-11-377, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Foreign Nonprofit Corporation; To Repeal Section 79-11-379, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Or The Resignation Of A Foreign Nonprofit Corporation's Registered Agent; To Repeal Section 79-15-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Foreign Investment Trust Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-15-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Or Resignation Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Foreign Investment Trust; To Repeal Section 79-15-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Foreign Investment Trust; To Repeal Section 79-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Foreign Business Trust Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-16-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Change Or Resignation Of Registered Office Or Registered Agent By A Foreign Business Trust; To Repeal Section 79-16-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Foreign Business Trust; To Repeal Section 79-29-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That A Limited Liability Company Maintain A Registered Office And Registered Agent Within The State; To Repeal Section 79-29-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Service Of Process Upon A Limited Liability Company; And For Related Purposes.

2714.title: Noncitizens; define requirements for issuing driver's license or nondriver ID.
2714.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-43 And 63-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Requirements For Issuing Or Renewing A Noncitizen's Driver's License; To Amend Section 45-35-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Requirements For Issuing A Noncitizen's Nondriver Identification Card; And For Related Purposes.

2715.title: Sales taxation; reduce rate on sales of unprepared food for human consumption.
2715.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Be Codified As Section 27-65-26.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Sales Tax On Retail Sales Of Unprepared Food For Human Consumption To 6-1/2% Through June 30, 2014, And To 6% Thereafter; To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2716.title: Mississippi Health Insurance Exchange Act; enact.
2716.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Health Insurance Exchange Act Of 2010"; To Provide Definitions; To Establish The Mississippi Health Insurance Exchange As An Instrumentality Of The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Appointment Of A Board Of Directors Of The Exchange And Empower The Board To Appoint An Executive Director And Organize For Business; To Prescribe The Powers And Responsibilities Of The Exchange; To Provide For Enrollment And Coverage Election Under The Program; To Provide Requirements For Participation Of Plans In The Exchange; To Prescribe Underwriting Rules For The Exchange; To Provide For Continuation Of Coverage; To Provide For Dispute Resolution; To Provide For Participating Employer Plans; To Provide For The Payment Of Commissions To Insurance Producers; To Bring Forward Sections 83-61-1 Through 83-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Known As The "voluntary Basic Health Insurance Coverage Law", For Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2717.title: Institutions that train gaming employees; delete requirement that employees and students must be Mississippi residents.
2717.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires All Employees And Students Of Schools Or Training Institutions That Teach Or Train Gaming Employees To Be Residents Of The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2718.title: Ad valorem taxes; remove the provision that prescribes the manner in which affordable rental housing must be appraised.
2718.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-50, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Prescribes The Manner In Which The Appraisal Of Affordable Rental Housing Shall Be Made For The Purpose Of Arriving At The True Value Of The Property; And For Related Purposes.

2719.title: State funds; transfer certain sums to BCF to restore portion of FY10 budget cuts.
2719.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Certain Sums To The Budget Contingency Fund During Fiscal Year 2010 For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Restore A Portion Of The Budget Cuts Made To Certain Agencies During Fiscal Year 2010; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Specified Sums To Certain Agencies From The Amount Transferred To The Budget Contingency Fund; To Authorize The Agencies To Which The Funds Are Transferred To Escalate Their Budgets And Expend Those Funds For The Purposes Authorized By Law, Subject To Certain Conditions; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer A Certain Sum To The School District Emergency Assistance Fund And To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Escalate The Appropriate Budget By That Amount And Expend That Sum For The Purposes Authorized By Law, Subject To Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2720.title: "Austin James Watkins" Out-of-Home Abuse and Neglect Investigations Unit in the Department of Human Services; establish.
2720.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The "austin James Watkins" Out-of-home Abuse And Neglect Investigations Unit (ohan) Within The Department Of Human Services To Monitor And Investigate Allegations Of Abuse Or Neglect Of Children In Foster Homes Or Relative Care; And For Related Purposes.

2723.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program; increase funding for at-risk pupils.
2723.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Allotment Of Mississippi Adequate Education Program Funding For At-risk Students; And For Related Purposes.

2724.title: Ad valorem school taxes; no annual publication requirements if no millage rate increase is proposed.
2724.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Required Newspaper Publication For The School Board's Annual Ad Valorem Tax Assessment For The Support Of The School District Shall Not Be Required If No Millage Rate Increase Is Proposed; And For Related Purposes.

2725.title: Public purchasing laws and regulations; Board of Trustees IHL may adopt purchasing regulations for member institutions.
2725.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-7-1, 31-7-5, 31-7-7 And 31-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Be Exempt From The Rules And Regulations Of The Department Of Finance And Administration Regarding The Purchase Of Commodities, And To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Adopt Such Purchasing Regulations For Member Institutions; And For Related Purposes.

2726.title: Research and Development Center; increase assessment charged by IHL for services.
2726.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-141-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Assessment Charged By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Services At The Research And Development Center In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2728.title: Teacher salary experience increments; suspend for 2 years.
2728.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Suspend The Annual Experience Increment For Certified School Employees For A Two-year Period; And For Related Purposes.

2729.title: Mississippi Education Achievement Council; establish to set higher education benchmarks.
2729.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Education Achievement Council To Set And Monitor Higher Education Goals; To Direct The Institutions Of Higher Learning And Community Colleges To Assist The Council And Publish Annual Reports As Required; And For Related Purposes.

2730.title: Distinctive license tags; authorize for supporters of certain high schools in Jones County.
2730.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of West Jones High School, South Jones High School, Northeast Jones High School And Laurel High School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of Such Fees; And For Related Purposes.

2732.title: Administrative merger of MVSU with JSU; direct IHL to implement.
2732.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Promulgate Rules And Regulations For The Orderly Merger Of The Administration Of Mississippi Valley State University With Jackson State University; To Amend Sections 37-127-1, 37-127-3, 37-127-5 And 37-127-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto And To Provide That Mississippi Valley State University Shall Be A Distinct Campus Of Jackson State University; To Amend Section 37-101-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-101-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Study The Scope Of University Programs And Consolidate Programs Which Are Duplicative Or Not Cost-effective; And For Related Purposes.

2733.title: Mississippi University for Women; Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning may change name in its discretion.
2733.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-117-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, In Its Discretion, To Change The Legal Name Of Mississippi University For Women And That Such Name Change Will Not Affect The Rights, Powers And Prerogatives Of Said University; And For Related Purposes.

2734.title: Tourism; revise definition of tourism project for purposes of tourism project sales tax incentive program.
2734.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Term "tourism Project" For Purposes Of The Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program To Provide That The Term May Include Historical Resort Developments; To Define The Term "historical Resort Development;" And For Related Purposes.

2735.title: Board of Mental Health; contract with Region 7 Community Mental Health to operate crisis center in Brookhaven.
2735.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-4-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Mental Health To Contract With The Region 7 Community Mental Health Center For The Purpose Of Operating The Crisis Intervention Center At Brookhaven, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2737.title: Municipalities; change the date upon which elected municipal officers take office.
2737.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-5-23, 21-8-7 And 21-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Date Upon Which Elected Municipal Officers Take Office From The First Monday In July To The First Day In July That Does Not Occur On A Weekend; To Amend Sections 21-5-13 And 21-8-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2738.title: Wildlife; remove the requirement that a veteran's total disability must be service related to qualify for license exemption.
2738.description: An Act To Amend Sections 49-7-5 And 49-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That A License Exemption For A Totally Disabled Veteran Must Be Service Related; To Provide That A Totally Disabled Veteran Has To Present Proof Of His Disability To The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Only Once; And For Related Purposes.

2739.title: County court administrators; salary paid directly by county.
2739.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of The County Court Administrator Shall Be Paid By The Participating County Directly To The Administrator In The Same Manner As Other County Employees Are Compensated; And For Related Purposes.

2740.title: Petroleum Products Inspection Law of MS; revise penalties and extend repealer on definitions.
2740.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-55-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Definitions And Specifications Under The Petroleum Products Inspection Law Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 75-55-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For Violations Of Such Law And To Provide For Its Repeal; And For Related Purposes.

2741.title: Administrative merger of ASU with JSU; direct IHL to implement.
2741.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Promulgate Rules And Regulations For The Orderly Merger Of The Administration Of Alcorn State University With Jackson State University; To Amend Sections 37-121-1, 37-121-3, 37-121-5 And 37-121-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto And To Provide That Alcorn State University Shall Be A Distinct Campus Of Jackson State University; To Amend Section 37-101-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-101-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Study The Scope Of University Programs And Consolidate Programs Which Are Duplicative Or Not Cost-effective; And For Related Purposes.

2742.title: Nationally accredited proprietary schools; may follow federal standards for faculty.
2742.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-60-5 And 73-7-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Nationally Accredited Proprietary Schools Are Authorized To Follow Federal Standards For Hiring And Training Faculty; And For Related Purposes.

2743.title: Ad valorem taxes; revise advertising requirements when county proposes no millage increase.
2743.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Form And Content Of The Required Newspaper Advertisement When A County's Proposed Ad Valorem Tax Assessment For The Support Of The County Does Not Require Any Increase In Its Current Millage Rate; And For Related Purposes.

2744.title: Institutions of higher learning; authorize to dispose of real property.
2744.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-117-1, 37-119-1, 37-123-1, 37-125-1 And 37-127-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Mississippi University For Women, The University Of Southern Mississippi, Delta State University, Jackson State University And Mississippi Valley State University To Sell Real Estate And Personal Property Conveyed Or Given To Them; And For Related Purposes.

2746.title: Mississippi Interpreter Registration Law; clarify confidentiality, update definitions, etc.
2746.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-33-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Confidential Relationship Between Deaf, Hard Of Hearing Or Deafblind Consumers And The Person Who Engages The Services Of An Interpreter, To Revise The Definition Of Certification Entities, To Revise Qualifications For Registration As An Interpreter, To Provide That The Registering Authority Shall Provide Quality Assurance Evaluation For The Interpreter Registration Program; And For Related Purposes.

2747.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize for supporters of running in Mississippi.
2747.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag For Supporters Of Running In The State Of Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tag; To Provide That A Portion Of Such Fee Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund And Shall Be Available For Expenditure At The Discretion Of The Mississippi Athletic Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2748.title: Homemade beer; authorize making of homemade beer for domestic or household uses.
2748.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Every Person Who Is 21 Years Of Age Or Older Shall Have The Right To Make Homemade Beer For Domestic Or Household Uses; To Provide That Homemade Beer Made For Domestic Or Household Use Is Not Subject To Taxation; To Limit The Amount Of Homemade Beer That May Be Produced In Any One Calendar Year; To Authorize The Removal Of Homemade Beer From The Location Where It Is Made For Family Or Domestic Uses And To Authorize Homemade Beer To Be Taken To Organized Events, Exhibitions Or Competitions; To Make It Clear That Homemade Wine Or Beer May Not Be Offered For Sale; And For Related Purposes.

2749.title: Youth court; transportation and treatment costs post commitment.
2749.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-615, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Cost Of Transporting Or Housing Any Child Committed To Any Institution Or Other Agency Shall Be Paid By The County Or Municipality From Which The Charge Of Delinquency, Abuse, Or Neglect Arises; And For Related Purposes.

2750.title: Long-arm statute; revise completion of service of process.
2750.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-3-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Service Of Process That Is Mailed Under The Automobile Collision Long-arm Statute Shall Be Complete Upon Filing Of Evidence That The Mail Was Not Able To Be Delivered Due To Actions Taken Or Not Taken By The Defendant; And For Related Purposes.

2751.title: Pseudoephedrine or ephedrine; include in Schedule III.
2751.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Ephedrine And Pseudoephedrine As A Schedule Iii Controlled Substance; To Amend Sections 41-29-313 And 41-29-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 41-29-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Restricts The Over-the-counter Purchase And Sale Of Ephedrine And Pseudoephedrine; And For Related Purposes.

2752.title: Cellular phone charges; customer not liable for charges that result from unauthorized use of phone.
2752.description: An Act To Provide That A Customer Shall Not Be Liable For Cellular Phone Charges Imposed By A Wireless Service Provider That Result From The Unauthorized Use Of The Customer's Cellular Phone; And For Related Purposes.

2754.title: CON; authorize transfer of beds from Hancock County and new CON in Lamar County.
2754.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Transfer And Relocate Nursing Facility Beds Formerly Licensed In Hancock County To Three Locations In Stone, Lamar And Hancock Counties; To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For Nursing Facility Beds In Lamar County; And For Related Purposes.

2755.title: Law Enforcement Officers Disability Trust Fund; expand coverage to include disability benefits for emergency management personnel.
2755.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

2756.title: Continuing legal education; legislators exempt.
2756.description: An Act To Exempt Members Of The Legislature From Mandatory Continuing Legal Education Requirements; To Provide Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2757.title: Motor vehicles; allow ER physicians to use blinking, oscillating or rotating red lights when responding to an emergency.
2757.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Emergency Room Physicians To Use Blinking, Oscillating Or Rotating Red Lights When Responding To An Emergency; And For Related Purposes.

2758.title: Electric utility companies; shall establish a renewable portfolio standard goal of 10% of sales by 2015.
2758.description: An Act To Require Each Electric Utility Company That Sells Electricity For Consumption In This State To Establish A Renewable Portfolio Standard Goal Of 10% Of Its Net Electricity Sales By January 1, 2015; To Authorize The Public Service Commission To Provide Incentives To Encourage Electric Utility Companies To Exceed Their Renewable Portfolio Standards Or To Meet Their Renewable Portfolio Standards Ahead Of Time, Or Both; And For Related Purposes.

2760.title: Counterfeit products; clarify offense of sale of.
2760.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-21-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Application Of The Offense Of The Sale Of Goods Bearing Counterfeit Stamps Or Labels; And For Related Purposes.

2764.title: Bail agents; revise.
2764.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Licensed Bail Agents Shall Not Need An Officer's Approval As A Surety; To Amend Section 99-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Forfeiture Of Bond; To Amend Section 99-5-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Arrest And Surrender Of The Principal; To Amend Section 21-23-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Forfeiture Of Bond And Revocation Of The Authority To Write Bond; And For Related Purposes.

2765.title: Bail agents; revise licensure laws.
2765.description: An Act To Amend Sections 83-39-1, 83-39-3 And 83-39-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Definition Of Professional Bail Agent; To Prohibit Certain Relatives Of Agents From Writing Bonds; To Require Criminal Background Checks; To Provide For License Revocation For Impersonating A Bail Agent; To Bring Forward Sections 83-39-27 And 83-39-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2767.title: Insurance rate filings; revise effective date when Commissioner of Insurance needs extension to consider filing.
2767.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-2-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Effective Date Of Certain Rate Filings When The Commissioner Of Insurance Has Given Notice That An Extension Is Necessary To Consider The Filing; And For Related Purposes.

2768.title: Workers' Compensation Commission; shall adopt regulations requiring employee safety program.
2768.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Workers' Compensation Commission, Instead Of The Commissioner Of Insurance, Shall Adopt Rules And Regulations To Require Insurers To Establish A Safety Program For The Employees Of The Insured Employer; And For Related Purposes.

2770.title: Insurance companies; revise risk-based capital level requirements.
2770.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-5-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions For Certain Terms As They Relate To Risk-based Capital Level Requirements For Insurance Companies; To Amend Section 83-5-403, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions Of Law Related To An Excess In Capital Over The Rbc Requirements For Insurance Companies; To Amend Section 83-5-405, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "company Action Level Event"; To Amend Section 83-5-415, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions Of Law Related To The Confidentiality Of Submitted Rbc Reports And Plans; And For Related Purposes.

2771.title: Insurance companies; revise statutory classifications by deleting the home warranty class.
2771.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-19-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Home Warranty Class From The List Of Classifications For Which Insurance Companies May Be Formed; To Create A New Section To Provide That Any Privilege License Issued Under The Insurance Code Shall Be Effective On The Date The License Is Issued; And For Related Purposes.

2773.title: Seventh Chancery District; appoint special or family masters.
2773.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Chancellors Of The Seventh Chancery District To Appoint Special Or Family Masters; And For Related Purposes.

2774.title: Public water systems; delete repealer on requirement to maintain optimum corrosion inhibitor levels.
2774.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-26-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Requirement That Public Water Systems Maintain Optimum Corrosion Inhibitor Levels; And For Related Purposes.

2777.title: Hamlets; revise law regulating.
2777.description: An Act To Amend Sections 17-27-1, 17-27-3, 17-27-5, 17-27-7, 17-27-9 And 17-27-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Municipal Hamlet Act; And For Related Purposes.

2778.title: Alcoholic beverages, light wine and beer; allow municipalities in dry county to vote on legalizing sales of in the municipality.
2778.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Municipality With A Population Of Not Less Than 5,000 According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census That Is Located In A County That Has Voted Against Coming Out From Under The Dry Law May Conduct A Local Option Election On The Question Of Whether Alcoholic Beverages May Be Sold Or Possessed In The Municipality; To Provide That If A Municipality That Has Voted To Permit The Sale, And The Receipt, Storage And Transportation For The Purpose Of Sale, Of Alcoholic Beverages Extends Its Boundaries Into A County That Has Voted Against Coming Out From Under The Dry Law, Then The Sale, And The Receipt, Storage And Transportation For The Purpose Of Sale, Of Alcoholic Beverages Shall Not Be Permitted In The Portion Of Such Municipality Extended Into Such A County Unless Authorized By An Election Held For That Purpose After The Date The Boundaries Of Such Municipality Are Extended Into Such A County; To Amend Section 67-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any City To Conduct A Local Option Election On The Question Of Whether Light Wine And Beer May Be Sold Orpossessed In The Municipality; To Provide That If A Municipality That Has Voted To Permit The Sale, And The Receipt, Storage And Transportation For The Purpose Of Sale, Of Beer Of An Alcoholic Content Of Not More Than 5% By Weight Extends Its Boundaries Into A County That Has Voted Against Allowing The Transportation, Storage, Sale, Distribution, Receipt And/or Manufacture Of Beer Of An Alcoholic Content Of Not More Than 5%, Then The Sale, And The Receipt, Storage And Transportation For The Purpose Of Sale, Of Beer Of An Alcoholic Content Of Not More Than 5% By Weight Shall Not Be Permitted In The Portion Of Such Municipality Extended Into Such A County Unless Authorized By An Election Held For That Purpose After The Date The Boundaries Of Such Municipality Are Extended Into Such A County; And For Related Purposes.

2782.title: Insurance Integrity Enforcement Bureau; bring forward provisions for purpose of amendment.
2782.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 7-5-301, 7-5-303, 7-5-305, 7-5-307 And 7-5-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Insurance Integrity Enforcement Bureau Within The Office Of The Attorney General, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2784.title: Income tax; authorize payment of certain large tax liabilities in monthly installments over 60 months.
2784.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Payment Of Certain State Income Tax Liability In Installments Over A Period Of Not To Exceed 60 Months If The Amount Of The Tax Liability Is In Excess Of $3,000.00 And The Taxpayer Has Entered Into An Installment Agreement With The Internal Revenue Service To Pay Federal Income Taxes On Income Earned During The Same Taxable Year During Which The State Income Tax Liability Was Incurred; And For Related Purposes.

2785.title: State and local government cafeteria plans; salary reductions may be used to pay reasonable administrative expenses.
2785.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Employee Salary Reductions May Be Used To Pay Reasonable Cafeteria Plan Administrative Expenses; And For Related Purposes.

2786.title: State Fire Academy; cities and counties providing certain fire service personnel training shall coordinate with.
2786.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-11-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Municipalities And Counties Providing Training To Fire Service Personnel Outside Of Their Jurisdiction Shall Coordinate Such Efforts With The State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

2787.title: Alcoholic beverages; allow direct shipment of certain wines, authorize a wine only package retailer's permit and allow wine tasting.
2787.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Persons Domiciled Outside This State To Lawfully Ship Directly To Package Retailers Those Manufactured Wines That Are Not Listed By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division As A Part Of Its Inventory And Distribution Operation; To Provide That Such Manufactured Wine Must Be Purchased Through The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue; To Require Package Retailers To Pay The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division For The Manufactured Wine And Pay All Taxes, Fees And Markups Imposed On The Manufactured Wine Prior To Any Such Shipment; To Require A Person 21 Years Of Age Or Older To Sign For Manufactured Wine Shipped To A Package Retailer Under This Act; To Require Shipments Of Manufactured Wine Into This State Under This Act To Be Made By A Duly Licensed Carrier; To Make It Clear That All Taxes, Fees And Surcharges That Are Imposed Upon The Sale Of Wine Shipped By The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division Of The Department Of Revenue Apply To Wine Shipped Under This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Issuance Of A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; To Authorize The Holder Of A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit To Offer Wine Samples To Customers Pursuant To Regulations Established By The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Fee For A Wine Only Package Retailer's Permit; To Amend Sections 27-71-15 And 67-1-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2790.title: Pseudoephedrine; tracking system for sales of.
2790.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Tracking System To Track Sales Of Pseudoephedrine And Ephedrine; To Require Certain Information To Be Recorded Regarding Such Sales; To Provide Access To The Tracking System For Law Enforcement; To Authorize The Attorney General To Promulgate Rules And Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

2793.title: Records of floor debate in both houses of the Legislature; to be available under the Open Records Law.
2793.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2011 Regular Session Of The Legislature, The Secretary Of The Mississippi Senate And The Clerk Of The House Of Representatives Shall Maintain Records Of The Floor Debate In Their Respective Houses And Make Such Records Available To The Public Under The Open Records Law; And For Related Purposes.

2795.title: DUI; revise imposition of minimum penalties against minors.
2795.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Imposition Of Minimum Penalties Against Minors In Dui Cases; And For Related Purposes.

2796.title: DUI; authorize drug or alcohol treatment in lieu of imprisonment.
2796.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize House Arrest At A Treatment Facility As Confinement Under The Act; And For Related Purposes.

2797.title: Judges, district attorneys, assistant district attorneys and criminal investigators; revise.

2798.title: Online voter registration; require the Secretary of State to study and report on the cost and feasibility of.
2798.description: An Act To Require The Secretary Of State To Conduct A Study To Determine The Cost And Feasibility Of A System That Would Allow Citizens Of This State To Register To Vote And Update Their Voter Registration Information Online Through A Secure Internet Web Site; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Develop And Submit A Report Of His Findings To The Chairman Of The Elections Committee Of The Senate And The Chairman Of The Apportionment And Elections Committee Of The House Of Representatives; And For Related Purposes.

2799.title: Borrowing for state to offset temporary cash flow deficiencies due to pandemic flu outbreak; authorize.
2799.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-17-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State To Borrow Funds To Offset Temporary Cash Flow Deficiencies Due To Pandemic Flu Outbreak; And For Related Purposes.

2801.title: Emergency 911 address; authorize counties to charge registration fee for.
2801.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Charge A Registration Fee For The Registration Of A New 911 Address Or A Change Of Ownership Or Occupancy Of An Existing 911 Address; And For Related Purposes.

2802.title: Memorial Highway; designate certain segment of MS Highway 23 in Itawamba County as the "Tammy Wynette Memorial Highway."
2802.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 23 In Itawamba County As The Tammy Wynette Memorial Highway; And For Related Purposes.

2803.title: Public employees' health insurance; authorize purchase of supplemental policy for active employees who are Medicare eligible.
2803.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Political Subdivisions To Negotiate For And Secure For All Medicare Eligible Employees And Their Dependents A Supplemental Health Insurance Policy That May Be Offered On A Voluntary Basis To Any Such Employee Who Rejects Group Coverage Under This Section; To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And School Employees Health Insurance Management Board To Negotiate For And Secure For All Active Employees Who Are Medicare Eligible And Their Dependents A Supplemental Health Insurance Policy That May Be Offered On A Voluntary Basis To Any Such Employee Who Rejects Group Coverage Under The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

2804.title: School boards; revise composition for certain school districts.
2804.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Composition Of The Membership Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Municipal Separate School District In Certain Municipalities Having A Population In Excess Of 100,000, To Reflect The Number Of Wards In The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2805.title: Mental commitment; revise 72-hour hold.
2805.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Use Of The Seventy-two Hour Hold For Persons Treated In Licensed Medical Facilities; To Create New Section 41-4-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Implementation Of Crisis Intervention Teams; To Provide That Crisis Intervention Teams Be Operated Within Local Catchment Areas Served By Certain Law Enforcement Agencies; To Provide That Only One Licensed Medical Facility Will Serve As A Single Point Of Entry For A Crisis Intervention Team Catchment Area; To Provide For Local Community Mental Health Centers To Coordinate And Oversee The Development Of Crisis Intervention Teams In The District Served; To Authorize Certain Trained Law Enforcement Officers To Take Into Custody Persons With Substantial Likelihood Of Bodily Harm For The Purpose Of Emergency Treatment In A Licensed Medical Facility Serving As A Single Point Of Entry; To Exempt Law Enforcement Officers From Civil And Criminal Liability For Detaining A Mentally Ill Person In Good Faith; To Authorize Certain Licensed Psychiatric Nurse Practitioners To Hold A Patient For Treatment In A Licensed Medical Facility Serving As A Single Point Of Entry; To Exempt Psychiatric Nurse Practitioners From Civil And Criminal Liability For Detaining A Mentally Ill Person In Good Faith; To Provide For Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Services Operated By A Licensed Medical Facility That Is Serving As The Single Point Of Entry For A Crisis Intervention Team Catchment Area; To Require That Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Services Provide Beds Need For Extended Treatment And To Require That These Beds Be Licensed By The State Board Of Health; To Provide That A Person May Not Be Held By A Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Service For A Period Of Time Longer Than Seventy-two Hours; To Require That The State Board Of Mental Health Shall Encourage And Facilitate Community Mental Health Centers In The Development Of Crisis Intervention Teams And Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Services; To Encourage Colleges And Universities That Have Criminal Justice Programs To Collaborate With Law Enforcement Agencies In Training Crisis Intervention Team Officers; And For Related Purposes.

2806.title: State agency budgets; authorize transfer of allotments and remove employees from State Personnel Board procedures.
2806.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize State Agency Heads To Transfer Allotments From One Budget Category To Another And To Prohibit Any Salary Increases In Fiscal Year 2010; To Require The Reporting Of Personnel Contracts Of Former State Employees; To Amend Sections 25-9-127 And 25-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For A Period Of Two Years The Personnel Actions Of All State Agencies Subject To The Regulations Of The State Personnel Board Shall Be Exempt From State Personnel Board Procedures, And All Employees Of Such Agencies Shall Be Classified As Nonstate Service During That Period; And For Related Purposes.

2807.title: Central business, payroll and purchases for all community college districts; SBCJC Office of Shared Services administers services.
2807.description: An Act To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2014, The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges Shall Administer A Central Business Office For All Community And Junior Colleges In The State To Provide Accounting Services, Payroll Services And Prepare And Distribute All Checks For The Salaries Of Instructional And Noninstructional Community College Employees; To Authorize The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Establish An Office Of Community College Business And Payroll, To Direct The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To File With The State Treasurer And The Department Of Finance And Administration Necessary Data And Information To Enable The Department To Prepare All Community/junior College District Payroll Checks And Distribute Said Payments By Electronic Funds Transfer To Each Employee; To Authorize The State Treasurer And The Department Of Finance And Administration To Establish Necessary Funds And Accounts In The Name Of Each Community/junior College District In The State In Order To Verify Each Employee To Whom Payroll Checks Are Distributed; To Provide That Each Community/junior College District Shall Transfer To The Department Of Finance And Administration From Local District Funds Any Local Supplements Or Other Amounts To Be Used For Community/junior College District Salaries On A Monthly Basis; To Authorize The State Treasurer And The State Fiscal Officer To Jointly Promulgate Regulations For The Utilization Of Electronic Funds Transfer To Community/junior College Districts For Salary Payroll Purposes; To Provide That The Savings Resulting From The Consolidation Of All Payroll Functions To A Central Department Shall Be Certified To The Legislative Budget Office And Shall Be Appropriated By The Legislature For The Support Of The Community/junior Colleges In The Program; To Provide That The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges Shall Be The Purchasing Agent For All Community Junior College Districts In The State; To Provide That All Community/junior College Districts Shall Purchase Perishables, Food, Commodities, Equipment, Supplies, Utilities And Transportation Vehicles Through The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges; To Establish An Office Of School Purchasing Of The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges; To Amend Sections 37-4-3, 37-29-67 And 37-29-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Authorize The Executive Director Of The Department Of Finance And Administration To Consolidate The Business Services Provided Under This Act Into The Department; And For Related Purposes.

2808.title: Central business, payroll and purchases for all public school districts; SDE Office of Shared Services administers services.
2808.description: An Act To Provide That Beginning Not Later Than The 2014-2015 School Year The State Department Of Education Shall Administer A Central Business Office, Accounting, Payroll And Prepare And Distribute All Checks For The Salaries Of Licensed And Nonlicensed School District Employees In The State; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Establish An Office Of School District Business And Payroll; To Amend Section 37-151-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Education To File With The State Treasurer And The Department Of Finance And Administration Necessary Data And Information To Enable The Department To Prepare All School District Payroll Checks And Distribute Said Payments By Electronic Funds Transfer To Each Employee; To Authorize The State Treasurer And The Department Of Finance And Administration To Establish Necessary Funds And Accounts In The Name Of Each School District In The State In Order To Verify Each Employee To Whom Payroll Checks Are Distributed; To Provide That Each School District Shall Transfer To The Department Of Finance And Administration From Local District Maintenance Funds Any Local Supplements Or Other Amounts To Be Used For School District Salaries On A Monthly Basis; To Authorize The State Fiscal Officer To Promulgate Regulations For The Utilization Of Electronic Funds Transfer To School Districts For Salary Payroll Purposes; To Provide That The State Department Of Education Shall Be The Purchasing Agent For All Public School Districts In The State; To Provide That All Public School Districts Shall Purchase Perishables, Food, Commodities, Equipment, Supplies, Utilities And School Buses Through The State Department Of Education; To Establish An Office Of School Purchasing Of The State Department Of Education; To Amend Sections 31-7-12, 37-39-1, 37-39-5, 37-39-15, 37-39-17, 37-39-21, 37-39-23, 37-39-25, 37-41-101 And 37-41-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Department Of Finance And Administration Is Authorized To Consolidate This Shared Services Function Into The Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

2812.title: Memorial highways; designate "Ken Lundberg Memorial Highway" in Grenada County and "Veterans Memorial Bridge" in D'Iberville.
2812.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 51 In Grenada County As The "ken Lundberg Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Bridge On D'iberville Boulevard In Harrison County As The "veteran's Memorial Bridge"; And For Related Purposes.

2813.title: Hill Fire folk play; designate as official folk play of Mississippi.
2813.description: An Act To Designate Montgomery County Arts Council's Hill Fire As The Folk Play Of The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2814.title: Certified nurse midwife; define for licensure under Nurse Practice Act.
2814.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-15-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Terms "practice Of Midwifery" And "certified Nurse Midwife" For The Purposes Of The Nursing Practice Law; To Remove The Rollback To Former Law Provision Of This Section; To Create New Section 73-15-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board Of Nursing Shall Regulate The Practice Of Midwifery; To Provide That The Practice Of Midwifery Shall Only Be Conducted By Certified Nurse Midwives; To Provide That Any Person Who Is Not A Certified Nurse Midwife Who Engages In The Practice Of Midwifery Shall Be Subject To Criminal Penalties And Injunctive Relief; To Amend Section 73-25-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove From The Definition Of The Practice Of Medicine The Exception For Females Engaged Solely In The Practice Of Midwifery; And For Related Purposes.

2815.title: Oil and gas wells; must be located away from barns and homes.
2815.description: An Act Require That Oil And Gas Well Drilling Locations Be Situated A Certain Distance From Homes And Barns; To Amend Section 53-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Direct Codification; And For Related Purposes.

2816.title: State agency information technology services; authorize Mississippi Department of Information Technology Services to consolidate.
2816.description: An Act Relating To The Planning And Implementation Of The State's Information Technology Resources By The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services (mdits); To Amend Section 25-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Department Of Information Technology Services To Manage One Or More State Data Centers; To Direct The Authority To Identify Opportunities For Consolidation Of Computer Hardware And Software And Use Virtualization Technology To Optimize The Number Of Machines And Environmentally Controlled Facilities; To Direct Mdits To Optimize The Shared Technology Components Of The State; To Direct Mdits To Increase Federal Participation In The State Data Center And Its Shared Technology Infrastructure; To Direct Mdits To Expand Online Services To Citizens, Businesses And Other Governmental Entities; To Direct All State Agencies And Institutions To Give Their Full Cooperation And Assistance In The Successful Achievement Of These Efforts; To Direct Mdits To Report Progress In Its Annual Report To The Legislature; To Codify Section 25-53-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Applicability Of The State Data Center Operated By Mdits; To Authorize And Direct Mdits To Develop A Strategic Plan For The Consolidation Of Information Resources For All State Agencies At The State Data Center; To Require State Agencies To Comply With The Plan For Consolidating Identified Operations To Be Performed Through The State Data Center; To Authorize The State Data Center To Issue A Timetable For Selected State Agencies To Enter Into Interagency Agreements For The Provision Of Information Services By The State Data Center; To Provide For The Transfer Of Ownership Of Information Resources And Employees Pursuant To The Interagency Agreement; To Authorize The State Data Center To Set And Charge Fees For Information Technology Services; To Authorize Mdits To Issue Rules And Regulations To Implement This Act; To Amend Sections 25-53-1, 25-53-3, 25-53-25, 25-53-125 And 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Bring Forward Section 25-53-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To Telecommunications Services To State Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2817.title: Net energy metering; require electric utilities to allow.
2817.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Findings With Regard To Net Energy Metering; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Require Electric Utilities To Allow Net Energy Metering Facilities To Be Interconnected Using A Meter Capable Of Registering The Flow Of Electricity In Two Directions; To Require The Public Service Commission To Establish Appropriate Rates, Terms And Conditions For Net Energy Metering Contracts, And To Prescribe Other Duties Of The Public Service Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2818.title: Schools at-risk of failing; revise procedures and sanctions under school district conservatorship law.
2818.description: An Act Relating To Schools At-risk Of Failing; To Amend Section 37-3-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Provide Technical Assistance To Individual Schools And School Districts; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Department Of Education May Take Certain Corrective Action In School Districts Where An Emergency Has Been Declared Due To A School Having At-risk Status For Two Consecutive Years Or When The Majority Of Schools In The District Has Been Under At-risk Status For Any One Year, And To Provide That The Deputy Superintendent Of The Mississippi Recovery School District Is Appointed By The State Superintendent Of Education Subject To The Approval Of The State Board Of Education; To Amend Section 37-18-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of A School At-risk, And To Prescribe The Membership And Responsibilities Of The School Evaluation Teams Assigned By The State Department Of Education; To Amend Section 37-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Specific Membership Of Local Parent-citizen Advisory Committees Required In School Improvement Action Plans And To Require A District With A School At-risk To Establish A Community-based Education Council For Accountability; To Amend Section 37-18-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sanctions To Be Imposed By The Conservator In Schools Under At-risk Status, To Revise The Specific Sanctions Against Teachers, Principals, School District Administrative Office Personnel, And Superintendents Based Upon The Length Of Time The School Has Been Under At-risk Status, To Delete The Authority Of The State Board Of Education To Request The Removal Or A Referendum To Remove The Members Of The School Board Of A School District Which Has Been Under At-risk Status For Three Years; And For Related Purposes.

2820.title: Mississippi Stroke Registry Act and Stroke Task Force; establish.
2820.description: An Act Entitled "the Mississippi Stroke Registry Act"; To Provide Legislative Intent Relating To Care Of Stroke Patients; To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Establish A Stroke Task Force And To Authorize The Task Force To Receive Pertinent Data On Stroke Patients; To Provide For Annual Reports To The Legislature; To Provide For Confidentiality Of Patient Medical Records; To Provide Immunity From Civil Or Criminal Liability For Furnishing Information To The Task Force; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Misuse Of Information; And For Related Purposes.

2821.title: Municipal judges; provide additional.
2821.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Additional Municipal Judges For Municipalities; And For Related Purposes.

2822.title: Mental health services; revise and improve delivery.
2822.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 41-4-7, 41-19-33, 41-21-87 And 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 41-21-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Use Of The Seventy-two Hour Hold For Persons Treated In Licensed Medical Facilities; To Create New Section 41-4-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Implementation Of Crisis Intervention Teams; To Provide That Crisis Intervention Teams Be Operated Within Local Catchment Areas Served By Certain Law Enforcement Agencies; To Provide That Only One Licensed Medical Facility Will Serve As A Single Point Of Entry For A Crisis Intervention Team Catchment Area; To Provide For Local Community Mental Health Centers To Coordinate And Oversee The Development Of Crisis Intervention Teams In The District Served; To Authorize Certain Trained Law Enforcement Officers To Take Into Custody Persons With Substantial Likelihood Of Bodily Harm For The Purpose Of Emergency Treatment In A Licensed Medical Facility Serving As A Single Point Of Entry; To Exempt Law Enforcement Officers From Civil And Criminal Liability For Detaining A Mentally Ill Person In Good Faith; To Authorize Certain Licensed Psychiatric Nurse Practitioners To Hold A Patient For Treatment In A Licensed Medical Facility Serving As A Single Point Of Entry; To Exempt Psychiatric Nurse Practitioners From Civil And Criminal Liability For Detaining A Mentally Ill Person In Good Faith; To Provide For Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Services Operated By A Licensed Medical Facility That Is Serving As The Single Point Of Entry For A Crisis Intervention Team Catchment Area; To Require That Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Services Provide Beds Need For Extended Treatment And To Require That These Beds Be Licensed By The State Board Of Health; To Provide That A Person May Not Be Held By A Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Service For A Period Of Time Longer Than Seventy-two Hours; To Require That The State Board Of Mental Health Shall Encourage And Facilitate Community Mental Health Centers In The Development Of Crisis Intervention Teams And Comprehensive Psychiatric Emergency Services; To Encourage Colleges And Universities That Have Criminal Justice Programs To Collaborate With Law Enforcement Agencies In Training Crisis Intervention Team Officers; And For Related Purposes.

2823.title: State and local government contracts; shall give preference to disabled veteran businesses in Mississippi.
2823.description: An Act To Require All Agencies, Departments, Institutions And Other Entities Of This State, And Any Political Subdivision Thereof, To Give Preference To Disabled Veteran Businesses Doing Business As Mississippi Firms, Corporations Or Individuals; And For Related Purposes.

2825.title: Administrative merger of MUW with MSU; direct IHL to implement.
2825.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Promulgate Rules And Regulations For The Orderly Merger Of The Administration Of Mississippi University For Women With Mississippi State University; To Amend Section 37-117-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto And To Provide That Mississippi University For Women Shall Be A Distinct Campus Of Mississippi State University; To Amend Section 37-101-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-101-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Study The Scope Of University Programs And Consolidate Programs Which Are Duplicative Or Not Cost-effective; To Repeal Sections 37-117-3, 37-117-5, 37-117-7, 37-117-9 And 37-117-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Standards For The Selection Of Students For Mississippi University For Women; And For Related Purposes.

2826.title: Office of Shared Services in DFA; provide business services for certain state agencies.
2826.description: An Act To Establish An Office Of Shared Services (oss) In The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Provide That Beginning On July 1, 2011, The Office Of Shared Services Shall Establish A Central Business Office For Select Boards And Commissions In The State; To Provide Accounting Services, Payroll Services, Human Resource Services, Information Technology Services And Procurement Contracting Services; To Centrally Locate The Select Boards And Commissions; To Require The Office Of Shared Services To Develop A Transition Plan To Phase-in These Services Prior To January 31, 2011; To Require Select Boards And Commissions To Comply With The Plan; To Authorize Fees For Services; To Amend Section 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 25-9-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Employees And Service Functions Of The Office Of Shared Services Shall Be Exempt From State Service; And For Related Purposes.

2827.title: State Chemist and State Chemical Laboratory; revise qualifications and responsibility.
2827.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-21-7, 57-21-9, 57-21-11 And 57-21-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications, Status And Responsibilities Of The State Chemist And To Provide For The Program Organization And Personnel Support For The Mississippi State Chemical Laboratory; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: Department of Corrections contract with CPA to establish state inmate cost; require.
2830.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-1211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Corrections To Hire An Independent Certified Public Accounting Firm To Conduct An Annual Cost Of Incarceration Report; To Require The Peer Committee To Conduct Such A Review Beginning In Fiscal Year 2015, And Every 5 Years Thereafter; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Municipal election commissioners; if names of persons elected are not transmitted, Secretary of State may petition court to compel.
2832.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-611, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If The Municipal Election Commissioners Fail To Transmit To The Secretary Of State A Statement Certifying The Names Of The Persons Elected At A Municipal Election, The Secretary Of State May Issue A Show Cause Order Directing The Municipal Election Commissioners To Provide To The Secretary Of State A Written Response Containing The Reasons For Such Failure; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Petition A Court Of Competent Jurisdiction To Compel The Municipal Election Commissioners To Transmit The Statement; And For Related Purposes.

2833.title: Municipal elections; require election managers to be qualified electors of the municipality.
2833.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-231, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Who Serve As Managers In Municipal Elections Shall Be Qualified Electors Of The Municipality In Which The Polling Place Is Located; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: Elections; revise runoff date for certain levee commissioner; clarify authority of chancellor in 7th Chancery District.
2834.description: An Act To Amend Section 3, Chapter 85, Laws Of 1930, As Amended By Section 3, Chapter 574, Laws Of 1968, To Provide That The Date For Runoff Elections For The Office Of Levee Commissioner For The Mississippi Levee District Shall Be Three Weeks After The General Election; To Amend Section 9-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of Chancellors In The Seventh Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: Registration of nonresident dispensers of controlled substances; require registration.
2835.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Registration Of Nonresident Facilities That Distribute Or Dispense Controlled Substances Into The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: Fees for wholesale distributors of prescription drugs; revise.
2836.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Permitting Fees For Resident And Nonresident Wholesale Distributors Of Prescription Drugs; And For Related Purposes.

2837.title: Nonsettling cigarette manufacturer fee; do not impose on cigarettes distributed in this state for sale outside this state.
2837.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-70-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "tobacco Settlement Agreement" In The Law That Imposes A Fee On Cigarette Manufacturers That Did Not Sign A Tobacco Settlement Agreement; To Amend Section 27-70-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision That Imposes The Fee On Cigarettes Sold, Purchased Or Otherwise Distributed In This State For Sale Outside Of This State; To Amend Section 27-70-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For A Period Of 90 Days From The Date That A Nonsettling Manufacturer Does Not Appear In The Directory That The Attorney General Is Required To Maintain, A Distributor May Continue To Stamp And Sell The Cigarettes Of The Nonsettling Manufacturer Removed From The Directory That Were Purchased Before The Removal; And For Related Purposes.

2839.title: School district consolidation; require in counties with 3 or more school districts.
2839.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-7-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Any Mississippi County Having 3 Or More School Districts, There Shall Be An Administrative Consolidation Into Not More Than 2 School Districts; To Provide For A New County Board Of Education To Be Elected In Such County In The November 2011 General Election; To Provide That The New County Board Of Education Shall Serve As The Lead Agency To Consolidate The School Districts In Such County And To Direct The State Board Of Education To Administratively Consolidate Any School District Which Does Not Voluntarily Follow The Consolidation Order; To Abolish The Former School Boards Following The Administrative Consolidation And Provide For The Transfer Of School District Assets And Liabilities; To Provide For Execution Of Teacher And School District Employee Contracts In The New School Districts And To Provide For The Preparation Of School District Budgets In The New School Districts; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Regulations To Implement Such Administrative Consolidation; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: Cremains; provide for disposition when unclaimed.
2840.description: An Act To Provide Immunity To The Operator Of A Crematorium For Disposal Of Unclaimed Ashes After The Passage Of A Certain Amount Of Time; To Amend Section 41-39-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2841.title: Shellfish; require labeling to show country of origin.
2841.description: An Act To Provide That Farm-raised And Wild Shellfish Used For Human Consumption Be Labeled To Show Country Of Origin; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of Labeling Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2842.title: Income taxation; allow a deduction for amounts contributed to accounts established to pay for uninsured wind damage to homesteads.
2842.description: An Act To Authorize Owners Of Homesteads To Establish Catastrophe Savings Accounts And To Utilize Money In Such Accounts To Provide Reimbursement For Deductible Amounts And Other Uninsured Portions Of Damage To Homesteads From Windstorm Events; To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Amounts Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Exclude Interest On Such Accounts From Gross Income For Income Tax Purposes; To Provide Limits On The Amount That May Be Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Provide That A Distribution From A Catastrophe Savings Account Must Be Included In The Income Of The Taxpayer Unless The Distribution Is Used To Cover Qualified Catastrophe Expenses; To Provide That The Income Tax Shall Be Increased On Taxable Distributions From A Catastrophe Savings Account; To Amend Sections 27-7-15 And 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2843.title: Gaming; remove obsolete and repealed language and confirm authority to conduct certain activities.
2843.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-76-5, 75-76-7, 75-76-9, 75-76-11, 75-76-13, 75-76-15, 75-76-17, 75-76-33, 75-76-87, 75-76-89 And 75-76-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Obsolete Language Referring To The Time-limited Authority Possessed By The State Tax Commission Before October 1, 1993, To Regulate Activities Governed By The Gaming Control Act; To Clarify That Specific Provisions Of The Gaming Control Act Authorize A Licensee To Conduct Certain Gaming Activities; To Clarify Definitions Under The Act; To Require The Mississippi Gaming Commission To Adopt Regulations Prescribing The Manner In Which A Gaming Licensee May Conduct Gaming Activities Authorized Under The Act; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: Statewide Victims' Information and NotificationSystem Fund; increase statewide monetary assessment for benefit of.
2844.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Assessment For The Benefit Of The Statewide Victims' Information And Notification System Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2845.title: Driver's license; revise penalty for driving with suspended.
2845.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For Driving On A Suspended Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

2846.title: County court; authorize for Pearl River County.
2846.description: An Act To Create Section 9-9-18.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A County Court In Pearl River County; To Provide For The Election Of The County Court Judge; To Provide That The County Court Of Pearl River County Shall Be Funded By The Pearl River County Board Of Supervisors; To Bring Forward Sections 9-9-1, 9-9-36 And 9-9-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

2847.title: "Mississippi Strategic Planning and Performance Budgeting System Act of 2010"; enact.
2847.description: An Act To Enact The "mississippi Strategic Planning And Performance Budget System Enhancement Act Of 2010"; To Define Certain Terms; To Establish A Process For Statewide Strategic Planning And Agency Budgeting; To Require That Certain Functions Be Carried Out By The Legislative Budget Committee And The Legislative Budget Office; To Provide For The Annual Preparation Of A Strategic Plan For The Operation Of All State Agencies To Comply With The Goals For Each Area In Which The Agencies Provide Services; To Provide For Individual Agency Strategic Plans Based Upon The State Plan To Be Submitted Annually By State Agencies; To Provide That Funds To State Agencies Shall Be Budgeted And Appropriated Based Upon The Agency Strategic Plans; To Prescribe The Components Of The Strategic Plans; To Require Achievement Goals For Each Functional Area Of State Government To Be Incorporated In The Agency Strategic Plan, And To Direct The Legislative Budget Office To Establish A System Of Performance Audits And Evaluations To Determine The Extent To Which State Agencies Are Complying With The Adopted Performance Goals As Prescribed In The Agencies Appropriation Bill; To Provide That Beginning With The 2013 Regular Session The Legislature Shall Enact Nine Appropriation Bills To Defray The Expenses Of All State General-fund And Special-fund Agencies Based Upon Certain Functional Areas To Conform With The Adopted State Agency Strategic Plan; To Provide For Certain Duties Of The Peer Committee Relating To Performance Monitoring Of Agency Budgets And To Grant To The Peer Committee The Power Of Compulsory Process And Power Of Enforcement; To Direct Lbc To Establish An Agency Innovation Incentive Program; To Codify Sections 5-3-68 And 5-3-70 And To Amend Sections 5-3-59, 27-103-101, 27-103-103, 27-103-111, 27-103-129, 27-103-131, 27-103-137, 27-103-139, 27-103-209 And 27-103-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 27-104-3 And 27-104-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower The Department Of Finance And Administration And Its Executive Director To Provide State Agencies With Training Regarding Strategic Planning And Budgeting; To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The State Auditor To Contract With The Peer Committee To Review The Performance Of Agencies; To Repeal Sections 27-103-121, 27-103-123, 27-103-125 And 27-103-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Budgeting Practices; To Repeal Sections 27-103-151 Through 27-103-157, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Budget And Strategic Planning Act Of 1994; And For Related Purposes.

2848.title: Healthy Food Retail Act; create to encourage consumption of affordable healthy foods in underserved communities.
2848.description: An Act To Create The Healthy Food Retail Act; To Provide That, To The Extent Funds Are Available, The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, In Cooperation With Public And Private Sector Partners, Shall Establish A Financing Program That Provides Grants And Loans To Healthy Food Retailers That Increase Access To Fresh Fruits And Vegetables And Other Affordable Healthy Food In Underserved Communities; To Provide That The Department May Contract With One Or More Qualified Nonprofit Organizations Or Community Development Financial Institutions To Administer The Program Described In This Act Through A Public-private Partnership, To Raise Matching Funds, Market The Program Statewide, Evaluate Applicants, Make Award Decisions, Underwrite Loans, And Monitor Compliance And Impact; To Provide That The Program Shall Provide Funding On A Competitive, One-time Basis As Appropriate For The Eligible Project; To Provide The Types Of Programs And Projects For Which Funding May Be Provided; To Provide The Criteria That Must Be Met For Funding Under The Program; To Provide That The Department Shall Establish Program Benchmarks And Reporting Processes To Make Certain That The Program Benefits Both Rural And Urban Communities In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: Highways; repeal the section that designates a certain segment of MS Highway 5 in Benton County as a scenic route.
2849.description: An Act To Repeal Section 65-3-64, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Designated A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 5 In Benton County As A Scenic Route; To Direct The Transportation Department To Remove Any Scenic Signs And Markers; And For Related Purposes.

2850.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act; revise forfeiture under.
2850.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Forfeiture Of Property Other Than Controlled Substances Under The Controlled Substances Act; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-179, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-181, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-183, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 41-29-185, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2851.title: Health professional students receiving SREB scholarships; IHL shall not impose certain conditions.
2851.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-101-221, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Shall Not Impose An In-state Service Commitment On Health Professional Students Receiving Instruction Out Of State Under An Agreement With The Southern Regional Education Board; And For Related Purposes.

2852.title: State agencies to submit energy management plans and meet energy consumption reduction standards; require.
2852.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-39-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require State Agencies To Submit Energy Management Plans And Meet Energy Consumption Reduction Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2853.title: Department of Revenue; revise information that may not be disclosed, allow to require certain electronic filing.
