3013.description: An Act To Direct The Governor To Implement A Furlough Plan For The State Of Mississippi Applicable To All State Service And Nonstate Service Employees And State Contract Personnel; To Provide For State Agency Closures On Days When These Employees Are Furloughed; To Provide Exemptions For Employees And Agencies Providing Direct Patient Or Inmate Residential Care Or Providing Law Enforcement Services; To Amend Section 25-1-98, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

3014.title: "Mississippi Accountability and Transparency Act of 2008"; DFA make report on implementation.
3014.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 27-104-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The "mississippi Accountability And Transparency Act Of 2008" And To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Develop And Make A Report To The 2011 Regular Session Of The Legislature On The Operation Of The Searchable Web Site Containing Information On Certain State Expenditures; And For Related Purposes.

3015.title: Oakley; revise age committing a delinquent child.
3015.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Child Who Has Been Adjudicated Delinquent For A Nonviolent Felony Or Fewer Than 3 Misdemeanors Shall Be Committed To The Training School; To Decrease From 20 Days To 10 Days The Time Period That The Training School Must Give Notice To The Committing Court When A Youth Is About To Be Released From The Training School; And For Related Purposes.

3018.title: State-held lands; revise law regulating the conveyances of.
3018.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Lands Held By State Agencies To Be Titled In The Name Of The State Of Mississippi, To Provide For Transfer Of State-held Lands Among Agencies, To Allow The Secretary Of State With The Approval Of The Governor To Accept Donations Of Land To The State, And To Clarify Certain Exemptions From The Act; And For Related Purposes.

3019.title: Health insurance; limit insurers' recoupment of payments to health care providers.
3019.description: An Act To Provide That, Except In Cases Of Fraud, A Health Care Insurer May Exercise Recoupment From A Health Care Provider Only During The Eighteen-month Period After The Date That The Health Care Insurer Paid The Claim Submitted By The Provider; To Provide That A Health Care Insurer That Exercises Recoupment Under This Act Shall Give The Health Care Provider A Written Or Electronic Statement Specifying The Basis For The Recoupment; To Provide That The Failure To Comply With Any Provision Of This Act Shall Be Deemed An Unfair Trade Practice And May Be Punished By Certain Fines And Penalties; To Require The Commissioner Of Insurance To Adopt Rules And Regulations To Ensure Compliance With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3020.title: Certain school boards convey school buildings not used for school purposes to nonprofit entity; authorize.
3020.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-455, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Empower The County Board Of Education Of Certain Counties To Convey School Buildings Not Used For School Purposes To A Nonprofit Entity That Has Made Substantial Improvements To The Property Without The Necessity Of Advertising For Competitive Bids; And For Related Purposes.

3021.title: Public assistance benefits; require applicants to submit to random drug testing to qualify.
3021.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For Public Benefits In Mississippi To Submit To Random Drug Testing In Order To Be Eligible; To Provide That Any Such Person Whose Test Results Are Positive Regarding The Presence Of Any Unlawful Drug In The Person's System Shall Be Ineligible To Receive Public Assistance For A Period Of Time Based On The Number Of Positive Drug Tests; To Provide Procedures And Exceptions For Such Random Drug Testing; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Willful Violations Of Random Drug Testing Requirements; To Make It Unlawful For Any State Agency To Provide Any Public Benefit In Violation Of Random Drug Testing Requirements; To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-17-1, 71-5-511 And 43-33-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Require The Division Of Medicaid, The Department Of Human Services, The Office Of Employment Security And The Mississippi Housing Authorities To Require Applicants Of Public Assistance Programs To Submit To Random Drug Testing As Required Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3022.title: Task force to study strategies for educating state's residents on personal finances; create.
3022.description: An Act To Create A Task Force To Study Strategies For Educating The State's Residents And Students About Personal Finances, Including, But Not Limited To, Budgeting, Savings, Credit And Identity Theft, And To Make Recommendations To The Legislature On How To Improve Financial Literacy Throughout The State; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Set Forth The Duties Of The Task Force; To Provide That The Task Force Shall Perform Its Duties Without Legislative Appropriation Or Use Of Any State Funds; And For Related Purposes.

3023.title: School influenza vaccination pilot program; establish under State Department of Health.
3023.description: An Act To Establish An Influenza Vaccination School Pilot Program In Mississippi For School-aged Children 5 Through 18 Years Of Age To Be Administered By The State Department Of Health In Consultation With The State Department Of Education; To Provide Certain Standards For The Program; To Amend Section 43-20-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Prescribe Certain Responsibilities On Licensed Child Care Facilities Relating To Immunization Information; And For Related Purposes.

3024.title: Community Corrections Reassimilation and Restitution Program; create.
3024.description: An Act To Create A Community Corrections Reassimilation And Restitution Program; To Provide For A Commission To Oversee The Program; To Provide For The Composition Of The Commission; To Allow The Commission To Appoint An Executive Director Who Shall Serve At Its Pleasure; To Incorporate Programs And Support Services Concerning Pretrial Release, Community Service Program, Supervision For Participants Entering A Plea Of Guilty Pursuant To Section 99-15-26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Post-adjudication Supervision, A Vocational/educational And Employment Program, Residential Rehabilitation And Work Release, A Reentry Residential And Nonresidential Program, Adult And Juvenile Drug And Dui Court Programs And Services, Including, But Not Limited To, Deferred Prosecution And Pretrial Diversion, And Any Other Similar Or Related Program; To Authorize The Commission To Contract For Its Programs And Services With A Not-for-profit Corporation; To Authorize The Collection Of Reasonable Fees From Participants Of Its Programs And Services; And For Related Purposes.

3025.title: Mentally ill; may not be held in jail pending commitment.
3025.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Mentally Ill May Not Be Held In Jail Pending Medical Treatment; To Amend Section 41-4-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

3026.title: Tort Claims Fund; exempt MDOT from participation.
3026.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation From Participation In The State Tort Claims Fund; To Require The Commission To Provide Coverage For Liability Of The Commission And Department; To Provide Coverage Of Claims During The Transition Period; And For Related Purposes.

3027.title: Nonlicensed teacher assignment; provide notice requirements.
3027.description: An Act To Require A Local School District To Provide Notice Of The Assignment Of An Improperly Or Nonlicensed Teacher To The Same Classroom For More Than 30 Consecutive Day To A Student's Parent Or Legal Guardian; To Specify The Time Within Which The Notice Must Be Provided; To Exempt Certain Schools From The Notice Requirement; To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt Rules Providing For Teacher Preparation And Continuing Education Programs For The Licensing Of Nontraditional Teachers; To Exempt Certain Teachers With Certain Experience From The Continuing Education Requirements Of This Section; To Authorize A Local School District To Issue A Teaching Permit And Employ Certain Persons Who Does Not Hold A Valid License; To Provide Reciprocity For Licensure To Certain Persons; To Require The Board To Adopt Rules Allowing A Licensed Teacher To Qualify For Additional Certification; To Amend Section 37-3-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Board To Adopt Rules Establishing The Training Requirements Necessary To Obtain A License Or Enter A Teacher Internship; To Establish Performance Standards For Teacher Preparation Programs; To Amend Section 37-149-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board For Education, The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Develop And Implement Programs To Identify And Recruit Person To Become Teachers, To Prescribe The Responsibilities Of Those Entities With Respect To Teacher Recruit, And To Prescribe The Use Of Any Funds Made Available For Teacher Recruitment Purposes; To Bring Forward Sections 37-149-3, 37-149-7 And 37-159-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish The Goals And Function Of The Mississippi Teacher Center, Provide For The Appointment And Prescribes The Duties Of Teacher Recruiters And Creates The Teacher Recruitment And Retention Grant Program Respectively, Or Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Teacher Compensation, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

3028.title: Corrections; provide that a county is not liable for medical costs that exceed certain reimbursement rates.
3028.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-901, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A County Shall Not Be Liable For Medical Costs That Exceed Medicaid Rates Or Rates Paid By The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

3029.title: Transportation; authorize MDOT to make certain expenditures without an appropriation bill.
3029.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Make Certain Expenditures From The State Highway Fund Without An Appropriation Bill To Fund Existing Contracts And To Fund Essential Operations And Personnel Of The Commission And The Department If The Legislature During Any Regular Session Fails To Enact An Appropriation Bill To Fund The Operations Of The Department For The Next Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

3030.title: Cleaning private property; revise procedure by municipalities.
3030.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedures Required Of Municipalities To Clean Property Determined To Be A Menace To Those In The Municipal Community And To Revise Collection Of Fees Therefor That Remain Unpaid By The Property Owner; And For Related Purposes.

3031.title: Parole; provide for discretion for the revocation of certain offender's parole.
3031.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Parole Board Discretion To Continue Or Discontinue The Parole Of An Offender On Parole If The Offender Is Convicted Of A Felony Committed Prior To The Offender Being Placed On Parole; And For Related Purposes.

3032.title: Office of Capital Defense Counsel/Office of Indigent Appeals; merge into Office of State Public Defender.
3032.description: An Act To Consolidate The Office Of Capital Defense Counsel And The Office Of Indigent Appeals Into The Office Of State Public Defender To Provide Administrative, Budgeting And Financial Services Support To The Office Of Capital Defense Counsel And The Office Of Indigent Appeals; To Coordinate The Collection And Dissemination Of Statistical Data Related To The Indigent Defense System; To Develop Plans And Proposals For A Statewide Public Defender System In Coordination With The Mississippi Public Defender Task Force; To Amend Sections 99-18-3, 99-40-1 And 99-18-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 99-39-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Organization Of The Mississippi Office Of Capital Post-conviction Counsel; And For Related Purposes.

3033.title: Drug courts; authorize drug court judge to assess direct cost of confinement for person in jail.
3033.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-23-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972 To Provide That A Drug Court Judge May Assess A Defendant For The County's Cost Of Confinement; And For Related Purposes.

3036.title: Student immunization requirements; provide exemption based on philosophical beliefs of parent or guardian.
3036.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From Immunization Requirements For Students Based Upon A Conflict With The Philosophical Beliefs Of The Parent Or Guardian, And To Provide Procedures To Exercise Such Exemption; And For Related Purposes.

3037.title: Payday lending; prohibit activities of/declare public nuisance.
3037.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Intent To Prohibit Activities Commonly Referred To As Payday Lending, Deferred Presentment Services, Advance Cash Services And Other Similar Activities; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Engage In The Business Of Making Certain Small Loans; To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Provide For Collection Of Civil Penalties In Actions By The State Or By Private Parties On Behalf Of The State; To Declare The Site Or Location Of A Place Of Business Where Payday Lending Takes Place In The State Of Mississippi As A Public Nuisance; To Repeal Sections 75-67-401 Through 75-67-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Title Pledge Act; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

3038.title: Justice court judges; salary shall not increase with salary for supervisors unless approved separately.
3038.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Salaries Of Certain Justice Court Judges Shall Not Be Increased To Reflect A Commensurate Increase For County Supervisors, Unless Otherwise Approved Separately; And For Related Purposes.

3039.title: Emergency 911 address; require owners and tenants of residences, buildings and structures to obtain.
3039.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Any Person Who Owns Or Rents A Residence, Building Or Structure To Obtain A 911 Address From The County Before Occupying The Residence, Building Or Structure; And For Related Purposes.

3040.title: Trapping; all cities and counties to trap within 100 feet of a street to protect public safety.
3040.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Municipalities And Counties To Trap Within 100 Feet Of A Public Road To Protect Public Safety; And For Related Purposes.

3041.title: Fishing; authorize Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks to issue group pier fishing license.
3041.description: An Act To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Issue An Annual Group Pier Fishing License; To Establish The Fee For Such License; To Provide That Persons Fishing From Such Piers Are Not Required To Purchase An Individual Fishing License; And For Related Purposes.

3042.title: High school students suspended from extracurricular/athletic activity for failure to maintain certain grades; repeal.
3042.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Students In Grades 7 Through 12 To Be Suspended From Participation In Extracurricular Or Athletic Activity For Failure To Maintain A Certain Cumulative Grade Point Average; And For Related Purposes.

3043.title: Airports; exempt parking revenue from sales tax.
3043.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Airport Authority Revenue From Certain Sales Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

3044.title: Highways; revise requirements for trucks carrying loose material.
3044.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-83 And Section 63-7-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirements For Trucks Carrying Loose Material; And For Related Purposes.

3045.title: Highways; create the "John Paul Frerer Bicycle Safety Act."
3045.description: An Act To Provide The Rights And Duties Of Those Persons Operating Bicycles On Any Roadway Or Highway Or Path Set Aside For Bicycles; To Set Forth The Rights And Duties Of The Operator Of A Motor Vehicle With Respect To Bicycles; To Prohibit Certain Activities; And For Related Purposes.

3046.title: Transportation; allow MTC to assess a fee for certain surplus right-of-way and uneconomic remnant property sales.
3046.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-1-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commission On Transportation To Assess A Fee For The Sale Of Certain Surplus Right-of-way And Uneconomic Remnant Property; And For Related Purposes.

3047.title: County prosecuting attorneys; salary shall not automatically increase after salary increase of supervisors.
3047.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No County Prosecuting Attorney Shall Receive A Commensurate Increase In Salary Reflecting A Salary Increase Of The Supervisors Of His Respective County; And For Related Purposes.

3048.title: Medical examiners; must be certified forensic pathologists.
3048.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Qualifications Of Pathologists Able To Perform Postmortem Examinations And Autopsies; And For Related Purposes.

3049.title: Whistleblower Act; protection of public employee from reprisal for giving information to investigative body or agency.
3049.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-9-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-172, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-175, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-9-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

3050.title: Uniform traffic ticket; revise responsibility for devising form and accounting for copies.
3050.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The State Auditor With Regard To The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law; To Give Additional Responsibility To The Commissioner Of Public Safety, Including The Decision As To The Number And Distribution Of The Ticket Forms, Where Filed, And What Information Is To Be Reported By Court Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

3051.title: Silencers; authorize in limited circumstances.
3051.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Possession Of A Silencer For A Hunting Rifle; And For Related Purposes.

3052.title: Social security numbers; provide for redaction in recorded documents.
3052.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State And Local Officials To Redact Individual Social Security Numbers When Any Record Is Published On The Internet Or On A Government Controlled Web Site; To Authorize Redaction Of Social Security Number By The Chancery Clerks When Possible; And For Related Purposes.

3053.title: Cleaning private property; revise municipal notice procedures.
3053.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Assessment Of Cost Of Cleaning Private Property By A Municipality Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

3054.title: Bureau of Fleet Management of DFA; bring forward.
3054.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 25-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Section Which Establishes And Empowers The Bureau Of Fleet Management Of The Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

3061.title: Nonviolent offenders; may be placed on house arrest.

3063.title: Bingo licensees; define authority of Mississippi Gaming Commission.
3063.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-33-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Powers Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission With Respect To The Regulation Of Licensees And Applicants For Bingo Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

3064.title: Judicial office; candidates may not qualify before January 1 of the year in which the election is held.
3064.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Candidates For Judicial Office May Not File Their Intent To Be A Candidate And Pay The Proper Assessment Before January 1 Of The Year In Which The Election For The Judicial Office Is Held; And For Related Purposes.

3065.title: Homestead exemption reimbursement; prohibit under certain conditions.
3065.description: An Act To Create New Code Section 27-33-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Department Of Revenue From Distributing Homestead Exemption Reimbursement Funds To Any Local Taxing District Wherein The Appraised Value Of Property Has Increased And The Local Taxing District Has Not Published, In A Newspaper Of General Circulation, A Notice Showing The Millage Rate That Would Have Produced The Same Revenues Collected In The Preceding Fiscal Year; To Amend Sections 27-33-77 And 27-33-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

3066.title: Radar; authorize use by sheriffs and municipal police.
3066.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff In Any County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon Public Streets, Roads And Highways That Are Under The Jurisdiction Of The Board Of Supervisors For Maintenance And Construction And That Are Located Outside The Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality And To Authorize Law Enforcement Officers Of Any Size Municipality To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Within The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

3067.title: Regional jails; authorize Franklin County to withdraw from the Jefferson/Franklin Regional Correctional Facility.
3067.description: An Act To Authorize Franklin County To Withdraw From The Jefferson/franklin Regional Correctional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

3068.title: Lotteries; define certain games of chance as lotteries.
3068.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Sales Of Games As Lotteries; And For Related Purposes.

3069.title: Emergency telephone service and enhanced wireless emergency telephone service; extend repealer on.
3069.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 19-5-303, 19-5-313, 19-5-319, 19-5-331 Through 19-5-341, 19-5-359 And 19-5-361, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For An Emergency Telephone Service Charge, Create A Commercial Mobile Radio Service Board And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties, Provide For Collection Of Service Charges, Require Confidentiality Of Proprietary Information And Require The Commercial Mobile Radio Service To Provide Wireless Enhanced 911 Service; To Amend Section 19-5-371, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Reenacted Sections; And For Related Purposes.

3070.title: Emergency telecommunicators; extend repealer on training requirements/funding.
3070.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Minimum Standards For Emergency Telecommunicators; To Amend Section 19-5-357, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Funding For The Training Of Such Telecommunicators; To Amend Section 19-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Continuing Education For Certified Emergency Telecommunicators; And For Related Purposes.

3072.title: Distinctive license tag; reauthorize for supporters of the Clinton Community Nature Center.
3072.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Clinton Community Nature Center; To Amend Section 27-19-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

3073.title: Private property; unpaid costs of cleaning by municipality collected as for delinquent municipal taxes.
3073.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Assessments Levied By A Municipality For The Costs Incurred By The Municipality In Cleaning Private Property Shall Become Delinquent And Shall Be Collected In The Same Manner And At The Same Time As Municipal Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

3074.title: Personal care attendant for the severely disabled; provide qualifications.
3074.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-33-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Definitions For The Terms "personal Care Attendant" Or "attendant" And "personal Care Attendant Registry" Or "registry"; To Amend Section 37-33-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Qualifications, Education And Training Requirements, Fingerprinting And Criminal Background Checks; And A Registry For Personal Care Attendants; And For Related Purposes.

3075.title: Medicaid reimbursement for inpatient services; require APR/DRG system.
3075.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Implementation Of An Apr/drg System Of Inpatient Service Reimbursement For Medicaid On July 1, 2010; And For Related Purposes.

3076.title: Mississippi Prison Industries; prohibit state agencies from purchasing from business employing inmates of another state.
3076.description: An Act To Provide That Private Prisons And State Agencies May Not Buy Goods From An Entity That Employs Inmates From A Correctional System Of Another State Unless Approved By The Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation; And For Related Purposes.

3077.title: Marine Resources; authorize commission to revoke license indefinitely for multiple offenses within a certain time period.
3077.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commission On Marine Resources To Revoke Indefinitely The License Of The Person And Vessel For Multiple Offenses Within A Certain Time Period; And For Related Purposes.

3078.title: Public Service Commission; define authority relative to performing audits of utilities.
3078.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Restrict The Public Service Commission And Its Staff From Engaging In Audits, Inspections And Examinations Of Public Utilities; And For Related Purposes.

3079.title: Residential property foreclosures; prohibit unless 90-day written notice is given.
3079.description: An Act To Prohibit Foreclosure On Residential Property Unless The Mortgagee Or Holder Of The Mortgage Gives The Mortgagor 90-days' Written Notice; To Prescribe The Contents Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Mortgagee To Notify The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance Of The Date Of The Foreclosure Sale, The Purchase Price Obtained At The Sale, And A Copy Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Maintain A Database Of Certain Foreclosure Activity Information; And For Related Purposes.

3081.title: Malicious prosecution; define as an intentional common law tort.
3081.description: An Act To Create New Section 95-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Common Law Intentional Tort Of Malicious Prosecution; And For Related Purposes.

3082.title: Cell phones; require hands-free accessories and prohibit texting while driving.
3082.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Prohibit The Use Of Cellular Telephones While Operating A Motor Vehicle Without Using Hands-free Accessories; To Prohibit Cell Phone Use By Certain Minors; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

3083.title: CON; issue to Alexander Milne Home for Women, Inc., for ICF-MR beds in Laurel.
3083.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need To The Alexander Milne Home For Women, Inc., For Not Exceeding 45 Icf-mr Beds In Laurel, Under The Condition That The State Portion Of The Medicaid Match Be Paid By The Recipient Of The Certificate Of Need; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division Of Medicaid To Make Full Reimbursement To Any Intermediate Care Facility For The Mentally Retarded That Is A Nonprofit 501(c)(3) Corporation Paying The State's Portion Of The Medicaid Match; And For Related Purposes.

3084.title: MS Affordable Housing Trust Fund; create.
3084.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; To Provide That The Trust Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Home Corporation; To Provide That Money In The Trust Fund Shall Be Made Available To Assist The Development, Rehabilitation And Preservation Of Affordable Housing And For Other Purposes Consistent With This Act; To Provide The Income Levels Of Persons For Whom The Trust Fund Shall Be Utilized To Benefit; To Provide That At Least 50% Of The Funds In The Trust Fund Expended In Any Fiscal Year Shall Be Used For The Purpose Of Rental Housing Development Or Rehabilitation; To Provide That A Portion Of The Money In The Trust Fund May Be Used To Make Capacity Building Grants To Certain Entities; To Authorize Local Governments To Create Or Participate In Local Housing Trust Funds Or Otherwise Provide Funding Or Support For The Purpose Of Supporting Affordable Housing; And For Related Purposes.

3086.title: Portable school classrooms; require process for environmental evaluation of sites for construction.
3086.description: An Act To Prescribe A Process For The Environmental Evaluation Of A Site For The Construction Of A Portable Classroom Facility; To Provide That The Local School Board Shall Not Proceed To Acquire Or Prepare A Site For Construction Of A Portable Classroom Until The Completion Of Required Environmental Evaluations Approved By The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Amend Sections 37-45-23 And 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

3087.title: Elections; require persons or organizations that solicit voter registration applications to register with the Secretary of State.
3087.description: An Act To Require Every Person Or Organization That Solicits Or Collects Voter Registration Applications From Applicants For Voter Registration In This State, Unless Designated As A Voter Registrar By Law, To File An Annual Registration Statement With The Secretary Of State Prior To Engaging In Any Voter Registration Activities; To Require Certain Information Be Included In Such Statements; To Provide That There Shall Be No Registration Fee; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Assess Fines For Failure To File Registration Statements Prior To Participating In Voter Registration Activities; To Require All Persons Or Organizations Registered Pursuant To This Act To File An Annual Report With The Secretary Of State Containing A List Of All Applications For Voter Registration Solicited Or Collected During The Preceding 12 Calendar Months And Certain Other Information; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Fine A Registered Individual Or Organization For Failure To Submit Applications To The Appropriate Registrar; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Fine A Registered Organization For Failure To Submit An Annual Report; To Provide That No Person Shall Receive Compensation Based On The Number Of Applications Solicited Or Collected Or On Any Other Volume Basis; To Provide That No Organization May Pay Compensation Based On The Number Of Applications Solicited Or Collected Or On Any Other Volume Basis; To Provide That All Voter Applications Solicited Or Collected Shall Be Delivered To The Appropriate Registrar Within A Certain Amount Of Time; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Impose Fines For Failure To Timely Deliver Applications To The Appropriate Registrar; To Provide For Registration Of Persons Whose Applications Are Delivered To The Secretary Of State By A Registered Person Or Organization; To Amend Section 23-15-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

3088.title: Voting precincts; must have at least 250 qualified electors.
3088.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-281, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board Of Supervisors Shall Notify The Office Of The Secretary Of State Of The Boundaries Of Supervisors Districts And Precincts By No Later Than April 1, 2011, And To Require That The Voting Place In Each District And Precinct Shall Be Indicated By Common Name And Street Address; To Amend Section 23-15-285, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Voting Precinct Shall Have Less Than 250 Qualified Electors And To Provide That This Minimum Size Requirement Shall Not Apply If The Requirement Would Cause Qualified Electors To Travel More Than 15 Miles Over The Most Commonly Used Roadways In Order To Vote; And For Related Purposes.

3089.title: Certificates of nomination and nominating petitions for President and V.P.; must be filed not later than 5:00 p.m. on the deadline day.
3089.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-785, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Certificates Of Nomination And Nominating Petitions For Candidates For President And Vice President Of The United States Must Be Filed In The Office Of The Secretary Of State By Not Later Than 5:00 P.m. 60 Days Prior To The Election; And For Related Purposes.

3090.title: Sunshine Attorney Act; create.
3090.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Notice Of Certain Litigation Shall Be Given To An Agency Head And That Agencies May Retain Separate Counsel In Certain Situations; To Amend Section 7-5-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Authority Of The Attorney General To Enter Into Contracts For Outside Legal Services; To Amend Section 7-5-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Case Docket Maintained By The Attorney General; To Authorize State Agencies And Other State Entities To Directly Employ Legal Counsel, Whether Salaried Or On A Case-by-case Basis, When Certain Conflicts Of Interest Exist; To Provide That Compensation Of Such Legal Counsel May Be Paid From Any Funds Appropriated Or Otherwise Available To The Appointing Or Employing Entity; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Personal Service Contract Review Board To Review Certain Fee Contracts For Outside Legal Counsel When Entered Into By The Attorney General Or State Agencies; To Amend Section 7-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

3091.title: Operation Lifesaver; create statewide monetary assessment for benefit of.
3091.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Statewide Monetary Assessment Against Railroad Crossing Violations Only For The Benefit Of The Operation Lifesaver Program And Fund; To Create The Operation Lifesaver Program Under The Auspices Of The Department Of Transportation; To Create The Operation Lifesaver Special Fund; And For Related Purposes.

3092.title: Agriculture; consolidate several agencies.
3092.description: An Act To Provide For The Transfer Of Personnel And Resources Of The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Provide That The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health Shall Be An Advisory Board To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Sections 69-15-2 And 69-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Provide For The Transfer Of Personnel And Resources Of The Mississippi Board Of Veterinary Medicine To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Provide That The Mississippi Board Of Veterinary Medicine Shall Be An Advisory Board To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Sections 73-39-53 And 73-39-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Provide For The Transfer Of Personnel And Resources Of The Mississippi Fair Commission To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Provide That The Mississippi Fair Commission Shall Be An Advisory Commission To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Section 69-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Provide For The Transfer Of Personnel And Resources Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Provide That The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board Shall Be An Advisory Board To The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce; To Amend Sections 69-7-251, 69-7-253 And 69-7-255, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Provide For The Transfer Of Personnel And Resources Of The State Board Of Registration For Foresters To The State Forestry Commission; To Provide That The State Board Of Registration For Foresters Shall Be An Advisory Board To The State Forestry Commission; To Amend Sections 73-36-3, 73-36-9, 73-36-17, 73-36-19 And 49-19-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 49-19-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Free Commercial Tree Seedlings For Farm Owners; To Repeal Section 49-19-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Tree Seedling Revolving Fund; To Repeal Section 49-19-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Created A Joint Forestry Study Committee; And For Related Purposes.

3093.title: State agency advertising procurements; require approval by Personal Service Contract Review Board.
3093.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Personal Services Contract Review Board To Establish Standards And Preapprove All State Agency Advertising Procurements; And For Related Purposes.

3096.title: Coastal Wetlands; authorize executive director to issue after fact authorization for minor violation of a permit.
3096.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-27-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Executive Director Of The Department Of Marine Resource To Issue An After The Fact Authorization For Unauthorized Work Outside Of A Permit If The Work Is In Accordance With U.s. Corps Of Engineers General Permits For Minor Structures And Activities; And For Related Purposes.

3097.title: Corrections; authorize MDOC to construct a fire station at or near the South Mississippi Correctional Institution.
3097.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Corrections To Build A Fire Station At Or Near The South Mississippi Correctional Institution; And For Related Purposes.

3098.title: Crabs; remove prohibition on possessing female sponge crabs and authorize Commission on Marine Resources to regulate taking of crabs.
3098.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-84, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Prohibition Against Possession For Female Sponge Crabs; To Authorize The Commission On Marine Resources To Promulgate Regulations On The Taking Of Certain Crabs; And For Related Purposes.

3099.title: Public lands; bring forward various provisions for purpose of amendment.

3100.title: Charitable organizations; violations of the Charitable Bingo Law are also a violation of law requiring registration.
3100.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-11-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Organizations That Conduct Bingo Under The Charitable Bingo Law Shall Not Be Exempt From The Requirement That Charitable Organizations Must Register With The Secretary Of State; To Amend Section 79-11-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Deny, Suspend Or Revoke The Registration Of A Charitable Organization For Violations Of The Charitable Bingo Law; To Amend Section 79-11-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That It Shall Be A Violation Of The Law That Requires Charitable Organizations To Register With The Secretary Of State For A Registered Charitable Organization To Violate The Provisions Of The Charitable Bingo Law; And For Related Purposes.

3103.title: Council on Education Technology; revise responsibilities; authorize.
3103.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Membership Of The Council On Education Technology; To Revise The Responsibilities Of The Council; And For Related Purposes.

3104.title: Task Force to Study Strategies for Solving the Current Teacher Shortage in Mississippi; establish.
3104.description: An Act To Create The Task Force To Study Strategies For Solving The Current Teacher Shortage In Mississippi To Make Recommendations To The 2011 Regular Session Of The Legislature Regarding Teacher Attrition, Retention And Growth; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Set Forth The Duties Of The Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

3106.title: Dept. of Revenue; authorize certain info to be provided to Bd. of Tax Appeals & provide for appeals of IRP registration denials.
3106.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Tax Appeals To Obtain, Review, Receive Into Evidence And Otherwise Examine And Consider Applications, Returns, Reports And Any Particulars Set Forth Or Disclosed In Any Application Report Or Return Required On Any Taxes Collected By Reports Received By The Department Of Revenue And Any Other Documents And Information Received, Generated And Maintained By The Department Or Revenue; To Amend Sections 27-3-73, 27-7-83, 27-13-57 And 27-65-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Certain Confidential Information May Be Provided By The Department Of Revenue To The Board Of Tax Appeals; To Amend Section 27-19-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Exchange Any Information It May Have On Commercial Vehicles With Any Agency Or Department Of The United States Government, The State Of Mississippi Or Any Other State That Is Responsible For Enforcement Of Laws, Rules And Regulations Relating To The Safety Of Commercial Vehicles; To Amend Section 27-19-136, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Notice Of Assessment Of Motor Vehicle Privilege Taxes And Notice Of Terms Of Payment Of Such Taxes May Be By Regular Mail Instead Of Certified Mail; To Amend Sections 27-77-1, 27-77-11, 27-77-12, 27-77-13 And 27-77-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Appeals To The Board Of Review Of The Department Of Revenue And The Board Of Tax Appeals Of The Denial, Revocation Or Suspension Of The Registration Of A Vehicle Under The Provisions Of The International Registration Plan; To Amend Sections 67-1-71 And 67-1-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Technical Changes To The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; And For Related Purposes.

3108.title: Mississippi State Workforce Investment Board; revise membership of.
3108.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi State Workforce Investment Board To Include The Executive Director From Each Of The Four Workforce Areas In The State; To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Shall Serve On The Board In A Nonvoting, Advisory Capacity; And For Related Purposes.

3109.title: PERS; increase the number of years for retirement at any age for public schoolteachers hired on or after July 1, 2011.
3109.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase To 30 Years The Number Of Years Of Creditable Service Required For Retirement Regardless Of Age Under The Public Employees' Retirement System For Persons Who Become Members Of The System On Or After July 1, 2011; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-114 And 25-11-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

3110.title: Income tax credit for port facility usage and annual impact report; extend repeal date.
3110.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-7-22.23 And 27-7-22.24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2011, The Repeal Date On The Income Tax Credit For Certain Taxpayers That Use The Port Facilities At State, County Or Municipal Ports For Certain Charges Paid By The Taxpayer On The Import Of Cargo, And The Provision That Requires The Mississippi Development Authority To Report Annually To The Legislature Regarding The Impact Of The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

3111.title: Annual compensation for sworn officers of the Mississippi Highway Patrol based on hourly rate; provide for.
3111.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Allocation Of Annual Compensation For Sworn Officers Of The Mississippi Highway Patrol Based On An Hourly Rate; And For Related Purposes.

3112.title: Distinctive license tag; delete requirement that the name of the county in which vehicle is registered be placed thereon.
3112.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires All Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Authorized And/or Renewed After July 1, 2010, To Have A County Designation Referencing The Name Of The County In Which The Vehicle Is Registered; And For Related Purposes.

3115.title: Flood and drainage control districts; create study committee to study impact on state.
3115.description: An Act To Create A Special Study Committee To Examine Flood And Drainage Control Districts To Determine If The Districts Have Provided Adequate Protection To People Of The State; To Study The Economic Impact Of Such Districts; To Review The Functional Operations Of The Districts; And For Related Purposes.

3118.title: Oil and gas severance taxes; revise definition of "person" for purposes of and clarify production subject to.
3118.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-25-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "person" Under The Oil Severance Tax Laws To Include The State Of Mississippi And Any Of Its Political Subdivisions; To Amend Section 27-25-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Oil Severance Tax Is Levied Upon The Production Of Oil From Lands Or Waters That The State, Its Counties, Municipalities, School Districts Or Other Political Subdivisions Own Or In Which They Have An Ownership Interest; To Amend Section 27-25-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "person" Under The Gas Severance Tax Laws To Include The State Of Mississippi And Any Of Its Political Subdivisions; To Amend Section 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Gas Severance Tax Is Levied Upon The Production Of Gas From Lands Or Waters That The State, Its Counties, Municipalities, School Districts Or Other Political Subdivisions Own Or In Which They Have An Ownership Interest; And For Related Purposes.

3119.title: Child sexual conduct; revise computation of second or subsequent offense of depiction of.
3119.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Computation Of Second Or Subsequent Offense Of Depicting Child Sexual Conduct; And For Related Purposes.

3120.title: Deer enclosures; create a task force to study deer breeding industry in the state.
3120.description: An Act To Create A Task Force To Study And Make Recommendations On White-tailed Deer Enclosures And Breeding Pens And The White-tailed Breeding Industry; To Recommend Safeguards To Protect Native Wildlife And Deer Within Such Enclosures; To Determine The Economic Impact Of Potential Development Of White-tailed Deer Breeding Industry; And For Related Purposes.

3121.title: Landowners; compensated by state for certain diminution in property value.
3121.description: An Act To Provide That The State Shall Compensate A Landowner Whose Property Is Diminished In Value Due To Development On An Adjacent Tract Of Land; And For Related Purposes.

3122.title: Department of Audit; bring forward provisions relating to powers and duties of.
3122.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Powers And Duties Of The Department Of Audit, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

3123.title: State-owned vehicles; prohibit permanent assignment of passenger vehicles to certain employees.
3123.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No State Department, Institution Or Agency Shall Permanently Assign A Passenger Vehicle To Its Employee, Except To An Employee Whose Job Duties Require Traveling To A Work Site Other Than The Department, Institution Or Agency Site; And For Related Purposes.

3124.title: Severed mineral interests; require registration in the office of the chancery clerk.
3124.description: An Act To Require Registration Of Severed Mineral Interests In The Office Of The Chancery Clerk Of The County In Which The Mineral Interest Is Located; To Provide For Forfeiture To The State Of Any Severed Mineral Interest Not So Registered; And For Related Purposes.

3126.title: Old School for the Blind property; authorize DFA to sell and convey.
3126.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property Formerly Known As The "old School For The Blind," Located In Jackson, Mississippi; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Mississippi Transportation Commission, To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property Located Within The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi; To Require Monies Derived From The Sale To Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Being Disbursed To The State Board Of Education; To Provide That The State Shall Retain The Right To Repurchase The Real Property If Certain Conditions Occur; To Provide That The State Shall Retain All Mineral Rights To The Real Property Sold Under This Act; To Amend Sections 27-33-17 And 27-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Repeal Sections 1, 2 And 3, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2007, Which Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Lease The Old School For The Blind Property; And For Related Purposes.

3127.title: Lowndes County; may enter into loan agreements with the USDA for terms of not more than 30 years.
3127.description: An Act To Authorize Lowndes County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Loan Agreements With The United States Department Of Agriculture For Terms Of Not More Than 30 Years To Finance The Acquisition Of Real Property And Otherwise Aid In The Development Of The Aerospace Park In The County; And For Related Purposes.

3128.title: Old School for the Blind property; revise authority to lease and redevelop.
3128.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration And The Mississippi Development Authority To Lease The Property Formerly Known As The "old School For The Blind," Which Is Located North Of Eastover Drive In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, For Purposes Of Redevelopment For Terms Not To Exceed 80 Years Resulting In Its Highest And Best Use; To Repeal Sections 2 And 3, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2007, Which Prescribe The Terms For Residential Leases Entered Into By The Mississippi Development Authority With Regard To The Property; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 561, Laws Of 2009, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Contract With A Development Facilitator To Identify And Select Qualified Developers; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Assist The Department Of Finance And Administration And The Development Facilitator In The Performance Of The Contract; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Obtain At Least Two Appraisals On The Property To Establish Its Fair Market Rental Value; To Provide That The Properties Described In Sections 1 And 2 Of This Act Shall Not Be Leased For An Amount Less Than The Fair Market Rental Value; To Require That Any Lease Executed Under This Act Must Contain Provisions For The Periodic Adjustment Of Rentals Throughout The Term Of The Lease; To Amend Section 29-1-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Sections 27-33-17 And 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Homestead Exemption For Persons Who Lease Or Assign The Property From The Lessee And Occupy And Use The Property As A Home; And For Related Purposes.

3130.title: Bonds; issue state g.o. bonds for constructing a new spillway at Lake Mary in Wilkinson County.
3130.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi For The Purpose Of Constructing A New Lake Mary Spillway And Dam In Wilkinson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3131.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property and services to the Military Veterans Association, Inc.
3131.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property To The Military Veterans Association, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3132.title: Sales taxation; exempt the sale of property and services used in the improvement of realty for churches or religious association.
3132.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Purchase Of Tangible Personal Property For Use In The Performance Of A Contract For An Improvement To Realty For A Church Or Religious Association And To Exempt The Sale Of Services For Use In The Performance Of Such A Contract; And For Related Purposes.

3134.title: Appropriation FY2011; Oakley Training School funded to continue operation as juvenile training facility.
3134.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Human Services - Oakley Training School, For Fiscal Year 2011; To Provide That Oakley Training School Shall Continue To Operate As A Secure Training School For Juvenile Delinquents Committed By The Court To The Custody Of The Mississippi Department Of Human Services.

3135.title: Yalobusha County; may locate a detention facility and sheriff's office anywhere in the county.
3135.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Yalobusha County, Mississippi, To Locate A Detention Facility And A Sheriff's Office On County-owned Land Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

3136.title: Appropriation; State Department of Education; national board certification, additional for FY2010.
3136.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Department Of Education-national Board Certification Program For Fiscal Year 2010; And For Related Purposes.

3137.title: Appropriation; district attorneys; staff, chancellor and circuit judges; additional for FY2010.
3137.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys; And To Pay Expenses Of Special Judges, Chancellors And Circuit Judges; And To The Department Of Public Safety Crime Laboratory, Highway Safety Patrol And Bureau Of Narcotics Continuation Funding For Fiscal Year 2010; And For Related Purposes.

3138.title: Bonds; authorize for matching funds for construction of a regional workforce training center at Southwest MS Community College.
3138.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Matching Construction Funds Necessary To Obtain Funds From The Economic Development Administration Of The United States Department Of Commerce To Pay The Cost Of Construction Of A Regional Workforce Training Center On The Campus Of Southwest Mississippi Community College; And For Related Purposes.

3139.title: City of Rolling Fork; authorize expansion of water distribution system to areas more than 5 miles outside city limits.
3139.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Rolling Fork In Sharkey County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water Distribution System Within Certain Areas That Are More Than Five Miles Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Rolling Fork; And For Related Purposes.

3140.title: The Sweetened Beverages and Syrups Tax Law; enact.
3140.description: An Act To Create The Sweetened Beverages And Syrups Tax Law; To Provide That Distributors Who Receive, Store, Manufacture, Bottle Or Distribute Certain Sweetened Beverage Products For Sale To Retailers In This State Must Obtain From The Department Of Revenue A Permit To Engage In Such Business; To Impose An Excise Tax On Every Distributor For The Privilege Of Selling Certain Sweetened Beverage Products; To Create The Children's Health Promotion Fund; To Provide That 20% Of The Revenue From The Excise Tax Imposed By This Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Children's Health Promotion Fund And That The Remainder Of Such Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Money In Such Fund; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Tax Levied By This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3141.title: Income taxation; grant a tax credit for contributions to certain student aid programs.
3141.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Contributions Made By A Taxpayer To The Mississippi Tuition Grant Assistance Program Or Any Other Similar Program Established To Provide Financial Assistance To Students Attending Mississippi Community Colleges Or Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

3143.title: Tunica County; authorize contribution to the Institute of Community Services, Inc.
3143.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County To Contribute Funds To The Institute Of Community Services, Inc., To Assist The Institute In Establishing And Operating Head Start Classes For Children In Tunica County, To Acquire, Operate And Maintain New And Existing Vehicles To Be Used To Transport The Children To And From The Head Start Facility And To Provide Day Care Vouchers For Parents; And For Related Purposes.

3146.title: St. Catherine Creek Utility Authority; limit its duties to solid waste and storm water.
3146.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 953, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, Which Creates The St. Catherine Creek Utility Authority Within Adams County, Mississippi, To Reduce The Scope Of Authority's Duties And Responsibilities To Prevent The Fragmentation, Duplication And Overlap Of Duties And Responsibilities With Other Adams County Entities; And For Related Purposes.

3147.title: Farmers markets; clarify sales tax provisions regarding products sold at markets certified by Department of Agriculture.
3147.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Description Of Certain Food Products Grown, Made Or Processed In Mississippi And Sold At Farmers' Markets Certified By The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce For Purposes Of The Exemption From Sales Tax For Agricultural Products; And For Related Purposes.

3151.title: Bonds; increase for loans to develop the Farish Street Historic District.
3151.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 465, Laws Of 1999, To Increase From $6,000,000.00 To $12,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Making Loans Or Grants Available To The Appropriate Planning And Development District To Make Low Interest Loans Available To Persons Or Entities Who Develop Certain Property In The Farish Street Historic District; To Clarify The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Such Loans May Be Used; To Remove The Provision That Limits The Maximum Amount Of A Loan That May Be Made To Any One Person Or Entity; And For Related Purposes.

3152.title: Appropriation; Alcorn State-Agricultural Programs.

3154.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service For Fiscal Year 2011.

3155.title: Appropriation; Forest & Wildlife Research.
3155.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Incurred In The Maintenance And Operation Of The Forest And Wildlife Research Center For Fiscal Year 2011.

3156.title: Appropriation; College of Veterinary Medicine.
3156.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The College Of Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3157.title: Appropriation; Student Financial Aid.
3157.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support And Maintenance Of Financial Aid Scholarship, Loan And Grant Programs And The Mississippi Office Of Student Financial Aid, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3158.title: Appropriation; Univ. Med. Cen. - Consol.
3158.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center For Fiscal Year 2011.

3159.title: Appropriation; IHL - General Support - Subsidiary Programs -Consol.

3160.title: Appropriation; IHL - General Support.

3161.title: Appropriation; Jr. Colleges - Admin.
3161.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges For Fiscal Year 2011.

3162.title: Appropriation; Jr. Colleges - Support.
3162.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2011.

3165.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi National Guard For Fiscal Year 2011.

3166.title: Appropriation; Dept. Public Safety - Consol.
3166.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Public Safety For Fiscal Year 2011.

3167.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans Affairs Board For Fiscal Year 2011.

3168.title: Appropriation; Ethics Comm.
3168.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Ethics Commission For The Fiscal Year 2011.

3169.title: Appropriation; Judicial Performance Comm.
3169.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission On Judicial Performance Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2011.

3170.title: Appropriation; Banking and Consumer Finance.
3170.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Support Of The State Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance For Fiscal Year 2011.

3171.title: Appropriation; MS Department of Employment Security.
3171.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For Fiscal Year 2011.

3172.title: Appropriation; Mississippi Department of Revenue.
3172.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Revenue, Including The Homestead Exemption Division, The Motor Vehicle Comptroller Functions, The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division, And The Bureau Of Telecommunications; For The Purpose Of Reimbursing The Counties, County Districts And Municipal Separate School Districts For Tax Losses Incurred By Reason Of The Exemption Of Homes From Certain Ad Valorem Taxes; And For The Purpose Of Purchasing Motor Vehicle License Tags, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3173.title: Appropriation; MS Workers Compensation Comm.
3173.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Workers' Compensation Commission For Fiscal Year 2011.

3174.title: Appropriation; Dept. of Mental Health.
3174.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Mental Health And Certain Programs Of The Division Of Alcohol And Drug Abuse, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3175.title: Appropriation; Gaming Commission.
3175.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3178.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners For Fiscal Year 2011.
