3179.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To The Mississippi State Board Of Dental Examiners For Fiscal Year 2011.

3180.title: Appropriation; Funeral Services Bd.
3180.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Funeral Services For Fiscal Year 2011.

3181.title: Appropriation; Board of Massage Therapy.
3181.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Massage Therapy, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3182.title: Appropriation; Pharmacy Bd.
3182.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Pharmacy For Fiscal Year 2011.

3183.title: Appropriation; Prof. Counselors Licensing Bd.
3183.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Professional Counselor Licensing Board For Fiscal Year 2011.

3184.title: Appropriation; Veterinary Exam. Bd.
3184.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Veterinary Examiners For Fiscal Year 2011.

3185.title: Appropriation; Bd. of Architecture.
3185.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Architecture And Landscape Architecture Advisory Committee For Fiscal Year 2011.

3186.title: Appropriation; Mississippi Board of Registered Professional Geologists.
3186.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Registered Professional Geologists For Fiscal Year 2011.

3187.title: Appropriation; Motor Vehicle Comm.
3187.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Commission For Fiscal Year 2011.

3188.title: Appropriation; Bd. of Public Accountancy.
3188.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Accountancy For Fiscal Year 2011.

3189.title: Appropriation; Public Contractors Bd.
3189.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Contractors For Fiscal Year 2011.

3190.title: Appropriation; Agriculture & Commerce - Support and Grain Div.
3190.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, For The Fiscal Year 2011.

3191.title: Appropriation; Egg Marketing Bd.
3191.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3192.title: Appropriation; Animal Health Board.
3192.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board For Fiscal Year 2011.

3193.title: Appropriation; Fair Comm. - Co. Livestock Show.
3193.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Fair Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Dixie National Livestock Show; A Roundup For Junior Exhibitors Of Livestock And Goats; Supplemental Funds For Livestock Premiums; County Livestock Shows In Offering And Paying Prizes Or Awards To Competitors In Approved County Livestock Shows; The Five District Livestock Shows; The Five State Dairy Shows; The Mississippi High School Rodeo; And To Provide How Said Money Shall Be Paid Out Of The State Treasury For Fiscal Year 2011.

3194.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Comm. - Support.
3194.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Fair Commission, The Mississippi Livestock Coliseum And The Industrial Showcase And Trade Mart Building For Fiscal Year 2011.

3195.title: Appropriation; Tenn-Tom Waterway Develop. Dist.
3195.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway Development Authority For The Purposes Enumerated In Section 51-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3196.title: Appropriation; Dept. of Audit.
3196.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Audit For Fiscal Year 2011.

3197.title: Appropriation; Finance & Admin. Consol.
3197.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2011.

3198.title: Appropriation; Governor's Office and Mansion.
3198.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For Expenses Of The Executive Department, Being The Governor's Office And Staff, And For Expenses Incidental To The Proper Operation Of The Governor's Mansion And Residence Of The Governor, For Fiscal Year 2011.

3199.title: Appropriation; Information Technology Services.
3199.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2011.

3200.title: Appropriation; Personnel Bd.
3200.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Personnel Board For Fiscal Year 2011.

3201.title: Appropriation; Secretary of State.
3201.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2011.

3202.title: Appropriation; Debt Service-Bank Ser. Charge.
3202.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2011, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2011.

3203.title: Appropriation; Treasurers Office.
3203.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2011.

3204.title: Homestead exemption; increase in certain counties for persons 65 or older or totally disabled.
3204.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After January 1, 2011, Homeowners Who Are 65 Years Of Age Or Older Or Who Are Totally Disabled In Counties That Have Experienced An Increase In The Total Assessed Value Of All Class I Property Of 10% Or More Since 2008 As A Result Of An Update In The Valuation Of Class I Property, Shall Be Allowed An Exemption From All Ad Valorem Taxes On Not In Excess Of $10,000.00 Of The Assessed Value Of The Homestead Property; And For Related Purposes.

3205.title: Natchez/Adams County; authorize contributions to Natchez, Inc. and abolish the Natchez-Adams County Development Authority.
3205.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Natchez, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Organized For Economic Development Purposes; To Repeal Chapter 913, Local And Private Laws Of 2002, Which Creates The Natchez-adams County Development Authority, And To Provide That Any Funds Held By The Natchez-adams County Development Authority From Any Source, And All Equipment, Furnishings And Other Personal Property, Records, Documents And Files Of The Natchez-adams County Development Authority, Shall Be Contributed Or Transferred To Natchez, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3208.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.
3208.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,470,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3209.title: Small business; authorize a loan program to encourage extension of conventional financing.
3209.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Small Business Participating Loan Program To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That The Program Shall Provide Loans To Small Businesses For The Purpose Of Encouraging The Extension Of Conventional Financing And The Issuance Of Letters Of Credit To Small Businesses By Private Institutions; To Provide That The Amount Of A Loan To Any Single Small Business Under The Program Shall Not Exceed 50% Of The Total Cost Of The Project For Which Financing Is Sought Or $100,000.00, Whichever Is Less; To Create The Mississippi Small Business Participating Loan Program Revolving Fund In The State Treasury From Which Money To Make The Loans Under The Program Shall Be Drawn; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $23,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Program; To Amend Section 57-10-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "small Business" Under The Mississippi Small Business Assistance Act; To Amend Section 57-10-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount That Planning And Development Districts And Qualified Entities May Retain To Aid In The Administration And Management Of The Mississippi Small Business Assistance Program; And For Related Purposes.

3210.title: Economic development; authorize certain tax exemption and loans or grants for certain business enterprises.
3210.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Business Enterprises That Locate Or Expand In This State That Own Or Operate A Facility For The Manufacture Or Assembly Of Systems Or Components Used In The Generation Of Clean Energy, Or Own Or Operate A Facility That Manufactures Or Assembles Products For The Aerospace Industry Or Provides Research And Development Or Training Services In The Aerospace Industry, Shall Be Exempt For A Period Of Ten Years From Any Sales And Use Tax Related To The Purchase Of Component Building Materials And Equipment For Initial Construction Of Facilities Or Expansion Of Facilities, All Income Tax Imposed On Income Earned By The Business Enterprise, Franchise Tax Imposed On The Business Enterprise And Any Sales And Use Tax Imposed On The Lease Of Machinery And Equipment Acquired In The Initial Construction To Establish The Facility Or For An Expansion Of A Facility; To Provide That Certain Business Enterprises That Operate Data Centers In This State Shall Be Exempt From Any Sales And Use Tax Imposed On The Business Enterprise For The Purchase Of Component Building Materials And Equipment For Initial Construction Of Facilities Or Expansion Of Facilities, And Any Sales And Use Tax Imposed On The Purchase Of Replacement Hardware, Software Or Other Necessary Technology To Operate A Data Center; To Provide That Applications For The Tax Exemptions Shall Be Made To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Minimum Contents Of The Application; To Provide Certain Conditions That Apply To The Exemptions; To Amend Sections 27-7-21, 27-13-5, 27-13-7 And 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Create The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Fund To Provide Loans Or Grants To Local Governments And Certain Business Enterprises To Construct Or Otherwise Provide Certain Facilities; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That Local Governments And Business Enterprises Desiring A Loan Or A Grant Must Submit An Application To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Minimum Content Of Such Applications; To Provide That Contracts By Local Governments For The Acquisition, Purchase, Construction Or Installation Of A Project Shall Be Exempt From The Provisions Of Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, If Certain Conditions Are Met; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $100,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Fund; To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $316,000,000.00 To $321,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Language Providing For The Issuance Of Bonds Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $27,500,000.00 To $32,500,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of $2,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Amend Sections 57-62-3, 57-62-5, 57-62-9, 57-62-11, 57-62-13 And 57-62-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Legislative Intent Provisions Regarding The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act; To Revise Certain Definitions And Provisions Regarding Incentive Payments Made To Qualified Businesses Under The Mississippi Advantage Jobs Act; To Change Internal References Regarding The State Tax Commission And Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

3211.title: Freeport warehouse ad valorem tax exemption; authorize certain underground formations and cavities to be warehouses.
3211.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Underground Formations And Cavities Shall Be Considered To Be A Warehouse Or Storage Facility Under The Law That Authorizes Counties Or Municipalities To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Certain Personal Property Consigned To A Freeport Warehouse; And For Related Purposes.

3215.title: Bonds; Bond Commission may negotiate sale of cert. bonds; auth. edu. bldg. corps. for comm. colleges; auth. bonds for wireless sys.
3215.description: An Act To Amend Sections 97 Through 118, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2004 Third Extraordinary Session, As Last Amended By Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009, To Extend The Authority To Issue Bonds For Certain Capital Improvements Until July 1, 2011; To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 525, Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Section 11, Chapter 506, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 506, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Sections 3 Through 18, Chapter 541, Laws Of 2001, As Last Amended By Section 1, Chapter 607, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 7, Chapter 607, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 15, Chapter 538, Laws Of 2006, To Extend Until July 1, 2011, The Authority To Issue Certain Bonds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 3, Chapter 504, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 504, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 13, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Chapter 460, Laws Of 2006, As Amended By Chapter 463, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Sections 2 Through 17, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2005 Third Extraordinary Session, As Amended By Section 2, Chapter 437, Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until July 1, 2013, The Authority To Issue State General Obligation Bonds For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Sections 40 Through 55, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2005 Third Extraordinary Session, As Amended By Section 3, Chapter 437, Laws Of 2008, To Extend Until July 1, 2011, The Authority To Issue State General Obligation Bonds For The Mississippi Job Protection Act Fund; To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 5, Chapter 506, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Sections 7 Through 22, Chapter 459, Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Sections 1 Through 18, Laws Of 2006, As Amended By Section 1, Chapter 355, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Chapter 542, Laws Of 2006, As Amended By Section 1, Chapter 429, Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Amend Section 5, Chapter 538, Laws Of 2006, As Amended By Section 54, Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009, To Authorize The State Bond Commission To Negotiate The Sale Of Such Bonds And To Delete The Requirement That The Notice Of The Sale Of The Bonds Be Published In A Newspaper Or Financial Journal With A Large National Circulation; To Authorize The Formation Of Nonprofit Corporations For The Purpose Of Acquiring Or Constructing Facilities For Community And Junior Colleges Which Shall Be Known As Educational Building Corporations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Such Corporations; To Authorize Such Corporations To Issue Its Bonds To Provide Funds For The Acquiring Or Construction Of Facilities; To Provide For The Issuance Of Such Bonds; To Provide That All Bonds Issued By An Educational Building Corporation Shall Be Solely And Exclusively Obligations Of The Corporation And Shall Not Create An Obligation Or Debt Of The State Of Mississippi And Shall Not Constitute A Debt Of The Community Or Junior College For Which The Facilities Are To Be Constructed; To Amend Section 37-29-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase To 35 Years The Term Of Lease Agreements Or Service That The Board Of Trustees Of Community Or Junior Colleges Are Authorized To Enter Into To Acquire Lands, Buildings And Related Facilities; To Require Community Or Junior Colleges To Purchase Business Interruption Insurance On Certain Auxiliary Facilities; To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By Section 1, House Bill No. 1681, 2010 Regular Session, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Certify The Number Of Acres Used By The Applicant For Sweet Potato Growing And Farming Purposes During The Calendar Year In Which Application Is Made For Assistance Under A Certain Loan Guaranty Program Established By This Section; To Provide That The Maximum Amount Of The Loan Under Such Program Shall Not Exceed $1,700.00 Per Acre; To Provide That The Time Allowed For Repayment Of A Loan Under Such Program Shall Not Be More Than Five Years; To Authorize The Governor To Issue To A Telecommunication Enterprise That Has Contracted With The State To Provide Broadband Telecommunications Service To Institutions Of Higher Learning, A Payment Credit Voucher In Lieu Of An Equal Amount Of Cash Payment Pursuant To The Terms Of The Contract For Services; To Provide That The Payment Credit Voucher Shall Entitle The Telecommunications Enterprise To A Credit Against The Aggregate Tax Liabilities Imposed On Such Telecommunications Enterprise By Chapters 7 And 13 Of Title 27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In An Amount That Is Equal To Such Payment Credit Voucher; To Limit The Aggregate Amount Of The Credits That May Be Issued In Any One Fiscal Year; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007 As Amended By Section 25, Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Construction, Maintenance And Operation Of A Statewide Wireless Communications System; And For Related Purposes.

3216.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for the purchase of new hybrid electric vehicles or electric vehicles.
3216.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Purchase New Hybrid Electric Vehicles Or Electric Vehicles Without The Intent To Resell The Vehicle; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit To The Lesser Of $1,500.00 Or 2% Of The Total Cost Of The Vehicle; To Provide That In No Event Shall The Amount Of The Credit Exceed The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year Reduced By The Sum Of All Other Credits Allowable To The Taxpayer Under The State Income Tax Laws; And For Related Purposes.

3217.title: Appropriation; State Government Agencies Special Fund; Additional FY 2010.
3217.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys; The Mississippi State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners; The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration; The Mississippi Fair Commission - Dixie National Livestock Show; The Pat Harrison Waterway District; The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; And The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges For Fiscal Year 2010; And For Related Purposes.

3218.title: Jackson County; authorize the use for forfeiture funds to pay a clothing allowance to certain undercover agents.
3218.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Utilize Forfeiture Funds To Pay An Annual Clothing Allowance To Undercover Agents Assigned To The Narcotics Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

3219.title: Cigarettes; impose a health tax on cigarettes of distributors.
3219.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-70-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Purpose Of The Chapter Of Law Relating To Taxes Imposed On Certain Cigarettes; To Amend Section 27-70-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "tobacco Settlement Agreement"; To Amend Sections 27-70-5 And 27-70-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Health Impact Tax Shall Not Apply To Cigarettes That Are Sold, Purchased Or Otherwise Distributed In This State For Sale Outside This State; To Provide That A Person May Not Transport From This State Certain Cigarettes For Sale In Another State Without First Affixing To The Cigarettes The Stamp Required By The State In Which The Cigarettes Are To Be Sold Or By Paying Any Other Excise Tax On The Cigarettes Imposed By The State In Which The Cigarettes Are To Be Sold Unless This Practice Is Prohibited In Such Other State; To Provide That The Health Impact Tax Shall Be Imposed, Levied And Assessed On Each Distributor Of Cigarettes And Shall Be Due And Payable On Or Before The 15th Day Of The Month Next Succeeding The Month In Which The Cigarettes Are Sold, Used, Consumed, Or Distributed In This State; To Provide That Cigarette Distributors Shall Be Eligible For A Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide Penalties For Cigarette Distributors Who Violate The Provisions Of This Law; To Amend Section 27-69-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Information In Permits Issued Under The Tobacco Tax Law May Be Disclosed To The Holder Of A Wholesaler's Permit And To Law Enforcement Agencies Of The State Or Any Political Subdivision Of The State; To Amend Section 27-69-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If Any Wholesaler Subject To The Provisions Of The Tobacco Tax Law Shall Cease To Do Business In The State Of Mississippi, He Shall Be Allowed A Refund Of The Tax Paid On Cigarettes In His Possession; To Repeal Sections 27-70-7, 27-70-11, 27-70-13, 27-70-15, 27-70-17 And 27-70-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Impose A Fee On Nonsettling Cigarette Manufacturers, Provide For The Computation, The Rate Of Increase And Notice Of The Fee To Such Manufacturers, Require Such Manufacturers To Certify Their Compliance With The Fee Requirement, Provide For A Directory Of Certified Cigarette Manufacturers, Require Certain Cigarette Manufacturers To Prepay A Fee And Require Certain Cigarette Manufacturers To Register With The Attorney General; And For Related Purposes.

3220.title: MS Major Economic Impact Act; revise the definition of the term "project" and authorize the issuance of bonds for a project.
3220.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-75-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "project" Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act To Include Certain Manufacturers Of Solar Panels; To Amend Section 57-75-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Contracts By The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Authority Or A Public Agency For The Acquisition, Purchase, Construction Or Installation Of Such Projects Shall Be Exempt From The Provisions Of Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, If Certain Conditions Are Met; To Amend Section 57-75-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Authority Certain Additional Powers And Duties With Regard To Such Projects; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Such Projects And To Specify The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Such Bonds May Be Utilized; To Amend Section 57-75-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The County In Which Such A Project Is Located To Acquire The Site For Such Project And Contribute The Site To The Enterprise Operating The Project, Apply For Grants And Loans And Utilize The Proceeds Of Such Grants And Loans For Infrastructure Related To The Project And Enter Into A Lease Agreement With The Enterprise Operating The Project For A Term Not To Exceed 99 Years; And For Related Purposes.

3221.title: City of Ridgeland; authorize the city to levy an additional sales tax for certain purposes.
3221.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; To Require The City Of Ridgeland To Appoint A Commission Which Must Approve The Expenditure Of Revenue From The Tax Levied Pursuant To This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3222.title: Forrest County; authorize contributions to various agencies.
3222.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Forrest County To Contribute Funds To The Association For Retarded Citizens, Big Brothers/big Sisters Of Southeast Mississippi, Boy Scouts Of America, Gulf Pine Girl Scout Council, Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Inc., Neighborhood Education Enhancement Development Services (n.e.e.d.s.), Salvation Army, Pearl River Valley Opportunity, Pinebelt Association For Community Enhancement (p.a.c.e.), Hattiesburg Little League Baseball Association, Petal Optimist Club Baseball, The Aids Services Coalition And First Tee; And For Related Purposes.

3223.title: Hinds County; may establish the Hinds Co. Economic Development Authority and abolish Hinds Co. Economic Development District.
3223.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County, Mississippi, To Establish An Economic And Community Development Authority To Be Known As The Hinds County Economic Development Authority; To Provide For The Appointment Of Trustees Of The Authority; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Authority; To Provide That The Authority May Be Authorized By The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Certain Economic Development, And/or Community Development For Municipalities Located In Hinds County; To Provide That The Authority May Be Authorized By The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Certain Community Development Services In The County; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County To Issue Bonds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Cost Of Acquiring And Improving Land And Buildings Related To Economic Development; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Dissolve The Hinds County Economic Development District; And For Related Purposes.

3224.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
3224.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Mississippi Food Network; The Initiative, Inc.; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Vicksburg Main Street Project; Warren Washington Issaquena Sharkey Community Action Agency; We Care Community Services, Inc.; And Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

3225.title: Three Rivers PPD; authorize certain counties and municipalities for loans & grants made available by.
3225.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Calhoun County, Chickasaw County, Lafayette County, Lee County, Monroe County, Pontotoc County, Union County And Itawamba County, And The Governing Authorities Of The Municipalities Of Abbeville, Aberdeen, Algoma, Amory, Baldwyn, Blue Springs, Bruce, Calhoun City, Derma, Ecru, Fulton, Gattman, Guntown, Hatley, Houston, Mantachie, Myrtle, Nettleton, New Albany, New Houlka, Okolona, Oxford, Plantersville, Pontotoc, Saltillo, Sherman, Taylor, Thaxton, Tupelo, Shannon, Slate Springs, Smithville, Tremont, Vardaman, Verona And Woodland, To Apply For And Receive Loans Or Grant Funds Made Available By Three Rivers Planning And Development District For Economic And Community Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

3227.title: Harrison County; authorize the lease of a trailer to the Gulf Coast Community Foundation for nominal consideration.
3227.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County To Lease A Surplus Trailer To The Gulf Coast Community Foundation For Nominal Consideration To Be Used As A Facility To Serve The Citizens Of The Saucier Community As A Food Pantry And For Other Charitable Uses; And For Related Purposes.

3229.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize to contribute funds and in-kind services to Beulah Cemetery.
3229.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To And Provide In-kind Services For Maintenance To The Beulah Cemetery; And For Related Purposes.

3231.title: Issaquena County; authorize to participate in turbine project in Mississippi River.
3231.description: An Act To Authorize Issaquena County, Mississippi, To Participate In A Project To Install Turbines In The Mississippi River To Generate Electricity For Sale By The County; To Provide That The County May Finance The Project By Issuance Of Revenue Bonds; To Authorize Issaquena County To Form A Nonprofit Corporation To Carry Out The Project; And For Related Purposes.

3232.title: Lauderdale County; authorize to negotiate fee-in-lieu payment to school district under major economic project in the county.
3232.description: An Act To Provide That The Lauderdale County, Mississippi, Board Of Supervisors May, With Respect To Any Company Constructing And Locating A Major Capital Project, As Defined By The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act, Apportion, Divide And Allocate The Sum Allowed As A Fee-in-lieu Pursuant To Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Such Proportion To The School District That Is Agreed Upon In Negotiations; And For Related Purposes.

3233.title: Issaquena County; authorize transfer of lot to Town of Mayersville.
3233.description: An Act To Authorize Issaquena County, Mississippi, To Transfer To The Town Of Mayersville, Mississippi, A Certain Lot Which The County Has No Use For; And For Related Purposes.

3234.title: Town of Glendora; designate a qualified resort area for purposes of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law.
3234.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Glendora, Mississippi, To Designate The Town As A Qualified Resort Area For Purposes Of The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; And For Related Purposes.

3235.title: City of Biloxi, MS; may clean certain private property that was impacted by Hurricane Katrina.
3235.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Biloxi, Mississippi, To Take Necessary Action To Clean Private Property On Which Commercial Buildings Or Multifamily Housing Building Structures Are, Or Were, Located That Were Impacted By Hurricane Katrina, Are No Long In A State Of Repair Suitable For Use And Occupancy, And Are Neglected To The Extent The Structures Or Debris And Remnants From Structures Are A Menace To Public Health And Safety; To Provide For A Hearing And Notice To Property Owners And Lienholders; To Provide That If The City Takes Corrective Action Regarding The Property, The City May Recover Its Actual Cost And Impose A Penalty; And For Related Purposes.

3236.title: Claiborne County; authorize to expend funds for the development of an industrial park.
3236.description: An Act To Provide That The Board Of Supervisors Of Claiborne County, Mississippi, May Expend, And Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Claiborne County Economic Development District To Expend, Any Money In The County Treasury For Economic Development And For The Acquisition, Development And Improvement Of Real Estate Within Claiborne County, Mississippi, To Be Used For An Industrial Park, Parks Or Sites; Authorize Such Board Of Trustees To Sell, Lease, Trade, Exchange Or Otherwise Dispose Of Sites Located Within Industrial Parks Or Sites For Industrial, Commercial, Warehouse And Other Use; And For Related Purposes.

3238.title: Jackson Convention and Visitors Bureau; remove repeal date on.
3238.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Authorize The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau To Make Contracts With, And Contributions Or Payments To, Governmental Authorities, Public Agencies, Private Entities And Persons In Support Of Programs, Activities Or Facilities Which Are Useful In The Promotion Of Tourism And Conventions And Related Matters Within The City Of Jackson Upon Such Consideration Or Lack Thereof As The Parties Thereto May Agree; To Provide That Such Contracts May Extend For A Term Of Up To 10 Years; To Authorize The Bureau To Enter Into Contracts And Agreement For The Acquisition, Construction, Improvement, Rehabilitation, Furnishing And Equipping Of Buildings And Facilities Which Are Necessary And Useful In The Furtherance Of The Activities Of The Bureau And The Promotion, Establishment And Development Of Tourism, Conventions And Related Matters Within The City Of Jackson, And To Authorize The Bureau To Borrow Funds, Issue Debt And The Arrange Financing For Such Purposes Upon Such Consideration As The Parties Thereto Shall Agree; To Provide That Such Contracts May Extend For A Term Of Up To 25 Years; To Delete The July 1, 2011, Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law Which Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Impose A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

3239.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize to name a Family Master for chancery court.
3239.description: An Act To Authorize The Senior Chancellor Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Name A Qualified Individual To Serve As A Family Master For Its Chancery Court; And For Related Purposes.

3240.title: Harrison County; authorize contracts with not-for-profit organizations for promotion of tourism and conventions.
3240.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County, Mississippi, To Contract With Not-for-profit Organizations To Provide Services For Advertising, Marketing And Promotion Of Tourism And Conventions In Harrison County And Other Related Activities; And For Related Purposes.

3242.title: Authorized activity by trustees; clarify that religious denominations or foundations are included.
3242.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-27-1.102, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Acting As A Trustee By A Religious Denomination, Church Or Synagogue Or An Affiliated Foundation Is Authorized Trust Activity; And For Related Purposes.

3243.title: Reenacted State Department of Health and State Board of Health; change effective date on bill.
3243.description: An Act To Amend Section 18 Of House Bill No. 211 (2010 Regular Session) To Change The Effective Date Of The Bill Reenacting The State Department Of Health And The State Board Of Health; And For Related Purposes.

3244.title: Public property; authorize DFA to sell and convey or lease the Old School for the Blind property.
3244.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Sell And Convey Or Lease Certain State-owned Real Property Formerly Known As The "old School For The Blind," Located In Jackson, Mississippi; To Require Monies Derived From The Sale Or Lease Of That Property To Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Being Disbursed To The State Board Of Education; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Negotiate An Agreement Requiring The Developer To Construct A New Superintendent Residence And Building Maintenance Facility; To Provide That The State Shall Retain The Right To Repurchase The Real Property Or Terminate The Lease If Certain Conditions Occur; To Provide That The State Shall Retain All Mineral Rights To The Real Property Sold Or Leased Under This Act; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Review And Consider All Proposals For The Purchase Or Lease Of The Property Using Certain Reviewing Factors; To Allow The Department Of Finance And Administration To Correct Any Discrepancies In The Legal Description To The Property; To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property Located In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, In Connection With The Proposed Sale Or Lease Of The "old School For The Blind Property"; To Amend Sections 27-33-17 And 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Repeal Sections 1, 2 And 3, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2007, Which Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Lease The Old School For The Blind Property; And For Related Purposes.

3245.title: Health care exchange plans; prohibit use of federal funds to pay for elective abortions in Mississippi.
3245.description: An Act Entitled The "federal Abortion-mandate Opt-out Act"; To Prohibit The Use Of Federal Funds To Pay For Elective Abortions Covered By Private Insurance In The State Of Mississippi Through A Health Care Exchange; And For Related Purposes.

3246.title: Amend Senate Rules to limit private discourse on the Senate floor while the Senate is in session.
3246.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule No. 34 To Provide That Senators And Senate Staff Shall Not Be Permitted To Engage In Private Discourse On The Senate Floor While The Senate Is In Session Except At The Sides Of The Senate Chamber.

3247.title: Senate Rules; limit number of resolution presentations on the floor of the Senate.
3247.description: A Resolution Adopting Senate Rule 28a To Limit The Number Of Resolution Presentations Which A Senator May Make On The Floor Of The Senate.

3248.title: Senate Rules; amend to require an unedited copy of the Senate Journal from the previous day available to any Senator.
3248.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule 25 To Direct The Secretary To Make An Unedited Copy Of The Senate Journal From The Previous Legislative Day Available In The Senate Lounge And On The Senate Floor Upon The Request Of Any Senator.

3249.title: Senate Rules; authorize bills and resolutions to be prepared on letter-size paper.
3249.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule No. 73 To Provide That Beginning With The 2011 Regular Session All Bills And Resolutions May Be Prepared On Letter-size Or Legal-size Paper.

3250.title: Recognize business and civic leadership of Michael Joe Cannon.
3250.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Business And Civic Leadership Of Michael Joe Cannon Of Greenwood, Mississippi.

3251.title: Celebrating the 100th Anniversary of the Boy Scouts of America.
3251.description: A Resolution Celebrating The 100th Anniversary Of The Boy Scouts Of America And Honoring Scouting Values.

3252.title: Welcome Turkish Delegation to Mississippi.
3252.description: A Resolution Welcoming And Saluting The Members Of The Turkish Delegation To The State Of Mississippi On The Occasion Of The Turkish Council Of Americans And Eurasians (tcae) Turkish-mississippian Friendship Reception.

3253.title: Commend life of D'Iberville businessman, oysterman and policeman Thomas "Bay" Gollott.
3253.description: A Resolution Commending The Life Of Respected Gulf Coast Businessman, Oysterman And Veteran Policeman Thomas "bay" Gollott Of D'iberville, Mississippi.

3254.title: Commend Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Incorporated on the occasion of its "2010 Statewide Delta Day at the Capitol."
3254.description: A Resolution Commending Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Incorporated, On The Occasion Of Its "2010 Statewide Delta Day At The Capitol."

3255.title: Commend Kayla Stricker on being selected the 2009 State Games AT&T Female Athlete of the year.
3255.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Kayla Stricker On Being Selected As The 2009 State Games Of Mississippi At&t Female Athlete Of The Year.

3256.title: Commend Joe Morrow upon being selected the 2009 State Games AT&T Male Athlete of the Year.
3256.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Joe Morrow On Being Selected As The 2009 State Games Of Mississippi At&t Male Athlete Of The Year.

3257.title: Recognize and salute Chef Luis Bruno for Mississippi Public Broadcasting Production "Cooking for Life with Chef Luis Bruno."
3257.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Saluting Chef Luis Bruno, Former Executive Chef For The Governor Of Mississippi And Leading Healthy Food Advocate, As An Unofficial Ambassador For The State Of Mississippi, And Congratulating Him On His Mississippi Public Broadcasting Production "cooking For Life With Chef Luis Bruno."

3258.title: Commend Mississippi Homemaker Volunteers, Inc.
3258.description: A Resolution To Recognize And Commend The Civic And Charitable Contributions Of Mississippi Homemaker Volunteers, Inc.

3259.title: Expressing our appreciation to Paul Lacoste.
3259.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Expressing Our Appreciation To Paul Lacoste For His Leadership In Increasing The Mississippi Senate's Awareness Of And Improving Our Overall Health.

3260.title: Commend Dr. James Price upon the occasion of his retirement as Superintendent of Vicksburg-Warren School District.
3260.description: A Resolution Commending The Dedicated Service Of Dr. James Price, Superintendent Of The Vicksburg-warren School District, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3261.title: Commend service of Dr. John E. Walls, Jr., Deputy Superintendent of Vicksburg-Warren School District, upon his retirement.
3261.description: A Resolution Commending The Dedicated Service Of Dr. John E. Walls, Jr., Deputy Superintendent Of The Vicksburg-warren School District, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3262.title: Constitutional amendment; reduce the size of the Legislature.
3262.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 254, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reduce The Size Of The Legislature.

3263.title: Commend Jackson Academy "Lady Raiders" Girls Soccer Team for first State Championship.
3263.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Jackson Academy "lady Raiders" Girls Soccer Team And Coach Nic Henderson For Their First State Championship.

3264.title: Commend the life of Don Butler, former Chief of the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol.
3264.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Mourn The Loss And Commend The Life Of Donald Butler, Former Chief Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol.

3265.title: Commend life of prominent Jackson businessman and community leader Hap Hederman.
3265.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life Of Prominent Jackson Businessman And Community Leader Hap Hederman.

3266.title: Commend life of Afghanistan casualty, Sergeant Matthew Ingram.
3266.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life Of United States Army Sergeant Matthew Lee Ingram Of Newton County, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In Action In Afghanistan On Friday, August 21, 2009, And Express The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3267.title: Commend life of Afghanistan casualty Mississippi Army National Guard Sergeant First Class Severin Summers III.
3267.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life Of Mississippi Army National Guard Sergeant First Class Severin Summers Iii Who Was Lost In Action In Afghanistan On Sunday, August 2, 2009, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3268.title: Commend Anna Elizabeth Tadlock, Miss Mississippi 2009.
3268.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Anna Elizabeth Tadlock For Being Crowned Miss Mississippi 2009.

3269.title: Commend Sergeant 1st Class Jesse Nicholson for receiving the Bronze Star with Valor for heroic actions in Iraq.
3269.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Sergeant 1st Class Jesse R. Nicholson Upon His Receipt Of The Bronze Star With Valor For His Heroic Actions In Iraq On February 16, 2005.

3270.title: Commend Ken Toler, Sr., Mississippi Sports Hall of Fame Class of 2010.
3270.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ken Toler, Sr., Recipient Of The Highest Number Of Mississippi Tennis Rankings Than Any Other Individual Player In History, Upon His Induction Into The Mississippi Sports Hall Of Fame Class Of 2010.

3271.title: Commend Orange Grove "Southern Heat" Baseball Team for Southwest Regional Championship Title.
3271.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Orange Grove "southern Heat" All-star Baseball Team For Winning The 2009 Cal Ripken Nine And Under Southwest Regional Baseball Tournament.

3272.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend relative to a flat-rate income tax system.
3272.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To A Flat-rate Income Tax System And Urging And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

3273.title: Commend life of Philippine casualty United States Army Special Forces Sergeant 1st Class Christopher Shaw of Natchez, Mississippi.
3273.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life Of United States Army Special Forces Sergeant 1st Class Christopher D. Shaw Of Natchez, Mississippi, Who Was Lost In Action On September 29, 2009, In The Philippine Islands, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3274.title: Commend Pearl High School Marching Band for winning the 2009 Class 5A State Championship.
3274.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl High School "pirate" Marching Band And Band Director Jeff Cannon For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association/mississippi Band Association 2009 Class 5a State Championship.

3275.title: Commend Jackson Academy "Raiders" Football Team for MAIS State Championship.
3275.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Jackson Academy "raiders" Football Team And First Year Head Coach David Sykes For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Class Aaa Division I State Football Championship.

3276.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life of retired FBI Agent and former MS Commissioner of Public Safety Jim Ingram.
3276.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Well-documented Law Enforcement Career Of Retired Fbi Agent And Former Mississippi Commissioner Of Public Safety Jim Ingram.

3277.title: Commend life of Iraq casualty U.S. Army Sergeant First Class Johnny Roosevelt Polk of Gulfport, Mississippi.
3277.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life Of Mississippi Army National Guard Sergeant First Class Johnny Roosevelt Polk Of Gulfport, Mississippi, Who Died On July 31, 2009, From Wounds Received In Action In Iraq, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3278.title: Mourn the loss of Spiritual and Civic Leader The Reverend Glen Ray Travis.
3278.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Spiritual And Civic Leader The Reverend Glen Ray Travis.

3279.title: Commend life of Dr. Robert E. "Bobby" Schmieg, Jr., leading UMC faculty trauma and general surgeon.
3279.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of Dr. Robert E. "bobby" Schmieg, Jr., Of Jackson And Natchez, Mississippi, Leading Faculty Trauma And General Surgeon At The University Medical Center, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3280.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and service of State Health Officer Dr. Ed Thompson, Jr.
3280.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of State Health Officer And "medical Statesman" Dr. Ed Thompson, Jr., And Commending His Leadership In Supporting State And National Public Health Issues And His Selfless Service To The State Of Mississippi.

3281.title: Commend life of Daniel Arthur "Dan" Wiggs of Ripley, Mississippi.
3281.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Civic Leadership Of Daniel Arthur "dan" Wiggs Of Ripley, Mississippi.

3282.title: Commend the life of Vietnam P.O.W., Colonel John "Jack" Pitchford of Natchez, Mississippi.
3282.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life Of Colonel John "jack" Pitchford, P.o.w. And Vietnam War Hero From Natchez, Mississippi.

3283.title: Commend life of former State Senator Pat Welch.
3283.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of Former Mississippi Senator Thomas Patrick (pat) Welch Of Mccomb, Mississippi.

3284.title: Commend World War II Veteran and Newton County resident Vernon Gibbs for receiving the French Legion of Honor Medal.
3284.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting And Commending World War Ii Veteran And Newton County Resident Vernon Gibbs For Receiving The French National Order Of The Legion Of Honor.

3285.title: Commend NASA and designate January 6, 2010, as NASA Space Day in Mississippi.
3285.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating January 6, 2010, As "nasa Space Day In Mississippi" In Commemoration Of The Program's 52nd Year Anniversary, And Encouraging Mississippi Residents To Recognize Nasa's Significant Accomplishments And Contributions To Our State.

3286.title: Mourn the loss and commend public service of Bassfield Mayor Buford Blount II.
3286.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Legacy Of Public Service Of Retired Air Force Colonel And Jefferson Davis County Icon Mayor Buford C. Blount Ii Of Bassfield, Mississippi.

3287.title: Commend long and distinguished legacy of public service of former House Appropriations Chairman Representative "Charlie" Capps, Jr.
3287.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Long And Distinguished Legacy Of Public Service Of Former State Representative And Appropriations Chairman Charles Wilson (charlie) Capps, Jr., Of Cleveland, Mississippi.

3288.title: Commend Mississippi Highway Patrol fitness team for winning second consecutive National "Lawfit Challenge."
3288.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi Highway Patrol Fitness Team For Its Record-breaking Effort In Winning Its Second Consecutive National Center For Public Safety Fitness "lawfit Challenge."

3289.title: Resolution to protect and defend state authority under Tenth Amendment to U.S. Constitution over certain powers.
3289.description: A Concurrent Resolution Reinforcing The Fundamental Principle And Authority Of State Sovereignty Under The Tenth Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Over Certain Powers And Discouraging The Federal Government From Imposing Certain Restrictive Mandates.

3290.title: Commend the life of former State Senator, retired Brigadier General (MNG) and Biloxi businessman Tommy Munro.
3290.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Mourn The Loss And Commend The Life And Public Service Of Former Mississippi Senator, Retired Brigadier General With The Mississippi National Guard And Respected Biloxi Businessman And Civic Leader John Thomas (tommy) Munro.

3291.title: Recognize Jackson Jazz Artist Cassandra Wilson upon the dedication of Mississippi's 100th Blues Trail Marker.
3291.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting Jackson Jazz Artist Cassandra Wilson Upon The Occasion Of The Mississippi Blues Trail Marker In Her Honor Which Is Mississippi's 100th Marker.

3292.title: Recognize April 19, 2010, as "Patriots Day in Mississippi."
3292.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating April 19, 2010, As "patriots Day In Mississippi" To Commemorate The Beginning Of The American Revolution.

3293.title: Const.; provide for alternative forms of county government.
3293.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Add Section 260-a To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Providing For The Creation Of Alternative Forms Of County Government By Majority Vote Of The Electors Of Any County In A Manner To Be Prescribed By Law; And For Related Purposes.

3294.title: Constitution; amend Section 124 to require a favorable recommendation from the State Parole Board before the Governor can issue a pardon.
3294.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Governor May Grant Pardons And Commute Sentences Only Upon A Favorable Recommendation By The State Parole Board; And For Related Purposes.

3295.title: Designate "Hydrocephalus Awareness Week in Mississippi."
3295.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The First Week Of June 2010 As "hydrocephalus Awareness Week In Mississippi."

3296.title: Constitution; amend Section 241 to provide that persons convicted of a felony may not vote.

3297.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule No. 40 To Provide That The Deadline For The Final Adoption Of Conference Reports On Appropriation And Revenue Bills Shall Be On Monday, The 84th Day Of A 90-day Session.

3299.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 26, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Allow An Impartial Jury To Be Drawn From A Wider Geographical Area Than The County Where The Crime Was Committed; And For Related Purposes.

3301.title: Constitution; amend to require election districts to be composed of whole precincts.

3305.title: Constitution; amend Section 241 to provide that a person convicted of buying votes shall lose his right of suffrage.
3305.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Any Person Convicted Of Buying Votes Shall Lose His Right Of Suffrage.

3306.title: Constitution; amend Section 46 to allow a decrease in the compensation of members of the Legislature to become effective immediately.

3417.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Forest High School "bearcats" Boys Basketball Team And Head Coach Roy Pinkston For Winning The Mhsaa Class 3a Boys State Championship Title And For Their Outstanding 2009-2010 Season.

3418.title: Commend Horn Lake High School "Lady Eagles" Basketball Team for winning first girls Class 6A State Championship.
3418.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Horn Lake High School "lady Eagles" Girls Basketball Team And Head Coach Janna Lyons For Winning Their First Mhsaa Class 6a State Championship And For Their Outstanding 2009-2010 Season.

3420.title: Commend Dr. William A. (Billy) Morehead, President of the Association of Government Accountants.

3421.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Pastor And Congregation Of First Baptist Church In Morton, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of Their Sesquicentennial (150th) Anniversary Celebration.

3423.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Direct The Department Of Finance And Administration To Place A Moratorium On The Acquisition Of Any Real Property Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, And To Prohibit The Relocation Of Any State Agency Located Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Any Locality Outside The City Of Jackson, Mississippi; To Direct The Peer Committee To Conduct A Study And Establish Guidelines Regarding Office Space In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3424.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Newton High School "lady Tigers" Girls Basketball Team And Head Coach Crandal Porter For Winning The Mhsaa Class 2a State Championship And For Their Outstanding 2009-2010 Season.

3425.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Lifelong Contributions Of Kathryn Bass Moody To The Legacy And Success Of Pearl River Community College On The Occasion Of The Student Residence Hall Named In Her Honor.

3426.title: Recognize contributions of Mrs. Earlora Holden to PRCC on the occasion of the Student Residence Hall named in her honor.
3426.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Contributions Of Mrs. Earlora Chapman Holden To The Legacy And Success Of Pearl River Community College On The Occasion Of The Student Residence Hall Named In Her Honor.

3427.title: Commend Mississippi State University Men's Basketball Team and Coach Rick Stansbury for winning SEC Western Division Title.
3427.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi State University "bulldogs" Men's Basketball Team And Coach Rick Stansbury For Winning The Western Division Southeastern Conference (sec) Title And For Receiving The Number 1 Seed In The National Invitational Tournament.

3428.title: Commend Ingomar High School "Falcons" Boys Basketball Team and legendary Coach Norris Ashley for MHSAA Class 1A State Championship.
3428.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ingomar High School "falcons" Boys Basketball Team And Legendary Coach Norris Ashley For Winning The Mhsaa Class 1a State Championship And For Their Outstanding 2009-2010 Season.

3429.title: Recognize Drs. John M. and Vera Mae Perkins upon occasion of 50th Anniversary of the Perkins Foundation.
3429.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Dr. John M. And Dr. Vera Mae Perkins As The Founders Of The John And Vera Mae Perkins Foundation On The Occasion Of The Foundation's 50th Anniversary.

3430.title: Authorize the establishment of a Mississippi Legislative Prayer Caucus.
3430.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Authorize The Establishment Of A Mississippi Legislative Prayer Caucus And To Provide For Its Organization.

3431.title: Commend Raymond High School "Lady Rangers" Basketball Team for winning the Grand Slam and Class 4A State Championship.
3431.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Raymond High School "lady Rangers" Girls Basketball Team And Head Coach Shay Jackson For Winning The State Overall "grand Slam" Championship, For Winning Their Second Consecutive Class 4a State Championship And For Their Excellent 2009-2010 Season.

3432.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The U.s. Congress To Adopt Legislation To Enable The States To Intercept Federal Tax Refunds For Payment Of Obligations Under Legally Enforceable Court Orders.

3434.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing November 9, 2010, As "diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy (dpn) Awareness Day In Mississippi" To Bring Attention To Diabetes Management Programs.
